1113.title: Further Racovania Choices

choices: Soon, one of the Stranken Vampires descends upon the town for an early selection
Word of the Festival reaches an Adinahn Princess, making everyone anxious!
One day, a strange patron wanders into the Tavern when Olga is working...
11131.content:
Racovania was a sleepy little village nestled in the mountains. Its people were simple farmers, with few exceptions, and the quality of life was questionable at best. Townsfolk were nurtured by hard work, tilling the soil and wrangling the livestock, and those that weren't were similarly forged by equally unpleasant lifestyles. Miners, who worked further up the mountain closer towards the Peaks, couriers who made the treacherous path up and down the mountain and across the country to deliver parcels and letters. Even those who performed service duties in town, like smithees and traders, were not granted easy lives.

It was for this reason, because of their tedium, that the barkeep of the Bleakfrost Tavern put such a great emphasis on keeping her customers bellies filled with good food and mead. After a hard day at work, around dusk, almost everyone who didn't return to their homes could be found at the Tavern—of age or not. The fire was warm and the company was good. Somaria, "the best chef in all of Racovia", kept herself busy trying new recipes and inventing new specials to appease the watering mouths and rumbling gullets of her faithful patrons. It could have been well into the night, eeking into the morning, and the Tavern would still be alive with music of the bard and the drunken laughs of her patrons. Bleakfrost Tavern was very important to Racovania and it's people...

Which was precisely why Olga had found herself so eagerly wanted there.

"On the house, blue-eyes." came the sultry voice of the barkeep, Helga, "Courtesy of the gentlemen who've been eyeballin' you all night."

Olga Forgedotter shrunk slightly, her face flushed and her smile crooked. She waved sheepishly to the burly men tucked away in the corner, their bellies brushing against the table as their rosy cheeks burned with beer and lust. They waved back, rather loudly, and one men put his fingers in his mouth to blow a piercing whistle her way.

She hadn't been at this job very long, and she wasn't very good at it. Every day Olga tripped and fell, spilled pints and dropped food on the floor. But the customers kept coming, even more eagerly than ever in fact! Helga mostly had her work mornings, when the traffic was easy and the workload was light. However, Olga was placed very strategically so that she would get off at six in the afternoon, when most of the lusty-eyed men started pouring in at five. Helga got to lure all the lecherous customers she wanted inside for their business, and let Olga go early once they were good, drunk and hungry.

"Don't take it so personally—it's all in good fun." Helga reassured her barmaid with a pat on the back and a hearty laugh, "Or at least it better be. It'd be a shame if all the tips they gave you had to go to hirin' that Orc to walk you home every night!"

Helga was an older woman. Not close to graying just yet, but she was old enough to have flirted with her Father when they were young. She was strong and sturdy, a farmer's daughter, with long brown hair and deep green eyes. Her skin was ruddy and her figure was plump—she was a head shorter than most men in Racovania, but had a set of hips wider than some men's shoulders were wide. When she pat you on the back, you felt it.

"I think I can take care of myself." Olga said with a smile as she reached behind the bar and grabbed her basket, "Do you think I could get a steak and stew to go? It's Tora's turn to cook dinner and... I don't actually think she remembered."

"Say no more." Helga said with a smile, and then a hearty laugh, "Hey, maybe I'll throw in an extra roll for the two of you, huh? Eat them both on the way home, Olga. You're far too skinny to be working in my Tavern!"

***


Nestled against the dull gray slab of the mountain, lit by the fire of the forge as the life slowly flickered from it, Olga's homestead was of a generous size. Her father's father had built it with the money he had bought from selling his father's farm, and it had been designed with a legacy in mind. Not only did it function as a forge for smithing, its two stories were both a business and a home for his family. A store room and a floor downstairs housed and displayed armors and weapons for the hunters, mercenaries, adventurers and enthusiasts that had been forged outside, while the second floor had all the furnishings a family might need. There was a kitchen, two bedrooms (one that Tora and Olga had shared as children), and a modest living space with a roaring fire.

With their father gone, it seemed almost too big for Olga and her older sister. While Tora had done her best in replacing her father at the forge, no one could replace his rolling laughter or the presence that his boisterous personality claimed all to itself.

"Tora!" Olga cried out, the wooden door slamming behind her, "Oh sister, I've brought home dinner~!"

"Wonderful—I'm starving!"

Tora was Olga's older sister by three years. They had been very much the same growing up, both frail and waifish girls with blue eyes and blonde hair like their father. But since she had become the smithee of the house, lifting the hammer and forging all day, Tora had since grown hearty. Where Olga was waifish, Tora was toned and strong. Though she still had the same sweet face of her mother, her long blonde hair had been cut short so as not to be struck at the anvil, or caught ablaze by the coals. Despite her newfound burliness, Tora was not without her suitors.

"Well that's funny, because it was your turn to cook dinner tonight." Olga chided her older sister as she sat at the table, "And your loving, caring, oh-so-responsible sister just so happened to remember that you always forget."

"Quiet your tongue. You're hanging around Helga too much—you're becoming an old nag." Tora rolled her eyes and wiped the water from her brow, "I'm just now washing up."

"Big order?"

"The biggest." Tora grumbled as Olga set her plate and bowl down in front of her, "I'm happy that word has spread all the way to Adinah, but this is the last time I let them order in bulk."

Olga didn't believe that for a moment, but she bit her tongue. Tora worked hard to keep their family (what was left of it) afloat. She had to pay for steel, for materials, and occasionally protection. On top of keeping them both fed. It was a wonder they weren't bare bones by now—though admittedly, what Olga earned from working at the Tavern helped a lot more than Tora was keen to admit. Times were hard for the Forgedotters, but like her father had always told them, "tempered steel is strong steel."

And so they ate. Olga regaled her sister with stories from the tavern, Tora responded in kind with gossip from her merchants. They went to bed early and departed to their separate bedrooms. They both had busy days ahead of them, Olga knew. Tora had her order to fill, and Helga had her and the other barmaids preparing for the Racovanian festival already. It was just... there had to be more to live than this? Even in Racovania, surely this wasn't all right? As much as she tried to be optimistic, things could get so dreary sometimes.

Olga sighed heavily as she went to bed early, was it so much to ask for something different to happen?

Little did Olga know, as the turned and tossed beneath her covers, that her challenge had been accepted. Her prayers heard by the Gods (though which God, no one could be sure), that which was once certain began to become decidedly less so. What may have or perhaps should have been a humdrum life with her sister, one day after the other with only slight variation, grew uneasy as the winds of fate began to change...
11131.title: The Bubbly Belle of Bleakfrost Tavern

choices: Olga—oh no!
Tora—oh no!
Greta—phew!
111311.content:
In perhaps a sick twisted sort of way, Olga did get her wish.

Olga had offered to stay late that evening at the Tavern. Preparing for the Racovanian Festival was a tall order, and Helga could use (and handsomely paid for) all the help she could get. A little toiling in the kitchen with Somaria was well worth the extra gold that she would earn for what little she managed to help the seasoned chef in the kitchen. The bar was alive with mirth and pleasure. The bard was singing, the other barmaids were tapping drinks and serving plates. Helga was roaring with laughter, not-so-subtly flirting with Thorne the Elder as he made his own clumsy advances. Olga could have almost sworn that this was the slight, subtle difference that she had been looking for in life...

And then everything just stopped.

Everyone in Racovania knew the tell-tale sound of the carraige's black wheels as they clamored down the road that lead further north. Up there was Vampire Country, owned almost exclusively by the Stranken Clan. Those blood-suckers offered protection and supplies for the townsfolk... but at a terrible price.

One that no one in the town had gone untouched by.

There was a whole lot of them. The Stranken family was represented by several castles dotting the landscape of Racovania, up into the Peaks even. Every so often, at least once a year, one of them would descend upon the town looking for payment for their services. They were a necessary evil, tolerated by the town. But if any one family could kill such a warm, pleasant night, it was the Stranken Clan of Vampires.

Outside, the dull gray of the twilight had grown to an unhealthy sort of reddish glow. The soot and clouds above may as well have been made of lead, blocking any and all sunlight that dared to peek beyond the smoky veil into the town. A black carriage, manned by a foursome of fearsome black steeds (each one as dark as coal) and no driver rolled down the mountainside and into the main road that ran through the town.

Everyone, not just the patrons of the bar, shuffled outside. It was a fate far worse than death for those who dared ignore the call of the Strankens. No one had dared try it since Olga had been alive. Her father had always told her to report dutifuly, keep her head down, and try to look as unappetizing as possible.

As the carriage stopped, a small crowd of begrudgingly diligent townsfolk crowded around it. Before long, literally everyone was circled around it. The entire town's population was at the beck and call for these Vampires whenever they rolled through. Sometimes, though not often, they were simply passing through. Olga could only hope that now was one of those times.

"Olga—"

"Nilheia's mane!" the busty barmaid jumped, covering her mouth, for fear of upsetting the ominous carriage's occupant

It was only Tora, thankfully. Her older sister had managed to find her in the crowd and had made her way over to the congregation of taverners who had gathered in a particular area. With her strong arms, Tora pulled her sister in close for a warm embrace.

Nobody knew what those fanged freaks did with the women that they abducted. No one (literally, no one) had ever seen nor heard from the abductees once they had been spirited away in one of those black carriages. Rumors had emerged of course, albeit in hushed whispers, that they were eaten whole. Or sacrificed to Damus in unholy rituals. Olga shuddered at the thought of what those awful creatures must do to their victims—wasn't it enough that they sucked blood? How much worse could vampires get?

"Quiet girl, quiet." Tora said, breaking away, "They'lll... they might hear you..."

As if on cue, the carriage door opened with a sharp whine. The black hinges creaked as the wooden door opened to reveal one of the more "well-known" Stranken Vampires. Lady Cameena was the one located most closely to Racovania, and the one with which most of the public dealings with the town were done. She was feared none-the-less, but she was easily the most well-known among the common folk. Olga had heard stories of an even more terribly beautiful creature named Eviana, but had not seen such a woman for herself. Legend had it she was the Mother of all vampires—all of them, even Cameena, were descended from her.

One long gray leg extended from inside the coach and planted itself firmly in the dirt. Thick, ripe hips emerged as the rubenesque Lady of the Night descended fully into the town, her long black hair flowing in the soft breeze that carried throughout the silent town.

Tora squeezed Olga's hand, like when they were children.

"Good evening to you all." Cameena said, her voice hauntingly low and beautiful, "I hope you are all having a pleasant evening."

No one dared answer.

"I have come to the decision that I require another tribute. As my clan has already collected, I understand that this may come as... a sort of shock." The woman bit her ebony-black bottom lip, "But whomsoever's family I rob of one of their delicious daughters will be handsomely rewarded. I am not a cruel mistress, nor is my lady Eviana, but our needs are... growing."

Gentle sobbing filled the town from one corner, lower lips quivered everywhere as the earlier mirth was hollowed and filled with a sense of great loss. The poor girl hadn't even been chosen, and the town was mourning her.

"In order to provide for you so that you may live out your pitiful..." Cameena looked around distastefully, "Existence. My clan must be well nourished and paid for our services—those who would replace us would do much more than take one of your daughters."

"Now girls..." she said, checking her nails, "Step forward then, would you? So that I might pick the prettiest among you."

On cue, as commanded, each of the eligible daughters of the village stepped forward. There was Anna, the neighbor girl. She was a bit younger than Olga. The merchants' daughters, Alisha and Mina. Claris, and Greta. And finally, Olga and Tora stepped forward with heavy hearts. While their father was no longer alive, they would forever remain "eligible" in the eyes of the Stranken Clan—'til they bore children themselves, it seemed.

"Well well well..." Cameena lined them all up, looking each girl up and down, "Such a small selection... what happened to the redheaded girl from a few years back?"

"S...She married." the girl's father answered quietly, "I-Into a nice family in town."

"Pooh." Cameena curled her nose, "Wasn't there a, uh... oh... the Priest's Daughter, what happened to her?"

"L-Lady Elvira claimed her last year." someone else said, "The father... he took his life."

"Well that's depressing." Cameena rolled her eyes, "There was a whole slew of girls from that round-faced family with the pig farm. What happened to them?"

"The Pox." coughed yet another villager, "That was quite a few years ago."

"Ugh." Cameena put her hands on her hips, "So you're all that's left then? This village is turning into a real sausage fest..."

Thankfully, children were off limits. Once a girl had her first blood, she had from then until her first birth to be claimed by their winged sentinels. Suffice it to say, marriages were a frequency in Racovania. Baby showers too. Children were something celebrated and cherished, as they represented freedom from the agreement that the Stranken Clan held them all to, in one way or the other.

Unfortunately, Olga gulped as Cameena walked the line of eligible girls, she was far from ineligible.

The crop of seven—all sisters in a strange sort of way, bound together by this horrible agreement—were examined. Up and down, from their heads to their toes. Cameena even extended a greying arm, gave a couple of girls a good squeeze. Tilting their heads, examining their necks. She made a poigniant stop, her breasts bouncing ever so slightly, and made her announcement...

"You." Cameena extended one taloned finger, pointing squarely at...
111311.title: A Premature Culling

choices: Olga is taken straight to the Dining Hall, where a grand feast awaits her!
Olga is shown her quarters—guess she's not going to die TONIGHT at least...
Olga is taken somewhere else in the castle...
1113111.content:
"You." Cameena extended one taloned finger, pointing squarely at Olga.

The world around Olga Forgedotter quickly withdrew from the world around her. Everything went cold and dim, the blood red moon may as well have been gray and the fog that had encroached clear. She felt and saw nothing. Not the embrace of her sister as she sobbed into her shoulder, not the pained expressions of the townsfolk as they said goodbye to yet another Racovanian youth. She didn't register the relieved, though saddened, exhales of Greta or the twins. She didn't even really seem to register Cameena Stranken herself, looming venomously over there as her arm bent at her hip.

Olga was just cold—there was only the chill of the mountain air, and the sound of her heart as it drummed behind her ears.

"You'll do quite nicely." Cameena said with a smile, "Come now. Into my carraige."

As if on cue, one of the riderless horses sputtered, calling Olga into her seat beside the blood-sucker.

"No! Y-You can't!" Tora pushed off of Olga, facing the Vampire Elite with a familiar fire in her eyes, "She's my sister you heartless, uncaring... thing! She's but a girl—take me instead!"

"T-Tora...?" Olga managed behind watering eyes, "I... I..."

"When our father died, he left Olga in my stead—I'm in charge of her!" Tora shouted at the ashen ambassador, "So I volunteer. Take me instead, a-and let my little sister live. Please."

A proud woman, Tora had never so much as begged for an extra dessert at suppertime. Which was why it was so strange to see her fall to the ground, on her knees, with her hands clasped out in front of her. Hot tears streamed down her cheeks as she was overcome by all manner of sisterly emotions—perhaps even motherly, given their lack of parentage.

"Hmm..." Cameena said with a smile, one that showed the presence of her fangs, "But no. You're far to... hrm... stringy looking."

"B-But!"

"I have made my choice. I demand that barmaid for myself, and if I am denied again, I will raze this entire town with but a flick of my wrist!" Cameena puffed her grey bosom and arched her shoulders. Indeed, the night seemed to come sooner and grow colder as she presented herself in such a way. Tora simply shrunk into herself, rescinding the offer quietly.

"T-Tora?" Olga repeated again, tears running down her cheeks, "I... I don't want to..."

"Shh..." Tora embraced her younger sister tightly, "I-It's... it's okay. Just... be brave."

At the touch of a gray hand on her shoulder, Olga's eyes widened in fear. It pulled at her gently, and then decidedly less so.

"T-Tora?!"

"Be brave, Olga!" the older Forgedotter shouted as Olga was ushered to her coach, "...Be brave..."

***


The ride up to Cameena's palace was a rocky one, and unbearably slow.

Olga had never been on many carriage rides. Everything (well, most everything) she had ever needed was in town. The market for food, the Tavern for entertainment, her family for warmth and comfort...

As such, she'd been somewhat spared from having to do too many of them. She didn't much care for them. She got motion sickness sometimes, and rockier roads gave her headaches. What made this one especially bad was that she was sitting uncomfortably close to a blood-sucking mistress of the night. Cameena Stranken's broad hips brushed against hers every so often. It made her flinch and recoil noticeably, which made her "hostess" incredibly displeased.

"I swear, you humans are so skittish." Cameena said in a friendly sort of tone, as if she hadn't just kidnapped Olga but rather had been giving her a ride into town, "We're both women here. It's perfectly natural for our bodies to touch."

"There's nothing natural about you..." Olga whispered underneath her breath

"What was that?" Cameena asked in that same sort of tone, cupping a hand to her ear

"...I said I'm hungry..." Olga corrected herself, "I hadn't had a chance to eat my supper before... before..."

"Oh well then there's no worries there, darling!" Cameena said with a dismissive wave of her hand, "I'll make sure you're treated to a wonderful meal—surely one much better than whatever paltry porridge you were going to slurp down from that disgusting inn."

Olga hunkered into her seat, drowning out Cameena's prattling with the sound of the carriage. The horses neighing. The wheels turning. Everything just sort've melted away. This was it, Olga thought, she was going to die. She'd always known that this was a possibility—being picked by one of these awful creatures as their feast—but there was no real way to prepare for it. How could she have?

"At least you'll feed me before you suck me dry..." Olga muttered again

"Oh... something like that." Cameena licked her lips, "Now chin up dear... we've almost arrived at your new home."
1113111.title: Abducting Olga

choices: And so, Olga feasts, to Cameena's great delight!
Olga retains enough willpower to make small talk. Cameena begrudgingly obliges.
A human maid suddenly comes with urgent news for Cameena.
11131111.content:
Once they finally arrived, Olga thought, for one very brief moment, that maybe things wouldn't be so bad.

The castle looked rather impressive up close. It inspired feelings of foreboding from a far distance, given its gothic design and the perpetual rain that seemingly enveloped the entire mountainside. And yet, Olga couldn't help but marvel at how well-put together the design was. Every block, every tile, every single piece of the infrastructure was positioned perfectly; not a detail imperfect, everything where it needed to be. Add in the complimentary dark paintwork, the gothic statues and spires, and the castle certainly had an artistic aesthetic to it.

Depressing and dark. As expected from one of the merciless bloodsuckers who plagued the North.

"Welcome to your new home," Cameena said in that same tone she'd used the whole ride over. That tone of casual friendliness, coming form her kidnapper. It was so wrong.

At an arm gesture from the vampire, the massive gate doors slowly creaked open. And once again, Olga found herself spellbound, this time by the interior of the castle. Or rather the main entry hall.

She'd been expecting a dreary atmosphere; no lights, torn tapestries, a shattered window here and there, and maybe some of those creepy shadow creatures crawling about. Instead, Olga was greeted by an illuminated hallway, a clean-tiled floor with a fancy dark red carpet, beautiful tapestries, and mystical-looking decorations. The former barmaid found herself blinking in awe and confusion. This was not what she had been expecting.

"Come this way, come."

Olga froze, her heart hammering as she suddenly felt Cameena lean uncomfortably close into her personal bubble. The vampire wrapped a gray-skinned arm around the blonde's shoulders, who responded by trembling horribly and whimpering.

"Oh, stop with that," Cameena frowned, tightening her hold on the sniffling human before moving her fingers to grasp at her cheek. She forced the girl to look at her, Olga shrinking before the cold gaze of the vampire's crimson eyes. "Like it or not, this is your life now. You are mine."

Olga's blue eyes brimmed with tears, a hiccup escaping her as her new master continued to glare into her soul.

"Only you can make the best of it," Cameena continued, coldly. "Learn to adapt, you'll be all the better for it. Keep sobbing, and you'll only annoy me. And believe me, you do not want that. No matter how you look at it, this is your reality now. Am I understood?"

Olga's tears fell, but she silenced the sob that wanted to be let out. Instead, she used what willpower she could muster to steel her shaky self, look the monster in the eye, and nod. "Yes, my lady."

"Good girl," Cameena smiled in satisfaction, loosening her arm's grip but still keeping it wrapped around the blonde's shoulders. "Now, come. Into your new home. And..." to Olga's numbing shock, Cameena moved a long, talon-like finger to wipe away the tears from her cheeks. "No more of that. No guest of mine will exhibit such unsightly behavior."

Olga stared for a moment, before averting her gaze to distract herself with the tapestries they passed by. She wondered if Cameena was playing some sort of sadistic game with her, lulling her into a false sense of security before sinking her fangs into her neck. Yes, that had to be it. And that only served to increase her anxiety for her impending doom. Why did she have to play such a game? If she was going to die, could she just not get it over with?

A low, rumbling sound cut off her inner ramblings. And the overall silence of their walk.

Cameena grinned disturbingly, her eyes looking upon Olga's thin middle approvingly. "Yes, oh yes. I knew you had promise."

Olga, for her part, simply blushed in self-mortification. So much for dying with a shred of dignity...

"Come, come!" Cameena said giddily, increasing the pace of their walk, much to Olga's shock and horror. "My servants have worked to prepare a feast for your welcome. We must hurry before it gets cold, and your belly cries for more!"

Olga was now very much certain that she was going to die, one way or another, by tonight. If not from her vampire mistress draining her of every drop of blood in her, then definitely from the humiliation she was currently suffering through.

She certainly hoped she could. Whatever Cameena had in store for her would be horrible, that much she knew. But for it to involve food? Olga hoped she could be miraculously struck down before the lady of the night could carry out whatever ghastly torture she had in store for her.

"Here we are!"

Olga blinked. Had she been thinking so deeply, her mind had wandered off? One minute they were in the enormous grand hallway, and now they were suddenly before another set of double doors? Or maybe...had Cameena moved them that quickly?

Before she could so much as ask, the doors were pulled open. Olga caught a quick glimpse of the creatures, expecting them to be some more of those shadowy beings that seemed to hover near Cameena when she needed them.

What she saw instead made her yelp. Two beings, completely chalk white, humanoid in appearance, were what had pulled the double doors open. They may have looked human in shape, but they lacked distinguishing features. Nothing to indicate if they were male or female. Hollow, naked bodies that were devoid of any characteristics or physical traits. And yet, what Olga found truly disturbing about these creatures was their faces. No facial features at all. Just this...blocky shape that seemed reminiscent of a mask. Black, empty eye-holes were eyes ought to have been.

But Olga could not ponder on the bizarre creatures for long. Cameena was already leading her inside, and at once her nose was assaulted by a most delectable aroma.

There in the middle of the enormous dining room was a great long table. And upon it, more food than Olga had ever seen on a table before. A succulent turkey in the middle, a big leg of lamb smeared in sauce and butter, three pies that smelled of beef, heathen cakes, roast pork, and so on. It was too much for Olga to take in.

Her belly growled urgently, even louder than last time. Her mouth watered.

"Come this way, darling," Cameena purred, guiding Olga to the table, to the seat closest to the feast. "Eat. Eat to your heart's content. All this is yours to gorge on."

Olga was having difficulty listening, her gaze focused entirely on the spread before her. "All this...for me?" she smacked her lips.

"But of course!" Cameena said joyously, sitting at the head of the table, next to Olga. "Nothing but the best for my...guest. Now please..."

Cameena's red eyes seemed to shine as she observed the blonde human's focus on the food, her grin stretching from ear to ear, her tongue lolling out to lick her lips as Olga picked her first helping.

"Enjoy yourself..."
11131111.title: Be My Guest

choices: Meanwhile, Olga was placed in one of the lavish guest rooms for the night.
That night, Olga became plagued by a gluttonous nightmare.
Actually, something else happened instead...
111311112.content:
Upon taking the first succulent bite from the veritable feast before her, Olga's taste buds felt as if they lit up like fireworks, as she then began to devour a few more plentiful bites, munching on some of the delicacies with a gluttonous gusto.

"Hehe! Yes, that's a good girl. Eat up." Cameena gleefully thought, rubbing her pale hands together with an almost sadistic chortle, eagerly awaiting how substantial her newly acquired bloodbag will become in the near future. And yet, as if like a crackle of thunder, the seemingly svelte vampire countess was soon interrupted by the chiming of Olga's voice, still bearing a mouthful of chewed-up cuisines as she muffled, "*munch* Am I rweally *munch* *munch*...Your guesht?"

Suffice to say, it certainly knocked the dark-haired countess out of her lucrative daydream, unintentionally staring back at the still chewing Olga, which seemed rather...odd to the vampire. After all, out of the many "piggies" she's acquired and developed over the decades, most of them didn't outright withhold a small yet normal conversation with her out sheer fear of the gluttonous bloodsucker.

And yet...Here was Olga, attempting to make small talk with her.

This alone surprised even Cameena, as she now had to stoop herself to just conversing with her newest pet.

However, much to her begrudging outlook of the situation, Cameena couldn't help but feel like there was...something underlying all of this idle chitchat, as she reluctantly took a seat beside Olga, doing her best to put on a friendly reassuring face towards the chubby Northerner, placing a pale long-nailed hand upon Olga's shoulder and feintly said, "...Absoultely, my dear! After all, we of the illustrious Stranken Family pride ourselves on...luxury, you would say."

Despite her current situation, Olga felt like believing in Cameena's words, as she continued munching down on the delicacies, all whilst making some small talk with the vampire countess, obviously out of a need for company. However, much to her chagrin, Cameena pretended to keenly listen to Olga's conversation.

== 2 Hours Later... ==

"Ugh! I'd thought she would NEVER stop talking!" Cameena raved, now currently inside her illustrious yet lavish personal quarters, her servants undoing her corset, which let her budding belly fully expand from the strict confines, still a little frustrated as to how long it took for her newest livestock to have a full stomach.

"*sigh*...Well, at least she has some potential for rich potent blood. Though, I won't admit this outright to the other Nobles and that damnable Eviana, but...that human, Olga. The little chat with her felt quite...stimulating, if I do say so myself." Cameena thought aloud, her mind contemplating uncharacteristically about her newest "pet".

And yet, little did the vampire countess realize under her own intuition, that there was something...affectionate between the two completely different individuals.
111311112.title: Small Talk With A Vampire

choices: Late in the night, Cameena comes in for her first taste...
Olga sleeps peacefully, waking up to a small snack in bed before breakfast.
A sudden commotion outside the castle wakes her. Olga goes to investigate.
Olga dreams deep in her sleep, both pleasant and unpleasant.
1113111121.content:
Have I been taken to die, or warped into a dark fairy tale book?

Olga uttered not a sound as she was quietly ushered into her room by one of the castle's many stone-faced maids. Once more she had been expecting something dreary and dark to remind her of her grim predicament. She expected to be sent to the top of one of the castle's spires, where there would no doubt be a room so small and unkempt that there would be no illusion it was a prison cell. A room so dirty the cobblestone tiles looked severely outdated and covered in moss. Dust everywhere, a mangy old desk next to an unclean bed with torn sheets. Something to display Cameena's complete disregard for those beneath her, and her sadistic joy in torturing her captured souls by making them as miserable as possible.

Instead, the young blue-eyed blonde had been presented with a room that was the exact opposite. If it could even be defined as a "room" to begin with.

The first thing Olga took note of was that her new room was big. Very big. Comparison-wise, it was equivalent to the main floor of the Bleakfrost Tavern, except no tables, no stairs, no counter, and in place of all that was a single bedroom with an absurd amount of space. A queen-sized bed, far more space to spare on the mattress than Olga was accustomed to, was set in the middle, against a wall with two giant glass windows to the side, each leading to a grand balcony. The bed had a canopy, lustrous carpets dripping down to the floor and, in Olga's opinion, giving an almost tent-like appearance. The windows had these fancy curtains draping from them, barely touching down the carpeted floor of the room gracefully.

On the far left side about ten feet from the bed was a desk with a grand mirror, accompanied by several assortments ranging from make-up kits to writing utensils, complete with blank pages laid on the surface of the desk. On the right, equally ten feet or so from the bed were two things; a big wardrobe and next to it a single wide door. A door so wide and high that Olga figured maybe three of her could fit through it no problem. She ventured over to it, cradling her stuffed tummy from the dinner just a while back, and opened it to another jaw-dropping surprise.

A bathroom unlike any Olga had seen. Instead of the typical white tub or single bucket, there instead was a square construct protruding from the middle of the room, filled to the brim with hot steaming water. Squared tiles on the floor, with a small carpet at the entrance for wiping bare feet of water purposes, along with an assortment of towels in a transparent cabinet.

This is a bathroom? It's bigger than mine and Tora's house!

Granted, the Forgedotter sisters lived in a blacksmith's house, but the point still stood. Olga was presented an entire set of living arrangements that not only contradicted every one of her expectations, but everything she was used to. Was this what vampires did with their reaped victims? Were all vampires so accommodating? Olga had a hard time reconciling the image.

After finishing her inspection of the bathroom, Olga came back into the bedroom to notice a sizable red nightgown laid out on the bed for her that hadn't been there before. She looked towards the entrance to find the maid standing there, still in perfect pose and expressionless. Had she picked out the nightgown while she was inspecting the bathroom?

"The Lady encourages you to get comfortable," the pale, raven-haired woman said in a blank tone. "You are free to move about the castle as you see fit. This is your home now."

"The...whole castle?" the disbelief in Olga's voice was palpable.

The maid merely nodded. "This is your home now. Lady Cameena has nothing to hide from her guests."

Olga absorbed that sentence and all its implications. Steeling herself, she dared to ask the question that had been plaguing her since arriving. "Are there...others here? Others she has..." she gulped, her resolve failing. "...taken?"

To her great discomfort, the maid's wooden expression did not change one bit. "That is something you will have to take up with Lady Cameena on your own."

The maid had said it with no change in her countenance, yet her tone had taken a noticeably more icy tone to it, enough to make Olga flinch. Even so, she managed to press on, meeting the maid's cool gaze. "I-I thought she had nothing to hide."

"It is not a servant's place to gossip," the maid coolly retorted, before giving a quick cordial bow. "Now please excuse me."

And she was gone, closing the door quietly behind her. As if to reinforce that the entire castle was Olga's home now, there was no sound of the door being locked. She really was being granted the freedom to explore.

But right now Olga didn't want to explore. Now she felt the full exhaustion after a day as draining as this one, and the epic meal she had consumed not five minutes ago. Her hands fell to her inflated middle, not yet meaningfully big, but now a budding pot. She turned to the bed, which looked very inviting right now. And the square bathtub full of hot water was certainly calling out to her...

The hot bath helped in soothing her body, but not her heart. As she washed herself, she thought back to her home. She thought of the Bleakfrost Tavern and all her fellow barmaids. She thought of Helga and all her matronly wit and love. She thought of Somaria and all her wisdom both in the kitchen and the world around them, being an older sister at work. She thought of Tora, her beloved older sister whom she would most likely never see again. All of them, whom she had been snatched away from.

She wept quietly to herself, curling on herself in the bathtub as she released her held-in sorrow.

When she emerged from the bathroom and changed into the red nightgown laid out for her, she was still sniffling a little, but a lot calmer than before. Her exhaustion now doubled from crying, she climbed into the bed and sunk into the covers. She didn't even register the comforting warmth of the plush sheets, because as soon as her head hit the pillows, she was out like a light.
1113111121.title: The Stranken Guest Suite Special

choices: Just like last night, Olga manages to make small-talk with Cameena.
Cameena really can't stop staring at Olga...
A maid suddenly comes in. "One of your relatives has arrived, my lady."
As Olga eats, other girls appear and join in on the feast. Other reaped victims.
11131111212.content:
Upon waking up Olga wondered if, for one fleeting moment, everything that had transpired in the last thirteen hours had all been just an awful, awful dream.

Just like those fever dreams she used to have when she would get sick and Tora would tend to her. Horrible nightmares that seemed real, but thankfully turned out to be all just products of her imagination gone mad. She was still with Tora, still at the Bleakfrost Tavern with her boss and co-workers, still in her world safe and sound.

Only when the last vestiges of sleep left her and she registered the ultra-comfy mattress she was nestling in, the fluffy and warming covers she was under, the softest pillows her head rested on was Olga painfully reminded of her new reality.

Her eyes stared at the roof of her bed's canopy first, and then glanced blearily around. It was going to take some getting used to, waking up to this room. Being reminded every waking moment this was her life now. Just that was enough to make her sink back into the bed, whimpering in misery. It was at that moment her stomach reminded her of its demands needs.

Olga sighed. I can't stay in bed all day, now can I...

She made to move her legs slowly out from under the covers, ready for the sensation of her bare feet gracing the carpeted floor. However, her intended action of getting up was frozen upon registering one alarming fact.

A maid, different from last night's, standing a mere two feet from her, a little serving tray held up in one hand.

The blonde shrieked and fell back into the covers, bringing them up to cover her face. She stayed like that for a few moments, hoping beyond hope that the new maid had scurried away. She peeked from the covers until her eyes could see. The maid was still standing her, her posture unbroken, and completely nonplussed by the human's terrified reflex action.

"Wh-What...?" Olga stammered, still peeking from the covers timidly.

"A treat before breakfast," the maid, this one red-haired with dark skin and golden eyes, droned mechanically. "Courtesy of Lady Cameena."

Olga just stared. Snacking before breakfast? What?

"What?"

"A show of hospitality. A gesture of thoughtful kindness from the Countess," the maid elaborated, presenting the tray forward. "She is well aware how humans work up appetite in the time they slumber. So she sends a precursor to the meal that awaits you."

Olga watched as the maid proceeded to lift the silver cloche from the bowl on the tray. The plate within carried rye bread, five slices total, and each slice was slathered in butter and jam. To the side was a tiny glass of mead.

Olga stared. Her stomach growled. Working at a tavern she never had to scrape for food like most people did, but then again Racovania did benefit from good harvests as a result of the deal brokered by the Stranken vampire clan. Still, to be tended to like this, served a snack before breakfast...all this royal treatment was too much for Olga to take in.

"Um..." her stomach growled again, and the maid lowered the tray within reach of her. "Th-Thank you..."

She ate daintily, unnerved by how the maid continued to just stand there all machine-like. She wondered if all the servants in the castle were like this. Surely not, as she had overheard some energetic bustling and words from the kitchen the night before as she ate dinner.

The bread tasted so good, though. Perfectly accompanied by butter and jam. And the mead...practically honey in her mouth with its sweetness. And this was just a prelude? After the big dinner she had last night, now Olga wanted to see what breakfast was like.

"Ah," the maid suddenly spoke and Olga froze up. "Hold a moment."

The blonde flinched and shut her eyes as the woman lifted her hand, anticipating a reprimanding action. Had she committed some faux pas? Made an offensive display with her eating? Well why did they bring her a snack covered in butter and jam to bed, then?!

Instead of a harsh discipline, Olga felt a soft fabric brush along the edges of her mouth. She opened her eyes, realizing the maid was merely wiping at her mouth with a napkin. Before Olga could make sense of that, she glanced down at her plate, and saw to her shock that she had already finished the five slices of rye bread and the cup of mead. She must have woken up hungrier than she thought.

And yet...this was not normal. Slightly chubby as she was, Olga had never been one to indulge like this. Then again, after last night's grand feast...

"Come. Lady Cameena awaits."

"Huh?"

Olga only now just registered that the maid had taken the tray back, and was waiting for her to rise out of bed and follow her. Blushing and with a timid demeanor, Olga got out of bed hesitantly. Her bare feet touching the carpeted floor soothed her somewhat, as did the rest of her baggy nightgown as it flowed and covered her well like a giant blanket.

"This way," the maid led Olga down a great hall as luxurious and brilliant as the main entry hall. They went down a flight of stairs, took a left into another long hallway, and down another flight of stairs that were spiral in design. It was a long walk, and as much as Olga could marvel at taking in more of her new home, the silence was uncomfortable.

"So..." she muttered, pausing to steel her nerve. "Do you...have a name?"

"Thora," the dark-skinned red-head said without pause.

"Thora..." Olga tested the name. "And the one from last night?"

"Aina, most likely."

Olga blinked. Most likely?

As though sensing the blonde's confusion, Thora elaborated. "She is the most experienced. There is no order on which maid attends to the Mistress' property, but Aina usually takes charge as she has worked here the longest."

"I see," Olga said carefully, taking this all in.

They continued on in silence, eventually reaching the grand double doors that lead to the main dining hall.

"We are here," Thora announced calmly, gesturing at the doors.

Olga watched in fascination as the faceless mannequins from last night materialized again to open the doors. She really should asked what were those beings and if they just appeared anywhere whenever.

The massive doors crawled open, revealing the majestic dining room in all its glory, with the lady of the castle sitting at the head of the table.

"Ah, here she is," Cameena crooned, looking up from the parchment she was writing on. "Come, by my side, not a moment to lose!"

Thora stepped aside so Olga could hesitantly walk forward. Any meek greetings she was about to say died in her throat as she took a good look at the gray-skinned countess.

Cameena was dressed much more casually as opposed to the usual regal armor she wore. Compared to last night's commanding attire, she now wore a black gown with red shades. Only that black gown with red shades.

Olga's face reddened as she noted how Cameena's gown was a lot more revealing than hers. Where Olga's swallowed her legs and hid her feet, Cameena's thick gray legs were bare and crossed over the other from where she sat. Where Olga's had sleeves that reached her hands, Cameena's stopped at just the elbow lines. Where Olga's gown covered her budding potbelly well, Cameena's had an open space specifically for her bigger belly to slide out and rest comfortably on her thighs. Finally where Olga's neckline and chest were properly covered, Cameena's prominent chest was very much out in the open.

Well, she had the decency to wear undergarments, but that was beside the point, as Olga's rapidly reddening face and stammering could attest.

"Are you ill?" Cameena asked in regards to the blonde's hot flush, expression twisting in distaste at the idea.

"N-No!" Olga squeaked as she sat beside her eternal hostess, focusing only on the food both out of hunger and to not stare at the scantily-clad vampire. "Just...the snack was really good."

"Was it?" Cameena leaned forward, resting her chubby face on her hands, red eyes glinting with much interest.

"Y-Yes. Thank you."

"Mmm, tell me how good."

"I-I'm sorry?"

Cameena leaned a little closer. "Tell me how good it was," she whispered saucily.

Olga found herself reddening and paling all at once, unable to decide how to properly feel about the chubby immortal right this moment. "It was...delicious..."

Cameena closed her eyes and leaned back with a slow, strong inhale, humming to herself. Olga trembled, fighting to stay focused on the breakfast spread out before her and not at the intimidating vampire.

"Delicious," Cameena said softly, thickly....dreamily? Olga wasn't sure anymore. "Oh! Where are my manners? Please," she gestured at the spread. "Dig in. Eat your fill, same as you did last night."

"Y-Yes..." Olga grabbed at her utensils and got started. Somehow, she was even more famished than she thought possible.

"Mmm, good," Cameena purred approvingly at the blonde's appetite, watching her closely the whole time.
11131111212.title: Breakfast at Cameena's

choices: "...Does it hurt to walk during the day?"
"...What is it like to drink blood? What does it taste like?"
Actually, she asked an entirely different question instead...
111311112121.content:
And yet, whilst Olga began to consume the hearty breakfast spread before her, she soon began to, oddly enough even for her, make some more small talk with the curvaceous Vampire countess, just moments after chowing down on a scrumptious cinnamon bun as she hesitantly asked, "U-Um...L-Lady Cameena? Can...C-Can I ask you something?"

"*sigh* Oh, great. More idle chit-chat. This is annoying. And yet... Why do I feel so obligated to answer?" Cameena contemplated, unsure about her current standing with her esteemed "guest". Sure, it was nothing to write home about when it came to her previous livestock, so...why did this one felt so...different?

"Um...L-Lady Cameena? Are...A-Are you alright?" Olga stammered, which seemed to snap the curvy vampire out of her contemplative stupor, blinking twice and thrice as she finally responded with a half-feint friendly tone and retorted, "Oh! Um...My sincerest apologies, my dear. I was just...contemplating on something. Nothing more."

"W-Well, um...I-I wanted to know what it is like...b-being a vampire, y-you know?" Olga meekly responded, chewing on another cinnamon bun with sheer hesitation, as if worried about making the somewhat plump vampire countess cross by mistake and naivety.

Though, fortunately for the plump Northerner, she was wrong on that thought, as Cameena displayed a curious expression and gesture whilst sitting in her decadent chair, her thick right leg crossed over her equally thick left leg, bearing a rather pleasantly surprised look in her inhuman eyes, with a fanged cheeky grin upon her blood red lips as she quipped, "Oh? ...And what exactly would you desire to know, dear?"

Suffice to say, despite her hostess' seemingly complacency in answering any questions she wholly desired to ask the svelte vampire countess, the problem for Olga was not to ask, but what question to ask. Sure, she could ask something straightforward as "What will happen to me?", or "Will I ever get to see my sister again?"

Suffice to say, the possibilities were quite literally endless. But eventually, after some momentary contemplation, Olga inevitably chose a suitable question to ask, exhaling a deep breath in order to relieve her shaking nerves and calmly asked...
111311112121.title: Olga's Curiosity

choices: Olga manages to run out of the dining hall, and deeper into the castle
Cameena has her breakfast early, and feeds on Olga until she passes out
1113111121212.content:
"When you, you know..." Olga dragged the first syllable out long as her voice stabilized, "Drink the blood."

Cameena's plaintive expression softened slightly. Her black brows raised just so, and her half-slitted eyes opened a bit more as she balanced her prominent pointed chin on top of the back of her hand. Leaning forward onto the table, the right corner of her blue lips tugged until the faintest hint of a smile had formed.

"As one with my prediliction tends to do." she added coolly

"Right." a hasty, almost embarassed laugh came from Cameena's dinnerguest, "Um... what does it... taste like?"

And here, the seeds of Cameena's smile began to blossom into a little smirk. An odd noise of quaint amusement flowed through her gray nostrils in what Olga may have mistook for a little laugh. Her hostess repositioned herself on the table, lifting her head and nestling it in her other hand boredly. With her now free dominant hand, she gesticulated vaguely while contemplating Olga's question.

"Now there's a conversation I didn't expect to have tonight," Cameena said, more to herself than to Olga, as she glanced emptily at her nails beneath long lacy gloves, "Whatever do you want to know that for, my dear?"

"Just, um..." Olga gulped, "Making conversation?"

"How quaint, you trying to keep me entertained." Cameena said with what appeared to be genuine amusement at the situation before repeating the question. "What does blood taste like?"

"To you, it may all taste the same. I don't suppose cute little farm girls are in the habit of suckling on their neighbors necks, but I don't know many mortals who enjoy the taste." Cameena silently beckoned a mannequin to fill her glass with viscous red wine, commanding it to stop with just two fingers once the glass was full, "But when you've acquired the proper taste for it, you'd be surprised with all the myriad ways that decide the flavor in one's veins."

"It's like... spices? A bit like spices." Cameena visibly struggled with the word, having gone for some time without the use for them herself, "What one puts into themselves affects the various intricacies of the meal—some people, you see, have a very thick blood while others are thin blooded, or say some have sweet blood while others are more bitter."

Olga watched from the other end of the dining hall, being attended to by the various servants as well she would allow. Everything was delicious, but something about tossing around the idea of drinking blood so casually made her sit uncomfortably in her seat. And the food sit uncomfortably on her stomach. She knew that she was the one who brought up the subject, and wouldn't object, but her eyes were far bigger than her stomach in this sense.

The way that her horrid hostess seemed to become so enthralled with the subject was another matter. The comfort that Cameena seemed to feel talking about drinking blood was proportionate to the discomfort that began to rise in the pit of Olga's stomach.

"But the most important part is that the taste of the blood can be influenced by a number of things." Cameena spread her fingers laterally in front of her, "The host's diet is a big indicator of what their blood will taste like, but things like exercise and overall health will affect whether or not the blood runs thin."

"Uh-huh." Olga gulped, "So... if I eat..."

"Yes, your diet is very much reflective of my diet so to speak." Cameena chuckled with surprising warmth, taking the connection from Olga's shoulders and putting it onto the dinner table, "To make a long story short... what you're eating now is going to impact how your blood tastes to me."

Olga felt her stomach drop out from underneath her. Her chest seemed to hollow out at the reminder that she was going to be feasted upon. Her blood was going to be drunken, whether she liked it or not.

"I..." Olga's face turned sheet white, "I don't..."

"Oh pish posh, you'll barely feel a thing." Cameena said dismissively, though not without seeming to understand that she'd made her dinnerguest uncomfortable, "You've hardly touched the ham now. Eat up."

The room seemed to spin as Olga's mind spun out of control. Once more, the awful reality dawned upon her; she was this monster's captive. Her slave. Her pet. Fancy dresses and nice rooms and scrumptious breakfasts meant nothing, only that she was being kept comfortable for ease of access. This gray-skinned, blue-lipped she-demon was going to... going to...

"I... I need some air..." Olga stood abruptly, knocking the chair out from behind her

"Miss, please." Thora said sternly, putting two hands on Olga's shoulders

"N-No!" the blonde farmgirl knocked her away, "St-Stay away!"
1113111121212.title: Questions Better Left Unasked

choices: Cameena bites Olga, draining enough to leave her lightheaded and calmer.
Cameena restrains herself, opting to calm Olga down with words and mild comforts
Free choice
11131111212121.content:
Olga was running purely on adrenaline. She didn't notice or care for anything else except for the exit behind her, pivoting around and making a run for it before Thora and another maid could get their hands on her. She took off in such a hurry that her naked foot flying through her nightgown came dangerously close from colliding with the collapsed chair.

"Miss!" someone said, probably Thora or another of her co-workers. Olga wasn't sure because it all came as a blur.

"Let her go," even Cameena's lazy command to the maids came as hazy and distant, and Olga's instincts immediately ordered her to capitalize on the opportunity.

You have a chance. Run.

And run she did, guided only by instinct as she pushed past the double doors, entered the grand hallway, and ran like she had never run before. More than once she came close to tripping as a consequence of her gown's flowing skirt, but thankfully fate was not that cruel. Yet.

She kept running with no end goal in sight. Anything to just get away from the monster. For a brief moment of clarity amidst her panic, she considered running for the main gates. She discarded the idea as quickly as it came; no way she could get out of the castle in any capacity. Trying to would be the most clear-cut way of getting caught. Or worse.

She didn't notice or care when she came to points where the hallway divided. She just picked one direction and ran down that hallway. It didn't matter to her where she ended up, she just wanted to get away.

It didn't help that she ran past many maids along the way. The castle's many attendants carried on with their tasks, completely ignoring the hysterical blonde running in their company. Some did pause in their duties to stare in silence as Olga ran past them, but that was it. Not a single ounce of surprise on their faces. Just this...blank curiosity that only served to unnerve Olga even more. It only encouraged her to run faster.

She didn't know what turn she took or if maybe at some point she had stopped in her tracks to run the other way around, but somehow she ended up in the kitchen. Assuming this was the only kitchen in the castle, and taking into account what Cameena had said at the table, it was a safe bet there had to be more than one kitchen in this giant castle.

"Hm?" a woman whom Olga assumed to be the head of the kitchen turned to look at the blonde intruder. No one else did, all the other females present busying themselves with their kitchen tasks, whether it was chopping meat or cleaning plates and silverware. "Miss, you're not supposed to be here."

Olga just stared, blue eyes wide and her mouth falling open and then closing as she breathed haphazardly. She was about to say something, but the executive chef gave a smile that made Olga freeze up.

"Unless..." the azure-haired woman said. "If you're here because you are still hungry, you need only say so. Shall we prepare a snack dish?"

The mere mention of food triggered another panic attack in Olga. She let out what was supposed to be a piercing scream, but what came out instead was a strangled gasp. She quickly turned on her bare heel and ran out of the kitchen, openly sobbing in despair.

"P-Please!" Olga wailed, shutting her eyes as her tears trailed behind her. "J-Just stay away! Please! Leave me alone--!"

She ran headfirst into a body, shrieking in fright as she fell back, her arms flailing as she went. A set of hands that felt cold to the touch grabbed at her wrists, saving her from falling down to the carpet floor.

"Are you finished?" Cameena sounded amused, and Olga opened her eyes to see the little fanged grin the vampire was giving her. "Honestly, if you weren't cattle, I would have said you were--"

"NO!" Olga shrieked loud enough to stun Cameena. "L-L-L-Let me go! LET ME GO!"

Cameena stared in barely hidden shock, gaping numbly as the little human wretched like a rabid animal trying to get free. The immortal tightened her grip on the girl's wrists quickly, but continued to stare in surprise and, dare she say it, a little bit of awe at the hysterical ferocity the blonde was displaying.

"Hey now!" Cameena started over Olga's screams and desperate fighting. "Calm down--!"

"NO!" the human wailed. "PLEASE! I DON'T WANT TO DIE!"

Cameena was silent for a second, absorbing those words and then blinking in honest shock. "That's what this is about? You aren't going to--"

"JUST LET ME GO! PLEASE--!"

"ENOUGH!"

Olga froze as Cameena's palm landed on her cheek and firmly stayed there. Her terrified, watery blue eyes looked up to meet Cameena's inhuman red eyes.

She didn't look happy.

Olga trembled horribly from a combination of her terror, Cameena's displeased gaze upon her, and the cold the vampire's touch brought.

Cameena just stared at her, actually growling a little as she made her displeasure known. Olga could only whimper and periodically gasp. She didn't notice the countess was looking at her chest, as though gauging the beats of her rapidly-beating heart inside her.

Cameena frowned. Human hearts aren't supposed to beat that fast. I need to calm her...
11131111212121.title: A Fruitless Endeavor

choices: The next day...
Several weeks later...
Several months later...
111311112121211.content:
Cameena rearranged her grip; holding Olga firmly by the shoulders, her fingers creasing the dress as she held the girl steady. Then, with the speed of a striking snake, her head lunged forward towards the girl.

Olga’s eyes went wide with shock as she felt the vampire bite down, it was like a pair of needles had struck her right in the neck. A sensation of coldness came over her, as Cameena’s lips created a tight seal around the wound, and then it began in earnest. A light-headedness came over Olga as she felt her blood being drained, her entire body feeling cold and numb from the vampire’s bite.

Meanwhile Cameena was trying to concentrate; she had no desire to drain enough to harm Olga, so she had to keep her parasitic appetite in check. Drain too much, and she could cause permanent damage to Olga, or worse. But it was proving more difficult than she anticipated; Olga’s blood was naturally very sweet it seemed, a taste the vampire relished more than any other wine of the vein. For a brief moment, Cameena’s eyes closed in bliss and she gulped a little too deeply, causing Olga to shake slightly.

Coming back to her senses, Cameena stopped herself and pulled her fangs out, her lips leaving Olga’s neck with a wet pop sound. The girl looked pale and her head was lolling back, but her heart was still beating, good.

Cameena adjusted her grip, tucking one arm under Olga’s back and the other down behind her knees, scooping the smaller woman up. There was nothing Olga could do, she had completely lost consciousness. With long elegant strides, the vampire began to carry her cargo back to the center of the castle.

---


“Ah!”

Olga woke up, everything coming back to her; the dinner, the vampire, running down the halls and… then having her blood drained by that monster!

Looking around, the blonde noticed that she was once again seated in the dining hall, but where was that vampire?

“I didn’t want to bite you tonight.” The voice caught Olga off-guard as Cameena strode into view, her expression was stern, like that of a disappointed parent. Olga just stared, so the vampire continued, “If you had just done as you were told, you wouldn’t have fainted… now eat up, you need to regain your strength.”

Olga turned her gaze forwards, noticing that the table had been re-set, with a new feast prepared for her. Despite her fear of… the entire situation, Olga leaned forward and began to help herself to a roast.

As she ate, Cameena continued lecturing her, “I told you that no harm would come to you in here.” She said in an icy tone. “You are protected by the largest fortress for miles, and I do not tolerate intruders. No chance of being killed by famine, disease or one of the beasts that prowl the woods.”

Instead of replying, Olga simply glared at her kidnapper. She wanted to give some sort of retort, but the vampire was far too intimidating… plus she really needed to eat, despite the meal earlier, she felt like she was on the verge of starving.

Cameena sighed, “Perhaps I need to iron out this relationship. I am not your predator, and you are not prey… you are my cattle and I am the farmer. Your every need shall be taken care of, and you will be very well fed here.”

As she finished, Olga stared at a large chunk of beef before her, “Farmers kill their cows… is that what you eventually intend to do with me?”

“Ok, enough with the analogies…” Cameena sighed, “I don’t need to drain you completely of blood, I just need some.” As the vampire spoke, Olga’s eyes lowered to her host’s middle. The gray-skinned woman’s belly was looking a bit rounder than she remembered, and it bobbed and sloshed quite a bit as well. “And things will be easier for you…” she continued, “if you ate more and kept up your strength. As I said earlier, I didn’t want to drink from you tonight, but you forced my hand. If you had just eaten well, it would have been a lot less unpleasant for you.”

There was a prolonged silence between the two, as Olga continued to eat, but making sure to keep an eye on Cameena. The vampire didn’t move though, she was intent on making sure Olga ate her fill.

Eventually though, one of the maids entered through the great doors and approached the owner of the castle.

“Mistress…” the girl began, before whispering something to the tall elegant woman.

“It seems my presence is required elsewhere tonight.” Cameena stated, still maintain her disapproving tone. “Rest assured though, I have no intention of letting tonight’s incident be repeated…” she then turned to the maid, “do not let her leave until she has finished the meal.” The maid nodded obediently, as Cameena strode past, a deep clang of the doors closing behind her as she left.

Olga wasn’t sure which she found more unnerving, Cameena’s icy stare, or this maid’s weird expressionless face. Either way, the blonde girl decided things would go best if she just ate what she could.

Bit by bit, Olga ate her way through the lavish dinner. If her situation would have been different, she would have quite enjoyed this, the meats were tender and rich in flavor, the sauces were thick and were almost delicious enough to drink straight from the spout, and she hadn’t even got to the desserts yet.

“I think I have had my fill…” Olga stated as she tried to leave her chair. But as she did, Olga felt strong fingers wrap around her wrist.

“Mistress said you are not to leave until it is finished.” The maid stated flatly.

Olga tried to wrest herself from the grasp, but found she could not. Either that bite had left her more drained than she thought, or this maid was far stronger than she looked.

“Uh… I guess I could have a bit more…” Olga mumbled, which seemed to satisfy the maid and released Olga’s arm. She wasn’t uncomfortably full, but what remained on the table seemed like a disproportionate amount of food for her to eat alone.

She tried her best though; thankfully Olga was on the desserts now, and they all went down smoothly, even if some sat pretty heavily in her stomach. Reluctant eating turned into slow plodding chews, as Olga’s belly began to stretch and strain with its contents.

It was a struggle for the poor girl to push the last slice of tart past her lips, but down it went, she could practically feel it hit her stomach with a squelch.

“I… I’m done…” Olga panted, dropping her cutlery.

The maid gave a polite nod. “Very good. Follow me to your room.”

However the maid, instead of helping Olga out of her chair, simply watched as the blonde girl heaved herself up. It felt like she had swallowed a lump of lead, and it kind of looked like it as well. Her dress may have been loose, but there was certainly a prominent swollen shape at the front. Gods, she looked like one of the pregnant women she had seen in the village.

Gingerly, she waddled after the maid, cradling her stuffed stomach as she was lead back up the flights of stairs, and into her lavish bedroom quarters.

Olga had had enough, she just wanted to go to sleep, and pray that this was just a horrible nightmare. Unfortunately the maid was still standing there… watching.

“I don’t need any help…” Olga stated, hoping that it might make her go away.

Thankfully, she did. With another bow, she left, closing the door after her. Olga emitted a sigh of relief, finally she was alone.

Waddling into towards her mirror, Olga pulled back her blonde locks to take a look at the damage. Two scabs were visible on her neck, where Cameena had bit her. She inwardly hoped they wouldn’t scare, but it was the least of her worries. One of which being her middle.

Gently, Olga pulled her dress upwards, to reveal her stomach. It was stuffed alright, puffed out and very sensitive to the touch. Olga thought back to Cameena’s words earlier, “was this what she meant by well fed?” She muttered to herself.

She let the dress drop back down, and turned to her bed. It seemed it had been made since she left it last, and a nightdress had been laid out on top of it. Like her current one, it was quite oversized for her, and very frilly and elegant.

Olga began to remove her dress; sleep was the only thing she was looking forward to right now. At least her dreams would take her away from this place.
111311112121211.title: The Vampire's Kiss

choices: An unlocked bedroom door. Time for Olga to get out of her pen a little...
Cameena Stranken, looking positively plump, and here for a snack of her own...
Free Choice
1113111121212112.content:
For the rest of her first day, Olga stayed in bed.

The lunch that she had eaten was especially heavy, and Cameena's feeding had left her particularly drained of energy. She made an attempt at the dinner that was brought to her, but most of her night was spent asleep. The maids had helped her change into proper sleeping attire—a long, silk nightgown that hung off of her like a rug—and put her to bed properly. The nausea that came with eating so much rich food on a stomach upset by the onset anemia left her feeling dizzy and weak. She was put to bed after being forced to eat a quarter of another rich meal, and fell back to sleep as soon as her head hit the pillow.

When she awoke early the next morning, she hardly felt any better.

The queasiness was still ever-present, curling the back of her throat and souring in the base of her nose. But the full moon over the mountain, high at this time of night, brightened her bedroom so much that she could hardly sleep. Edging herself towards the bed, Olga rose to rocking knees and wobbled unsteadily to the first window to draw the blinds.

And that was when she realized that she could see her hometown down below.

Sure, it was dark. Very few candles were lit at this time of night. But she could clearly make out town square. And following it with her finger, Olga could see the Bleakfrost Tavern. Which meant Ms. Helga and Ms Somaria's houses were right there. Greta's was across the street. The Woodcutter boys were across the way and there, two streets over from them, was her and Tora's house. The shop that her papa had started. Where she, her sister, and both of her parents had lived, all together. Before tragedy took them one by one. First her mama, then her papa, and now her...

She had to escape.

Letting the curtains flutter freely, Olga hurried to the door and struggled to turn the lock. They had locked her in here.

She pounded at the door an shouted, hoping that maybe one of those maids would hear her. She wailed and pounded for an hour, but to no avail.

***


Day in and day out, Olga was confined to her bedroom.

Initially, Olga had viewed her confinement to her bedroom as punishment. A way of correcting her behavior after her first night in the castle. She thought back to the horse breeders she had known in Racovania, how they would sometimes take in a wild stallion and then have to break them before they could be saddle-ridden.

How fortunate for her—she'd gone from steer to stallion after showing out.

Her room was big enough to allow her walking space. A toilet, bidet, and bath were tucked into the corner and hidden behind a thick red curtain. With no other options for seating, however, Olga would spent a lot of her day in bed. When she wasn't pacing around the room out of boredom or looking longingly at her hometown from the window, she was laying in bed, staring at the canopy. There was nothing to do. Everything that she could have wanted was provided to her by the daily rotation of maids that tended to her every need. They cleaned up after her, they delivered her meals, and they helped to dress her. They were also her only conversation; Olga treasured her moments with them more than a starving man to a grain of rice. She kept them in her room for as long as possible.

"Oh no, guests do not leave their rooms." Phyla had said one day with a small smile—she was easily the most approachable of them, "the mistress will call upon you when she's ready. Has she not been coming every night?"

"But I had dinner in the dining hall on my first night?"

"Of course you did. All of the mistress's guests do." Thora said somewhat gruffly, picking up the pieces of glass that Olga's latest accident had left imbedded in her rug, "And do you remember how you acted? Only the Mistress's favorites get to dine in the grand hall. And even then, not every night."

"So I'm just to sit here in my bedroom for the rest of my life?"

"You will do what the Mistress commands." Aino cocked a black eyebrow, "I will see to that. You're just lucky that the Mistress seems so taken with your taste, ma'am."

Olga was going stir-crazy. The only thing there was to do in the castle was eat. Four times a day, a different maid would knock on her door politely before rolling in a right feast for Olga to consume. She finished every meal puffing and panting, sometimes she could barely see straight before she collapsed onto her bed, cradling her doming stomach.

Breakfast, lunch, a second smaller meal before dinner, and then dinner proper. Olga ate enough to feed an entire shift back at the Bleakfrost Tavern. And with no exercise, all of Olga's muscles were melting away into soft jiggly flab.

Cameena Stranken was fattening her up!

"Don't sound so surprised, darling." Cameena had said to her during one of her daily feedings, "I told you that you would be kept very well-fed."

Olga's round face was especially so after the coming weeks. Her whole body had softened in light of the confounded conditioning she'd been put through. When she got here, she could hardly finish one meal. But after having nothing to do but eat all day, she'd gotten quite good at it. Her belly swelled out, her thighs widened and quivered with her every step. Her bosom blossomed outwards and hung lower and heavier. Without a mirror proper, Olga could only surmise the change by touch. But she knew that she was getting fat.

Olga had learned how to keep herself steady now, after Cameena's feedings. If she ate enough, she would only feel a bit light-headed. And since her hostess popped by at random, and was going to get her fill, it was incentive enough to avoid the sickness that came with her blood being let out on an empty stomach.

"And it's not like you're not getting anything out of this." Cameena purred, poking Olga in the belly, "Your tummy gets filled to satisfaction every night, yes?"

Cameena's finger sunk deep into Olga's pillowy paunch

"That's what I thought." she purred before licking her lips, "Do you think that you can manage another helping, darling? I'm a bit peckish today and your brand is especially scrumptious..."

***


"Here is the book you requested, ma'am." Thora said, handing Olga a large leather-bound book from the castle's library, "Some light reading after an especially heavy lunch then?"

"You could say that." Olga took the book in one hand, "How are you, Thora?"

"I'm well, and very busy." Thora had caught wise to Olga's penchant for wasting precious minutes of her busy day of tending to Cameena's livestock, "Enjoy the book, ma'am."

The door shut behind her, and Olga just groaned and flung herself on the bed. The book fell to the floor. She was a Smith's daughter, she had no book learning! She could barely read! But the other maids would at least tell her about the book if they'd read it. Then maybe she could talk to someone about more than just food. Or the Mistress. Or her bedding or whatever thing she'd broken so they'd have to come and stay with her for just a minute longer.

The terror that gripped her heart about this place was almost well and gone, but terminal boredom had been left in its place.

There was nothing to do here.

Olga groaned as she lay sprawled on the bed, belly rising high beneath her dress. Two meals into today and she was already stuffed. If untying her dress wasn't impossible without one of her maids, she would have done it by now. Let herself be free and breathe. After lunch was always the hardest time of the day. It seemed to come right after breakfast, whereas the small snack before dinner was much later in the afternoon. It barely gave her time to digest anything...

Which was probably the point. If that book didn't put her to sleep, her full gut might. Then she'd wake up just in time for her pre-dinner snack. Not cause any trouble. No begging for books she couldn't read or breaking priceless baubles so that the maids would come into her room and gripe at her. No trapping the help in conversations about the topics she knew interested them. Just eat and sleep, eat and sleep.

Like a good little farm animal.

Thankfully for Olga, an alternative method for occupying her afternoon presented itself in...
