There is a physician in Adinah that might be able to help her
11131122111211122.content:
In truth Coatlzintli was not all that thrilled about negotiating with a vampire. She was in a very delicate state right now, being in just the early stages of her pregnancy and honestly felt quite frail. Were she at her full strength then Coatlzintli would have felt more confident, in case the vampire decided to pull something during negotiations. She had to play this carefully.

As her dais approached the castle the naga looked up at its pitch-black stonework and tall be—spiked spires with menacing gargoyles. It was a far cry from the golden palaces of her swampy home.

As she approached tiny creatures dressed in robes skittered about, opening doors for her entourage and jabbering among themselves as they beckoned. Coatlzintli and her guards were led through a large stone courtyard, into a gigantic set of wrought-iron doors and into a massive hallway. The stone was just as bleak on the inside as the outside, with just red carpeting and drapes to break the color-scheme.

The creatures still beckoned though, leading on to a side set of doors almost as large as the first. Inside this room was a long banquet table. Its chairs sat empty, bar one; and relaxing there with a goblet in her hand was the “queen” of the castle, Carmeena Stranken.

“I did not know I was expecting guests…do what occasion do I owe the pleasure of such royalty in my castle?” The vampire purred before taking a sip from her cup. “I would offer you something to drink…but I just finished a hearty meal and I don’t think the flavour is quite to your…tastes.”

The naga queen looked long and hard at the creature sat before her. She had encountered these loathsome bloodsuckers before, but she never remembered any of them being quite so…corpulent. Carmeena Stranken looked absolutely stuffed into her clothes; her corset could actually be heard creaking with each slight movement the vampire made, her face had a clear double chin, her breasts were bulging almost lewdly out of her brassiere and her thick thighs seemed to be almost wrestling with each other. “I see you are looking well.” Coatzintli commented, trying to hide her rather mild touch on the vampire’s girth.

“I am here on business.” Coatlzintli stated firmly, rising a little out of her dais as it was placed on the ground. Being the queen of the naga came with some nice perks, like an overall larger frame than the majority of her kind; this gave her an edge when it came to bargaining with anyone smaller than her (which happen to be nearly every race in Yndyre).

“Business?” Carmeena repeated, twirling one of her long locks of raven-colored hair between two of her gray fingers. “I am not sure what I have that you could want.”

“A girl, human, from the village below.” The naga stated.

Carmeena at the statement simply threw her head back. “Hohoho! You are going to have to be more specific, I have many girls here and there within my walls.” Composing herself, the vampire continued; “Anyway…what does the great queen of the naga want with a lowly human girl? I can see you are not want for more slaves.” She gestured to the four men that stood by the dais.

“Blonde hair with blue eyes, she had a sister in the town. And never you mind why I want her, what matters is what I can give you in exchange…” Coatzintli offered, snapping the fingers of one of her upper arms.

Carmeena then got a bit sniffy. “I was going to ask; as I do not give up my cattle lightly, even if you…are…” The vampire stuttered as she saw what one of the eunuchs was holding. It was a massive glass container, filed to the brim with red liquid.

Coatzintli smiled, she had a hook. “I heard that vampires love rare blood, especially from sunny realms they do not wish to visit. And this batch was especially hard to recover…I assume you have never seen tyrannosaur blood before?”

“No…never…” Carmeena stuttered, her fangs sinking into her dark-gray lip as she tried to contain herself.

“So what do you say, the girl for the blood?” The naga offered, gesturing with her left-two arms at the jar.

The vampire wanted to hold back, to try and get a better deal, but she couldn’t The idea of blood from such a rare and exquisite creature was too much for her; oh the tastes from such a beast must be amazing!

“Yes…take her…one of my servants will show you to her room.”

The naga smiled again. “Good to do business with you.” She thanked, sliding back onto her dais as one of the eunuchs placed the jar at the far end of the table and joined his fellows as they picked up a corner each and escorted the heavily-laden queen out of the room.

Another of the little robed imps led the way. It was to a small side-room on the other side of the hall (clearly Carmeena liked keeping her food close by). As the doors opened Coatzintli covered her mouth in shock.

There was Tora, lying on a massive elegant bed while a pair of imps dashed back and forth stuffing food between her lips. She was dressed in a disheveled dress that had probably been elegant once, but was now more tattered food-stained rags than anything else. And her size was shocking as well; Coatzintli was used to seeing big, but Tora looked more than just that, she looked like a wave of lard trying to cover the bed. Tora's face was framed by a big fat ring of a double-chin, her arms were like hams and her belly was trying to overtake her whole lap.

“Food?” She burbled as the imps stopped feeding to see who had entered. Hurriedly they began nattering with the one that had guided Coatzintli inside, and then left the queen alone with Tora.

“By the gods…lower me now!” Coatzintli demanded before slithering over to Tora’s side. The girl was bleary-eyed and looked completely out of it. “She isn’t well, we need to get her to a physician…put her on my dais!”

The eunuchs moved as one, taking hold of some part of Tora as they raised her from the bed and onto the leaf-covered carrier. All the while the girl still mumbled about more food and how hungry she was.

“Quickly, we don’t have much time.” The queen hissed as she placed her lower hands on her taut belly, before slithering out the door eunuchs’ in-tow.

The naga queen muttered to herself that this was an awfully big risk to go through, but the vampires were vile parasites and this would be a blow to them.


***


Meanwhile, back in the dining hall…

“Oh *oomph* so good!”

Carmeena had wasted little time in helping herself to the container. The greedy vampire had never been able to restrain her bloodlust very well, certainly not for long periods anyway. She gulped greedily, allowing the blood to flow into her mouth like a waterfall. She could feel her belly press ever so much more against her corset, but she ignored it.

“Oh…*urp* that was exquisite…” The vampire remarked to nobody in particular. But as she wiped her mouth with the back of her hand she noticed something odd. Her gray skin had a little…mark on it, the more she looked at it the brighter it seemed. Then there was another one, a dark pink in color.

The queen of the night then looked at her arm; the same things were running up it! She was coming out in horribly blotches!

Then suddenly Carmeena felt a pressure in her chest, it was like her corset was trying to choke her! Struggling with the strings, the vamp decided to simply rip it from her person! Big gray boobs bobbed naked in the air, her modesty vanishing into the night as her dark-gray areola jutted outwards like huge plugs. It was then she noticed the problem, her boobs were swelling!

Carmeena cupped her massive mammeries as they grew bigger and bigger, overwhelming her hands like sacks of lard. It was then that she realised she had been duped, and she let out an unearthly screech.

“AAAARGH!” She roared, “Cow’s blood!? I hate cow’s blood! It goes right to my tits! Ugh!” Carmeena was furious that she had been had; the vampire thought to giving chase…but what if one of the other vampires or Eviana saw or heard her? She would be the laughing stock of the clan if that happened!

Cursing to herself, Carmeena tried to hug her swelling boobs to her chest, begging that the growth would stop soon.


***


“Tora! Oh gods what has been done to her?” Olga was in tears, she had her sister back, but the state she was in was horrible. “Please..” she sniveled, turning to the queen, “You have to help her!”
11131122111211122.title: Offering for a Vampire

111311221112111221.content:
Despite the fact that Olga's sister was now out of reach from Cameena's gluttonous fingers, even Coatzintli felt disgusted towards how the sibling of her new personal chef was being treated within the walls of Cameena's gothic castle, rendered into becoming nothing more than a living feedbag to the bloodsuckers. And yet, out of all of them, it just had to be the gluttonous one of all, Cameena Stranken. In a way, it almost made the Naga Queen lose her composure and vomit the food within her stomach. Either way, the deed was done, and now all that remained...was how to aid the fattened sister of Olga Forgedotter.

From there, Coatzintli slithered toward the distressed Olga, placing both her right hands upon one of Olga's chubby shoulders, where she then spoke toward the distressed female chef and asked, "Are there any physicians who can aid your sister here in your village?"

"...N-No, your highness! The Strankens took all of the healers and physicians in every village across Racovania. Th-They needed them for...something. I-I'm not sure why they needed them," Olga replied, stuttering a little from how distraught she was from seeing her older sister in such a fattened yet fragile state.

Of course, Coatzintli now realized what the vampires needed from the healers and physicians: They needed such individuals to keep the humans they've fattened up healthy, as well as making sure their blood was sweet and delectable. Overall, what Tora was forced to endure was undoubtedly a fate worse than death. Whether such healers were willing or reluctant in such insidious tasks...

Only the gods know of such an enigma.

But now, Coatzintli weighed her options going forward. She knew that they undoubtedly weren't returning to the lion's den, because there was a high probability that Cameena would certainly be waiting for them. That is, if the vampire could muster the courage to reveal herself with such enormous mammaries. Inevitably, Coatzintli knew there was only one option available now, as she calmly spoke toward Olga and sternly said, "Then, I guess we have no other alternative..."

"I am NOT leaving my sister to die, your highness!" Olga exclaimed, which the Naga Queen clearly understood the context behind the plump human's outburst.

In response to such an outburst, Coatzintli sternly spoke toward the distraught Olga and answered, "That is not what I have in mind, Olga Forgedotter." From there, Coatzintli turned her head to look toward one of her bodyguards, Shemal, and firmly commanded, "Shemal! Prepare the second dais! We're taking Tora Forgedotter with us!"

"As you wish, your highness!" Shemal swiftly retorted, where the bodyguard quickly hustled out of the ramshackled lodge and towards her fellow servants, commanding to prepare the second dais.

"Wait, you're.... Y-You're taking my sister with us?" Olga questioned, her expression in a semblance of slight disbelief yet also relief as well.

Coatzintlii then approached both siblings, then began to slowly cradle the half-conscious Tora in her dark-skinned arms somewhat and retorted, "In actuality, Olga Forgedotter, WE are transporting your sister with us. Judging from her current state, her mind must have been unwillingly and forcefully altered to be more docile to their indoctrination. Fortunately, we have a few healers and physicians who are experienced with such trauma, but we will have to return to Vaal-Za'haraam immediately so your sister will be given the proper treatment."

"So...We're leaving tonight, aren't we?" Olga asked, quickly connecting the dots as to what was unraveling before her eyes. And judging from how hasty the Naga Queen was slithering, Coatzintli must have done something insulting to someone, most likely to Cameena Stranken of all people. So, as Olga assisted Coatzintli in carrying her fattened sibling, the chubby female chef soon spoke toward the Naga Queen and said, "You...You did something while you were rescuing my sister, didn't you?"

"Let's just say say I gave Cameena Stranken cow blood. Made her think it was actually Tyrannosaur blood. Consider it as revenge for her atrocious crimes against your sister, Olga Forgedotter. However, right now, it is imperative that we pass the southern borders of Racovania by dawn's light. Otherwise, we shall be expecting a rather hostile Cameena Stranken once she recovers from her bloodied drunk stupor," Coatzintli confessed, being truthful and honest about what troubles she had willingly committed against the ruthless Cameena Stranken, as Olga managed to assist the Naga Queen and one or two of her bodyguards in carrying the now corpulent yet half-conscious Tora onto the newly built dais, making sure not to injure the older sibling when they laid her down.

From there, shortly after they laid Tora down on the second dais, Coatzintli soon spoke toward Olga and sternly said, "Olga Forgedotter, you will be transported alongside your sister in this dais. So, if there is anything that you need before we depart, now is the time to grab the necessities."

Of course, Olga instantly knew what the Naga Queen meant, as she then quickly sprinted back inside the hut, grabbing a family portrait and the quilt that her mother made for her and Tora when they were children, then rushing back out of the lodge and sitting on the dais alongside her sister.

"We're ready to leave, your highness," Olga flatly answered, letting Coatzintli and the bodyguards know that they were ready to leave Racovania. From there, as the group commanded their Marsh Wargs to pull the dais, Olga began to gently stroke her sister's unkempt lengthy hair, gently whispering into her sibling's ear as she calmly muttered, "It's okay, Tora. It's okay, you're safe. We're gonna get you help, I promise. I won't leave your side until then."
111311221112111221.title: A Long, Treacherous Journey

1113112211121112211.content:
Although they were involuntarily left with no choice but to leave their village without properly saying goodbye to everyone they knew, Olga and Tora Forgedotter were now on their way to the Naga capital city within the Motee Marshes, known only as "Vaal-Za'haraam". And yet, even though Olga was already well aware that she could no longer return home, Tora on the other hand... She wasn't even consciously aware of her current surroundings due to the involuntary brainwashing she was forced to undergo.

Suffice to say, both siblings had quite a long way to go until they reached the Motee Marshes.

And yet, despite how quick such events had transpired, all that Olga could care about...was her beloved older sister, who was currently rendered in a half-conscious and somewhat gluttonous stupor, always automatically yet subconsciously muttering for more food. Seeing her sister in such a jumbled ramshackled psychological condition certainly tugged heavily at Olga's heartstrings, causing the chubby female chef to shed some tears of grief and familial sympathy.

Eventually, by the time dawn's first light peered over the mountains, the entire group had long passed the southernmost borders of Racovania. Fortunately for them, the vampires weren't reckless and foolish enough to step out into broad daylight to hunt them without being burnt by the Sun's blazing light, and Coatzintli and the group were already deep in the rolling hills and farmlands of the Plains of Grobland, with farmers going through their fields to collect and harvest their homegrown produce and edibles.

However, as they were halfway through the Plains of Grobland, Olga began to gently sing towards her half-conscious sister, hoping to entice some semblance of a familial response from her weakened yet fattened sibling, as she began to gently stroke Tora's hair while she softly sang, "Hhhmmm, hmmm-hm... I see your red door... I want to paint it black... No colors *sob* anymore... I want them to turn black... I see the children walk by, dressed in their summer clothes... I have to turn my head, until my darkness goooes..."

At first, Coatzintli and the Nagas paid no mind of Olga's singing, which was surprisingly good considering that the plump human was never known to be a singer. However, it was at the second set of lyrics that the Naga paid close attention as Olga sang once more as she said, "I see your lines of colors, and they're all painted black... With flowers and my love, both never to come back... I've seen people turn their heads, and quickly look away... Like a newborn baby, it just happens everyday..."

Although she was unfamiliar with Racovanian folk songs, Coatzintli could easily understand that it was a song filled with somber tones, which made her feel all the more sympathetic towards Olga's familial plight. From there, Coatzintli gestured the servants to move her dais to be alongside the dais that held the two siblings within, where she then spoke toward Olga and calmly quipped, "...That was a beautiful song, Olga Forgedotter. I was unaware of your talents as a songstress."

Upon hearing Coatzintli's voice, Olga immediately stopped singing, where she then turned around to look at the Naga Queen and retorted, "Th-Thank you, your highness."

"I assume the reason for such a song was to entice a response from your sister, correct?" Coatzintli calmly replied, her voice displaying a compassionate tone towards the plump female human.

Of course, in response, Olga firmly nodded yes in confirmation, where she then spoke toward the Naga Queen and explained, "It was a song our mother used to sing to us when we were children. *sob* B-Back when we were still naive... I-I thought I could snap Tora out of this if I sang our mother's song to her, but..."

But then, Coatzintli swiftly placed a dark-skinned left lower hand upon Olga's left rounded shoulder, reassuring her as she answered, "Fret not, Olga Forgedotter. Once we reach Vaal-Za'haraam, I shall have my people's healers and physicians begin on healing and mending Tora's mind immediately. In the meantime however, I need you to be here for your sister. It might help if she has a familiar face beside her."

"Th-Thank you, your highness. It...It means a lot from you to help Tora." Olga said, feeling grateful for Coatzintli's aid in this dire matter.

The Naga Queen soon answered, "Your thanks is appreciated, Olga Forgedotter."

From there, Coatzintli's dais swiftly pulled ahead of the dais that Olga and Tora were transported in, just as Shemal and the other bodyguards trudged alongside their Queen's dais. "Permission to speak freely, your highness?" Shemal asked.

The Naga Queen swiftly replied, "Permission granted, Shemal."

"With all due respect, my Queen, but... Why are we risking so much for one human and her sibling? I understand your position as Queen and your duties to our people, but is it worth invoking the wrath of the damned bloodsuckers?" Shemal questioned, wanting to understand why Coatzintli was making such unnecessary risks for one human and her now weakened but fattened sibling.

Of course, in response to such skepticism, Coatzintli firmly spoke toward one of her most decorated bodyguards and queried, "I understand your skepticism and doubt, Shemal. However, ask me this: Do you deeply care for your beloved Ku'Sari?"

"Yes, I am willing to do anything for my betrothed, my Queen, but...What does this have to do with my question?" Shemal asked, confused as to why her Queen would bring up her lover, Ku'Sari, so trivially.

However, in response to such a question, Coatzintli firmly spoke toward the bodyguard and explained, "Shemal, you witnessed what had befallen on Tora Forgedotter with your own eyes. Imagine what should happen if these vampires decided that Nagas are much more delectable. What the human's sister has endured is truly a fate worse than death. I'm not trying to sound threatening, but do you want your betrothed or any one of our people to endure what Tora Forgedotter has undergone?"

Upon listening to what her Queen had said, Shemal began to imagine such a grisly and unsettling fate if her beloved Ku'Sari was to succumb to a similar fate as Tora. Suffice to say, it was certifiably more than enough to make her vibrant serpentine scales to stand up on end in disgust and horror, which swiftly prompted her to swiftly speak up and replied, "...N-No, my Queen! I would rather die than watch my betrothed be seduced and rendered a bloated feedbag to those gods-forsaken bloodsuckers!"

"Then you know exactly why we are lending our aid to such a poor unfortunate soul, Shemal. I want no more complaints until we reach Vaal-Za'haraam. Understood?" Coatzintli sternly answered.

This prompted Shemal to salute her Queen and replied, "Yes, my Queen!" And from that point forward, the long journey ahead was a modestly silent one, as each of the individuals contemplated on what should be done once they reach Vaal-Za'haraam, capital city of the Nagas.
1113112211121112211.title: A Conscience Painted Black

From there, their first stop was to hand Tora over to the healers & physicians.

11131122111211122111.content:
To say the trek was long and arduous was considered almost an understatement, considering they had little time to gather the proper supplies due to Coatzintli's deceitful trick upon the gluttonous Cameena Stranken. After all, the only supplies they had in stock were barrels of Serpen-Kaja to keep their strength up. However, over the course of two days and nights, Olga began to drink more Serpen-Kaja with each passing day, not out of thirst or sustenance, but out of stress towards her sister still in quite the half-conscious and somewhat gluttonous stupor, which mostly resulted in her sleeping often due to passing out drunk.

In a way, it was all the chubby female chef could do for the time being, since her fattened sister kept drifting in and out of consciousness. And even when she was conscious, the blubbery Tora would often ask for food with this docile, blank, and drone-like expression in her eyes, as if she was still inside the gothic castle she was imprisoned in, vividly unaware of her current deposition and situation.

Fortunately for Olga and the others, they reached the northeastern edge of the Motee Marshes by the early morning of the second day. And now, the only thing standing between them and the city of Vaal-Za'haraam were miles upon miles of moist, wet, and humid marshlands and swampy rivers. Upon arriving at the edge of the Motee Marshes, it was there that Olga soon noticed a large, finely crafted pontoon raft parked alongside a stone pier. Still feeling the after-effects of drinking nothing but Serpen-Kaja for the past two days, Olga rubbed the sides of her temples as she sluggishly asked, "Erm...Y-Your highness? Wh...W-Why are we stopping here?"

"Do not fret, Olga Forgedotter. We are merely preparing the raft for transporting the dais," Coatzintli explained, as she soon felt the eunuchs lift up the dais and carefully positioned them evenly upon the gold and wooden raft.

From there, several of the eunuchs began to grab onto these large rod-like oars, where they began to slowly but surely stroke and row the lengthy oars, thus propelling the intricate raft with relative ease.

However, becoming curious about her new surroundings, Olga couldn't help but stare in both amazement and awe over such an unfamiliar area. Of course, Coatzintli obviously noticed Olga's bewildered staring, which prompted the Naga Queen to speak toward her personal chef as she queried, "Impressive, isn't it, Olga Forgedotter?"

"I'm sorry, your highness. It's just that...I've never got to see the world outside of my village before until now. *sigh* I...I just wish my mother was still alive to see all of this," Olga answered, contemplating and reminiscing about her mother a little.

Of course, such a revelation did make the Naga Queen quite curious about Olga and Tora's biological progenitors, where Coatzintli then spoke toward the chubby female chef and asked, "I do not intend to pry, Olga Forgedotter, but...What was your blood mother truly like? She must gave been an...intriguing human."

"...Yeah, she was, your highness. She-" Olga replied, but was abruptly interrupted by a nearby violent upsurge of water, which revealed one of the Motee Marshes' indigenous predators.

In appearance, the creature was far bigger than the raft, as it it's great long jaws snapping like a gigantic bear trap. It looked like a huge scaly bird, but with the most fearsome head you could imagine, with teeth bigger than bananas lining its jaws. It peered toward the group, it's mangy feathers bristling and it's tiny eyes narrowing as it began to snarl as Shemal exclaimed, "Tyrannosaurus!! Soldiers, protect the Queen!"

From there, Coatzintli's bodyguards quickly grabbed their golden halberd spears, brandishing them towards the massive creature, ready for a fight. But then, just as the armored reptile was to attack the raft and it's passengers, another creature just as large dove out of the water and lunged at the Tyrannosaur, slamming it against a nearby riverbank. In appearance, this other creature was like a gigantic old hairy man. Long lank reddish fur covered its' body and it had jowls bigger than even the fattest human. Olga was left in complete shock and astonishment upon seeing such enormous beasts, as she witnessed the two large behemoths duke it out, slashing, clawing, and roaring at one another.

"Y-Y-Your highness? What in the Gods were those things!?" Olga yelped, being reasonably unnerved by such a near-death experience.

However, she saw that Coatzintli was still calm as ever, as if this was an ordinary occurrence for someone like her, as the Naga casually turned her head to look at the unnerved Olga and leisurely answered, "*hearty chuckle* Fret not, Olga Forgedotter! This is merely an everyday occurrence here in the Motee Marshes. In fact, the creature that just saved us is a gigantopithecus. They hate large predators like our friend here. There is no need for concern, they only attack if they feel threatened."

Obviously, upon hearing Coatzintli's explanation, Olga felt a little more relieved from such a revelation, still feeling her shock wearing off little by little, as she noticed the bodyguards and eunuchs swiftly return to their original positions on the raft. Eventually, as the sun began to finally descend over the horizon, the group had inevitably arrived at their predetermined destination: Vaal-Za'haraam. The capital city of the Nagas. Olga couldn't believe her own two eyes, as she soaked in every nook and cranny of the stone and gold-laced metropolis. There were large huts and established shops and marketplaces scattered along the city, as there multiple branching rivers that functioned as the swamp city's roads and streets.

However, across the four corners of Vaal-Za'haraam, there were four large temples, which appeared to be both spacious and intricate in design. Olga could only guess thagg those temples must functioned as either the home of Coatzintli's personal advisors, or as religious temples to their deities, or possibly both. And finally, perching high above the city alongside two adjacent waterfalls, stood what Olga could only assume to be the palace, where Coatzintli lived since she is the Queen of the Nagas. Upon seeing the city for herself, Coatzintli spoke toward the chubby female chef and proudly boasted, "Olga Forgedotter, welcome...to Vaal-Za'haraam!"

111311221112111221112.content:
Out of some of the things that she has seen as of late, seeing the notorious city of Vaal-Za'haraam in person was another thing entirely for the plump female chef known as Olga Forgedotter. After all, many travelers had often told stories of their exploits and adventures across the land when they were drunk on mead at the Bleakfrost Tavern. However, out of many of the astonishing tales from such adventurers, one always stuck out in her mind: "A massive city in the heart of the Motee Marshes, built out of limestone and trimmed up with gold and silver. And like the crown of a King, there sat a palace made of gold and jewels adorned atop of two converging waterfalls."

And yet, here she was, sitting on a floating pontoon raft alongside the Naga Queen herself, entering a city that looked like something out of a fantastical myth, as most of the serpentine denizens proceeded to cease going about their daily businesses to greet their revered and benevolent Queen, bowing and cheering in applause, while the raft made it's way toward one of the decorated temples. In a way, Olga felt a little overwhelmed, believing she just entered a metropolis fit for the Gods themselves! "Is there something amiss, Olga Forgedotter?" Coatzintli asked, easily noticing how flustered Olga appeared to be.

In response, Olga swiftly spoke toward the Naga Queen and replied, "Oh! Um... My apologies, your highness. It's just that... I feel like I've stepped inside a city fit only for the Gods."

"*hearty chuckle* Good to see that our fair city has left an impression on you, Olga Forgedotter! But do not fret, you shall become accustomed to Vaal-Za'haraam and it's inner workings." Coatzintli quipped, reassuring the chubby female human that she'd get accustomed to the capital city.

From there, Olga looked back towards the pregnant Naga Queen and asked, "So, um... I don't mean to be rude, your highness, but...where are we going?"

"To the Temple of Knowledge. It is not just the foundry for all of our civilization's history and lore, but it is also known as a place of healing and rejuvenation. If we are to mend your sister's mind whole once more, the Temple of Knowledge is our best hope for your sibling." Coatzintli explained, elaborating on where they were heading now.

Eventually, the group had finally arrived at the Temple of Knowledge, as the eunuchs tied down and fastened the pontoon raft to a stone drydock, where they then proceeded to lift up the dais and transport them further toward the enormous temple. Once they reached the base of the Temple of Knowledge, they were greeted by a group of five Nagas, four of which were all dressed up in what appeared to be priestess garments and robes. However, upon closer inspection, Olga noticed to first Naga leading them appeared to be drastically different from the other priestesses.

In appearance, she had the appearance of your average Naga, but her serpentine lower half was extremely similar to a Corn Snake, with red and black scales with a set of tan rings circling around a good portion of the Naga's serpentine tail. Her skin tone was of a Caucasian tone, but what was the most striking thing about her was this unique red tattoo, which started from her left shoulder, wrapped around her upper back and left breast, and ending just above her lips. Her hair was black as coal, but was extremely lengthy, as it reached just above her scaly butt, as it was put into a lengthy braided ponytail. However, the front bangs of her hair was a striking contrast to the rest of her hair, as her bangs appeared to be a bright pink hue. Her eyes her a golden yellow, with serpentine slits for pupils. And to top it all off, Olga easily noticed that this unique-looking Naga had a chubby physique similar to her own, complete with a bulbous pair of Triple E-Cup breasts. Finally, Olga noticed that this specific Naga also wore what appeared to be a pair of specialized goggles brandished upon the Naga's brow.

From there, Coatzintli casually dismounted herself from her royal dais, slithering over toward the unique-looking Naga, where Olga witnessed something unexpected: The Naga Queen and the other Naga were hugging one another, as if they were old friends! "Coatzintli! Oh, it is so good to see you, your highness!" the Naga excitedly quipped.

Coatzintli soon spoke back as she replied, "Yes, it feels good to be home again, Quessa."

Upon hearing the conversation between the two Nagas, Olga managed to put two and two together, quickly realizing who this unique-looking Naga actually was: This Naga undoubtedly had to be Quessa!

But as they approached the dais, Quessa noticed the second dais, where she then spoke toward Coatzintli and curiously queried, "Hmm, what's in the other dais, my Queen?"

In response, Coatzintlii displayed a fanged smirk upon her dark-skinned face and answered, "Oh, something I'm certain you'll be exhilarated to see, old friend."

From there, Quessa quickly realized what she was saying and said, "Humans?"

In response, Coatzintli firmly nodded in confirmation, which then caused Quessa to excitedly raise all four of her arms and jump up and down in a rather childish manner, as if she was joyfully celebrating.

From there, as Quessa soon swiftly slithered over toward the second dais, Coatzintli quickly spoke toward her exuberant friend and retorted, "I must warn you, Quessa, one of them is not-"

But before the Naga Queen could finish her sentence, Quessa had already unveiled the dais' curtains, revealing both Olga and the incapacitated Tora. Obviously, Quessa couldn't exactly contain her excitement, as she saw the two human females, speaking aloud with unhindered excitement as she exclaimed, "By the Gods!! You brought me two Humans!?!"

"Quessa, meet Olga Forgedotter. She will be my personal chef and your bride." Coatzintli explained, introducing the excited chubby Naga to the somewhat unnerved female human, who seemed about ready to hide from Quessa.

However, just as Olga was about to make a run toward the Naga Queen, Quessa quickly calmed down some, quickly showing herself to be not a threat as she retorted, "Hey, hey, hey! It's okay, Human- I mean, Olga... I'm not here to harm you."

From there, Quessa slowly extended her slightly chubby right upper arm toward the startled Olga, attempting to reassure that she was not a threat to the plump female chef. Fortunately for Quessa, Olga extended her own right hand and grasped Quessa's hand, where they slowly shook hands as Quessa said, "See? I'm not here to hurt you. I'm your friend, Olga."

Shortly after that, Olga mustered up enough courage to speak toward the exuberant Quessa and said, "Please, y-you have to help my sister Tora. I-I don't know what's wrong with her."

In response, Quessa looked downward and noticed the bloated elephantine Forgedotter sibling, where Quessa then spoke back towards Olga and calmly asked, "Tell me, Olga: was your sister always this...larger than life?"

Olga swiftly shook her somewhat cherubic face in firm confirmation. From there, Quessa swiftly placed her specialized goggles over her serpentine eyes, and began to thoroughly examine every speck of the half-conscious Tora, muttering to herself as she said, "Let's see... Decrease in muscle density and mass... Increased volume of cellulite across the anatomy... Dilated and jaded pupils... And what appears to be a vampire's bite mark on her right jugular... By the Gods, what has happened to her?"

"A fate worse than death, Quessa. Can your healers be able to mend her mind whole once more?" Coatzintli explained, not wanting to divulge on what she had witnessed back in Racovania.

Of course, in response to her Queen's question, Quessa then gestured the four priestesses to approach as Quessa spoke toward Coatzintli and answered, "Normally, we can mend the average Naga's mind in a matter of days. However, since this is the first human we have ever operated such a procedure on...we'll have to be extremely careful, which means it will take more time to complete. As for how long, I'd estimate a week or two at most. That is... if we begin immediately."

"Very well. Begin your preparations immediately, Quessa. In the meantime, I must return to the Palace, Patli must have become awfully concerned for my well-being during my time away from Vaal-Za'haraam," Coatzintli replied, where she parted ways with one of her closest friends.

But before she departed for the Palace, Olga then spoke toward the Naga Queen and asked, "Your Highness, should I go with you?"

"Like I had said previously, Olga Forgedotter. You are Quessa's bride, which means you shall be living with her from this point forward. I shall give you a week of recuperation before you shall begin your duties as my personal chef. But until then, I bid you farewell for now."

From there, after the servants hauled Coatzintli's royal dais back onto the pontoon raft, the eunuchs began to row the rod-like oars forward toward the Golden Palace, thus leaving Olga alone with her incapacitated but fattened sister, as well as the chubby exuberant Naga known as Quessa, as Quessa soon approached the female human chef, bearing an eager fanged grin on her slightly plump face and asked, "So, my dear Olga... What should we do first?"

1113112211121112211121.content:
"W-Well, I, um-" Olga hesitantly said. But before she could say any further, her plump stomach began to rumble and growl aggressively, interrupting the plump female chef in the process, as it began to demand for food and sustenance. Of course, Olga began to blush profusely from such an outburst from her own stomach. However, Quessa began to giggle lightly, as if it was a nostalgic reminder of her stomach's gluttonous habits.

From there, she placed a left upper and lower hand on Olga's plump lap out of reassurance and casually retorted, "Ah! You must be hungry. *giggle* I bet you didn't have anything to eat on the way here to the Motee Marshes, didn't you?"

"N-No, Ms. Quessa... I, um... only drank that Serpen-Kaja stuff on t-the way here," Olga hesitantly answered, attempting futilely to not make direct eye contact with the chubby Naga, which ultimately proved fruitless, as she watched as the four Naga priestesses grab and carry her rotund, incapacitated sister into the Temple of Knowledge, which prompted Olga to speak up instinctively as she asked, "W-Where are they taking Tora? What are they going to do to my sister?"

"Listen, Olga... I completely understand the need to protect your sister, given her current...ailment," Quessa answered, grabbing a hold of Olga with relative ease. After all, even though she appeared to be noticeably chubbier than the other Nagas she'd seen at this point, Olga could feel that Quessa still had some considerable strength to her physique, as Quessa gently but firmly held onto Olga with all four arms, speaking to her directly as she explained, "However, you must understand that you cannot help your sister at this stage of mental trauma. I promised my Queen that I will help mend Tora's mind whole again, but it will take time to do so. In the meantime..."

From there, Quessa then extended her left upper hand to Olga, gesturing to grab it as the plump Naga queried, "Would you mind if I personally escort you to your new home?"

At first, Olga wanted to outright deny Quessa's offering hand. However, in the back of her mind, a thought emerged: "I don't know who she truly is, but... She seems more than nice enough. After all, she's more than willing to help Tora. Maybe...maybe I should give Quessa a chance." And with that, Olga slowly but surely began to reach out with her left hand, which began to overlap and wrap around Quessa's hand, which made Quessa display a gentle reassuring smile towards the plump female chef as she replied, "I promise you this, my dear Olga: I will not stop until your sister is capable of hugging you once more."

And with that, Olga slowly but surely dismounted herself from the dais, where she somewhat reluctantly followed alongside Quessa, as they slowly made their way to the Temple of Knowledge. "So, um... I take it that this is also your home as well, Quessa?" Olga cautiously asked.

Quessa swiftly explained, "Oh yes! The Temple of Knowledge isn't just a foundry dedicated to Naga history, lore, healing, and rejuvenation, it also functions as my lodgings... Or rather, should I say, 'Our' lodgings, Olga."

Eventually, after a somewhat long trek toward the Temple, both Quessa and Olga made their way inside the substantial Temple of Knowledge, just as the female chef witnessed the four Naga priestesses carrying Tora into a different room ahead of them, while she and Quessa proceeded further into the temple, ascending up an elevated stone ramp, and into a spacious area of the temple.

However, what Olga soon laid her eyes upon was quite astonishing and awe-inspiring. "Olga, welcome to our humble abode," Quessa quipped, introducing the plump female chef to quite the spacious dwelling.

In appearance, the entire area was the same size as two to three large village huts bundled together, which was considerably massive to Olga. There were aisles upon aisles of bookcases, each filled to the brim with books and scrolls of abundant varieties. From there, she noticed a large bed off to the side, adorned with massive animal skins and pelts as bed sheets and blankets, as she then saw a substantially large fireplace, with a massive stone table adjacent to the aforementioned fireplace, complete with equally wide stone stools. And finally, Olga then noticed a beautiful patio adjacent to the spacious living quarters, complete with it's own stone table and stools. Overall, it was certainly quite the step up from her old lodgings back in her Racovanian village.

"*giggle* Impressive, is it not?" Quessa quipped, snapping Olga out of her awestruck stupor, in which Olga promptly nodded in confirmation. However, they were soon abruptly interrupted by Olga's stomach once more, as it growled and grumbled relentlessly. From there, Quessa swiftly guided Olga onto one of the stone stools as she said, "And speaking of priorities, we should really give you something to eat. And I know just what you need..." Shortly after that, Quessa swiftly slithered toward the kitchen area of her living quarters, pulling out an enormous bronze plate. Moments later, she returned to Olga, carrying in a large roasted hunk of meat on a bronze plate, where the chubby Naga placed the plate in front of the plump female chef and quipped, "Ta-Da! A nice big chunk of Triceratops rump roast!"

To say that Olga was in surprise was an understatement, as her vision soaked in the grilled Triceratops meat, gawking at how utterly absurd the slab of meat's size was. However, something else hit her as well, which came in the form of an erotic yet delectable aroma, coming from none other than the Triceratops rump roast. Needless to say, Olga had never smelled anything like this before.

"*giggle* Already watering at the mouth, are we?" From there, Quessa began to cut up a good slice of Triceratops meat, just enough to give Olga a taste of which was offered, as Quessa calmly reassured, "...Go ahead, try it. I assure you, this will be something you haven't tasted before, my dear Olga."

Like a Siren's call beckoning her, Olga grabbed the slice of meat with both hands, lifting the meat slice up to her mouth, where she then took a bite out of it. At first, she tasted nothing, but once the bitten portion of Triceratops meat made physical contact with her tongue, Olga began to experience this explosion of flavor on her taste buds, which left her wide eyed in the process. "By the Gods... THIS IS THE MOST DELICIOUS MEAT I'VE EVER TASTED!!!" she thought to herself, her taste buds lighting up like a starlit night sky, unable to contain her inner food addict, causing her to take larger and more voracious bites out of the Triceratops meat. From there, Quessa soon handed Olga a gold knife and fork, where the plump female chef used the utensils to begin her assault on the Triceratops rump roast, tearing it down slice after slice until...

11131122111211122111211.content:
A wise man once said, "Be careful what you wish for... It might just get you." Well, for Olga Forgedotter, right now besides wishing her sister to be healed, she instinctively wished she couldn't stop eating the flavorous Triceratops rump roast. Although her mind and her hunger was willing, her body on the other hand... was barely able to store all of the Triceratops meat within the stores of her stomach.

As of this moment, Olga was currently laying on her back against the stone floor of Quessa's living quarters, gently stroking the undoubtedly bloated and taut sides of her now engorged stomach, uttering guttural moans and grunts of mild pain. After all, she just completely devoured what she could assumed to be one of the buttcheeks of a Triceratops, so she basically didn't even want to get up under her own volition out of concern for upchucking what her stomach was currently digesting at this very moment, as she painfully muttered, "Uuuugh...So...Full *BUUUURRP!!!!*"

Of course, such engorging did take a bit of it's toll on the plump female chef's clothing, as there was now a prominent tear down the middle of the abdomen of her dress, with a decent portion of belly fat jutting out some from the newly created tear in her dress.

Obviously, Quessa had written down some notes in a hardcover book with her lower hands, writing down every detail regarding Olga's current physical state, preserving such notes for future studies. From there, the chubby Naga closed the book and placed the book into one of the bookcases, where she then cautiously carried the stuffed female human in her four arms and said, "*giggle* Well, I must admit, you certainly have quite the appetite, Olga. Impressive, very impressive, indeed."

Eventually, Quessa gently placed the stuffed Olga down onto the large bed, unfurling the animal pelt blankets, and gently laying the female human's head upon a leather headrest, thus allowing Olga to get some rest, as the bloated female human slowly but surely began to drift in and out of consciousness, soon realizing that she was about to go into a food coma.

"Now, don't worry yourself ragged, dear Olga. I shall make sure your sister's mind is made whole once more. So for now, sleep tight...and sleep well," Quessa whispered, softly speaking into one of Olga's ears, letting the human know that her fattened psychologically damaged sister was in capable hands, just as Olga had finally gave in and lost consciousness, now rendered fully asleep.

"May Jynera, Goddess of Revelries, grant you safe passage through the dreaming world, Olga Forgedotter," Quessa whispered, quoting a small prayer for the slumbering human female.

From there, Quessa quietly slithered her way out of her living quarters and toward the room where the other priestesses had carried Tora's unconscious body into earlier. In appearance, the room was adorned with various mystical artifacts and items, such as steamy candles, jars full of sacred herbs, and having an air of spiritualism swirling throughout the interior. This...was known as "The Spirit Room", and it was an integral part of the rejuvenation process when it came to healing one's mind and spirit.

But as the four Naga priestesses began brewing and concocting the proper potions and ingredients for the upcoming ritual, Quessa calmly slithered her way inside the room, where one of the priestesses swiftly noticed their superior as she said, "High Priestess Quessa!"

From there, all four of the Naga priestesses stopped what they were doing and proceeded to properly salute their leading priestess, which came in the form of kneeling their heads down while crossing their upper arms into an X formation. "At ease, my fellow priestesses," Quessa retorted, prompting the other priestesses to lower their upper arms and raise their heads to look toward their leader. Quessa then calmly spoke toward them and explained, "Now... I understand your apprehension towards aiding a human in a critical state such as her's. However, as healers and physicians of Knowledge, we have an obligation to learn not just about our anatomy, but the anatomy of other species as well. Understand?"

"By your command, High Priestess!" the priestesses retorted, all four of them speaking in unison towards their spiritual leader. From there, they began their work upon the incapacitated yet corpulent Tora, having Tora subconsciously ingest a few of the alchemic brews the priestesses had concocted earlier, hoping to entice some form of subtle response from ingesting such mixed chemicals. Suffice to say, Quessa certainly knew that this was probably take a few all-nighters to illicit some semblance of physical or psychological response from the fattened older sibling.
