111311221112111221112112.content:
To say that Olga had a good night's rest had little to no context as to what her thoughts were at the moment, which were keenly focused on seeing her sister's sanity returned to her once more. And yet, even then, she felt somewhat helpless to take any action when it came to aiding in her sister's psychological trauma, left with no other alternative but to pray that Quessa and the other priestesses could successfully mend Tora's mind whole once more.

Suffice to say, the plump female chef wasn't exactly receiving some well-deserved rest.

But as the sun slowly ascended over the horizon the next morning, Olga had hoped that all of this insanity was merely a bad dream. However, once she opened her eyes and began to hear the hustle and bustle of the city of Vaal-Za'haraam outside, the memories all came back to her, making her succumb to the truth...that she wasn't dreaming, that what has transpired over the past several days was real and bona fide.

"*long sigh*...So...I guess that I wasn't dreaming all of this, was I?" she said to herself, positioned in a sitting posture on the large bed, where she then slowly noticed the increased pudge on her abdomen, along with the tear in the middle of her dress. Out of curiosity, she gently placed a hand upon her slightly enlarged belly, jiggling it mildly to estimate it's increased girth. Overall, she undoubtedly noticed that she had gained some additional weight from devouring the Triceratops rump roast from yesterday.

"Had a good night's sleep, my dear Olga?" a voice rang out, which seemed to startle Olga somewhat, quickly turning her head towards the origin of the voice.

Of course, she soon calmed down a little upon realizing that the one who spoke to her was actually Quessa, who was currently sitting at the large stone table, drinking...something, from a silver goblet. However, Olga couldn't help but notice something different regarding the chubby Naga's demeanor, as Olga slowly dismounted herself from the bed, speaking toward her supposed "betrothed" and retorted, "No, I-I'm afraid not, Quessa. I...I just couldn't stop thinking about my sister. I'm...I'm just so worried about her."

"Like I said before, Olga. We won't...*yawn*...We won't stop until...*longer yawn* By the Gods, I'm tired," Quessa answered, becoming somewhat unable to continue finishing her sentence to Olga due to staying active throughout the entire night performing several rituals upon the incapacitated yet corpulent Tora, prioritizing work over sleep hygiene.

Of course, Olga easily noticed the tired expression in the chubby Naga's golden eyes, making the plump female chef feel a twinge of sympathy towards what Quessa was enduring. From there, Olga placed her hands on her womanly hips, staring at Quessa and firmly asked, "And I'm guessing you didn't get any sleep last night, didn't you?"

"*yawn*...Regrettably, yes, Olga Forgedotter. Why? Do you *yawn* have a remedy for such drowsiness?" Quessa queried, blatantly confessing her tiredness to Olga.

However, much to her own surprise, Olga began to walk over toward the kitchen area of the living quarters, pulling out what she recognized as cocoa beans. From there, she yanked the silver goblet out of Quessa's upper hands, where she grinded the cocoa beans into cocoa powder, pouring the powder into the goblet and stirring it with a bronze spoon. Finally, she promptly returned the goblet back to Quessa, where Olga then firmly retorted, "Drink this."

Somewhat reluctantly, Quessa drank a good sip of the newly brewed drink in her goblet. At first, she didn't feel anything. But seconds later, she felt her spirits reinvigorated once more, becoming alert and aware as if she had a good night's sleep, where she swiftly spoke toward Olga and said, "By the Gods... I feel inexplicably rejuvenated! What was in this brew?"

"It's called coffee, Quessa. It's supposed to raise one's spirits when they're sleep deprived. You can thank me later," Olga coldly replied, as if she still somewhat didn't trust the chubby Naga fully.

Of course, as Olga sat herself down in another stone stool, Quessa easily noticed the plump human giving her a bit of the cold shoulder, which seemed to have made the chubby Naga reasonably concerned for her arranged betrothed, prompting Quessa to speak toward Olga with a concerned tone as she asked, "You...don't fully trust me, do you Olga?"

"...What do you think?" Olga queried, crossing her slightly chubby arms in the process.

Out of concern, Quessa slowly slithered towards Olga from behind, gently wrapping her four hands around Olga's rounded shoulders, where the chubby Naga spoke toward the chubby female human with a calm but reassuring tone and explained, "Olga, I clearly understand your....apprehensive feelings about being my bride, but I can assure you...I'm not the villain in your story. That belongs to whoever rendered your beloved sister in such a damaged state."

Despite Quessa's reassurance, Olga reluctantly kept herself silent, but keenly listened to the chubby Naga's words. However, in a further attempt to prove to Olga that she isn't a heartless individual, Quessa soon spoke once more and reassuringly answered, "Listen, I made a solemn oath to mend your sister's mind whole once more, and I fully intend to fulfill such a promise. However, I must know if you are willing to give me a chance as your betrothed."

Once more, no response from Olga, so Quessa proposed an offer that the chubby human couldn't blatantly refuse, where the chubby Naga then retorted, "How about this, Olga? Since I have more than enough spare time, we go on a date. You know, explore Vaal-Za'haraam to our hearts' content. And since Queen Coatzintli has given you an entire week to yourself, we can spend some quality time together. However, if you still are not having fun during our time together, I will still heal your sister and call off the marriage between the two of us, no strings attached. Well, what do you say?"

Of course, Olga soaked in every word spewing from Quessa's forked tongue, now seeing that Quessa was willing to go out of her way to appease her. At first, she wanted to explicitly refuse the plump Naga's generous offer. However, the more she thought about it, the more it seemed a fair trade to the chubby female chef. Eventually, she made up her mind and decided to...
111311221112111221112112.title: No Longer A Dream

choices: "The Keiku Bazaar, to get you some new clothes that'll fit you."
"The Hei'Sei Apothecary, to gather some ingredients for your sister."
"The Bu'Bol Tavern. I heard their Triceratops rump roasts are divine!"
1113112211121112211121122.content:
"Alright. I'll, um...I'll take you up on your offer, Quessa," Olga flatly retorted, agreeing to give the chubby Naga a chance.

Of course, in response to the plump female chef's answer, Quessa quickly wrapped all four of her arms around Olga in a light excited hug, just as Quessa exuberantly squealed, "Eeep! Oh thank you, Olga! You surely won't regret this, I promise!"

However, before she could speak any further, Olga swiftly pressed a hand against the chubby Naga's lips, temporarily rendering the giddy Naga quite for a moment or two, as Olga then said, "Uh uh! Before we go anywhere, I've got a few conditions of my own."

"Of course, my dear! Name your offer." Quessa quipped, calming herself down a little, promptly severing her embrace from Olga.

From there, Olga then bluntly stated, "First off, I want to see Tora every now and then. I need to know what her current condition is."

"Understandable. However, I cannot allow you to interfere with the rituals we'll be performing upon your sibling," Quessa retorted, setting a few ground rules as well.

This led to Olga speaking toward the plump Naga and replied, "Fair enough. After all, my sister's life is in your hands. Second, I get to choose where we go on this...'date' of ours."

"That I can do. However, I can't allow you to venture outside the city and explore the Motee Marshes without proper authorization," Quessa explained, letting the plump female chef know that she wasn't allowed to venture outside of Vaal-Za'haraam and explore the Motee Marshes in it's entirety.

Obviously, after having a near-death experience with a Tyrannosaurus and a Gigantopithecus yesterday, Olga definitely wasn't going to be voluntarily exploring the Motee Marshes anytime soon, as she shuddered a little in unnerved hesitation and bluntly complied, "*shivers* You don't have to tell me twice on that, Quessa. And third, could you, um..."

From there, just as she got onto the third condition, Olga began to blush profusely, as she continued, "C-Could you, um...get me more of th-that Triceratops meat?"

Obviously, upon seeing such a drooling lustful expression on the female chef's somewhat cherubic face, Quessa could easily see that Olga had just developed an addictive hankering for Triceratops meat, which she couldn't help but giggle mildly at how fast Olga got hooked on such an average cuisine.

Then again, Quessa could see why Olga found the Triceratops meat to be so enticing, probably because she hadn't tasted anything similar in flavor and intensity. So, in response to the plump female chef's gluttonous request, Quessa placed her hands on her scaly yet plump womanly hips, bearing a smug fanged grin on her lips and retorted, "You're in love with the Triceratops meat, aren't you, my dear Olga?"

Obviously, Olga snapped out of her ravenous stupor, blushing profusely while she fidgeted with her hands and fingers, where she soon flustered, "No! Um...Maybe?" Quessa still displayed that smug grin on her lips, which easily demolished Olga's failing facade, causing the plump human to blare aloud as she confessed, "Okay, okay! I love the Triceratops meat I ate last night. Happy now?"

"*giggle* Very. But don't fret, dear Olga: I will make sure you get more than enough Triceratops meat to gorge on," Quessa remarked, vowing to make sure Olga had more than her fill of Triceratops meat, as the chubby Naga slithered over toward the counter-top to grab what appeared to be satchel full of gold coins, hanging it from her sash.

"And besides, dear Olga. Once the Rainy Season swings into high gear, you'll certainly be seeing a LOT more of me. *giggle*" Quessa retorted, vividly promising Olga that she'd be seeing a lot more Naga when the Rainy Season truly begins. Of course, Olga had little to no idea what Quessa meant when she said she'd be seeing a lot more of the chubby Naga. From there, Quessa then gestured Olga to come along with her as she quipped, "Now then, what do you say we get you some new clothes?"

Knowing that she promised the chubby Naga that she'll try to enjoy her stay at Vaal-Za'haraam, Olga cautiously approached the ecstatic yet calm Quessa, following closely behind her as they exited the Temple of Knowledge. From there, they proceeded toward another pontoon raft, as they got onto the wooden amphibious vehicle, where the eunuchs began rowing the raft up the canal.

"So, Quessa? Where, um...Where are we heading to first?" Olga asked, wanting to know what their first destination was here in Vaal-Za'haraam.

Fortunately, Quessa was quite willing to disclose such information, where she spoke with a hearty chuckle and replied, "*hearty chuckle* Do not fret, dear Olga. Our first destination shall be..."
1113112211121112211121122.title: Exceptional Conditions

choices: "Something form-fitting but can cover some necessities."
Something loose, but enough for someone to grow during the Rainy Season."
"Actually, we're looking for something...custom-made."
11131122111211122111211221.content:
"Our first destination shall be none other than the Keiku Bazaar. Apparently, they're well known for having a various assortment of clothes, Olga," Quessa explained, as the eunuchs continued rowing the pontoon raft down the elongated canals of Vaal-Za'haraam, turning at several different canal intersections along the way.

Of course, Olga couldn't help but gawk and stare in awe at her new surroundings, still relatively amazed at how vast and expansive the Naga capital city was.

"Is there something wrong, Olga?" Quessa asked, noticing the chubby female chef in her current state of mind.

Fortunately, Quessa's question easily snapped Olga back to reality, where she swiftly answered, "Oh, um...N-No, nothing's wrong, Ms. Quessa. It's just that...I am still becoming accustomed to how massive this place really is. I mean, I've never been to a city before until now."

"Oh, it's quite alright. And please, call me Quessa. And...thank you," Quessa replied, which seemed to confuse the plump human when the chubby Naga thanked her.

So, in response to what the chubby Naga said, Olga looked back at Quessa and asked, "For what?"

"For being honest and truthful with me, dear Olga," Quessa retorted, displaying an honest fanged smile towards the plump female chef. The chubby Naga then spoke once more and said, "I understand that you're still mostly apprehensive with being my betrothed, but at least allow me the honor of being your friend."

At first, Olga was reluctant to offer Quessa such a friendship. However, something in her gut told her to give the chubby Naga both the benefit of a doubt and a chance to become the human's friend in such an alien environment.

So, after much debating with herself, Olga eventually extended her hand out toward the plump Naga, where Quessa performed a similar response, grasping Olga's hand in the process, as Quessa then quipped, "Friends?"

"Friends," Olga firmly answered, where they then shook on it, as the pontoon raft had finally reached it's initial destination.

From there, the eunuchs then tied the pontoon raft to a stone dry-dock to prevent it from drifting off down the canal while they're preoccupied with shopping. Shortly after the eunuchs had tied down the raft, Olga and Quessa dismounted themselves from the raft, standing on the dry-dock, looking at the main entrance to the Keiku Bazaar. And with that, Quessa then looked at the plump female chef and queried, "So, my dear Olga, shall we see what the Keiku Bazaar has to offer?"

****************************

To say that the Keiku Bazaar was considerably impressive and expansive was quite a moot point, as Olga was in complete bewilderment at how much was available at each market stall. Clothes, jewelry, exotic fabrics, and so much more were to be found, as she and Quessa casually roamed the expansive Bazaar, looking at whatever caught Olga's attention. However, after several minutes of searching, they came across a large store with a variety of clothes for different species, as Quessa quipped, "Ooh! This place shall do wonderfully!"

From there, Quessa proceeded to drag along Olga towards the store, where they accosted one of the clerks of the store. In appearance, she was a Naga with vibrant green and white scales on her serpentine lower half, with a Hispanic skin tone, short blonde hair, and a petite physique. "Ke'Lani!" Quessa excitedly exclaimed, as if she was seeing an old friend.

Of course, Ke'Lani quickly responded in kind, rapidly hugging the plump Naga as she retorted, "Hey, Quessa! Long time, no see! So, how is my favorite High Priestess of Knowledge?"

Olga soon noticed that Quessa and Ke'Lani appeared to be old acquaintances, where Quessa swiftly quipped, "*giggle* Oh, you know me, Ke'Lani: I'm basically a Tyrannosaurus when it comes to knowledge!"

"*hearty chuckle* Well that's good to hear," Ke'Lani replied, glad to see that Quessa was her usual curious self. But then, moments later, the petite Naga soon became aware of Olga standing alongside Quessa, where Ke'Lani leaned down to examine the plump female chef, which unnerved Olga slightly as Ke'Lani asked, "Oh? And who's our tubby little guest here, Quessa? A friend of yours?"

"Oh, I almost forgot! Ke'Lani: Allow me to introduce you to Olga Forgedotter. She is Queen Coatzintli's newest personal chef." Quessa explained.

This completely surprised the petite Naga, prompting her to bow before Olga as if she was royalty, as Ke'Lani then replied, "Forgive me, ma'am. I was blissfully unaware of your position as the Queen's personal chef!"

"Oh, um...I-It isn't a big deal, Ke'Lani. I was merely lucky enough to impress her highness with my cooking," Olga bluntly explained, as Quessa quickly gestured Ke'Lani to stop bowing before the chubby female human.

The chubby Naga then retorted, "Olga: Meet Ke'Lani. Or rather, she's better known throughout the entire Bazaar as 'Ke'Lani The Seamstress.' because of her proficiency with creating and tailoring custom-made clothes for her clients, whether they be human or Naga."

"Oh please, Quessa. Enough with the praise, you're embarrassing me!" Ke'Lani quipped, her thin cheeks blushing profusely in the process of such appraisal.

Of course, Quessa quickly retorted, "Nonsense! You're one of, if not, THE best seamstress in all of Vaal-Za'haraam. After all, you deserve all of the hard work you've done for numerous Nagas during the Rainy Seasons."

"I guess you're right, Quessa. Anyway, enough about me! What can I get for you two lovely ladies?" Ke'Lani asked, diverting the subject some onto why Quessa and Olga were here.

So, in response to such a trivial question, Quessa spoke toward her friend and explained, "Well, we're here to get Olga some new clothes to wear. After all, her current garments won't last long when the Rainy Season truly begins, if you catch my drift."

"Oh, but of course! Anything for a good friend of mine!" Ke'Lani swiftly quipped, becoming anticipated some over tailoring her first human outfit, slithering inside the store, with Olga and Quessa following suit.

From there, as they browsed through the various articles of handcrafted garments, Ke'Lani soon spoke toward them and asked, "So, what exactly are you looking for then, ladies?"

Of course, in response to such a question, Quessa spoke toward her petite Naga friend and answered, "Well, we're looking for..."
11131122111211122111211221.title: Clothes shopping At Keiku Bazaar

choices: The rainy season begins
Olga gets to visit her sister
111311221112111221112112212.content:
“Something loose, but enough for someone to grow during the rainy season.” Quessa answered.

Rainy season? Olga had never heard of that before, normally in Racovania there were four seasons, and none of them contained excessive rain.

Olga then watched as the saleswoman slithered off and returned with a loincloth, but it was only when Olga saw Quessa place it around herself did she see just how big the item of clothing was.

It was huge! It had more than enough stretch to contain even Coatzintli’s massive pregnancy belly. Despite respecting the naga’s local customs quietly, this Olga had to speak up about.

“Ummm Quessa…isn’t that a little…big for you?” Olga nervously pointed out, trying not to insult the serpent woman.

Quessa slithered around and smiled at Olga. “Ok, leopard’s out of the bag I guess…” She chuckled, “It’s for the rainy season, every year the rains come and harvests bloom in the marshes, and this also attracts plenty of animals as well. We use this as an opportunity to eat much more than normal, it’s a big festival to celebrate nature’s bounty!”

Olga was only partially satisfied with this answer however. “So…what’s with the big clothes?”

Quessa chuckled again, “Because I’m going to get fat silly…I did say you would be seeing more of me after all. In fact we all are!” At this Quessa then stopped and put one of her fingers to her chin, “Hmmm, you should join in too! I would love to observe the effects of excessive eating on a human first hand!”

This certainly took Olga back. “I…uh…I am not sure if I want to...get fat.” She mumbled.

“It will help you handle life here better.” Quessa quickly added, taking two of her hands and gently holding Olga’s. “We don’t do as much harvesting during the drier months, so food will be harder to come by. I am not saying you need to get huge…just plump enough to help you.”

“I…I’ll think about it.” Olga relented.

The geeky naga looked ecstatic with Olga’s reply. “Yay! Oh! Then we need to get you some rainy season clothes as well then! Ke’lani! Another selection of dresses please!”

In a matter of minutes, the naga in charge of the stall slithered away and returned with a heaping armful of new clothes. A lot were in various electric-blue tones, seems Ke’lani thought they would complement Olga’s blonde hair very well.

Quessa and Ke’lani helped Olga put the clothes on, clipping the various fastenings and showing Olga how naga clothes worked. Most of which seemed to expose a lot of flesh. In fact the most conservative of the bunch was little more than what Olga considered a bra and a loincloth. She was constantly worried about Quessa’s hands touching her skin, but the naga was honest enough to know that they were not close enough for that, and so refrained for actually contacting skin-to-skin.

After a while Olga felt a bit more relaxed with the situation, and was starting to get into it a bit. She pulled the odd pose for the pair as they showered her with compliments; she even forgot how her pudgy tummy drooped a little over the waistband of the loincloths, or how much cleavage her now-larger breasts showed in the tops. Eventually Olga settled on a set of blue clothes with yellow thunderbolts trimming the sides.

Just as Olga thought that their shopping trip was over Quessa then turned to Ke’lani and reminded her of something. “Ok, since she likes this one, do you have it in a rainy season size?” The naga asked, to which the shop-keeper nodded and slithered away, returning with something far larger.

“I’m supposed to fit into this?” Olga choked as she held the garment around herself. The new matching blue and yellow set was frankly enormous; as the blonde woman held it around an imaginary version of herself it would fit, she noted how it was at least four times wider than she was.

“Don’t worry, you will grow into it!” Quessa added in a positive tone.

“I…thought you said I would only need to get a bit plump?” Olga gagged as she held the gigantic top aloft, noting how each cup was bigger than her head.

“Oh that is plump for us.” Quessa nonchalantly stated. The former waitress gulped, if that was plump she did not want to know what the naga thought truly fat was.

Soon after picking up Olga’s “rainy season clothes” Quessa picked out her own outfit and coins exchanged hands.

Some time later Quessa and Olga had made their way to a local tavern and eatery. It wasn’t too different on the inside than what she was used to in Racovania. Wooden tables, cheerful waitressing staff (even if they were all snake-woman) and plentiful mead. The seats were also very comfortable as well, covered in pillows to allow the naga to rest their entire serpentine lower-halves in comfort.

Quessa and Olga ordered some food and conversation began again.

“So, how are you enjoying the city…and our little date?” Quessa teased.

“I’m…enjoying myself…more than I thought actually.” Olga admitted. There was no sense in lying or being overly malicious to Quessa, she had been honest and genuine with her so far, and had respected all of Olga’s boundaries.

“I’m glad! And we haven’t even got to your favourite part yet!” Quessa replied, with a nod towards the kitchens where the unmistakable smell of roasted triceratops rump could be smelled wafting through the doors.

Olga tried to deny it a little, but her belly grumbled, giving her away.

“Haha! You can’t fool me. We will have you plumped up for rainy season in no time.” Quessa chuckled, putting the back of one of her hands to her mouth.

Olga sighed, she feared the naga was right on this. As the laughter of the serpent died down, Olga took a deep breath, there was a pressing question she wished to ask.

“Quessa…” Olga began, getting the woman’s attention. “Do you…like me?”

“Of course I like you, I wouldn’t be here with you if I didn’t think you were a nice person.”

“No that’s…not quite what I mean…do you like me like me?” Olga asked, “As in do you think I am attractive?”

Quessa blushed a bit at this. “Well…yes, you are very pretty.”

It was Olga’s turn to blush this time; “Well…thank you. You see though…I am not sure I am…well…attracted to woman.”

“I, I don’t understand.” Quessa replied, “Do you mean I am not pretty?”

Olga had to backpedal quickly at this. “No no no! You look adorable! It’s just…do you have naga men?”

“Men?” Quessa stated quizzically.

“You know, broad shoulders, no breasts…you use human men to lift the big platforms…” Olga tried to explain.

“Oh! Them…wait do you mean…you have two sexes?” Quessa looked serious right now, deadly serious. Olga simply nodded at this. “Woah! I totally need to write this down…darn the one time I forget my notes…”

It was Olga’s turn to chuckle now. “Well, basically I like men.”

“Oh…so there are no all-women couples in humans?” Quessa asked, she was clearly finding this all fascinating.

Olga paused and thought; there was that pair of farmers who visited the tavern a few times, they were from the southernmost part of Racovania and were both women. “There are some…”

“But…I guess you are not one of them then.” Quessa asked rhetorically. She sounded quite down about this. Olga thought to herself, did Quessa more than like her, did she actually love her? Had she just broken the heart of this poor woman who had only tried to make a good impression?

Olga felt pretty guilty about that, but she couldn’t help it. She found men attractive, not women; and certainly not woman who were half reptile.

Just as the as the silence couldn’t get any more awkward between them there was a sudden interruption. “Enjoy!” cooed the curvy waitress who had slithered up with their meals, dropping the plates on the table.

Olga salivated, triceratops rump…dam she had never known she could love something so much until she had come to this city. Without wasting a second Olga began to dig in, ripping the meat from her utensils and gulping it down like mad.

As the blonde woman wolfed down another hearty mouthful she looked across at Quessa delicately eating her food. She was awfully cute, eating virtually like a prim princess.
111311221112111221112112212.title: Room to grow

choices: Olga and Quessa continue to explore all the stalls.
Quessa gives Olga some of the potions so they can keep eating.
Olga's had enough for one day. Maybe she can handle more tomorrow.
After many weeks of eating and feasting, Olga goes to the grand final feast.
1113112211121112211121122121.content:
Olga was, suffice to say, very overwhelmed when she first saw all the festivities involved in the rainy season. To begin with, the capital city was far busier than a small little village like Racovania. In fact, Olga could not recall a time when she saw so many people at once. Then there was the fact that she was the one that everyone was gawking at. Being the only human among naga folk certainly would do that. Olga felt a tad embarrassed being stared at constantly. Quessa hardly noticed and seemed to ignore it. She merely continued about her way, showing Olga all the sights, sounds, and especially food involved with the event.

"Did I really have to wear this now?" Olga said, referring to her rainy season garb. It was far too loose on her and she had to hold it up most of the time as they walked. "I don't think I'm going to get big enough in one day to hold it up."

Quessa laughed. "No, of course not, but you'll want something with room to grow to help ease the digestion. For the next several weeks, we're going to be feasting almost non-stop. Trust me, you'll grow into it."

Olga sighed. She wasn't exactly keen on the idea, but she was willing to respect their culture. More importantly, if what Quessa said was true, then she would need the extra weight to keep sustained through the dry season.

All the while, the two of them passed by so many stalls. A few sold a few trinkets and items such as last-minute rainy season clothes, jewelry, toys, and noisemakers for the children. But most of them sold food, and lots of it. Quessa wasn't kidding when she said that the rainy season brought in many crops. Fruits, vegetables, baked goods, and plenty of meats were all available, and cost next to nothing. In fact, very few vendors actually charged them for the food. Being close to the queen's high priestess did come with that benefit. Most of them just felt sorry for her.

"Oh, well, aren't you a skinny, little monkey," one said to her before pushing a pile of foods that Olga didn't have names for onto her. "Here you go. Well, go on, eat. There's plenty there."

"This'll help fatten y'all up," another hearty merchant said. "Can't have the high priestess going hungry, now can we."

It was like that all day. Olga tried to keep up, but there were two problems standing in her way. The first was she wasn't used to this tradition. She hadn't built up the stomach capacity to eat as much as Quessa could. Second, Quessa and the other nagas could open their jaws incredibly wide to intake massive amounts of food. The priestess had even explained that they could eat entire animals whole this way. It made Olga want to hurl the first time she saw it. But, nonetheless, she could not accomplish this feat. Still, she tried to keep up and eat as much as she could. But, she was starting to hit a wall.

"You feeling alright?" Quessa said, when she noticed Olga was starting to look a little green.

"Yeah, just...ohhh," Olga moaned.

The naga was at her side in an instant. She looked at the human's outstretched and engorged middle. "You poor thing!" she gasped, touching it gingerly to find that there was no more room left in there. She would've burst for sure if she had eaten anymore. "Here, let's sit down and digest for a bit."

Quessa led the former waitress to a set of benches where Olga could lay back, letting her throbbing stomach lay reclined. Every breath seemed to hurt. "I'm sorry," she said between labored gasps.

"Don't be," the naga said. "This is your first rainy season. Happens to the best of us. Here, let me..."

With two of her free hands, Quessa helped to rub the taut sphere. If Olga wasn't in such pain, she would've objected to such close physical contact. But god, did that help so much! She lay back and let out a pleasurable sound.

The naga giggled. "Didn't know you'd like that so much."

"It helps," Olga muttered.

Quessa was silent for a moment, collecting her thoughts. "I'm sorry," she began.

"About what?"

"I...I should not have expected you to have feelings for me from the very beginning. I did not mean to be so forthright the other day," she explained. "I mean, we've only just met and all. I understand if...if you'll never come to like me. I do not understand your people fully, and I should have perhaps thought of that."

Olga felt incredibly sorry for her naga companion. She knew she had upset her that day she had explained she did not like women. In fact, this was the first day the naga had seemed like her perky self once more, and perhaps that was just all the festivities.

"I'm sorry too," Olga said. "I didn't mean to hurt your feelings. It's just...so very new to me. I mean, one minute I'm all alone in my old village, and now I'm here among all these naga. It's a lot to take in. And, it's not that I don't like you at all. I think you're terrific. You've been nothing but kind to me since I came here. And, look...it's going to take a while, but...I think...I could like you more than that."

"Really?" A vibrance seemed to come back to her scales.

"Yes, but I'd like to... Let's start from the beginning."

"The beginning?"

Olga smiled coyly. "Hi, I'm Olga." She held out her hand.

Quessa smiled back. "Hello, Olga. I am Quassa." She shook her hand eagerly.

The two sat quietly for a while, feeling like a certain tension had been released. And speaking of tension.

"I think I'm feeling better now," Olga said.

"Well, that's good. I predicted something like this might happen. I brought a few potions with me. They'll help give your stomach more capacity for food. Because, after all, every night of the season, there's a grand feast."

"Feast?" Olga wasn't so sure she could take even more eating.

The naga nodded. "Yup, and we'll get to be at the best feasts of all. We get to eat in the queen's tent. She has the biggest feasts during the season. I guess, she has to now. After all, she's not just getting big for the rainy season. She has to make sure she has enough for the little ones. Oooh, look at that!"

It would never cease to surprise Olga how easily distracted Quessa could get. They were standing in front of a jewelry stand. The naga was busy examining a lapis lazuli necklace. "Here, try this on," she said.

Olga put on the finery, and had to admit, it was pretty, and it did look good with her dress. Quessa smiled. "It suits you."

The former waitress smiled back. True, there was a lot to get used to in this new and strange land, but with Quessa by her side, maybe she could learn to like it...and more.
1113112211121112211121122121.title: Bread and Circuses for All

choices: Olga wakes the next day
Olga wakes some time later
11131122111211122111211221214.content:
Time passed deeper and deeper into the rainy season in the Motee Marshes. Olga soon found out why it was called that, the raindrops were like pellets of lead some days, thundering down outside her new home and creating a pleasant rumble on the rooftop. But the passage of time during the rainy season yielded more than just excess water.

“Told you it would fit.” Quessa teased as she saw Olga entering their living room. The naga’s predictions regarding Olga’s increase in girth was right on the money, the blonde woman had swollen up like a balloon. With fattening food thrust upon her, and a culture that pretty much demanded she were eating all the time, Olga was now looking heavier than even her former boss. Olga had become big and very very round, in fact she was struggling to be able to make her fingers touch if she tried to grab all of her monster belly now. Not that Quessa hadn't had her own share of seasonal pounds; the scientific naga was now sporting the same kind of girth as Olga was. Her belly was round and lapped over the waist of her loincloth and her backside had swollen immensely.

“It’s still *huff*…a little loose…” Olga puffed as she waddled slowly forwards.

“Not after today it won’t.” Quessa tutted knowingly.

Olga raised an eyebrow, “I can’t get fat that fast you know…thought you were supposed to be an expert on human anatomy.” She remarked teasingly.

“Oh I am…but today is the day of the grand feast, and you are going to need that last bit of stretching room.” Quessa responded. Olga meanwhile gulped, what had the naga got planned?

***


Once both women were ready they headed out for the palace, as Quessa was a high priestess she was supposed to have her grand feast in the palace itself alongside the other high priestesses and the queen herself. Olga had not seen queen Coatlzintli since she had arrived, so it might be nice for her to catch up.

The walk to the palace was quite arduous for Olga, her legs were so caked with fat that she had to start swinging them a little as she walked, producing her little waddle. Quessa meanwhile had no legs, and therefore no such problem. Although it did make her booty bounce like crazy, something Olga caught herself staring at quite often.

As the pair arrived they were granted immediate entrance by the guards, who Olga noted were also looking fatter and much less threatening than usual.

The inside was not the kind of regalness Olga expected, it was built out of the same gold that all the other upper-class houses in the city were made from, but the biggest difference was the sheer volume of decorative plants. They covered the edges of each room they passed into, until they finally reached the great hall.

As the pair entered Olga gasped at the sights; the ceiling was taller than any building she had ever entered, and there was an immense table littered with a multitude of freshly prepared animal carcasses, but the most striking sight was what laid at the far end of this table.

Coatzintli was reclined on an immense throne at the back, but if it wasn’t for her signature color patterns Olga would have struggled to recognise her. The naga queen was fat, fatter than any naga so far, she looked like the pictures Olga had seen of whales in books; her tail was thick as a tree-trunk, her face round as a dinner plate with two additional chins, her arms looked like fresh hams tipped with little sausages for fingers…but her belly…what a belly. It seemed Coatzintli’s pregnancy was going well; her majesties gravid tummy swelled forward like a ripe melon, resting on the steps to her throne as it protruded forwards.

As the pair took their seats Olga whispered to Quessa. “Don’t queens visit their guests?”

The naga leaned back over, “Normally yes, but our queen has taken herself beyond movement as of late, so she will just announce everyone’s presence when all the other dignitaries have arrived.”

It was true, Coatzintli was having food passed to her from the table, rather than her moving to get it herself.

The pair waited as more quests filed in and took their seats at the table. Once all the seats were filed the queen’s attendant coughed and made an announcement. “Our queen Coatzintli welcomes you all to her first rainy season feast! Remember it is customary that all shall finish their plates!”

As the attendant and then the queen spoke Olga gulped and looked up; in front of her was an entire water buffalo. The dam thing was bigger than she was! How was she supposed to eat all of that?!

Suddenly the speech came to an end and there was movement abound.

Olga watched as a naga slightly across from her bite down into her meal and began to unhinge her jaw. The blonde woman’s eyes grew wide as saucers as she watched the snake-woman’s mouth grow wider and wider as she began to envelope the carcass entirely with her lips!

Turning to her side Olga watched as Quessa was trying to do the same! It seemed she had to try…

Thankfully someone had been kind enough to give her cutlery, so Olga began to hurriedly cut great chunks out of the meal and wolfed them down with barely a chew. She mowed through the meat as fast as she could; making what she thought was excellent progress. Olga had been building up her appetite for the entire rainy season, all these rich foods all day had stretched her stomach until she found herself eating more than twice what she used to in a day! But this…this was too much.

Olga doubled over as best she could; her gut was in serious pain. She tried, she tried so hard to fit in but this was a physical barrier she couldn’t cross. Far more of the meat remained than laid within her stomach. Why was she doing this? Eating till she felt like her gut would rupture just to impress a few snake-people?

“Olga!” Came a soft voice next to her, “Are you alright?”

A tear dribbled down Olga’s fat cheek. “No…” she whimpered, “I can’t it’s too much…” Olga then turned to look at Quessa and her tears temporarily ceased. The snake she had been sharing so much time with looked radically different; her belly was enormous; swollen to such an insane degree that the serpent was sitting sideways to allow her monster stomach to rest off the table…and reach down all the way to the floor!

“Your…your stomach…” Olga mumbled.

“It’s fine.” Quessa brushed off, “This is what we have been practicing all rainy season for.”

The blonde woman sniffled; Quessa had been eating a lot for this feast to prove herself, and now Olga was wimping out. Olga looked again at the food and shook her head, “I can’t eat anymore…” she wept.

“I thought this might happen…here…” Quessa noted as she reached into a satchel by her side. “Drink this.”

“It…it hurts…” Olga sobbed.

“I know, but this should ease the pain…a few sips should make your stomach have enough stretch to help you digest properly.” Quessa explained as Olga looked at her quizzically. “It’s something we use for young naga who can’t stretch their bellies enough the first time.”

Olga graciously took hold of the bottle of potion and looked at it. This was why she was so concerned about finishing this, she wanted to make sure Quessa saved face and didn’t look bad in front of her peers…Olga cared for her. Looking again at the bottle Olga turned back to Quessa; “What would happen if I drank all of it?” She asked.

“Well it would give your belly some serious stretch…but you don’t need to…” But before Quessa could even finish her sentence, Olga had downed the drink.

It felt weird; Olga grunted as the potion filed her drum-tight belly even more…but then the pain faded. A small golden glow then enveloped Olga’s fat stomach and a familiar feeling came over it. “Quessa…” Olga stated, “I’m hungry…” And with that Olga returned to her meal, attacking it with the same gusto she had at the beginning, but this time nothing could stop her.

Olga ate and ate and ate, her belly swelling like a ripening fruit before everyone’s eyes. There was a slight hitch when it started to bump into her chin, but Olga just spread her legs wider and her belly dropped to the floor, hitting it with a dull thud as she continued to eat.

Her hunger was incredible, she even cracked the bones of the buffalo to suck out the nutritious marrow.

More and more she ate until barely scraps remained. Sure her plate still had broken bones on it while everyone else’s were empty, but that she be enough.

Stopping to drop her cutlery, Olga leaned back. But as she did her belly still remained in full view, cresting her horizon like the morning sun. It was huge, bigger than the buffalo she had just consumed, she was literally more belly than woman at this point.

Then, Olga began to feel her eyelids droop and grow heavy. “Quessa…” Olga mumbled deliriously. As Quessa leaned in Olga turned her head to give her a dopey grin. “I have something important to tell you.” She hazily mumbled. “I lo…I lov…I…I think I am going to sleep now…” And with that Olga blacked out.
11131122111211122111211221214.title: A Feast fit for a Queen

111311221112111221112112212142.content:
The first thing Olga saw upon awakening was her enormous belly, which now seemed to cover her entire view. The swelling had gone down considerably since the feast, however long that was, but now she was left with a mass of wobbling fat nearly pinning her down.

Olga grunted and struggled to try and sit up. She couldn't get the momentum going to roll herself up. "Oof," she grunted, giving up, and just resigning to lie there.

She let her pudgy fingers kneed and poke at her expanse. She was now a pile of flab, everything squishing beneath her fingers. Easily, she was twice her size since the festival, she had eaten so much. Speaking of eating...

Her stomach began to growl with a loud rumble. Finally, Quessa was at her side. "Oh, good, you're up," she said cheerfully.

The naga had to come around to Olga's side for her to see the priestess in full view. If Olga was twice her size since the feast, Quessa had gotten to about three times her size. She was now incredibly wide, her massive backside taking several seconds to stop quivering after she came to a stop. Her gut was even bigger than Olga's drooping down, almost touching the floor when she stood, and folded into several rolls.

Olga leaned back on the pillows and groaned. "How long have I been asleep?" she asked.

"Oh, only a couple days," Quessa said. "You really outdid yourself at the feast. I'm surprised you didn't go into a longer food coma."

"Two days!" Olga said in disbelief. "I've been asleep that long! Well...how did I get back here?"

Somehow, she had ended up back in their home, sleeping comfortably on the large bed, which she was surprised could hold her weight.

The naga chuckled. "Well, everyone kind of gets that way at the big feast. The queen always prepares for this. She had some of her stronger servants carry guests back on litters. I'm really impressed, Olga. The way you ate back there, it was amazing. And just look at you! I don't want to sound too optimistic, but you look like you'll do just fine through the dry season." She let her four hands start exploring Olga's expanse, gently prodding her bulging belly.

Olga had gotten used to this. All through the rainy season, Quessa had massaged and rubbed her belly to help ease any tension and pain. She had gotten to where she liked it.

Her stomach growled again. "I'm kind of hungry," Olga said. "Maybe some of that potion is wearing off."

The priestess smiled. "Well, your stomach will always be this stretched now that you've taken the potion. There's no reversing it. And, unfortunately, it is the start of the dry season now, meaning food isn't going to be as plentiful."

"Oh.." was all she could say. Not only was she going to be this bottomless pit, constantly craving massive quantities of food, now she wasn't going to be able to satisfy those hungers.

It seemed that Quessa sensed her concern. "Don't worry. It's not like you're going to starve. We still have food in the store houses. Part of the harvest festival was storing away enough food to last through the dry season. But, building the extra fat stores in our bodies helps us be able to ration those foods without having to worry about losing energy. I'll have a nice lunch prepared for us at once. It won't be as much as you're hoping for, unfortunately, but it'll do."

"So...how long am I going to be this big?" Olga asked. Now that she thought about it, she was perhaps as big as Tora was.

Suddenly, she felt bad. This whole rainy season, she hadn't asked about Tora. That was perhaps a good thing, since she wasn't nagging Quessa constantly about her, but now she missed her sister again.

"Well, most of the weight will burn off as you live off of small meals and your fat stores, but most of us still end up a little chubbier than when we started a year ago. I wouldn't worry too much about it. You look simply beautiful."

Olga blushed. "Um, thanks."

The priestess smiled, continuing to knead Olga's fat lovingly. "So..."

"So?"

"So, you were about to say something, back at the festival."

"What? I was?"

She nodded. "Yes...you were trying to tell me something, just before you went into your food coma. I think you were trying to tell me something important."

Flashes of memories came back to her. Between the memories of gorging and stuffing herself, she did somewhat remember having certain feelings, and a special something she was about to say.

"Oh, that?" Olga said, a warmth rising in her cheeks. "Well, I mean, I was pretty dazed after all the food. I don't know where that came from."

Quessa's face started to fall. "Oh..."

But Olga recovered. "Oh, no, no, I didn't mean anything bad. I just mean that I say stuff that's on my mind when I don't know what I'm doing. But, I don't know, I kinda meant it too."

"And what was it you meant?" the naga asked, an even bigger grin creeping to her face.

From there, despite heavily struggling against her newly established flab and blubber, Olga managed to successfully prop herself up in a sitting position on the lavish stone bed, where she then hesitantly spoke toward the now substantially larger Quessa and said, "Quessa, we...w-when I first arrived here in this city, I...I-I was somewhat confused, d-desperate even, to protect m-my sister Tora from whatever the Gods had in store for me and Tora.

"A-At first, I...I was really, um... apprehensive, about becoming someone else's bride, o-only caring about what happened to Tora, n-nothing more, nothing less. However, that...th-that all ch-changed...when I first met you, Quessa," Olga elaborated, fidgeting with her now chubby fingers, as well as expressing a profusely noticeable blush in the process.

Of course, Quessa still had that expressive grin plastered upon her plump Caucasian face of her's, where she slowly slithered towards Olga and coyly queried, "Oh? And what is it about me that changed, dear Olga?"

Obviously, Olga easily felt the metaphorical butterflies in her stomach growing in number, as she then spoke toward the now rotund Naga Priestess of Knowledge and shakingly explained, "...W-Well, um... When w-we first met outside the temple, I-I was very protective of my sister, along with being a little c-cowardly. B-But...eventually, I...I-I began to know you a little more with each passing m-moment we spent to-together, I... Quessa, I...I...I, um...I -"

But then, just as she was about to stutter her way through the words coming out of her own mouth, Olga suddenly felt Quessa press her substantially larger form against her own corpulent physique, with the rotund Naga Priestess interlocking all four of her hands with Olga's plump hands, where Quessa stared longingly into Olga's own eyes, still expressing a gleeful fanged grin on her lips as she quipped, "It's alright, my dear Olga... Let your heart speak out for you."

"....I....I l-love...y-y-you, Quessa. I am d-deeply in love with you," Olga hesitantly confessed, the blushing on her plump cheeks greatly increasing in volume, size, and hue. From there, as if out of pure instinct, both Olga and Quessa swiftly began to passionately kiss one another, despite being hindered somewhat by their now burgeoning bellies, rolling around a little on the large bed in the process.

Suffice to say, Olga had felt like a great weight had been lifted from her now substantially larger form, as her chubby hands wandered and began to playfully grope some of Quessa's belly flab, causing Quessa to exhale these pleasured moans as Olga went to town on her belly blubber. And throughout the entire night, the two women were certainly and vividly enjoying each other's company. That is, until they've both passed out on the bed from exhaustion, still wrapped in a loving embrace with one another.

11131122111211122111211221214243.content:
A wise man once said, "Time flies for those who enjoy their lives". And for the now substantially larger Olga Forgedotter, those such words weren't far from the truth. Ever since she had confessed her affections toward the the corpulent High Priestess of Knowledge, Quessa, Olga began to feel more comfortable around Quessa and possibly other Nagas as well. Although, despite her increased body mass and weight, Olga managed to adjust fairly well to her newly acquired almost elephantine physique.

Of course, Olga did acquire some assistance courtesy of Quessa from time to time when it came to properly standing up from the stone stools in her new dwellings, especially since her newly established apron of a belly often tended to weigh her down at times. Plus, the potion she drank during the Rainy Season Festival had a permanent effect on her physiology, not just giving her a greatly increased stomach capacity, but also an increased appetite as well.

In turn, this left Olga with quite a gluttonous hunger, enough to potentially store a whole Triceratops hatchling in her stomach if she wanted to.

Eventually, all of the extra bulk and padding began to take somewhat of a toll on the obese female chef, often leaving her quite exhausted during those long leisurely strolls around the Keiku Bazaar and the city of Vaal-Za'haraam as a whole. Fortunately for Olga, Quessa easily noticed her lover's feelings of complete exhaustion, so she decided to give the human another potion, only this concoction was brewed to enhance a malnourished Naga's muscle density and strength. Suffice to say, it was very effective upon the morbidly obese female chef, feeling as if she could lift a horse above her head with both hands.

Quessa & Olga's Dwellings, Temple of Knowledge
Vaal-Za'haraam, Motee Marshes
Two Weeks After The End Of The Rainy Season

To say that Olga had certainly "packed on the pounds" was certainly an understatement these days, as she casually stood up and sluggishly dismounted her corpulent self from the large stone bed. Of course, it was thanks to that Muscle Enhancement potion that Quessa gave to her earlier that she is still able to get out of bed without assistance. Otherwise, she might as well be rendered immobile by now.

"*sigh* Well, another beautiful morning, and another day to be hauling this mass of flesh around," Olga quipped to herself, feeling the undercarriage of her hefty apron belly, and jiggling it mildly out of mere amusement. After all, Quessa was certainly enjoying feeling her at her current size and girth.

Olga calmly waddled her way toward a nearby full body mirror, gazing her widened reflection, where she jokingly decided to pull off a few sexy poses in front of the mirror, giggling a little in the process as she chirped, "Still can't believe there are people out there who find girls at my size to be sexy. *giggle*"

But then, before she could continue, as if on cue, Olga soon heard her blubbery stomach growling profusely, demanding to be fed with something juicy and full of flavor. "Alright, alright, I'll get you something to eat," Olga said to her irritated stomach, gently patting it, as she then calmly waddled off toward the kitchen, her burgeoning hips sashaying from left to right with each waddling step she made.

Currently, Olga was now wearing a green and white bra and loincloth ensemble, and the ensemble had these silver spiral engravings all over the bra and loincloth. Once she made her way into the kitchen, she could see that someone already cooked her a juicy meal, which came in the form of a Triceratops rump roast splayed out on a bronze platter. Needless to say, it definitely got Olga's mouth drooling with gluttonous anticipation.

From there, just as she then began to voraciously tear into the platter of succulent Triceratops meat, Olga soon heard Quessa slither her way into the lofty dwellings, bearing an excited fanged grin on her cherubic face, where she eagerly slithered behind the rotund female chef, wrapping her four plump arms around Olga in a loving embrace as she chirped, "Good morning, my beloved Olga. Did you sleep well last night?"

"*Chomp, then gulp* Certainly, sweetie! Especially with you around for company," Olga retorted, planting an affectionate kiss upon Quessa's chubby right cheek in response, just as the corpulent Naga Priestess calmly severed the loving embrace, where she then slithered her way to an adjacent stone stool and sat her fattened rump down upon the stone stool alongside her beloved Olga.

"So...what's with the fanged grin on that beautiful chubby face of yours, honey?" Olga queried, curious to know why Quessa was much more ecstatic than her usual peppy self, just as the rotund female chef took another large bite out of the Triceratops rump roast.

However, what she wasn't expecting today was what Quessa said to her as the corpulent Naga Priestess gleefully chirped, "Well, I have some rather excellent news, my dear Olga! Your sister, Tora, is quickly showing signs of consciousness!"

Of course, upon hearing such a revelation, Olga accidentally swallowed a large chunk of Triceratops meat without properly chewing it up first, choking on the succulent meat for a brief moment or two. Fortunately, she managed to recover from the brief ordeal fairly quickly, where she quickly stopped eating, stood up as fast as her nearly elephantine physique would allow her, looking at her beloved Quessa and exclaimed, "TORA'S WAKING UP!?!"

From there, Olga quickly waddled up towards the equally rotund Quessa, grabbed both of the Naga's lower hands, and quickly said, "Quessa! That's the best news I've heard today!"

"*giggle* I'm glad to see that you're happy with such a revelation, my love," Quessa retorted, where she then proceeded to hug the corpulent female chef, despite size of their bellies hindering such an endeavor.

Moments later, Olga then looked back up towards her equally large lover and asked, "Thank you so much, Quessa! Is there any chance that I can see her?"

Shortly after hearing what Olga said, Quessa soon spoke toward the almost elephantine female chef and explained...

111311221112111221112112212142431.content:
Shortly after hearing what Olga said, Quessa soon spoke toward the almost elephantine female chef and explained, "Well, I wouldn't say that she is fully conscious, Olga. But she IS indeed subconsciously responding to the healing process quite well. Of course, we'll have to take into account Tora's state of mental health and trauma. Plus, we will also have to -"

"Quessa! You're rambling to yourself again," Olga retorted, easily snapping the substantially larger Naga Priestess out of her quirky science-fueled ramblings.

Of course, in response to her betrothed's statement, Quessa looked back at the rotund Olga and embarrassingly quipped, "Oops! *giggle* My bad, love. Force of habit."

"So...do I have permission to see my sister again?" Olga asked, wanting to know if Quessa would be willing to allow her to see her sister once again after all this time.

Fortunately for the corpulent female chef, Quessa gave a firm affirmative nod and complied, "To put it bluntly, my beloved Olga... Yes, you can see your sister. After all, it is the reason why I have come to you personally with such information first."

"Does Queen Coatzintli already know about my sister's current state?" Olga queried, especially since the Naga Queen was in fact the one who both brought them to Vaal-Za'haraam and allow Tora to be taken care of by the Priestesses here in the first place.

In response to such a question, Quessa nodded once more and explained, "She soon will be, my dear. I've been sending her Highness several reports of my progress to her via messenger bird for several weeks at this point, updating her from time to time on your sister's progress.

"In other words, my love: We can head over to the Spirit Room to see your sister right now...if you want to, of course," Quessa answered, letting Olga know that she can visit her sister at any time she wanted.

Obviously, the corpulent female chef wanted to see her beloved sibling as soon as humanly possible, where she then promptly spoke toward the rotund Naga Priestess and retorted, "Right now, you mean? Of course I want to see her, Quessa!"

"*giggle* I figured you would say that, sweetie," Quessa chirped, speaking with a flirtatious tone in her voice, just as Olga soon followed closely behind the rotund Naga Priestess, easily getting a clear view of Quessa's humongous scaly derriere with relative ease.

However, as they calmly made their way toward the Spirit Room, Olga felt this eerily minor itching sensation from one of her large thighs. Of course, she instinctively scratched the source of the itch for a brief moment, where it oddly enough, began to cease it's dry assault on her skin.

"Huh... That was...weird." Olga thought to herself, deciding to inevitably ignore such an odd feeling for the time being. After all, she needed to see her beloved sister Tora as soon as possible.

Eventually, both Olga and Quessa made their way inside the spacious Spirit Room, where they noticed a few of the other Naga Priestesses patiently waiting for their superior's commands.

"Please wait outside, my fellow priestesses," Quessa commanded, where the Naga Priestesses firmly obliged with her orders.

They saluted her as they bluntly retorted, "By your command, High Priestess Quessa!"

From there, the remaining Naga Priestesses calmly slithered their way out of the Spirit Room with relative ease, despite their increased girths. Now that they were the only ones within the room, Olga slowly approached her obese unconscious sister, gently caressing her now longer hair with her somewhat plump hands and fingers, where she calmly spoke toward the unconscious Tora splayed out before her and said, "Tora... Tora, please wake up. It's...I-It's me: Olga, your sister. Don't you remember?"

However, instead of slowly regaining consciousness, Tora, despite now weighing much more than she previously remembered, suddenly shot up from the stone slab, screaming her lungs off, as if she was experiencing a vivid nightmare. Of course, Tora quickly responded to her sister's psychological trauma, quickly grabbing her hands as she exclaimed, "Tora! Tora, Stop!! IT'S OKAY YOU'RE SAFE!! IT'S ME, OLGA!!!"

Fortunately for both Olga and Quessa, Tora was able to somewhat calm down upon hearing her sister's voice, her eyes darting from left to right, stopping when she finally gazed upon her sister, who was bearing a grateful teary-eyed grin on her plump cherubic face, as Tora finally spoke her first words in quite a while as she quiveringly said, "...O-Olga?"

In response to her sister saying her name, the tears of joy running down Olga's chubby face continued to flow, where she nodded in confirmation once or twice, causing both siblings to quickly hug one another in a loving familial embrace, like two lovers who have been separated but finally reunited after quite a long time.

"Tora...oh, Tora, I'm so relieved to see you once more. *sob* Y-You've had me all worried to no end!" Olga sobbed, greatly relieved to see her beloved sibling very much awake after what felt like months.

From there, Tora placed a plump hand upon her younger sister's chubby left cheek in reassurance, where she then looked at Olga and shakingly replied, "*sob* It is so good to finally see you again as well, little sis."

Of course, slowly but surely, Tora eventually began to notice a lot of things that seemed off about...well everything she was seeing in her peripheral vision, and the first thing she noticed was...

1113112211121112211121122121424312.content:
The first thing she noticed was the enormous, serpentine creature standing just behind Olga. Though Quessa looked like her typical, perky, and jolly self, seeing what was essentially a snake-woman with sharp teeth did nothing to ease Tora's nerves.

"Gods, what on earth is that!" she cried. She looked around at the magnificent temple. "Where am I?"

Olga had a feeling this wouldn't be an easy transition. "Well, I kind of struck a deal with the queen of the nagas to set you free," she answered. "This is Quessa, a high priestess. She was the one who brought you out of that...whatever that spell was the vampires used on you. Don't worry, she's friendly."

Tora only mouthed a few syllables, unable to process it all. "F-friendly?" she said at last.

"Um, yeah. Anyway, part of the deal was I come here to the capital city to be the queen's personal chef, so that's why we're here. You're actually in the Temple of Knowledge, which Quessa is a part of."

Quessa took that as her cue to slither up. "It is finally a treat to meet the sister of dear Olga. Here' let me help you up." She came around behind Tora and helped push her into a sitting position. Her immense flab shifted and settled as she sat up.

"Oh gods!" Tora moaned, running her hands through her own fat. "It's worse than I thought." She then looked at Olga. "Olga, you're...you're huge too! I know what happened to me...sort of, but how...?"

At this juncture, Olga's stomach began to growl once more. She rubbed her gut, trying to sooth it like a whining dog. "Maybe we can discuss that over something to eat. Surely, you're pretty hungry too."

Quessa and Olga helped Tora get from the temple to their home, which was no easy task. True, Olga and Tora were roughly the same size, but Olga at least had been up and about, getting used to carrying her weight, and the potions also helped. Tora, unfortunately, having been bed-bound by the vampires, and in a coma for some time in the naga city, found her muscles unable to really help her get around. They had to order a litter to be prepared to carry her back. Tora didn't like this at all, as she was still unsure of the naga, and she was embarrassed to consciously be aware that she was too fat to walk.

A pleasant lunch was prepared for the trio, and Olga ate voraciously, all the while, telling her sister of the events that followed after Tora was whisked away by the vampires.

"So, anyway, there's this big rainy season here, and during that time, it's important to eat as much as you can to store as fat for the dry season, which is going on now," Olga said, licking her fingers after having finished another hearty helping of triceratops meat. "And, that's how I got to looking like this." She grabbed a handful of her stomach and wobbled it for emphasis.

Tora was still in a bit of shock. There was so much to take in. She was in this immense city out in the middle of gods knew where, with nagas of all people. She had just been rescued from what she had assumed was an endless fate in the hands of Cameena Stranken. Her sister had bargained her own life away to save her. And to top it all off, the two of them were now round, fat, balls of flesh. Still, there was one thing that she couldn't just sit idly by and say nothing about.

"So, you've...you've married this naga, I mean, Quessa?" she said.

"Yes, and it's actually worked out for the better. I really do love her," Olga said, already anticipating her sister's next question. "I mean, at first it was just part of the deal, but I guess it just felt right after a while."

Tora shook her head. "I can't say I really understand it, Olga, but if it's what makes you happy, then I'm happy for you."

"Glad to hear it," Quessa said, coming up behind Olga and taking her plate for her. "Dear me, Olga, I don't know what I'm going to do about this appetite of yours." She tickled the side of her belly. "You may just end up staying cute and chubby like this all the time. I could like that."

Olga laughed. "Maybe. Those appetite enhancers really have made it hard to keep full."

"Well, that'll be good news come next rainy season. You can eat all you want then."

"So, we're really staying here?" Tora said.

Olga could see her pained expression. She knew her sister missed their home, their forge, and all their friends. She wasn't sure how to say it. "Well, yes. I mean, I did promise myself as the queen's cook, and I don't think I could ever bring myself to force Quessa to leave her position as a high priestess just to come back to the north with me." Tora winced a little. So, she had assumed that they would leave without Quessa. "And, I kind of like it here." She said this one quickly, hoping not to upset her. "It's warm, it's nice, no vampires..."

Tora sighed. This wasn't exactly what she had planned. Then again, what did she have planned. Before, she was trapped under the spell of Cameena, so escape wasn't happening that way. But, this didn't exactly feel like joyful freedom either.

"Just give it a try," Olga said, resting her hand over her sister's. "I think you'll come to like it."

11131122111211122111211221214243121.content:
"But, I am curious," Olga continued, "what happened to you after Cameena took you? It's okay if you don't want to talk about it, but I just wanted to know how it all happened...that is, if you remember."

Tora took a deep breath, unsure where to start. She did remember bits and pieces of the ordeal, though most of what she remembered happened early on. "Well, I'll tell you this, it wasn't at all what I expected," she began. "She didn't say much on the way back to her manor, and I think she just wanted to let me dangle a bit, get myself worked up. I really thought she would just drain me as soon as we got in there. But, that's when things got weird.

"She told me she was hungry, and I was waiting for it. I knew this would be the end. Instead, she bid me to follow her to one of the other chambers. Damus preserve me, that's when I saw what really happened to all those poor girls who get taken. She took me to see this one, probably could've once been an adorable little brunette when she was first taken. Now, the poor thing was a useless blob, big as the bed she was laying on. All she could do was lay there and eat. I've never seen someone so big. Cameena was just thrilled with how big her 'cattle' had gotten, and that's when she sunk her fangs into the girl's belly and began to drink. I thought I would be sick right there. Course, the girl was so fat, I don't think she felt a thing, thank the gods. When she finished, that's when Cameena explained that the vampires don't kill their prey, at least not for a long while. It makes sense, now that you think about it. They'd have to steal a girl every night if they did that. Instead, they keep them and only drink a small amount, just enough to leave them alive. But why just drink a few drops, you know?

"That's why they fatten them up. The bigger they are, the more blood they produce, and the longer they can provide food for the vampires. They only kill them at grand feasts when they invite a good number of their kin. It's only then that they take an incredibly fat one, like the one laying before me and drain her dry. It just so happened that the reason I was taken was because Cameena had just hosted a feast the week before.

"She wasn't done with the tour yet, and she wasn't done with me. She took me back down to the dining room, where I got to see some of the more 'newly' acquired girls. A feast fit for the king was set out, and all of them were gorging on it like food wouldn't exist tomorrow. Each of the girls were at various stages of plump and fat as they devoured each morsel of food. Cameena explained that some of these girls ate of their own free will to avoid Cameena's wrath. Some even grew to enjoy it. Others had to be put under a hypnotic curse, which caused them to eat constantly, sometimes near to the point of bursting. That was when I saw her impish slaves drag one girl away from the feast, her stomach round like a boulder, and quivering like it would pop at the drop of a needle. She tried to fight back and run back to the feast to continue gorging. It was unearthly some of the sounds she made, like some wild boar.

"Cameena then gave me a choice, and asked if I would eat willingly or if I would have to become a dumb beast like that girl. For the time being, I decided it was better to have my wits about me. Perhaps I could find a way to escape. For the next several weeks, I stayed in the manor, being forced to eat heavy meals five times a day so that I could gain weight quick enough for Cameena's liking. She was eager to try my blood, and wanted me 'healthy' enough to endure the ordeal. That was...that was the hardest part. I've never felt anything like that first time she bit me. It was this rush of pleasure mixed with pain all at once. It was horrible. I still have fevered nightmares because of it.

"Despite the fact that I was getting significantly larger, I still had the ability to go about the castle, and so long as Cameena didn't require my services, or it wasn't meal time, I was free to wander about as I pleased. That's when I thought I found my chance. I had found an open window in the manor, and I began gathering bed sheets to make a rope to climb down and escape during the night. I don't know how, but Cameena caught wind of my plans. She decided that I needed to be made into a more obedient pet, and that's when she put me under the curse. I don't remember much else beyond that...just memories of lots of food. I wake up months later, and I see what it's done to me."

Tora began to sob uncontrollably at the thought of all the torture she had undergone. Olga was at her side, stroking her shoulder. It was odd, she thought, now she was the one having to take care of her sister like an older sibling. "It's alright, Tora," she said soothingly. "You're away from all that now. She can't hurt you. According to the queen, she's not going to be hurting much of anyone else anytime soon."

"But look at me!" Tora wailed. "I'm an enormous fat cow! I can't even get up without your help."

Olga remained firm in her reassurance. "In case you've forgotten, I'm as big as you are now. It's okay, it really is. I love you all the same, and it doesn't look all that bad. Like I said, it'll help a lot during the dry season here. And Quessa, I'm sure has more of the potion she gives me to help me get around, isn't that right?"

Quessa nodded. "Of course. I'll send for some right away."

Tora sniffed. "I just don't know. This is all so sudden and frightening to me. Olga, how am I going to handle this?"

"Don't worry about it for right now. We'll figure something out. Right now, all that matters is that you're here, and not with Cameena anymore."
11131122111211122111211221214243121.title: Tora's Tale

111311221112111221112112212142431213.content:
Tora could adjust to a lot of these new changes. She actually found the south much more pleasant than Racovania, both for the warmer weather, and the fact that there were no more vampires. Despite her initial reservations about the naga, she had adjusted to that as well. They weren't a brutal race, nor were they malicious to others. They were just isolated, and preferred to stay that way, meaning that invaders and unwelcome visitors often saw their brutality. But, Olga and Tora were guests, and they therefore received a lot of the local hospitality.

She could even accept her sister's full immersion into the culture. Olga always was the sort to find the silver lining and wonder in all things, so it didn't come as a surprise to Tora that her sister actually liked living among the naga. Most of the time, Olga was busy working in the queen's kitchens, so they only saw each other early in the mornings or late in the evenings, meaning Tora usually had to find ways to occupy herself.

That didn't come as easily. True, the potions Quessa had given Tora helped her at least have the strength to get up and move around on her own, but the fact of the matter was that she was still an enormous ball of fat at the end of the day. Cameena had taken everything from her: her freedom, her will, and her body. She tried to stay strong for Olga, but at night, when she was totally alone, she sobbed uncontrollably for all that had happened to her at the hands of that vicious bloodsucker.

But, even with the added movement thanks to the potions, Tora could find little to do to occupy herself with. She didn't have a job like Olga did, and the nagas had their own ways of weapon making. Her smithing skills wouldn't come in handy here. There was very little to do about town, and therefore, she didn't exactly make any new friends. The only people she saw were Quessa and Olga.

That was the hardest thing to adjust to. Tora had been prepared for a lot of the unusual changes that she woke up to, but seeing her sister in a relationship with the naga priestess was something she would never have dreamed of in a million years. To begin with, she had never pictured Olga being the type to like women. All the times she could remember teasing her sister about potential dates had always been about the young men in the town: the strapping son of the woodcutter or the tall and strong butcher's boy.

Second, the fact that Olga so willingly loved a naga made this incredibly awkward. Though Tora no longer feared them, she didn't exactly find them all that appealing in appearance either. Scaly bodies that slithered around and made her skin crawl seemed like the least attractive thing in her mind. Those serpentine faces didn't exactly do much for their looks either, she thought. Yet, Olga acted as if it were nothing, and would openly make out with Quessa any chance she got. Throw in the fact that both women were incredibly large, Olga now more so than Quessa, and it just felt incredibly odd.

That was the other thing Tora noticed. It seemed that as the dry season progressed, Quessa had been right: most of the naga slowly lost all their rainy season weight, including herself. The naga priestess was starting to look a tad less round, still heavy for sure, but starting to shrink. Olga, on the other hand, had remained just as fat as the day Tora had woken up, if not fatter. Despite the fact that there wasn't as much food to go around as there was during rainy season, Quessa had seen to it that Olga was well cared for and well-fed. Tora had heard what the naga sometimes called humans: hairless monkeys. She and Olga, though, looked more like pink pigs.

Not that Olga minded. She was still able to get up, go out, and enjoy life. She ate whatever she wanted, and Quessa still loved her all the same. What wasn't there to enjoy about this life? Not that Tora had lost all that much weight herself. Nothing seemed to change in the slightest for her. But Olga seemed content to remain fat and happy, and that concerned her.

At the moment, Olga was just finishing the hearty dinner Quessa had prepared for them. Tora had picked at her food, not having found the odd meats they ate all that appetizing. Her sister had eaten until she was stuffed like the fat geese their neighbor used to raise.

"That was wonderful. I really needed that after a long day at the palace," Olga said, licking meat juices off her fingers and rubbing her gut with her other free hand. At this rate, Olga would eclipse Tora's size easily by the next rainy season, and gods forbid what would happen then.

Quessa sat beside Olga, helping her rub her distended belly with her two free hands, the two nuzzling each other's foreheads. Tora thought she was going to be sick. The naga poked a little. "Oh really?" she teased. "It looks to me like someone might have been snacking in the kitchens today."

"I've gotta taste test my stuff. After all, I'm supposed to be making only the best for the queen. She's almost due you know."

"Indeed, I'm aware. I'm supposed to put together a blessing ceremony when the little ones arrive."

There seemed to be something Quessa wanted to say right then and there, but couldn't bring herself to do it. But Tora noticed. She wondered what sort of intentions the naga had for her sister.

Olga yawned. "Well, we'd best get some sleep. I need to be with it tomorrow. I was almost falling asleep making sauces today."

The loving couple got up and waddled/slithered to their bedroom, leaving Tora still dumbfounded, much like she was every night. What did Olga see in her?
111311221112111221112112212142431213.title: The Odd Couple
