11131122111221122121122122211112111.content:
By this point during the year, most Naga would have shed their with wet season poundage and would have started to look slim and elegant again. Unless it was your job to eat; Nochtli’s bubble butt, which Olga had thought excessively large at first, would be considered small compared to her wet season figure.

But the human head chef had turned things on their heads; at least for those inside the palace walls, everyone in the working classes was carrying on as normal. But in the palace grounds, things had begun to get out of control. The Naga ability to put on weight lightning fast was counter-measured by the reverse, and so even at the height of the wet season waistlines inside the grand palace never hit a critical mass. But right now, that was exactly what was happening.

“Move your butt!”

“I can’t! Your tail is taking up all the space!”

“Girls, what’s going on?”

Olga had been greeted in the morning to a recurring problem. Two of Coatlzintli’s daughters had tried to pass through a doorway at the same time, and ultimately become stuck. A pair of brown and green tails thrashing around as the two overweight princesses both tried to force their bulk through at the same time.

“We’re stuck!” Came the unified whine as both girls sobbed in that something-has-slightly-inconvenienced-my-royal-highness way. Olga sighed, looks like her services were required.

Gently, the blonde woman picked up the slightly smaller Naga’s tail and held it under her armpit. “Ok, I am going to pull, when you feel me tugging, try to push yourself backwards, ok?”

“Ok!” Came the high pitched voice, signalling Olga to pull.

She tugged and strained, sweat pouring from her brow and dripping onto her poncho. The dry season was really not the best time to over-exert herself, everything just ended up… sticky.

Thankfully though, her struggles were soon over, as the smaller daughter popped out, with the other falling to the floor.

“Ooof! Finally!” The bigger sister proclaimed. Now they were free, Olga could take a look at both girls and see who it was that had to adjust to their size.

Working for so long in the palace, Olga found she had adjusted quite well to her new charges. Even with over one hundred children, the only human for miles had managed to remember their names… well most of them. The more reclusive ones she still had trouble with.

These two were not the case though; it was Zeltzin and Xoco. Zeltzin was one of the “middle-children”, (as no one middle child could be determined, that was the best Olga could call her) she was also exceptionally beautiful. Her bone structure gave her a real classical beauty that any painter would have killed to work with; she had long flowing hair that always had a beautiful sheen to it, and was the daughter most likely to be spotted wearing make-up. Meanwhile Xoco was one of the younger broods, and was hence a little shorter than her sisters. Olga had taken a bit of a shine to her, but that might have been because the two were about the same size (when Olga arrived anyway), and was thus less intimidating than the other Naga.

Both however had succumbed to the rampant obesity that had swept the palace occupants. Zeltzin’s weight had mostly stuck to her chest and butt, leaving her face untouched, while Zoco was fat just about everywhere evenly.

“I think you two need to be more careful… one at a time through the doors.” Olga stated, trying not to sound like a scolding parent.

“Fiiine…” Zeltzin huffed, before slithering away through the door, one wide hip still bumping the side.

Olga rolled her eyes, before turning to the remaining princess, “Are you ok?” She asked.

“Yeah…” Xoco replied, “just not really used to this… I have never been this big.” She emphasized her point by picking up her big dollop of a belly and dropping it, letting the large brown sack of fat hit her lap with a slapping sound.

Olga guessed the stout Naga was right, she must have been about as big as her old boss before she left for the marshes. “Well, just watch out from now on. I’m not going to stop cooking any time soon.” Olga added a wink at the end to try and cheer the princess up.

“Haha! Well I guess I don’t mind being a bit careful if I can eat more of your legger food!” The snake-woman replied, her forked tongue lapping her lips as she thought of it.

“Great! Well, speaking of that, I need to get to the kitchen. See you for first breakfast!”

“See ya!”

And with that morning escapade, Olga set back off on her route to the kitchens, following roughly the route Zeltzin had slithered off to, but taking a right at the end of the hall. She was thankful that the rest of the Naga were less active in the mornings, Zeltzin and Xoco had been probably the thinnest of the princesses when she first arrived, so they were a bit behind the rest of their siblings. However, they were an exception, most had taken too her new rainy-season-all-year diet very well. Space, had become a premium.


***


Olga encountered the first problems in her kitchens. While her staff were a mix of low and high birth, none could resist snacking at work. While none had grown to the almost unimaginable girths of others in the palace, they had certainly not shrunk down as the rainy season ended.

The head chef had had to deal with a lot of pots, pans and other kitchen items being knocked around by wide rears, thickened tails, wobbling arms, bulging breasts and oversized guts.

Some days Olga wanted to clear them out and work in peace. But she needed the extra arms, which the Nagas had in spades.

That was one thing Olga could appreciate, the extra arms. It really let the Naga multi-task like nothing she had ever seen. Certainly a feature she could admit to being jealous of, rather than put off by… like the scales or forked tongues.

She was also glad her workforce was still mobile, something that could not be said throughout the rest of the palace…


***


“First breakfast!” Olga called out loudly as she entered the hatchlings quarters. Entering the room lately plucked a thread of nostalgia in Olga; the multitude of massive mounds almost looked like the mountains of home in Racovania.

But these were no natural land-formations, but the colossal forms of the most gluttonous and sedentary of Coatlzintli’s brood. Each girl was bigger and heavier than ever; some lay on their sides, letting a tidal wave of belly fat flow over the edge of their dais and onto the stone floor. Others lay on their backs, their breasts and stomachs rising like mountains. Many of the brood were completely immobile, or approaching it, so food always had to be brought to them. In on case though, a little extra help was required.

“Ok Chantico, I’m coming up!” Olga called as she approached the side of the most mountainous of Naga. With the aid of one of her helpers, Olga was hoisted up the side of Chantico’s stomach until she was perched atop the massive girl.

“Hey!” Chantico greeted, wiggling her fingers in greeting. “What’s on the menu today?”

“Oh what DON’T I have!” Olga replied gleefully, motioning for the Naga below to start handing things up.

As was obvious Chantico had lost the ability to feed herself. Her arms had grown too fat and heavy to use, and her pampered youth meant she lacked the udder-arm strength of an adult Naga. Not to mention a smaller frame than her royal mother. Speaking of which, Chantico’s size was reminding Olga of her royal highness more and more by the day. But by now, how big was Coatlzintli?

As Olga fed the gleeful princess, Quetzalli (situated not far from Chantico) and her chatted.

“We hoped Chantico would stop growing so fast now her arms have stopped the working.” Quetzalli chuckled, poking fun at her vast sister.

“Ha… *oomph* Ha…” Chantico replied. “Not like you have moved lately, when did you last leave your dais? A week ago?”

That shut Quetzalli up. She wasn’t as fat as her sibling, and was much bigger and stronger… but she had been so lazy of late. Perhaps she should go out and roam the palace a bit more? After second breakfast that is!


***


Eventually, after what felt like hours, Olga and her team finished feeding the princesses. The former barmaid was tired and sweaty from the task, but she still had one more person to see to. Amoxtli and Olga’s relationship over time had really progressed. While they had gotten off to a rocky start (Olga could certainly say she had never started a friendship by seeing the other person’s tits the first time they met); Olga could happily say that Amoxtli was her best friend in the city.

And as best friend to the head chef, Amoxtli had been privy to certain perks…

It had become clear to everyone in the kingdom that Olga Forgedotter, the scrappy little legger from the Cold Country up north, wasn’t going anywhere. Who would have wanted her to?

She had singlehandedly revolutionized the culinary customs for the upper echelon of the Naga people. No longer dependent on hunting and gathering their food and stockpiling it for the season, the Naga were now free to laze around and let their food basically grow itself. Now that their precious fruits could be plucked from the vine during any season, wet or dry, and crops could be grown to both help feed livestock and themselves, the once active and noble race of snake women were quickly beginning to resemble slugs.

Nevertheless, Olga was an important woman in the Marshes, and she wasn’t so entirely naïve that she hadn’t used her newfound prominence to her advantage at least once or twice.

Amoxtli had been her best friend since the Queens had hired her and whisked her away from her homelands of the north. She’d been with them threw thick and thin (though there wasn’t much of the latter going on around the marshes anymore) and had been a steadfast companion throughout her transition into a strange new world with such creatures in it. Upon her ascent into prominence, and whereupon it could not be disputed, it was only natural that Olga would want to repay the immense favor that was being her first friend in her new homeland.

Amoxtli had been named Captain of the Culinary Guard, and assigned by the Council of Scales, who ruled in-absentia while Queen Coatlzintli continued her extended stay in Adinah, to be Olga’s personal guard after some coaxing and a night of Olga’s services.

Once upon a time it would have been a death knell forthe proud warrior, Amoxtli the Red Tailed, to retire from the battlefield. To shed all but her traditional armor and lay down many of the weapons she’d trained since hatching to use would have been to Amoxtli the Red Tailed of dinners past, an insult and a waste.

But she had changed just as much as any of the other Naga in the marshes—perhaps more than any of them, truly.

Having taken keenly to Olga’s preferential treatment, Amoxtli was in no shape to guard anything. Once lithe and muscular, all of the warrior woman’s bulk had simply melted into heft. Woefully out of shape, amply out of practice, and incredibly sluggish after seasons of shirking responsibility in order to stuff herself to her heart’s content—becoming more and more insatiable as Olga’s preferential treatment began to take its toll on the once disciplined warrior’s body and mind.

Amoxtli, Captain of the Culinary Guard, had become spoiled, greedy, and immensely fat.

“Blue Eyes!” Amoxtli puffed, struggling to slither herself into a half-risen state, “Y’r late!”

As Amoxtli resituated, her heavy swinging tail landing with dull THUD THUDs against the stone, her great brown stomach drooped ever closer to the floor. On her side, it pooled like a great ocean of malleable mush—stroked by two arms rapidly growing too big around the top to do much of anything else. She had been busting out of customary arm-bands left and right, practically popping out of rings as her once nimble fingers grew more large and unwieldy after every meal’s wake.

“I am not.” Olga said in a friendly, teasing sort of tone as she watched her pile of protector struggle to write, “You’re just a little extra grumpy today.”

Olga laughed as Amoxtli puffed her spherical cheeks in displeasure. To someone so coddled as she, after a lifetime of hardship, even an extra minute felt like torture. With two hands, she ran concentric circles into her sagging stomach while the other struggled to even fold underneath her massive chest.

“Whatever… *huff puff*… just lay it on me!”

Amoxtli required the assistances of three smaller house naga to help roll her onto her side so that she might be able to feed herself. Though for how much longer, nobody really cared to say. It was an open secret among the two of them—plus the rotating staff of small chubby naga—that the once great warrior had already grown too wide around to slither out from her newly appointed chambers. Her tree-wide tail end was bad enough, but the great weight of her stomach as it bulged mightily from all sides. It hung low, low over her lap now, her great brown belly growing closer to the stone floors by the day…

And yet, she was happy to keep eating.

“Shouldn’t Captain of the…” she sputtered and wheezed, wrestling her title with her mouthfuls, before giving up, “Whatever… shouldn’t I get first pick?”

“You get to eat right after all the Queen’s daughters!” Olga laughed a little as she rubbed her friend’s stomach, billowing closer to her these days than Amoxtli’s mouth, “You literally get second pick.”

“I work harder than any of those lazy brats.” Amoxtli said gruffly as a servant hand-fed her a marsh berry

“Yes you do.” Olga pat Amoxtli’s tremendous tummy approvingly, “Now open wide!”

Laying there in her resplendent gluttony, Amoxtli was happy to be pampered as if she were one of the queen’s own brood. Being hand-fed various feasts until she was too full to move, and perhaps eventually even too fat to move, weighed only as heavy on her conscience as her drive to get back out on the field.

In a way, Amoxtli represented the dangers of what Olga’s rapid change to the food chain meant for the Naga. A warrior race of people, gone to seed in the wake of their own rampant gluttony…

1113112211122112212112212221111211111.content:
It was inevitable; after many delays, problems, solutions, further problems and further solutions, the great queen of the Naga was on her way home.

Letters had been sent announcing her return to her own kind beforehand, alerting the staff to ready themselves for her majesty’s arrival.

There was plentiful chatter around the palace; daughters happy to hear their mother was coming home, nobles worrying that their new favourite guest would have her time preoccupied by the queen, and staff worried if they had enough food to feed her. The last concern was a serious one, for within the letter had been a warning that queen Coatlzintli had only grown “more majestic” during her stay in Adinah.

Finally the day arrived, and Olga was stationed inside the kitchen as usual. She was preparing the welcome feast; her royal highness could start her diet tomorrow, besides… her daughters would probably clear most of the plates themselves these days.

As Olga carried a large pot (or more like a vat) of jam across the threshold, a voice called out to her.

“Chef! I think you should see this!” It was one of Olga’s cooks, beckoning her over with her lower set of arms, while the top ones propped her up on the kitchen windowsill.

Setting the tub down, Olga came over, careful to avoid tripping over the long orange tail of her staff. As Olga peered over the edge of the window, she saw the familiar majesty of the Naga city. But as she scanned the horizon, Olga noticed something. Every so often, to the left of her vision, something shook the rainforest, causing a flood of brightly colored birds to fly into the air. Eventually whatever it was reached the edge of the treeline and the greenery parted to make way for a colossal shape.

“No way…” Olga muttered under her breath, as she watched a very familiar brown and green silhouette emerge.

It was queen Coatlzintli for sure, but yet how could it be… the sheer size of her, it was unbelievable. How could any one person become this big!? The topmost part of the queen was towering over the battlements that surrounded the city; how was she even supposed to get through the gate!?

As Olga watched, a thought cropped into her head. “Was her mother ever that… big?” Olga asked the Naga next to her.

“Never…” she replied, neither woman taking their eyes off of the mountain-sized woman as they spoke.


***


Once the cooking was done, Olga practically threw her apron away as she left. She and Coatlzintli had become friends on their trip to the marshes; initially she had just planned on catching up with her… but after catching a glimpse at the monstrous size the queen had reached, her first instinct was to make sure she was ok.

Thankfully Olga did not have to go far to reach her, as the queen’s dais had just reached the palace courtyard. It seemed a new one had been constructed in Adinah, made of some sort of stone most likely, and outfitted with wheels and yokes to be pulled by some beasts of burden.

Said beasts of burden were a pair of Triceratops. Their tri-horned visages normally a bit off-putting to the young woman. But Olga was on a mission, and rushed past the animals as they were unhooked from the yokes and escorted away to the stables, Olga ducking under one of their feathery tails as she went.

“Coatlzintli!” Olga called out, waving her arms. The blonde woman was worried that Coatlzintli’s ears might be covered in flab at this point, but a slight twitching of the pointy tips told her that was not the case. Now able to stop and catch her breath, Olga was able to take in just how big her old friend had become…

Coatlzintli was sitting on her front, so her face was in full view, and how it had changed. The titanic Naga’s second chin drooped down her face by several feet, flowing across the top of her breasts like icing. Her cheeks were each the size of a platter, rippling like pools with each breath the queen took.

Below was Coatlzintli’s breasts. Olga had started to grow used to reptilian nudity; a good time to start, as nothing could contain the avalanche of breast-flesh that flowed forth. If they were water, Olga could easily have swum lengths across them.

But underneath was the queen’s largest part, a belly so large that it was enough to prop Coatlzintli up on its own, Olga estimated that it was as big as the tavern she used to work in Racovania. The sack of fat was larger at the base, allowing Olga from even her low position to see the top of the queen’s royal rump, each cheek looking big enough to be used as an entire bed.

It took a moment for Olga to spot them, but she eventually saw the queen’s arms. Each of her four limbs was so utterly buried in flab that Olga couldn’t see any of Coatlzintli’s fingers. They were just puddles with another puddle on top, tipped with a divot.

Olga couldn’t see any of the queen’s black, brown and green tail; but assumed from the lack of twitching that it too was simply too large to move.

When Olga had first met Coatlzintli, the obese Naga had been the fattest person she had ever met by a miles, and even now, whilst Olga’s expectations of humongous obesity became normalized, Coatlzintli still managed to impress her.

“Hello Olga.” Coatlzintli greeted with a smile. “I hope you have been learning well here, it looks like your job may need you to stay a bit longer than planned…”


***


Olga had moved herself back indoors while the logistical nightmare to get Coatlzintli up the first set of stairs and into the palace was underway. So instead she got to work laying out the palace feast, helped organise the positions everyone would sit at the table, and then went back to Amoxtli’s corners to chat and snack (well, Amoxtli did the vast majority of the snacking.

After a while, a guard came to escort Olga to the dinning hall.

Olga was surprised when the guard led her to sit next to the queen herself. She knew that the position of head chef was high, but not this high!

As Olga sat down, next to the monolithic form of her friend and queen, she felt a surge of pride swell in her chest as she tucked into the finger-food that she had helped create. But as she took her share of nibbles, the queen spoke, and Olga’s heart dropped.

“I think I may have made a mistake bringing you here Olga…” Coatlzintli stated slowly in a low voice.

The blonde woman stopped a jam tart half-way to her mouth and looked up at Coatlzintli, speechless. Meanwhile, the queen continued.

“When I hired you, I hoped that you might bring healthier foods to my palace… but that is not the case it seems. I fear that should you cook for me as you have my daughters, I will only grow ever larger; and if I don’t slim down, this may have been my last visit to other kingdoms… coming home was a nightmare.”

“I…I see…” Olga replied, putting the tart down dejectedly.

“I should have listened to Patli… I am sorry for dragging you out here, so far from home.” Coatlzintli added. She was not angry, just sad and a bit disappointed.

“Right…” Olga added, before trying to change the topic a little, “Where is Patli?”

“My wife is currently helping my eldest daughter feed herself…” Coatzintli answered. Olga looked where the queen’s eyes were drawn, watching as the much smaller Naga helped Quetzalli reach food that was situated out of the reach of her tubby arms.

Olga began to pick at her abandoned tart. “So… what will happen to me?”

The queen sighed.
1113112211122112212112212221111211111.title: Homecoming Queen

choices: Olga didn't return alone, of course...
11131122111221122121122122211112111111.content:
And that was, as they say, the end of it—Olga's journey to the South had come to an end.

The main reason that Olga had been hired in the first place was in hopes of helping Her Majesty slim down. Coatlzintli had thought, all those seasons ago, that a chef of her talent would have been able to concoct a menu capable of at least stalling (if not halting and reversing) the weight gain that had plagued the corners of her mind back when she had merely been massive. Coming home at more than twice the size she had been when she left, seeing what damage that Olga's unchecked culinary appetites had wrought on her kingdom...

It was clear that if Coatlizintli had kept Olga around in any capacity as a chef, there would be no slimming down. Of course, now that she had lost the ability to feed herself autonomously, there was no chance of that happening anyway - not with Patli around.

No, keeping Olga in the Marshes would only do more harm than good - she'd already irreparably damaged the Naga culture by introducing strange new ideas. The class division between the Elite and the Townspeople meant that some women were so fat that they could barely slither around, while others were Dry Season slender - her people had become lazy and decadent, and consumed by a distinctly Human sort of obsession with more.

If Olga was allowed to stay in the Marshes, perhaps as a chef or a taverner, it would only delay the inevitable.

There were no hard feelings in the matter of the separation—but Olga was to leave the Kingdom as soon as was possible.

***


"It's so good to have you back with us, Olga."

Olga's arrival had meant a lot of publicity for the Bleakfrost Tavern—she'd become quite famous in the North for her pilgrimage to "culture" the Snakes of the South (or at least, that's how it had become framed over the course of her stay). Once it had become widespread that one of the best chefs in all of Adinah had returned to her rightul place behind the bar, customers came pouring in from across the land in hopes of getting to taste the "Steak that Saved the Snakes" or "Recipes fit for Royalty"... really, Olga didn't have any idea where it all came from.

The aplomb with which she had been welcomed back was a welcome surprise, and helped ease the feeling of despair that ached in her belly for all the weeks she had been on the road. When the envoy had dropped her off, Olga had never felt so low...

But to see all of these hungry smiles waiting for her with bells on back in her home of Racovania was enough to wipe away the ennui most days.

"Of course... you don't have to keep cooking every night." Somaria's dark face dimpled slightly at the cheeks now as Olga served her another bowl of stew, "We're the ones happy to have you back, dear!"

"I know, it's just—here, taste this—I'm so used to cooking for so many people, Ms. Somaria!"

"I really think that you've earned a—mmph!—break though."

"Nonsense—ooh, here, try this?"

As Somaria swallowed, her full stomach pressing hard against her apron as she sat squat on the bench seating at the firepit, a distinct sense of deja vu began to overwhelm her as Olga kept feeding her various bits and bites of whatever was in arm's reach...

Maybe there was some merit as to the reason why Her Majesty had sent Olga back...

"Mmmm~

But really... who was she to complain?
11131122111221122121122122211112111111.title: Ending the Tale of Olga (1)

111311221112211221211221222111121111111.content:
Helga hadn't managed to lose much weight during the duration of Olga's departure—she was still recognizable as the stout brown-haired barmaid that made floorboards creak and furniture groan whenever she settled down upon it.

The food that she was carrying was not for her; not long ago, perhaps it would have been. Helga had a well-known penchant for eating well into unbridled roundness, a habit that had taken quite some time to stall and had only been made possible by lack of Olga's talent in the kitchen. Now that it was back, there was certainly some danger to her former heft returning...

"Helgaaaa..."

Amoxtli's four fleshy arms strained in impotence as Helga lowered a thick slice of bacon into her own mouth. The four cinnamon brown sausages were so doughy and soft that they couldn't reach past their own arm wings, let alone contend with her decadent middle roll as it sagged and swelled between them. Her stomach hung low, pooling on the bed in front of her and groaned in confused agony, demanding both rest and more. Her fat face creased at the second and third chins, frowning on all accounts as she struggled to reach past her own immensity.

"Hufff...m'hungryyyyy..."

Her slitted eyes watched in petulant horror as the smaller woman nibbled freely on what had been promised to her! Her mouth hung agape, panting hotly as she wriggled and wobbled on the bed in hopes of repositioning herself closer towards the food. She had no such luck. Even her tail, grown to the width of several many trunks at its biggest, was too fat to use against Helga and her teasing ways.

"You're a spoiled one, aren't ya Pet?" Helga batted her eyelashes as she leaned back against Amoxtli's vast belly, "You see anyone with somethin' t'eat and you want it for yourself—what a greedy snake, y'are!"

Amoxtli panted and whined like a kitten, a far cry from the fierce and brave warrior that had once shared a bed with Helga. Her cheeks trembled and her eyes moist, she was absolutely distraught at the thought of not getting to eat dinner tonight... even though she knew full and well that Helga was just teasing her.

"M'not... hfff... m'not a pet..." she puffed, "I'm... the captain of the—"

"Aye, aye, I've heard it all before." Helga squeezed a handful of Amoxtli's ocean of brown belly, "Captain of the Leftover Commitee, that's what we oughtta call you."

Helga leaned forward, pressing herself against Amoxtli's exposed enormousness. She was soft to the touch, without an ounce of muscle on her after only some time as Olga's personal taste-tester. Naga physiology was so strange—but so delightful to explore. Not long ago, Amoxtli was a tight, muscular snake who cut an impressive figure in Coatlzintli's armor. Now... she looked more like the queen herself with every passing day!

"We've got a lot of work to do if we want to slim you down and make a proper barmaid outta you"

Amoxtli grumbled cutely; the prospect of missing even one meal was enough to bring her to petulant, welled eyes these days. The cold temperature had made her less active than ever, meaning that all she had effectively done since their arrival in Racovania was sit and eat in one of the rooms of the bar. Considering that she had arrived at a bed-busting size and weight... they had wisely moved her to the back room.

Much less attention that way, but strategically close to the kitchen.

"But... b-but..." she kneaded her stomach rolls with four clawed hands nervously. All those smells she'd be smelling all day, the food she'd see! The thought of dieting now, after so long of being able to eat whatever she want, made her want to cry! "H-Helga—"

"Well, no one stays in my inn for free." Helga cocked a thick brown eyebrow as she prepared a biscuit, "So it's either you slim down until y'can slither around my bar or..."

She popped the biscuit into Amoxtli's awaiting mouth.

"We'll find other ways of y'earnin' your keep around here."
111311221112211221211221222111121111111.title: Ending the Tale of Olga (2)
