Sure, she supposed her hips flared out just a little bit more than they should, and her ass perhaps pushed the line of too big, and certainly nothing about her could be described as fit or toned but compared to the state she was in last time she was in the North, she was practically svelte.

It was all thanks to the secret weapon she came in possession of in her travels, who as it happened just entered the room as she was ruminating.

The figure who arrived was a little shorter than Lavena, wearing robes of grey and a lacquered black wood mask covering their face. Lavena wasn't entirely sure where this man, introduced to her as a “blood sorcerer,” was from, nor did she particularly care. Fully loyal to whomever held his contract, she bought it from his previous employer and worked with him to develop a blood substitute for her. Able to fuel her vampiric body but without any of the euphoric feelings of feeding on actual blood, this artificial blood was unsatisfying, but it was precisely because of its tasteless nature Lavena could keep from overindulging.

“Mistress...” the figure began, his voice barely more than a whisper, “I am pleased to inform you that the additive to the cattle's food has fully taken hold in their blood.”

Lavena's full lips curled into a smile, exposing her fangs. Her plan pivoted around Orin making the women of her little mining town's blood as euphoric and addictive as possible (not to mention ordering all the women of the town, even those not marked as cattle, to eat ridiculous proportions of food at every meal, which had nothing at all to do with Lavena wanting to look thinner in comparison). Soon all those who mocked me will be more helpless than I was, gluttonous addicts craving stock only I posses.

And yet, as dreams of her revenge danced in her mind, another thought, insidiously quiet, sneaked into her brain, I wonder what it taste like...

11133311.content:
Lavena followed her sorcerer down the stairs to the basement of the modest manor home that served as her temporary residence. The underground space served as a laboratory for Orin and his apprentice, the latter of whom Lavena was delighted to notice was quickly trying to brush crumbs off her robes before anyone noticed. I exempt her from the eating regimen and she's still a greedy pig. What a lack of self control.

The vampire couldn't remember the apprentice's name, only that she was one of the few people in town who could actually read, and thus she had been the only choice really for assisting Orin. The blonde girl was short and little more than a twig when they first arrived, but looking at the belly stretching out her robes and straining against the sash tied around her waist, it was clear that she had taken to the limited luxury her position afford very nicely.

When Lavena noticed that Orin's apprentice was fatter than the cattle currently asleep on a bed in the corner of the room, she couldn't help but smile.

Orin followed Lavena's gaze to the sleeping woman, “She had her evening meal here as I tested her blood, she's simply sleeping it off.”

Lavena approached the woman, licking her lips in anticipation. It had been so, so long since she'd actually fed on a human, she deserved a treat. And of course, to make sure Orin and the Pig had done their job correctly. Slowly she bent down towards the woman's neck, baring her fangs You're in control now, you deserve this. What harm could one taste cause?

The second blood flowed from the woman's neck into her mouth, Lavena was shocked numb, unable to process just what she was tasting. Everything around her dissolved, every thought gone, lost entirely to the most intensely pleasurable experience she's ever had.

It was the vampire's own moaning that snapped Lavena back to herself; she just managed to pull herself away before killing the member of her stock.. Lavena barely felt like she could stay standing, her body pulsing with sensation. She opened her mouth to tell her sorcerer it worked, but all she managed was a whimper of residual euphoria.

Orin gently slipped his arm under the vampire's and guided her to a chair, “Ingrid, check on the cattle there please, make sure she is still comfortable.”

Ah, Ingrid, that's the Pig's name... Lavena thought slowly, coherent thought slowly returning to her.

“They are going to complete loose themselves...” she mumbled satisfied.

111333111.content:
“She requested .mph..what?” Ingrid asked through a bite of her...second (or maybe fourth) sweet roll. The 19 year old blonde didn't know quite how she felt about living under a vampire's rule, or training to become a “blood sorcerer.” It had its perks, but so much of it didn't necessarily feel... morally good. What she did know was that the past year in this position had been awful for her waistline.

“The Mistress has requested some of our additive be mixed into her meal tonight,” Orin said, leaning against the wall of the basement laboratory. If he was concerned about the request, between the mask and his whisper voice, Ingrid couldn't tell.

“Is... is that a good idea Orin? I mean, it was designed to be addictive, and I mean...surely you've heard the rumors of what made her leave the North over a decade ago?”

Orin lets out something Ingrid interpreted as a chuckle, “You speak too freely, apprentice. As far as we are concerned, the Mistress only has good ideas. Furthermore, be careful who you spread those rumors too, your position affords you some exemption when it comes to the Mistress's rules, but she will kill you if she hears you spreading them.”

Ingrid huffs in annoyance and a little fear, shoving the rest of her sweet roll into her mouth. I wasn't spreading rumors...She moves to one of the counters, concerned and slightly embarrassed that she had to press her robed belly against the counter a little to reach the back of it to grab the bowls to begin preparing the vampire's meal. She used to be so thin, before Lavena took over, but all the food she had access to was too good. Maybe I should be more concerned about my own indulgences than Lavena's...

________________________

Lavena paced her bed room, twitching her fingers, picking up little knickknacks she'd picked up over her years of travel, only to put them down without even looking. Where is Orin with my meal? Once she had recovered from tasting the enhanced blood the other day, things had returned to normal. She was pleased by how little she craved it, impressed with her self control and congratulating herself for reaching the point in her relationship with indulgence that she could have a little treat without risk.

She spent the majority of her time awake since that day thinking about how little she needed more, how good she was, and while sure it tasted...indescribably delightful, it wasn't calling to her; the fact it was odd that it was always on her mind didn't strike her as odd at all. For just how well she was handling it, she decided she deserved a little treat.

Finally, after what seemed like hours after requesting dinner, a knock came at the door, “Come in!” Lavena called out, perhaps more eager than she intended. Orin stepped into the room, holding out a plate with what looked like a loaf of bread soaked in blood. Lavena enjoyed consuming the blood substitute through mortal food, it was the only indulgence she allowed herself since switching to it... well other than now.

Lifting the bread in her hand, the vampire took a quick bite. The euphoria wasm't quite as strong as it was straight from a human, but it still elicited a soft moan from her lips, her eyelids fluttering as she ate more. Breathing becoming heavy, she kept shoving more and more of the soft bread into her mouth. In a record time, the loaf was gone and Lavena had sat down on her bed, her breasts heaving in her revealing dress as she breathed heavily, letting the sensations of the additive run through her. Its so... I just... I need... It takes Lavena a moment to figure out what she wants to say, and just before Orin can ask if she needs anything else, Lavena mumbles, voice husky, “Another... I need... another.”

1113331111.content:
“Phew...stupid stairs...” Ingrid mumbled as she placed one hand on her knee, bent over trying to catch her breath as the her other continued to hold the tray she had to carry up from the basement all the way to the second floor of the manor. She grimaced as she took a deep breath and her belly pressed tightly against the belt around the waist of her robes.

Today had been quite the annoying reminder that she was perhaps abusing her access to food a little too much. For awhile Ingrid's stomach had slapped against her thighs as she walked, it was seemingly the only part of her ever getting bigger. Her chest had always been rather modest, easily hidden by the grey robes she wore, and until now she thought her legs had remained relatively thin as well (she tried not to look down and be confronted with her gut as much as possible, and mirrors always were always to be avoided), but the chaffing along the inside of her thighs after her climb forced her to reevaluate that belief.

She also realized she had spent the entirety of the past week in her and Orin's basement laboratory. It had a bed, it had a tub, servants would bring down food with the other supplies, there was no reason to leave. It was because Orin was actually having her perform small feats of magic which were exhausting, and it had absolutely nothing to do with the fact that Ingrid hated stairs and always thought of some excuse or another not to go up them. (Okay, maybe if she thought about it, it had a little to do with her hatred of stairs, but after how winded the climb left her, she resolved to make sure to climb them at least once a day. She needed to do something to start trying to loose a little weight).

Having mostly caught her breath and hoping that her face wasn't quite as flushed from the climb as it felt, Ingrid picked up her tray, flipped her braid over her relatively thin shoulder, and approached the door to what served as Lavena Olingrad's “throne room.” With a sigh and a quick straightening of her robes, Ingrid knocked on the door.

“Come!” Lavena's thick, husky voice called out almost immediately. As she did every time she entered the room, Ingrid had to appreciate the effort that went into making what once served as the former mayor of the village's office into a proper vampiric chamber. Strange skulls of monsters and beasts Lavena encountered on her travels lined the walls, bordered by black and red tapestries, the floor its self mostly covered by an expensive black and gold rugs that Ingrid was never entirely sure she was suppose to actually walk on. A large fireplace provided most of the light to the room, though much of it was cast in shadows, including the wide throne made of bestial bones Lavena herself was currently occupying.

Slowly the vampire drew herself to her feet, and Ingrid's suspicions from the last time she saw her a week ago were confirmed, Her ass definitely takes up more space on that throne than it used to. I can't really judge 'anyone' for gaining weight but...who knew vampires even could? It wasn't much, but it was notable. Lavena's dresses were fitting just a tad tighter, her breasts overflowing their confines a little more than before. Her stomach was pressed tighter against the diamond cutout on the dress, causing it's new, light layer of pudge to jut out ever so slightly. The vampire's hips had always been a bit wider than average (even for her impressive height), but considering they looked proportionally the same as always, Ingrid figured they had expanded slightly as well.

“Ah, is my sorcerer too busy to answer my summons today?” The vampire asked, stalking slowly towards Ingrid, whom gulped involuntarily even if Lavena's tone was playful more than angry.

“No, Mistress! He...there was an incident at the mine... while you slept... it required magical attention to clear quickly... Orin hasn't been back yet.”

The vampire loomed in front of her, and Ingrid was reminded of the full nature of their height difference when she has to avert her gaze towards the floor or be staring directly at Lavena's impressive cleavage. “And not only that... this does not look like the normal bread I have my meals soaked in.”

Ingrid sputters, “Well... the cooks were just finishing feeding... feeding your livestock and they um, weren't prepared since this isn't a normal time... and well... all that was left that could easily absorb the artificial blood was... my dinner...:” Ingrid sheepishly held the tray up to Lavena, letting her get a closer look at the 7 sweet rolls stained dark. A moment of silence passed and Ingrid dared to look up, only to lock her blue eyes briefly with the vampire's deadly green. Was she...looking at my belly? Ingrid's face heated up with embarrassment, Of course she was you just admitted you were going to eat over half a dozen pastries for dinner! Not that she's any better, Gone are her days of of a single serving of bread and blood substitute being enough.

“And is this the... special prepared blood?” Lavena asked after letting Ingrid squirm for a few more seconds. Ingrid noticed that after about the fourth day of asking for the additive to be added to her meals (something Ingrid couldn't help but smile smugly about: calling Lavena becoming hooked on the stuff), the vampire had stopped referring to it with the same language she referred to it when she talked of her plans to make the other vampires in the region addicted to her cattle and fat... or something, it sounded a little silly to Ingrid but maybe when one was “so far beyond mortal concerns” like the vampires supposedly were, such dumbly petty plans were common place.

“Yeah. I mean, yes of course Mistress!” Ingrid said, Orin didn't care about her informality, but he always did remind her Lavena did.

The vampire took the tray from her hand and slowly stalked back towards her throne with it, calling out, “You're dismissed. Tell Orin to meet me as soon as he returns... and make sure you have the cooks make you a fresh batch of these for your own dinner.”

__________

Outside the sun might have been starting to rise on the mining village, but inside Lavena's bed chamber, she was just lying down to sleep, body still ecstatically sensitive to the touch thanks to her specially prepared meal. It was just a little indulgence, one the vampire felt she deserved every now and then for how good she was the rest of the time. She had switched out of her dress into a long, loose night gown a matching shade of red as her hair, which now hung free down her back.

Lavena rubbed her stomach slowly, trying to ease the delightful pain of her evening meal and sooth the strange irretation her dress had stared to cause, for some reason it seemed like it rubbed her skin a little bit harder than normal around where it showed off her navel, but the silk texture of her nightgown was helping to relieve it.

Maybe I will have all my meals in sweet rolls from now on... or perhaps other pastries... The rubbing picked up pace as she thought about her next meal, a soft, genuine moan of want escaping her lips. I can't believe the Pig was going to eat all those for dinner... she'd enjoy being cattle a great deal I bet, Lavena thought, the hypocrisy of the fact she ate what she was criticizing Ingrid for planning to eat missing her completely.

Something about the artificial blood... or maybe the special preparation, made it so she could taste the sugar of the pastries, a taste she really had no reason of ever seeking out in the decades since being turned into a creature of the night. Now that she had it again, the thought of having more was appealing indeed. As an immortal creature, what could a sweet now and then really hurt?

11133311111.content:
Inside her small hut on the edge of the mining village, Astrid sighed as she heard the summoning bell ring from the village square. Life since Lavena Olingrad had taken over their town had been...strange, and the woman had some questions. With her husband currently incapacitated from an incident at the mine, he couldn't hold her back from trying to get some answers this time.

Somethings made sense of course; their vampiric overlord demanding a castle be built overlooking the village was what Astrid would expect, same with some of the women in the town being selected as cattle. As far as all the rumors around the town went though, the cattle were not fed upon... merely kept fat and happy in a temporary residence near the manor home Lavena used while her castle was constructed. Not only that, there was that bizarre order that all the women in the town needed to eat enough for three people. The vampire provided said food, money from the mines coupled with her own apparent personal fortune meant much more food than the village's population could reasonably need was brought in regularly as shipments from the mines were taken out.

Astrid did her best to avoid the clearly intended weight gain, splitting the food between her and her husband kept the inevitable rise in size slower than most of her peers, while her husband's mine work kept the effects at bay for him. In the early days, after her sister Ingrid had gotten employed in the manor (a position that she was always vague about), Astrid pawned most the extra food off on her when she would visit. Those visits were less and less now, in fact she hadn't seen her 'little' sister in three weeks. Astrid wasn't concerned though, the past few visit Ingrid had been sweaty and complaining about the quarter mile walk from the manor to Astrid's home, Astrid had no doubts Ingrid was fine, just lazy and not feeling up to the walk anymore.

Slipping on some furs to protect against the night cold, Astrid slipped out to answer the summons.
___________

Illuminated by the low hanging moon, Lavena Olingrad idly brushed a few leftover crumbs from her snack off the voluminous black fur coat she wore tied closed around her. It wasn't to protect against the cold, she had little concern over something as mundane as that. No, it served a much more important purpose.

One of her servants had ruined ruined her dresses.

Lavena had noticed they were getting tight the past few weeks, something her maid suggested might be because it had been exceptionally cold recently and the house staff weren't taking proper care to avoid shrinking the rich fabric. The vampire didn't remember such procedures being necessary for all the time she was in the North before leaving 15 years ago, but her servants must had been more capable back then. Her maid had insisted she would take care of the issue, but her dress splitting up the side and in the back while she ate that evening was indisputable proof that the issue hadn't been dealt with at all.

Lavena had been furious, her immediate thought being to drain her maid and the rest of the staff dry. She manged to keep from acting on said impulse, conceding to herself that doing so might not be very in control of her. When her blood sorcerer suggested leaving dealing with the staff up to him instead, she agreed. No need for her to waste her time on such a minor incident.

So to take her mind off things, Lavena decided to check in on her humans, among whom no doubt a few were having clothing mishaps of their own. A servant placed a chair on top of the small wooden platform built in the village square so Lavena could stand above the crowd when they gathered (not that she didn't already do that with her height). As she sat to wait for the village to gather, she frowned as her hips had some friction with the chairs arms, and how her ass forced her to set forward slightly. Lavena knew she was hippy, and that her ass was perhaps on the large side of normal, but this chair was ridiculous, Leave it to these idiots to find the North's tiniest chair, a waif would feel confined in this!

The gathering herd of humans instantly made her feel better. The women of the town were looking down right stuffed. Tight dresses, furs unable to be tied closed over jutting bellies, even some torn sleeves from upper arms swollen larger with fat than the muscled arms the men who worked the mines. Those women who lived further down in the village had sweaty foreheads and reddened cheeks despite the below freezing temperatures as they slowly made their way into the square. To Lavena's delight, one woman was brought in a cart pulled by her husband (the mine's foreman), and yet after pulling her and helping her down, she was the one short of breath and grumbling about being tired. Yes... this chair might be tight, but I am the only woman in miles who could possibly sit in it.

“It is wonderful to see my beautiful subjects again...” Lavena called out to the crowd once most had gathered. Her husky voice with its slight rasp carried easily in the cold night air, “I am pleased to see you all looking so positively healthy this night.” She did genuinely have a soft spot for humans, the same way one might have a soft spot for pigs and keep a few as pets while still eating pork. Those who became the chosen cattle of Nobles tended to end up enjoying the lifestyle, and if she could let all the women in her town experiences that, well, it practically warmed her cold, dead heart. She would have extended it to the men too even, but, well, someone still had to work the mines.

Lying in her chair, Quixee was munching on a small strawberry as she was beginning to wake up for the morning. Since her body was only a few inches in height, she usually considered a berry to be a good meal for the morning, and she needed to be well-fed, since today was going to be the first day of her study on Harpies for her village.

As she continued to eat, the little fairy continued to practice her human words, so that she could better understand the harpies. While most fairies preferred to just use their own language, Quixee wanted to be able to converse with the other races on the planet, so that she could better study their personalities and behaviors. Finishing the last of the strawberry, Quixee rubbed her stuffed belly, before beginning to fly north, to where she could finally reach the lands that the harpies call home.

"Ok, so this map says that they're halfway up this mountain, so it shouldn't be that hard to fly up there." While Quixee continued to fly upwards the mountain, in hopes that she would eventually reach the harpy village, she noticed that it was getting a lot colder than she was used to, probably due to the land around her starting to snow. Looking for the closest tree, Quixee used a leaf to make a makeshift cloak for herself, so that she could handle the colder climate for now.

Eventually, after hours of flying, Quixee could see a house, and as she flew by it she could see a fat harpy, gorging herself with meat, through the window. Knocking on the door, Quixee waited for the harpy to come before saying "Hey, excuse me, but I would like to ask if this is the harpy village that's on this mountain?"

"Huh? Oh wait there you are. Didn't expect to see a small little fairy this far north." As the harpy was talking, she continued to munch on a big roast pork, which she held by her hands. "Yeah, you are pretty close to that place, but you don't really wanna stay there during the night. I mean, I could barely notice you, and they may not notice you at all, or even accidentally crush you."

"But then where should I stay?" Quixee quickly asked. "If I stay out here for the night, I'll freeze to death!"

"Relax, you can stay here for the night. I'm pretty stocked up with food, so you should be okay for at least a single day of staying here. Name's Nicole."

"Really? Thanks for your generosity." As Nicole held open the door for Quixee to enter, the fairy could quickly smell that there was a large variety of foods littered all around the place, some of them on plate while others were just lying on the ground. While Quixee mostly didn't mind about ground food, she could tell that some of the foods littered around were beginning to form mold, which probably meant that it was spoiled.

Before she could look around anymore, Quixee was quickly interrupted by Nicole, who insisted that she try a bit of the food since she was going to be staying for now. Grabbing a meatball, Nicole quickly shoved a small part of the meat into the fairy's mouth, which at her size, was around as big as her mouth could hold. As she swallowed the meat, Quixee was overcome with a strong, and pleasant taste.

"Hey, this isn't half bad!" Quixee exclaimed, after taking another bite from the meatball that Nicole was feeding her.

"Yeah, I found and cooked all these meats that you see around you. Sometimes I eat them, and sometimes I let them rot on the floor to attract more meaty animals, like pigs or cows." The two continued to talk through the night, and as Quixee continued to gorge herself on meat, she thought that it was gonna be a good time to stay with this harpy while she studied them.

Astica wasn't ready for this at all. In fact, if it was up to her, she knew she would never be ready, and would rather avoid the whole thing all together.

She understood the practical purposes of such an odd practice. It was cold up in the tundra, to be sure. Plus, they didn't give her all that much range of motion when she went hunting with her older brothers. Still, this was no better, as she knew after this, she would be doing very little moving at all.

But, what never made sense to her was how much the other women in the village seemed to enjoy it, almost like they were brainwashed into believing this was truly something the gods wanted. Astica didn't think the gods would find this appealing at all.

Among all the traditions of the northmen, one thing remained constant: the need to keep warm. Men often beefed themselves up into strong, muscular beings with a layer of fat to keep warm. Women in the northern villages did something far more drastic.

It had become ritual by now, an important sacred ceremony any woman underwent before being married. Young women entered the great hut in the center of the village, only to come out obese, blubbery creatures, provided they could still walk upon leaving the hut.

Originally, the extra weight was solely for the purpose of staying warm. None of these women ever had to wear furs because their body heat stayed pretty well maintained under all the blubber. However, in recent years, it had taken on new meaning. Now, it was considered a mark of beauty for a woman to be enormous, round, and plushy. Now, any many desired only the fattest women for their wives.

Astica was now at the age where she was expected to undergo the ritual, and she hated every second of it. She wanted to be like her brothers: strong, proud hunters and warriors. She wanted to run free and live by her own rules, not bound to a home to be some fat, breeding sow for some hairy boar of a husband.

Yet, here she was, standing before the wood hut, watching the smoke waft from the opening in the roof, wondering what sort of fate awaited her.

"You know you'll do fine," Batolir, one of her brothers said.

She sighed. "It's not that I'm worried about. I just don't want to do it. Why can't I be like you and Kluendr and just be myself?"

The tall northman looked down at his sister. "It's tradition, Astica. You know that."

"Would you put yourself through that kind of a process?"

"Well, no, but..."

"Then you understand how I must feel."

He sighed and tried to reason with her. "Look, no one said you have to get all that big. You just have to live there for the next two years, and whatever size you leave at is what you get. Just don't come crying to me when no man will take you."

She stuck her tongue out at him. "Like I'd want a man like that anyway," she said.

He rolled his eyes. "You are as stubborn as an old yak sometimes, you know that?"

She smiled proudly at that. "Why thank you," she said with a little bow.

"Just behave," he said. He began to walk away before turning back to his sister. "I'll miss you. And I will come back to see you in two years."

Astica only waved back, swallowing hard. So this was really happening to her. There was no backing out, no making excuses, nothing standing in her way of this anymore. She sucked in a deep breath before entering the hut.

Inside, it was incredibly toasty and warm. She looked ahead of her and saw a long pit full of hot coals, which was helping to keep the place warm. Long tables lined the hall. They were almost as big as those found in the chief's great halls, she thought. She wondered just how many women came here at a time.

At the far end of the hall sat one of the biggest women Astica had ever seen in her entire life. She had her dark hair done up in a bun to keep it out of her eyes, and her skin was covered in various blue tattoos. It must've taken a lot of ink to cover a woman of her size.

She was a mountain of flab, from her round flushed face with multiple chins, to her chubby toes on feet that looked like they had never walked in years. Most dominating of all were the rolls and rolls of her round belly cascading over her wide dimpled hips, surrounded by her jiggling, wobbly arms. She was fanning herself with her flabby palm, clearly far too warm from the heat in the room. But, all the same, she maintained her composure. She looked the picture of elegance.

Astica approached her cautiously, not sure what to expect. The woman noted her presence and began to speak. "Ah, yes, I was told a new one would be arriving. I am Olahvir, the fattening hut matron. Welcome." She gave an honest smile to the young woman. "For the next two years, you shall live here, eating and learning the ways of being a northman's wife. You shall find this life both easy and challenging at the same time. So long as you put in effort, you will see results, and you will find this experience pleasant. Now, to begin..."
11411.title: Astica

choices: Astica manages to keep her weight somewhat under control.
Astica cannot control her weight!
Astica has mixed results, becoming both fat and strong.
114112.content:
A welcome feast… of course. What else should Astica have expected of such a place; the villages traditions clearly sought to make a fat pig of her as soon as possible.

Spread in front of her were all sorts of dishes, mostly meats and large vegetables. The table was low to the ground, easily within the obese woman’s reach, though she did not touch a crumb.

Deciding that she had mouthed off enough for one day (this old hag was getting a mouthful the following morning that was for sure), Astica sat down obediently… for now.

The food was not what the brunette had expected, there was no fatty richness or sweet butters here, the food was heavy and sat in her stomach like a lead weight. It filled Astica up quickly as well, prompting quiet tut-tuts from the older woman with disapproval. Never one to fear a challenge, Astica would pick up the pace each time. This food was heavy, not fatty, she could eat plenty of this and not put on the kind of weight her new tent-buddy had swaddled around her.

Eventually Astica had eaten all she could, most of the plates were close to empty, but their contents were obvious to see in their new home. Astica’s belly had domed like a woman with child, her tough girl-abs bent and warped into a more well-rounded shape.

“Very well done.” Olahvir commented, “You showed more promise than I initially thought. Now we shall retire for the night, the light has gone and we have much work tomorrow…” The matron then pointed to a part of the tent that was covered by a set of drapes, indicating where Astica would sleep.

Astica huffed as she pushed herself upright, her balance slightly offset by her food-baby. Waddling awkwardly, the defiant young woman picked up her things and dragged them off to her quarters.

The hut had looked rustic on the outside, but the insides had all the comforts of a typical Norse home. Well-constructed wooden walls that reached high into the air, windows situated at the very top of said walls to keep the biting wind away from the occupant, and wooden beds covered in multiple furs.

With little else to do that night, Astica set her belongings in the corner (of which most consisted of various hunting weapons and a few changes of clothes), and got into bed. As she lay there, her hands ran up and down the bump in her middle and she pondered. Astica knew what parts of an animal made someone fat, she had done enough hunting with her father and brothers to know what’s what… so why was tonight’s meal so thick and heavy? They weren’t going to make a whale out of her that way. At least not quickly, and she could easily burn off small amounts of blubber she would acquire through exercise in her quarters while the old woman wasn’t watching.

Yeah, looked like things were going to go her way here…


***


The next day was the same as the previous night. Astica ate heavy low-fat meals for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The matron didn’t seem to mind what she did either, so long as she remained inside the hut. The dark-haired girl had no desire to talk to this purveyor of archaic ideas, so entertained herself throughout the day. Exploring the hut, making carvings with her favorite hunting knife, and practicing her archery and axe-throwing skills.

The next day was pretty much the same, and the next and the next. For several weeks in fact the routine was pretty much the same, heavy meals regularly and with no snacking in between. With Astica sneakily exercising every night to burn anything off.

After a month though, there was finally a change.

Dressing in her leather skirt and fur-edged cuirass Astica left her quarters to not be greeted with the usual meats and vegetables.

“Where’s breakfast?” Astica asked.

“Oh so she speaks? Here I thought I was teaching a mute.” Olahvir commented with a wry smile. “No we are done with the first part of your training, you are now to get your tattoos today, a sign of adulthood in a woman.

That still didn’t really answer why there was no food, but Astica shrugged, the less this crone concentrated on trying to turn her into a fat blob with mobility of a walrus on the beachside the better.

“Sit.” Olahvir commanded, patting a patch of fur rug in front of her and reaching for another rolled-up scrap of fur.

As Astica approached, the older woman unfurled the fur to reveal many tools, clearly for marking her with Nordic runes.

“Would you like blue or black?”


***


A few hours, and many painful pinpricks later, Astica had been fully inducted as a Norse woman. Resplendent with an electric-blue tattoo ringing her neck, another around her right bicep and a third on her left thigh. She quite liked them, they added a splash of color to her usually brown-haired and light-skinned look. The Norse woman flexed her bicep, watching the blue lines shrink then thicken as she moved her arm.

Sure they looked to the rest of the world as just zig-zags, but she liked them. Perhaps this silly hut wasn’t all bad?

*Grrrooooooo*

“Ah!” Astica screamed, doubling over, the pain was unbelievable! It was like her stomach had been hit by a spear! She pressed her arms around her stomach to sooth it, and a rumbling came from within like a thunderstorm. Thankfully the rumbling died down, long enough for her to get a sentence out. “What was that!?” Astica asked, more a rhetorical question than anything.

“It was the fruit of our labors.” Olahvir replied, rising for her feet and waddling away to a room at the back of the hut. Eventually she returned with a wooden tray, piled high with food. Astica didn’t ask first, she just dived in.

Her stomach felt like it was eating itself it was so hungry, gurgling like a ravenous animal until the first morsel dropped into the angry pit. Astica barely registered what she was grabbing, so long as it was edible, she ate it.

Eventually the food ran out, and her stomach began to calm down. By then, her caretaker had returned with another wooden tray overloaded with food. Still hungry, Astica began picking at it, glaring at Olahvir as she did.

This food was different, comprised mostly of sweet meats and treats. Astica had never had much taste for the latter, but she knew about the meat, fatty stuff that had always been removed to save for her rotund mother’s plate.

“I can see in your eyes that you have questions.” Olahvir continued. “The first part of a woman’s stay here is to change her, to make her body more suited to her new size. You must not just look like a fat wife, you must be a fat wife from the inside out.”

“In common tongue.” Astica snapped between bites, tired of the woman’s ramblings.

Olahvir’s nose curled distastefully. “We had to stretch your stomach, get you used to big meals, and make you hungry enough that eating all day will become normal. Even with just twenty-three months of your stay left, you should easily re-emerge five times your current size.”

Astica’s brown eyes went wide. Olahvir had changed her body drastically, and possibly permanently. Her mind whirled and her eating slowed (met with a gurgling of her now-demanding stomach). There had to be something she could do, she would up her exercise, do it at every spare moment away from this crazy woman. There was no way she was going to be turned into someone’s fat housewife!
114112.title: A Warm Welcome

choices: A deer! Jackpot!
A person. Shoo! Go away!
A cow...? What's that doing here?
1141122.content:
She hated, this she absolutely hated this. After a month of arrogantly thinking that she could somehow negate or escape the effects of this “fattening hut” Astica found herself now unable to control herself. Her appetite was out of control, and her weight was out of control.

Ever since she had got her tattoos, the food in the hut had switched from oversized and heavy to rich and fattening. Food that barely would have filled Astica before she came here, and now barely felt like snacks. Not to mention, the blasted matron kept food everywhere now. Instead of strict meals, Astica was tempted to eat all day, never feeling full, but constantly being well fed; and it was having a serious effect.

Astica was getting fat; the once strong and lithe woman had really filled out. Most of her new excess weight was stored in her stomach and thighs. Her firm girl-abs had been replaced with a large round stomach that sagged over her lap and ringed her skirts with thick lovehandles. Her thighs meanwhile were colossal, still strong as redwood trees, but now trying to mirror them in thickness. They were still somewhat firm, but were just so cumbersome. The rest of her hadn’t shied away from excess fat as well; her breasts were bigger, her calves looked like they were merging with her ankles, and her arms were even bigger than ever.

The ballooning Norse woman had always had big arms, but that was due to the musculature she had built up carrying game back home. Thankfully she could still see her large proud biceps, triceps and deltoids, but they had been coated in a layer of insulating blubber. Overall, Astica looked less like her old self, but not like the round sows that women leaving the hut normally looked like, instead she looked like a Norseman, but with breasts and a pretty face.

But Astica was not happy about it, each day her exercises grew shorter and shorter, as her increasing size cut into her stamina like a knife. Eventually she wouldn’t be able to fight back at all, and would succumb to the same fate as all other woman in her village.

That time didn’t feel all that far away either. Astica had put on weight so quickly, it felt like witchcraft (she wouldn’t put it past the old woman). She needed to do something, and quickly.


***

The next evening, after a day of trying (and failing) to stop herself snacking the daylight away, Astica returned to her living quarters. But instead of settling into her bed to sleep, Astica sat on her bed, hearing the wooden frame creak a little under her bulk. Then she waited; heard Olahvir plod her way to her own room, heard the older woman’s bed creak as well, and then listened carefully for the tell-tale sounds of her snoring.

*Zzzzz*

This was it.

Packing her things, Astica tightened the drawstring of her bag, threw it over her shoulder and tip-toed for the door. Her larger size made her feel ever so cumbersome, but there were no falls or mishaps. Her weight did not creak the floor, and the door was silent as she opened it and slunk out into the night.

Despite her new insulation, the fell North wind bit like a viper. It didn’t help that Astica had stubbornly refused a change of outfit, preferring to wear her hand-made fur garments until they split. This left her looking as well dressed for the snow as a courtesan for pitched battle.

Astica couldn’t go home, in fact she couldn’t stay in the village at all, she would be ostracized for not going through with the ritual. There was only one option, to flee South and strike up a new life. Leaving her family behind, tears trickled down her round cheeks, freezing the moment they dropped from her skin.

The bulky woman thankfully knew her way around the hunting grounds of the northlands pretty well, even in the dark. Her sense of direction would take her where she wanted to go.

There was no need to hide her tracks in the snow; once she hit the more open tundra the snow would dissipate and give way to frozen-solid earth. There would be no way even her girthy form would be able to make bootprints in that.

For several days Astica travelled South, out of the snowy forests into the wide tundra, all the while sustaining herself on food she had stowed away from the old woman’s hut. Thankfully the icy temperature kept it from going off.

As Astica reached denser forests again, lined with tall deciduous trees, she had a problem. It seemed that she had vastly underestimated her increased appetite, and food supplies that she had estimated would last a month had been used up within a week. While Astica would have loved to use being out in the wild as an opportunity to drop this weight, that would have to come later. She was already tired from all her walking and running, so stomach pains were not on her to-do list.

The Norse woman was not familiar with the berries that hung from the low branches, and was sure that some were poisonous. Plus, she was from the North, and northerners were hunters!

Removing her bow from the drawstring bag, Astica began to lay out a trap. She started by gathering as many of the berries that she could reach, delicately plucking them with her plump fingers so as not to burst them. And then laid a pile of them out in a clearing. Next step was to find somewhere to hide.

Normally this would have been easy, when she was a sly slip of a thing. But feeling and looking like a boulder with arms and legs, Astica struggled with finding a spot. Eventually she found a bush large enough to hide her bulk in; it was a bit further than she liked from the trap, but so be it. It was down-wind of the trap, and she could make out the top of the clearing at least, it would have to do.

Now came the hard part, waiting on an empty stomach. For a while Astica thought that the sounds of her growling stomach would drive away every living thing for miles. But as she started to give up hope, there was a sound that made her ears prick up.

A branch breaking, something of a decent size had approached. Looking at the clearing, her eyes locked in a predatory glare, Astica saw a…
1141122.title: Blubber-Coated-Muscle

choices: "I will still require milk... let's see how much you can provide."
"How would you like to feel like a farm animal?"
"I have something very appropriate in mind..."
11411223.content:
Wandering into the clearing was a large fat cow. Its fur was a dusty chocolate brown in color, lighter on the bell and down the nose, curled horns that rose up from her head, with a big bloated udder wobbling betwixt their hind legs.

Sniffing the air a little, the cow wandered over to the berries and began to sniff them too. Astica couldn’t tell if the beast could smell if they were poisonous or not, either way it wouldn’t stay still for long.

Notching an arrow to her bow, Astica pulled back and thought to herself, “Not your day…”

*Thud*


***


The fire should have kept away most predators, so Astica allowed herself a brief moment to relax as she ate her meal. She had learned long ago how to make fire with little more than a pair of sticks, so well-done beef was on the menu tonight.

It was still taking a while to get used to her new appetite. She had subconsciously eaten way more of her kill than she thought, and what remained had to last her until she could find civilisation. But Astica would be encountering familiarity sooner than she imagined…

As the heavyset woman indulged, a snap pricked her ears up; someone was approaching. Astica slid her fingers over to her hunting bow, pulling it closer.

“Well well… what do we have here?”

The voice was soft and feminine, and its owner just the same. Astica watched a tall lithe woman emerge from the undergrowth, and approach. She was dressed very oddly; a long single dress covered most of her figure, with a low cut going all the way to her navel and just barely covering the middle of each breast, while a long piece of fabric tied up the dress at her slim waist. A necklace of small bones hung from her neck, the central being a bird’s skull, but the rest were unidentifiable.

She wore nothing more though, not even a set of shoes. Her bare feet touching the ground… but something was off. With each stride the grass seemed to almost bend away from her before she even took a step on it.

“I could ask you the same…” Astica replied to the woman, keeping one hand to her bow.

“Well if you have to do that, then you clearly are not from around here…” The woman replied. She had an expression like a hungry wolf, and it worried the north-woman.

“And where is here exactly?” Astica asked.

The woman paced back and forth, her eyes never leaving Astica for a second. “I call this place home, but to others this is the Bristleback Woods, just on the edge of Racovania, the North and Grobland.” She then raised her hand in the air, catching a falling leaf. “Such a wonderous place, so rich with magic… but you haven’t answered my question…” The woman’s voice became cold and icy before she uttered her next sentence, “and why have you killed my cow?”

Astica’s blood ran as cold as the snow from her homeland. “I was starving…” She answered, gesturing to her empty bag.

The woman laughed. It was a horrible uncomfortable laugh that would give nobody pleasure to hear it. “Hohoho! You? Starving? A likely story; you are nearly as fat as my cow was!”

“I don’t normally look like this!” Astica fired back, grabbing a handful of flab and shaking it to illustrate her point.

Her accuser though didn’t buy it. “Are you trying to say you are cursed? My child I sense no ill magic upon you, trust me…” The woman’s gaze darkened and the air seemed to chill.

Astica wanted to flee, but the woman was too quick. Raising one hand, roots erupted from the ground and held Astica’s feet fast. “Going somewhere my dear?” She sneered.

The Norse woman’s heart was beating a mile a minute; “What are you?!”

“I am a witch.” The woman replied bluntly, tossing a lock of long black hair over her shoulder with her free hand, as the other remained raised to hold the vines still. “I used to be a druid, but left their circle to study magic in the world. I set up a cottage here and the locals began to come to me to for cures, sage advice, all those sorts of things I could provide that was beyond a simple peasant's understanding. Meanwhile I can study magic in this quite fascinating area in peace. My cow supplied me with milk, and occasionally ingredients… but now you took her from me, without my permission.” The witches’ eyes narrowed again and she strode closer; “so what price shall you pay for stealing from me?”
11411223.title: No such thing as a free meal

choices: Astica wakes up in a warm comfy bed.
Astica wakes up on the floor of a log cabin, filled with a grisly decor.
Astica wakes up where she was knocked out, at the bottom of the cliff.
114112233.content:
“I have something very appropriate in mind for you my fat cow thief…” The witch remarked, her stern glare sliding into a cruel sneer; and before Astica could even raise her bow to defend herself, the witch moved her arms around, a black aura encircling the tips of her fingers before firing into Astica.

The fat girl was knocked onto her back by the blow, the wind taken right out of her.

But Astica was made of sterner stuff, and with only a second of her vision swimming and she was back into the fight. Getting up was not so easy however, her more roly-poly build forced the Nordic lass to kinda roll sideways and heave herself up, bending at the middle was not an option.

Snatching her bow up as got to her feet, Astica turned towards the witch. However, things had taken a turn…

The witch was now levitating! Or rather it looked like it, what had happened was that a large root had picked her up as a kind-of platform, and more roots were ripping themselves out of the undergrowth to her side.

Astica’s fight or flight instincts had kicked in… and swiftly shifted gears.

Branches and twigs snapped as Astica’s bulky body hurtled through the forest, running directly away from her pursuer. Occasionally she swore that a vine out of the corner of her eye tried to grab her, and so Astica kept running.

But her body was betraying her, strong as the young woman was, she was very heavy. Now more resembling a wrestler who had gone to seed, rather than a lithe hunter, there was no way Astica could keep up that pace forever.

Astica lumbered into another clearing, sweat coating her fat body like the film over a newt. Her strong hands clapped her knees as she doubled over, wheezing to catch her breath. But as she tried to gather her strength back, Astica spotted something.

As her gaze was turned towards the ground, her vision was filled with her big belly and fattened cleavage. It was then that she spotted a hair on one of her breasts, light brown and much longer than any hair should be. Astica had never worried about waxing, she had never been a hairy woman. But now wasn’t the time to worry about appearances… or was it?

Another hair caught her eye, then another and another. As Astica stared, little brown hairs began to appear like crazy, sprouting from her pallid Northern skin. They coated her breasts like a carpet, before her eyes spotted them racing across her belly as well.

In shock the brunette pulled her hands from her knees to feel the hair, check if it was even real, but something was going on there as well. Her fingernails were growing dull, turning dark gray. Not only that, but her little finger was shrinking until it vanished into her hand! Not to mention that weird hair was growing on her arms now, creeping across the back of her hands but leaving her palms bare.

“What’s happening to me!?” Astica screamed into the woodland air.

“Isn’t it obvious?” A sultry voice answered.

Astica turned around, distracted from her predicament, to see the witch approaching. Quite lazily as well; still smirking, she was clearly enjoying this.

“It’s a curse dear.” The witch continued. “You killed my cow, so I’m making you my replacement… such a shame it began before I could take a look. Never used this curse before, wanted to study it in detail.”

“Replacement!? Curse!?” Astica spat, gripping her sides as a powerful pain gripped her body. The forest seemed to grow a bit smaller in Astica’s eyes, but it was actually the reverse, she was getting bigger. Her body enlarging slightly, giving her extra inches in every direction, and tightening her fur clothes around her like a vice.

If Astica hadn’t already figured out what the curse was doing to her, then she was about to get the clearest sign.

Pain gripped her head, as Astica saw her nose press into her field of vision, then start to widen into more of a square shape. All the while her nasal passage grew shiny and moist, leaving her with a stout muzzle. Up top, a pair of dark gray horns emerged from her head of dark-brown hair, curling into more of a yoke shape before stopping at about six inches in length each. Her ears seemed happy to join them elongating out and running part of the length of the horns as they became more diamond-shaped.

Behind Astica, she could feel something slapping the back of her legs, signalling that her spine had elongated into a tail. Thick hair sprouted at the tip, matching the colour of the hair on her head.

Then her boots, already straining under her increased size, erupted. The leather rupturing completely as a pair of gray/black hooves emerged, leaving Astica with just the leather and fur straps covering her calves left. But the strangest sensation yet was about to happen…

Astica felt a weird presence in front of her tunic. It was like her tubby belly was growing a lump, a very sensitive lump. The Nordic woman couldn’t see what was going on, but the sensitivity of this new organ was all too familiar; normally she would have called it a breast… but in her current condition she knew it to be a fat udder.

Meanwhile the witch seemed to be having the time of her life. “Haha! Oh my, dear you look such a mess… well don’t worry, we will have you munching grass on all fours in no time…”

It was then that Astica noticed that the witch seemed to still be controlling the curse. Her hand that originally cast the spell was outstretched and moving, like a puppeteer. She had to do something, or else the rest of her life would be spent as some fat farm animal having her tits yanked by this horrible hag!

Astica was still in pain, but she could still double over. Leaning forward, the brunette took off like a rocket, her new hooves granting her superb purchase on the dry woodland ground; aiming for horns directly at the witch.

Either the witch was not as fast as she thought, she had overestimated Astica’s state or she had gotten too close. Either way, she found herself with two spikes slamming straight into her stomach, propelled by over four hundred pounds of force.

The witch flew backwards, hit a tree and fell into a crumpled heap.

Astica the now cow-woman was shocked, she had no idea she had that kind of strength. She was also no longer in pain, so clearly the curse had stopped progressing. But one look at her malformed hands indicated that it wasn’t reversing any time soon. Before Astica could contemplated her situation any further though, she decided to make sure her foe had been dealt with.

The witch was lying on her side, hair covering her face, and a growing red stain in the middle of her dress. Was she dead or just knocked out?

Clearly neither, as Astica saw the fingers on one of the witch’s hands start to twitch. The transformed woman didn’t really want to go another round, she might not be nice enough to turn Astica into just a cow if given the chance, Astica decided to use the free moments she had and tried to flee again.

As Astica crashed through the undergrowth once more, she had a much easier time of it. Her increased size had come with more muscle and stronger bones. She felt like a mammoth from her tundra homeland, easily smashing apart anything in her way.

Eventually stronger light broke through the canopy, signalling to Astica that she was nearing the edge of the woods. Hopefully there would be farmers or some of human habitation, anywhere she could hide.

Spurred on by the thought of safety, Astica increased her speed, running at full tilt towards the light and freedom.

Blinding light obscured Astica’s vision for a moment as the darkness of the woods peeled away, revealing not rolling farmland… but a cliff edge!

Astica tried to stop, but she had gathered too much momentum. She dug her hooves in, but still her heavy body had too much force. She reached the edge of the cliff, stumbled and felt the ground buckle beneath her.

From there Astica could barely see what was going on. Her world span in front of her eyes as she tumbled down the steep cliff. Before finally coming to a sudden stop as she hit a fallen log; there was a blinding pain in her right leg before she lost consciousness.
114112233.title: The Witch's Curse

choices: A long-haired Harpy.
A very overwight Siren.
A red-headed Satyr.
A rather chipper dwarf.
A very skinny Orc.
1141122331.content:
“Hey she’s coming round!”

“Quiet honey, she’s been through a lot.”

The voices thumped through Astica’s head as if they were the beating of a drum in her ear. As her eyes opened, her vison was swimming and blurry, nothing made sense. She remembered a cow… a cliff… some woods… the witch!

Astica tried her best to move, swinging her arms around, when a pair of soft hands landed on her shoulders.

“It’s ok dear, you’re safe.”

The words comforted the Norse woman, they were soft and motherly, drawing back memories of the family she had left behind.

Eventually her vision started to clear up, and she could take stock of her surroundings.

The half-awake girl was not resting at the bottom of a ravine where she last was conscious, but instead was inside a wooden room. There were cabinets and drawers around, with small charming carved dolls resting on top. Small paintings dotted the wall, lit by the dappled light that shone through the window.

“Feeling a little better there?”

Astica was caught off-guard as the voice spoke again. Next to her bed, sitting on a stool, was a woman. She had long silvery-blonde hair, slightly ruddy skin from a life of toil, was just past middle age and her figure was rather stout and plump. For sure this was not the witch that had pursued Astica so doggedly.

“Do you talk?” The woman asked, leaning in with a warm smile. “We don’t get minotaurs up here, do you speak common?” Minotaur? What did she mean?

The resting woman moved one of her hands, and saw the brown fur covering her skin, and the tough callused fingernails.

“Uuuuuh… yes… I do…” Astica answered slowly, before raising her own question to the mystery woman. “Wh… where am I?”

Not breaking her warm smile, she answered. “You’re in the Gilded Dragon, part tavern part hostel, it’s also my home. We run this place to help weary travellers.”

“We?”

“Yes, me and my daughter, plus we have some more staff here.” The woman could read on Astica’s face that she was still uneasy. “Don’t worry, you can stay here free of charge, especially after what happened.”

“What happen… *ARGH!*” Astica tried to turn slightly to face the woman better, but was met with incredible pain.

“Don’t move… I was going to explain. We found you at the bottom of a cliff, your leg was in bad shape. We fixed you up as best we could and got the village healer to look you over, but it will take some time to recover.”

“Thankyou…” Astica stated as she tried to make herself comfortable again. “You’ve helped me so much, I don’t even know your name…”

“Sonia.” Her rescuer answered. “If you want, the rest of my little family would like to meet you, they have all been very worried you were not going to make it.”

Feeling like she owed Sonia, Astica didn’t really want to say no. “Yes, that would be nice.” She half-lied; in reality Astica just wanted to go back to sleep, to hope that this had all been some weird fever dream in the forest.

The blonde woman nodded. “Girls she’s up!” She called, trying to keep her voice down around Astica. First to open the door was someone Astica presumed was Sonia’s daughter that she had mentioned.

“This is Katya.” Sonia introduced.

Katya looked every bit a younger version of her mother. From her silver-less blonde hair to her slight roundness in the middle, indicating where she would inherit her mother’s middle-aged-spread someday. One difference between them was a healthy smattering of freckles on Katya’s cheeks.

“And this is…” Sonia began, as someone very different walked in through the door.

"Thank you," the tall man said as he dusted the snow off his great coat. He was quite a thin figure, and as he unwound his scarf, he revealed a short, red beard and a pair of piercing blue eyes. "Cicifus' mind numbing hells, it is cold out there! I thought winter had broken!?"

"It has. This is spring," the old inn keeper chuckled. He was not as tall as the traveller, but far broader. His arms were thick with muscle, and as he took his coat, the traveller noted the thick callouses on the man's hands. "I'll admit I'm somewhat shocked to see a peddler wandering the roads in this weather. I should warn you, you'll probably be stuck here for a time. This blizzard is a freak, tis true, but it'll melt soon enough, then the roads will be impassable."

"That's fine, I'm just glad I made it," he said, trying and failing to blow a little warmth back into his hands. "Can you set me up with a room and meals for the duration?"

"Certainly. What name should I put you under?"

"Michael Kensington. And don't worry about payment. I have both pepper and true silver. What about stabling for my mount?"

"That'll be included, though you have to pay for the feed, naturally. My name's Ivan, by the way," the old innkeeper said as he hung Michael's coat. Ivan poured a slug of ale into a copper warmer, placing it on the fire. "So what brings you so far from Roiling Bay?"

"Potential business. How did you know I was from the South?"

"It's the name," the keep said as he tested the temperature of the warming beverage. Satisfied, he poured it into a pewter tankard, and offered it to his guest. "This should get some warmth back into your bones. And I wasn't always an innkeeper. In my younger years, I saw a lot of the world as a carpenter on various trading vessels. I reckon I've set foot in every port in this land at least once, and quite a few more then that. And the only place I ever heard names like yours was down in Roiling Bay, usually Cluny or Tuxley."

Michael laughed, and took a sip of his drink. "Well, you're spot on, mate. My family's from Cluny, and I moved to Tuxley about five or six years ago. Joined up with the Merchant Guild there, and barely been home since."

He was, of course, giving Ivan the extreme cliff notes version of what had actually brought him here. The young merchant had proven very successful in his chosen profession, and had even convinced the council of masters to allow him to travel to the far north to establish trade with (what he assured them was) this rather rich and untapped realm.

It had been the new Prince, Anya, who had invited him, of course. The two had met in Adinah, her an academically poor foreign student with an atrocious accent, and him a new merchant apprentice who spent more time getting his superiors tea then doing anything constructive. The two had quickly become fast friends, and though their association was short, the two had kept in touch, frequently sending letters between them.

For the last several months, Anya's letters had all but dried up, Then, out of the blue, he'd received a heavily encoded and multi-page document, written in Anya's heavy handwriting. It had taken him almost three days to decode it, and was shocked upon its contents. She'd listed off the death of her father by an unknown assassin; the murder of her siblings by her brother, Sergei; her overthrow of Sergei in turn, and her struggles with her new court.

She'd ended it by inviting Michael to come to Novograd, capital of the Meshcheri. Beyond being a good excuse to see each other again, she also promised a sizable business opportunity, one that would benefit both the guild and her realm, as well as making both of them quite wealthy. Michael had been quite intrigued, and sent back his own coded message stating he'd arrive in the spring.

And this, of course, brought the tanned southerner to where he now sat.

"Your travels have certainly taken you far, then," the old man chuckled. "Well, I have an early day tomorrow, so I shall leave you for the night. My wife and son are in the kitchen. They'll see to your room and food."

"Much obliged, Ivan."

"Oh, there's no need to thank me. You're paying for it, after all." And with that, the old keep wandered off, leaving Michael sipping his piping hot beer, wondering what tomorrow's meeting would bring.

1212.content:
Dhasca tried desperately to stifle a yawn. This was her fifth suitor for the day, and he was just as boring as the several dozen she had over the past several weeks. Her father had found his first grey hair, and apparently that meant she had to marry and start producing heirs soon. He had started announcing left and right that she was looking for a husband, and soon after that, she had been entertaining a slew of suitors every day. Her father needed to find a healthier outlet, other than her, for his mid-life crisis, she thought.

All these suitors were the same. They were either the sons of her father's strongest warriors or the sons of the high council of priests, and for some reason, that made them all boring, pretentious, and self-centered. She couldn't take another minute of it. She already hated being bartered off, why did she have to suffer this boredom on top of it?

She dismissed this latest one with as much pleasantry as she could muster, and sure enough, her father came to her shortly. King Orym was a tall, slight man with a great long, thin beard that trailed nearly to his waist. He was a kind and fair ruler, but sometimes he was a dense father if he couldn't see his only daughter's misery at the thought of having to marry so soon. In truth, he loved Dhasca more than anything. She was his oldest child, and his only daughter. She was beautiful and reminded him so much of his late wife. How could he not want the best for her?

"So, my beautiful flower, surely today you found the right one."

Dhasca had to play this just right. On the one hand, she couldn't outright tell him the truth, because then he would take her marriage into his own hands. On the other, she couldn't lie and commit herself to a life of misery. "They were nice," she managed to say.

"But just not the right one," her father finished, knowing his daughter better than that. For now, he had attributed all these rejections to his daughter just being picky. "We'll find one soon. Don't you worry. By the next harvest festival, you'll have your wedding."

"Great..." Dhasca said, lying between her teeth. "I look forward to it."

The truth was, she knew almost instantly who she would marry if she had the chance. But her father would never approve, and so she was stuck meeting them in secret, which was what she was planning on doing right now. She let out a fake yawn. "Well, father, I'm quite tired. I think I'll go to sleep for the night."

His eyebrows raised in surprise. "Are you sure? Did you not want to at least eat dinner?"

"No, I'm not all that hungry." She just wanted to be alone to sneak away, and he was keeping her here with these silly questions.

"Okay, well, goodnight." He kissed the top of his daughter's forehead and left.

Perfect. Dhasca waited until his footsteps could no longer be heard, and slipped away. She went to their usual meeting spot: the spring deep in the forest. While beautiful and a great source of water, it was quite out of the way and farther out than the other springs. This meant they would have their privacy.

It was already nightfall when she arrived, but she saw no sign of them yet. She sat by the edge of the water, admiring the luminescent plants nearby. She started undoing her braids, letting her hair cascade down over her shoulders, and hummed. Not only was she the princess, she was known for having the most beautiful singing voice. Music could always heal her stresses, her mother had taught her when she was just a girl. That was true, though there was someone else who could also do that.

"I was starting to wonder when you would come," a voice said behind her.

"The usual," Dhasca replied, "father had more suitors for me to meet."

"And what do you think of them?" they asked, trying to feign worry.

"Oh, but they're not nearly as wonderful as you." They sat down beside her, as she said this, looking deep into their eyes.

They laughed. "Good, because I don't know what I'd do if you found someone else more attractive than me."

"I would never think such a thing," she said, leaning in to kiss them. "I love only you."

Several minutes later, Dhasca laid back on the grass, panting, but content. "I needed this," she said. "Father says he wants to marry me off before the next harvest festival. I just needed to be with you, to forget all of this."

They lay down beside her, enjoying the basking in the afterglow of their lovemaking. "Really? That soon?"

Dhasca sighed. "I don't want it to happen, but he's getting persistent. I fear I'll have no choice. What am I to do? If I tell him about us, I fear he will not only refuse, but do something horrible like banish you. I can't even bear to think about that."

They threw their arm around her waist, their hand rubbing her gently to sooth her nerves. They hated to see her worry. "Well, I might have an idea of how to fix that."

Dhasca was now very curious. She rolled over to look her lover in the eyes. Any idea would do at this point.

Is Dhasca's lover a man or a woman? You decide.

12122.content:
Nilmini had her usual impish smile, the same smile that could make Dhasca melt instantly. Nilmini was the daughter of the royal healer, and they had known each other since childhood. In truth, she had been the princess' only friend as her father kept her fairly sheltered, and Dhasca didn't relate all that much to her younger brothers. Nilmini understood her in a way that others could not, and as they got older, their friendship became something more. At first, it was only the two of them experimenting with their feelings, but it had felt so right in that moment that they had never parted.

She was a tall, slightly taller than Dhasca, and broad-shouldered girl with a young and playful face. She was also a known trickster, who liked to play by her own rules. Unlike most elves, Nilmini had decided to chop off most of her hair when she was a young woman, much to the ire of her father. It had grown back, somewhat, into a messy pixie-cut. It gave her a boyish look that Dhasca loved very much.

Dhasca brushed the olive-colored skin of her lover's arm. "Please, tell me," she said. "I'm desperate at this point."

Nilmini was perhaps the stronger of the two personalities. She had been the first to confess her love, and would have been willing to openly admit it, if it weren't for the begging of Dhasca to keep it a secret. Much as she did love her, her father would never approve. With Nilmini, there was no way of producing heirs; it was just simple biology.

Nilmini only smiled again and straddled Dhasca, playfully pinning her down. She was not only the stronger personality, but the stronger one physically. As daughter to a healer, she had always been fairly strong and physically fit, not that Dhasca wasn't, but she was more on the thin and waif-like side. If there was one thing the princess loved the most, it was being held in those strong, protective arms.

"Well, these suitors only like you because of your rumored beauty and your singing voice," Nilmini began.

"Rumored?" Dhasca scoffed, feigning anger.

"Relax, you're the most gorgeous creature I know, but these guys only get to hear about it. Look, let's say that maybe you didn't live up to their expectations?"

Nilmini nuzzled her neck as she said this, sending a tingle down Dhasca's spine. Still, her words did not make sense. "What do you mean?" she asked nervously.

Her lover only shrugged, running her hands down Dhasca's sides and stopping at her hips. "Well, if you weren't as attractive as they were expected to believe, then maybe it would be they who turn you down. There's nothing your father can do about that."

That did make sense, she thought. If she was the one being rejected, rather than having to reject them, he would have to allow her to do as she pleased. It was tempting. "And just how am I supposed to make myself unattractive?"

She laughed. "Well, while that is going to be pretty hard to do, it's not like you can just stop bathing or fixing your hair. Your father would make you change all that back in an instant. We need something that's more...permanent."

Dhasca felt a little nervous. This didn't sound at all encouraging. "Like what?"

Nilmini rolled her eyes, realizing that hinting at it was getting nowhere. She sat up, and let her hands gently graze Dhasca's thin stomach. "Perhaps if you were a little...well, larger..."

Dhasca sat up, and the two elves were looking directly into each other's eyes. Was she hearing what she thought she heard. "You mean...get fatter?"

"Sure, these conceited losers only want a thin and beautiful princess they can parade around like a trophy. Once they see that that's off the table, they'd have to reject you."

The princess let Nilmini get off of her, and then bunched her knees to her chest. Something about this didn't feel right. She wanted to make herself smaller in this moment, and almost laughed realizing the irony, given what had been said. "Something wrong with that?" Nilmini asked, feeling like she had offended her.

"I don't know, it just feels like such an odd thing to do. It's not exactly, normal."

"Well, no, it's not, but then, these aren't normal circumstances," Nilmini said with a laugh.

"Would you still love me?" She asked that so suddenly, and covered her mouth as soon as it escaped her lips.

"What now?"

Dhasca took a deep breath. "I mean, you're talking about making me unattractive. Would you still find me attractive if I was...well, fat?"

Nilmini scooted up closer and put her arms around her partner. "You kidding? I would always love you, no matter what you looked like or what size you were. I'm just talking about what these other guys would think. To me, you could never be anything less than beautiful, inside and out."

She had tears in her eyes as she wrapped herself around her lover. "Thank you," was all she said.

Nilmini held her for a moment, but then laughed again. "Besides, I think you could use a little more meat on your bones." She playfully, and unsuccessfully, tried to grab at any body fat the girl might have. The princess really was a twig of a girl. "I can never say no to having more of you to love."

This made Dhasca feel better and she laughed too. "So, how is this supposed to work?" she asked tentatively.

Nilmini waved her off. "Easy," she said.
12122.title: Love Knows No Bounds
