“I’ll just bring you food for when you come out to meet me,” Nilmini finished. “That way, no one will be able to figure it out. You’ll still eat normally around your father and the elders, and just eat extra when you’re with me.”

This still felt odd, and a bit frightening to Dhasca. She was about to agree to a life-altering idea, and it just didn't feel right. “I suppose,” she said tentatively. “Are you sure this will work?”

Nilmini stood, starting to put her clothes back on. She shrugged. “Dunno. I mean, I’m pretty sure it will, but can’t know for sure. If it doesn’t, at least we tried.”

Dhasca also stood up, meeting her at eye level. “Easy for you to say. I’m the one who will have consequences if it doesn’t.”

Her lover smiled, and pulled her in for a kiss. As she stood back, she said with a laugh, “You’ll have consequences even if it does, but I’ll still be in love with you all the same. So, tomorrow?”

She rolled her eyes, crossing her arms. She hated how much Nilmini spoke so dismissively about it all. Dhasca was also trying to hide her nerves. “So soon?”

Her fingers fidgeted nervously, looking to Nilmini. She only turned around and grinned with a seductive smile. “That’s never stopped you from sneaking out to meet me almost every night before.”

Dhasca nodded, silently agreeing. This wasn’t going to be as easy as Nilmini was making it.

All throughout the next day Dhasca could hardly concentrate. She was too busy thinking about seeing Nilmini again that night. There had often been days where her thoughts of her secret lover prevented her from going about her day, but this time it was for entirely different reasons. Her hand rested on her flat stomach as she thought about what was to transpire very soon. She sighed.

“Something wrong, my beautiful little flower?” her father asked, as he stood before her. “You have hardly eaten breakfast. Are you unwell?”

She had hadn’t really noticed the plate of food before her, nor had she really been paying attention to the conversation around the table as her father had been speaking with the elders. “No, it’s just…there’s just a lot I’ve been thinking about.”

Her father nodded, seeming to understand. “I just hope I haven’t been pressuring you too much about this wedding,” he said. “Is that what’s troubling you?”

“Well…” Dhasca wanted desperately to tell him the truth, and was just about to. Maybe she could avoid this whole situation all together. Now was her chance.

“Because, I don’t want you to feel that you have to pick the ‘perfect’ mate,” he interrupted. “Any one of the men who has attempted for your hand would be just fine. They are all quite suitable, and I would not mind any one over the other.”

He was still forcing her into it, and there was no letting up, Dhasca realized. She would have no choice; Nilmini was right. “Anyway, we can’t have you wasting away like this over worry,” her father continued. “You’ll need to be in good health if you intend to have children with your new mate soon.”

Was everyone in a conspiracy to see her waistline expand, she wondered? She inwardly groaned. "Thank you, father," she said through gritted teeth. "I won't trouble myself too much over it."

* * *


Though it did not seem like it, Nilmini worried too. She had always prided herself on being forthright and honest with Dhasca almost all the time, but there was one thing that she hadn't been honest about. Nilmini had always known she was different from an early age. She figured out pretty soon that she liked girls over boys, long before Dhasca figured out what she liked herself. More importantly, she knew she had peculiar "tastes" in girls. It was therefore ironic when she had fallen for the small and thin Dhasca, and that irony was not lost on her one bit.

Perhaps it was the challenge of it that thrilled her. Nilmini had never once shared her secret desire with Dhasca, for fear of what she might say, and her reaction last night validated some of those fears. When the opportunity presented itself, Nilmini thought she was a genius. She had introduced the idea in a natural, logical, and subtle way, she thought. But Dhasca's own fears, brought out some of Nilmini's with it.

It wouldn't be worth it, if Dhasca didn't love herself as she was, and that was the main fear in the back of Nilmini's mind. Dhasca didn't see the same beauty she did. She wouldn't see how much Nilmini still appreciated and loved her. If she hated herself, Dhasca would never understand, and quite possibly, never forgive Nilmini.

And what if it didn't work? What if that didn't stop this marriage her father was planning? What if it was all for nothing? Then what? Oh, sure, Nilmini would have had her fun, but then poor Dhasca would still wind up miserable not only with someone she didn't love but in a body she couldn't love either. Plus, she would hate to lose the woman she loved, and after they had tried so hard.

What if she hurt Dhasca? That thought crossed her mind several times. Nilmini had never done this before, had never lived even one second of her own fantasy. She didn't know what she was doing. What if she made Dhasca sick forcing her to eat too much? What if she got sick from these sudden changes? What if...?

No, she had to stay on the positive side. She would do everything to make sure Dhasca was fine. She knew how to be cautious, contrary to what others thought of her usual impulsiveness. She would make sure Dhasca felt loved every second of every day, no matter the size. She could do this. And maybe, just maybe, she could reveal how she secretly desired this all along to Dhasca, but only when the time was right.

She loaded up the last of her supplies, and ran off to the woods.

1212232.content:
“Okay, so let’s get this over with,” Nilmini heard Dhasca say as she approached the spring.

Nilmini set down her sack with a bemused look. “Well, that’s a first,” she said, crossing her arms. “I always thought you liked coming here.”

“You know what I mean. This isn’t a typical night for us.”

Nilmini laughed, sitting down on a nearby rock. Dhasca sat beside her nervously.

“No, I suppose not,” Nilmini said. “But look, if you go into this with a bad attitude, then yeah, it’s going to be bad.”

Dhasca sighed and nodded, and Nilmini smiled back, grabbing the sack. “Now, I wasn’t sure what sort of things you like most, so I brought…”

Her eyes nearly bugged out. She had never seen so much food in one place. “Gods, Nilmini, where did you get all this?”

She shrugged. “I have my ways." A look from the princess told her she had better explain herself. "Okay, so I may have gone on a few scouting raids. You'll never believe what sort of stuff humans eat. And hey, I’m not expecting you to eat it all tonight. You tell me when you hit your limit, okay?”

“I suppose. Hey, is that an annoricot?” Dhasca said, pointing at a round, red fruit in the bag. "Wait, you said this was human food?"

Nilmini pulled it out. “Most of it is anyway. Some stuff I just grabbed, like this. Didn’t know you liked them. This is kinda nice. I feel like I’m getting to know different things about you.” She hoped that by making small talk and flirting with her lover, that would help put her at ease, and perhaps distract her from the situation.

Dhasca took the fruit and bit into it. She always did love the sweet, ripe taste. “Yeah, they were always one of my favorites. When I was little, I could never reach them on the trees. I always had to beg one of my brothers to climb up and get one. Wasn’t too hard, since I was older and could kinda boss them around.”

“Not a big climber?”

“Nah, too scared of heights.”

Nilmini continued to converse with Dhasca as she ate. And Dhasca ate pretty well, taking the different things her lover offered. A few time, she didn’t even need coaxing. For a little bit, they discussed the oddities of food found from the raids. Humans sure liked to eat meat, they learned; not exactly a comfortable situation for them. Still, there were some good things to be found. Their version of bread was much softer and fluffier than the hard crust they could come up with. And despite the odd feeling of seeing so much slaughtered animal meat in there, they had to admit that humans did have a good way of flavoring venison.

“Wow, you sure did come with an appetite tonight,” Nilmini commented, after they had been there for a few hours.

“Sort of,” Dhasca replied. “I was so nervous about coming here tonight, I didn't really eat all that much today. Besides, I think my father isn’t going to be too opposed to your plan either. He seems to want me putting on weight, at least for now.”

One of Nilmini’s eyebrows raised, thinking their plan was already going to be bust. “Oh?”

“Yeah, something about me needing to be ready to have kids and everything. I’m too skinny for that apparently.”

Nilmini smiled. As a healer’s daughter, she had done a fair share of midwifery, which may or may not have helped “awaken” her interests. “Well, it wouldn’t hurt for that,” she answered. “Course I don’t think he means for you to get all that big.”

Dhasca laughed. “Not like what we’re planning, right?”

She was glad the princess was starting to take a more light-hearted view of the situation. “Yeah.” She then sighed, feeling a little down. “You know, that’s the one thing I’m always going to regret about our relationship.”

Dhasca’s hand touched her shoulder. “What is?”

She only gave her a half-smile. “If this all works out, and your dad finally lets me marry you, I’ll never be able to give you children. Look, I don’t know if you would’ve wanted any, but you would’ve been a great mother, and I feel bad taking that opportunity away from you.”

Dhasca wrapped her in an embrace, and Nilmini could no longer hold back tears. She was never one for big shows of emotion, but when it came to Dhasca, she was much more willing to open up. “It’s okay,” she answered. “Sure, it would’ve been nice at some point in my life, but there are more important things, like you. Nilmini, if that were ever a problem, I wouldn’t be here with you right now.”

“Really?”

“Of course, silly.”

Nilmini wiped her tears. “Thanks. It really is too bad though, you would’ve looked cute with a little baby bump.” She poked Dhasca’s middle, which looked a tad swollen and full. Nilmini resisted the urge to outright start touching it. She didn't want to also talk about her big secret, not yet, anyway.

She rubbed it gently. “I’m actually feeling pretty full,” she answered with a grimace. “Starting to hurt. Can we call it a night?”

“Not, just yet,” Nilmini said, leaning them both back onto the ground. “In case you’ve forgotten, there’s another reason we come here.”

Dhasca giggled as she slowly got her cloak off.
1212232.title: And So it Begins...

choices: The Next Day: Someone walks in on them.

The Next Day: Dhasca and Nilmini get a perfect few days.
12122322.content:
Dhasca found herself enjoying her nights with Nilmini more since they had started this little scheme. Sure, at first it had been pretty awkward, and neither was sure what to do, but it had gotten better, and felt more like a normal routine to them. Nilmini was incredibly attentive to Dhasca during this time, and she rather liked the extra special attention. She also enjoyed it when Nilmini would rub and caress her stomach after she was full. She never realized that her lover could be even more sensual to her.

And that was nothing compared to their other intimate exchanges. Dhasca couldn’t figure it out, but she felt as though Nilmini had become more passionate and vigorous since they had started this experiment. Not that she was complaining, but it was…odd, she thought. Here she was getting fatter on purpose, and Nilmini seemed to love her more. Either her girlfriend was very good at lying to her and telling her how much she loved her, or it was something else. She did not pay it too much mind though.

“Someone’s getting softer,” her lover said, bringing her out of her thoughts.

Nilmini gently pinched at Dhasca’s sides as they lay in the grass together after their latest session. Indeed, their plan was somewhat working. The elven princess was starting to get a little bigger. She had once inspected herself in the mirror back at home to see the damages. Sure enough, her dress clung a little tighter to her, though it would take much longer before that loose-fitting dress would become too snug for her. Her high cheekbones had become rounder, and she did have a certain glow about her, but most of her new weight was settling in her lower half.

It wasn’t much, but she could see her thighs had widened a bit, and her sides were starting to show. Most prominent of all was the taut, rounder belly she was sporting. She had poked and played with it some, having a hard time believing this was what she really looked like now. Nilmini had described her as pear-shaped, or something like that, and that was becoming more apparent. She probably would never have known this about herself, had none of this happened.

Nilmini pulled Dhasca closer as she spoke again. “And are these soon-to-be love-handles I’m going to get to enjoy?” she teased.

She playfully swatted her away, her face turning a light shade of red. “Stop, I’m already a little self-conscious about it anyway.”

“Don’t be. You’re still the most beautiful creature I know.” She started rubbing Dhasca’s full stomach that way she always liked. The princess stretched and turned around so that Nilmini had a better reach. “Besides, not like it’s much for anyone to take notice.”

“Hm, then we’d better get busy before my father picks a suitor for me,” Dhasca said in a sleepy yawn.

Nilmini sat up, a wicked grin on her face. “I was thinking the same thing. Look, I gotta be at the palace tomorrow anyway. Dad’s trying to deal with that epidemic and needs to be out among the tribe.”

“They’re still getting sick?” Dhasca had heard about the other elves starting to contract human diseases and suffering horribly without immunity to those diseases. It did worry her very much.

It did not seem to worry Nilmini. That was one of the things Dhasca liked about her most: she could always put her mind at ease. “Dad’s the best healer; he can handle it. Anyway, that means I’ll be taking over his duties over at the palace for a couple days…”

“It’ll be nice to have you around,” Dhasca said, not catching on.

“Let’s just say that you’ll be ‘sick’ tomorrow. Not too sick, but ill enough that maybe you need to stay in bed for a couple days to rest, and get plenty to eat…”

“Nilmini, give it a rest,” Dhasca sighed in frustration. “Why can’t we just have a couple days to enjoy having each other around? Why does it always have to be about this? Besides, it’s too risky. What if someone catches us?”

She shrugged. “No one is going to catch us. You worry too much.”

“I don’t know…”

Nilmini rested her hands on Dhasca’s shoulders. “Look, it’s no different than what we do here. You said it yourself, we kind of are on a schedule here, and we could use a little bit of a boost. No one will catch us. And besides, I think a little risk makes it all the more interesting.” Her fingers were tickling Dhasca up and down her back.

She had also said all this in her seductive voice, which Dhasca knew she couldn’t resist for long. She rolled her eyes and sighed, “Fine, but this had better not be the whole of how I spend these couple of days with you.”

“Don’t worry, I’ll treat you like the princess you are. So, let's see if we can get you good and fat before next harvest.”

Nilmini gasped, mortified that she had said that out loud. Dhasca blushed. "I'm sorry," Nilmini started to say. "I didn't mean that... I was just trying..."

"It's okay. I know what you mean. I just hope this plan works."

Nilmini settled back down beside her. That had been a close call, she thought. She still wasn't ready to tell the princess her secret desires just yet. After all, she was only starting to get used to these changes herself. Still, the young elf couldn't resist. It was like a dream coming true. She let her hands explore Dhasca's new softness tenderly, and she desired the day when she would get even softer.
12122322.title: Several weeks later: Dhasca is starting to get ...

121223222.content:
Dhasca awoke to the smells of heavenly foods. She had certainly been sleeping so much better since her and Nilmini’s “experiment.” Going to bed with a full stomach probably played no small part in that. It therefore took a few minutes for her to get fully woken up. Sitting up, she already saw Nilmini. “Really? You couldn’t wait that long?”

Nilmini shrugged. “Sorry, just wanted to see you that bad.”

The princess only shook her head, giving her a look. “Uh huh, and it has nothing to do with all this?” She was gesturing to the large tray of food.

She only gave a sheepish look. “Well, you can’t enjoy the day on an empty stomach.”

Dhasca shook her head. “Of course, silly me. Nilmini, I don’t think I can eat all this.”

“I don’t think you’ve been paying attention these past few nights. Your appetite has grown since we started.”

She sighed, knowing that there was a purpose to all of this, even if she didn’t like it. And if it wasn't enough, her stomach betrayed her by letting out a growl. “Well, it does smell good, and I am kind of hungry.”

Dhasca couldn’t complain too much when she knew that the food was good. And Nilmini always had a way of making her feel comfortable, whether it was with conversation to take her mind off of things, or her romantic advances. Her lover only left a few times during the morning to tend to a few requests at the palace, but stayed with her almost the entire day. It took several hours, but unbelievably to Dhasca, she had somehow managed to eat the entire breakfast prepared for her. However, her stomach did feel painfully stuffed as a result. She wanted to stand up for just a minute after having spent the whole morning in bed, but found herself pinned down by the sudden change to her center of balance.

“I know how to fix that,” Nilmini said, leaning Dhasca back onto her bed so that she could be more comfortable.

Dhasca practically purred when Nilmini’s hands set to rubbing her belly. At first, it felt a little rough, and made it hurt only more, but strangely, it was a good pain. It soon turned very sensual, as Nilmini would be kissing her all the while. She hated to admit it, but this was the best part of this whole experience.

“Hm, feels pretty warm,” Nilmini commented, massaging near her belly button.

“Itches too,” Dhasca added, moving Nilmini’s hands closer to the sides of her stomach. She moaned a little when Nilmini's hands started rubbing the right spot.

“Yeah, I actually didn’t think you would eat it all. So, not bad.”

Dhasca almost didn’t realize she had fallen asleep. It was only as she groggily stirred in the afternoon that she became aware of it. Nilmini was gone, and probably off on another call for a while. She would be back soon, she reasoned. Meanwhile, Dhasca took to exploring the new inches that had been added to her. Her stomach was still quite full, but it didn’t feel as bad as when she had just finished eating. Her belly was still somewhat bulging and tight, but there was a certain softness to it. She liked the way her hand gently glided across the curve of it.

Well, if she ate like this every day, it would certainly not go unnoticed by her suitors, and most likely her father. What was he going to say once he realized something was up? What if he figured it out and found some way to make her stop, or prevent her from seeing Nilmini again? She didn't want to think of that possibility. She had to focus on their plan now. It had to work, it just had to.

The door opened and there was Nilmini with…even more food. “You can’t be serious,” Dhasca groaned.

Nilmini shrugged. “What? It’s just to tide you over for a while.”

“Nilmini, I’m still pretty full from earlier. I don’t think-”

“Relax, you can probably get a little in.”

She held a steaming flavored bread in front of Dhasca. This didn’t feel right, but Dhasca had to trust that Nilmini knew what she was doing. She tried eating what she could, but found that she was going at a much slower rate than before. It was a lot harder to eat when she was already full. The pain was starting to get worse. The itch on her stomach almost felt like her skin would tear at any moment.

“I really don’t think I can eat anymore,” Dhasca said, struggling between words to breathe. She had to lay back to give her stomach room as it stuck straight up, moving heavily with each labored breath.

Nilmin didn’t seem to hear her, she was so lost in her own fantasy. “Oh, come on, one more bite? Maybe another rub will help while you eat.”

Dhasca finally had to take charge. She pushed Nilmini’s hand away. “I said no!” she said shortly.

Nilmini was a little taken aback. “Dhasca…”

“No,” Dhasca said again, even more forcefully. Her belly quivered, stuffed far beyond her limits. She clutched at it and turned away from Nilmini. “Just, go away right now, okay?”

Now Nilmini felt horrible. “But…” she said in a hoarse whisper.

“Please, go away. You haven’t been listening at all.”

She sighed, and turned around to leave. Nilmini had gone and done the one thing she had feared she would do during this whole experience: she had hurt the woman she loved.
121223222.title: There are Limits

1212232221.content:
Nilmini sucked in a breath. She was standing in front of Dhasca’s door the very next morning, trying to work up the courage to knock. She hadn’t slept at all last night, and she had a pretty good feeling that Dhasca probably didn’t sleep well either. All night, Nilmini had been going over the day before over and over again, and no matter how she tried to see it, she had been to blame.

She had pushed the woman she loved too much, and now Dhasca probably hated her. She had hoped that what they were doing would have started out of necessity, but that it would have eventually become something to bond them closer together. She had hoped that she would have come to love it, even welcome it. Instead, she had thrown that out the window.

Gritting her teeth, Nilmini finally tapped on the door. Several heartbeats, which felt like hours to her, she finally heard Dhasca’s voice call out in a frustrated sigh, “Come in.”

Great, she already knew who it was, and she was still mad. It was going to have to take everything she had to speak without breaking down. Dhasca was still getting dressed, and upset as she was, Nilmini couldn’t help stealing a glance at her lover’s soft belly, which was now really starting to round out. She also couldn’t help but notice the two new, red, angry-looking stretch marks that had formed just to the left of Dhasca’s belly button. I did that, Nilmini thought, I’m such a monster.

Dhasca noticed Nilmini’s look and curtly nodded to her, acknowledging that they both knew. She let the rest of the dress fall into place, covering the evidence of what had happened yesterday. Finally, Dhasca looked at Nilmini, crossing her arms. “Well, are you going to speak?”

Nilmini only mouthed a few syllables before finding her voice. “I’m…I’m sorry, Dhasca, really sorry. I never meant to hurt you, and…”

“And you promised that I had control in this. You promised I could decide my limits. You promised me that I would not be harmed.”

Nilmini was practically in tears. So much for trying to hold it together. “I know, and I can understand if you don’t forgive me for it, but Dhasca, please understand, I didn’t mean for that to happen. I just…I don’t know.”

“You lost control,” Dhasca said, sitting beside her. “The fact that you thought you had control is what scares me, Nilmini. What do you see me as in all of this?”

That stung, but she deserved it, Nilmini knew. She had stopped seeing Dhasca as a person, a person she loved, and she hated herself for it. “Dhasca, you’re the only woman I’ll ever love, and I should’ve treated you better. I love you more than anything, and I should have treated you like I do. And I promise it won’t happen again. Heck, I’d understand if you want to stop altogether.”

Dhasca sat silent for a few minutes, as if mulling over what she was going to say. Nilmini continued to sob softly. Biting her lip, wondering if she’d regret it, Dhasca finally spoke. “This is something you like, isn’t it?”

“Wh-what?”

“This.” She gestured to her larger frame. “You find this sort of thing arousing, don’t you? I guess I should’ve figured it out sooner. The way you’d look at me, rub my stomach, I should’ve seen it. Yesterday, in your eyes, I finally saw it though. You’re attracted to this.”

This was not going at all how Nilmini had planned. Her heart was slamming against her chest. “Um, yeah, I wanted to tell you, but I didn’t know how you’d take it.”

“So, when you suggested this idea…was it because of this excitement you get from it?”

Nilmini knew where this was going. “Well, sort of. I mean, I wanted to help out, of course, and I still think this plan would. But, you know, it had a few added perks for me.” Dhasca gave her a cross look. “But I should have told you sooner.”

Dhasca ran a hand over the curve of her stomach, letting her hand squeeze its softness for a moment, and sighed. “So, you’ve wanted me bigger?”

She quickly grabbed the princess’ hands, becoming reassuring almost immediately. “Dhasca, don’t think I would love you any less if you weren’t. What I said that night, that I’d love you no matter what size…I meant it, I really did. I won’t love you any more if you get bigger, and I won’t love you any less if you’re smaller. I love you more than the world itself, and that’s enough for me.”

Dhasca smiled and rested her head against her lover’s shoulders. “Okay,” she said decisively, “but promise me I won’t get hurt again.”

“Absolutely,” Nilmini said, holding her close. “Absolutely. So…you mean you’re still up for this?”

The elven princess took a few deep breaths, as if thinking over her final answer. “Yes,” she said. “Besides, I think knowing now that you like it, I’ve got a new motivation.”

Nilmini pulled Dhasca off her shoulder and made sure they were eye to eye. “You sure? Remember, you don’t have to do this. I’ll still love you no matter what.”

“I know, but if I know that it means I’m going to have a more…intimate relationship with you, then I think I can learn to enjoy it.” She took Nilmini’s hands and pressed them onto her wider sides. “Besides, I think it’s made me a lot softer to cuddle, right?”

Nilmini flashed her a wicked grin. “You bet it has. Come here!”

12122322212.content:
“I’m liking this idea so much better,” Nilmini said, leaning to kiss Dhasca’s neck.

“Just keep it down,” she warned. “You keep making noise like you just did and someone’s going to catch us.”

It had become a regular ritual for Nilmini to start visiting Dhasca in her room. She rather liked the thrill of climbing in through her lover’s window. It put a new “forbidden” element to their romance. “Mmm, I like the feel of those hips right now,” Nilmini muttered, “and am I mistaken, or does your chest feel softer?”

Dhasca had taken a more positive attitude to putting on weight, and rather liked coyly tempting her lover with it. She would occasionally tease her by telling her how her clothes were starting to feel tighter. Or she would guide Nilmini's hands to explore her new padding. It hadn’t been terribly long since they had started this plan, but she was starting to look a little plump already. While most of the weight was settling to her lower half, some other areas were starting to catch up. “Maybe a little,” she teased.

Nilmini took a pinch near her ribs. “Pretty soon, I’m not going to be feeling these.”

She swatted her hand away. “One step at a time. I-”

There was a knock at the door. Dhasca bolted up. “Quick, hide!”

She was already pushing Nilmini off the bed before she could offer protest. “But-”

“No time!” Dhasca said, shoving her under the bed.

Not long after, her father entered her room. Dhasca desperately hoped her father wouldn’t see the flush to her cheeks, or notice the edge of Nilmini’s boot sticking out from under the bed. “Father,” she said, bowing. “What are you…”

The king kissed his daughter’s cheek. “Wonderful news, my beautiful little flower, but that can wait. Were you talking to someone just now?”

Her heart thundered in her chest. “N-no. I was just…practicing my singing.”

He nodded, approving. “A wonderful idea. You do have a marvelous voice.” As he embraced her, though, he stopped when he noticed something was different. “Is that a new dress?” he asked, trying to figure it out. “It feels different.”

Dhasca was tempted to chuckle, knowing what probably felt different. “Father, you said you had news,” she said, trying to change the subject.

He laughed, and looked rather pleased. “You’ll never believe it. There are several new suitors who have traveled far to ask for your hand.”

Dhasca became alarmed. “New? From where?”

“That’s just it, far from the Verge. I don’t know how, but they’ve all come, having heard of your incredible beauty.”

She started thinking on this. This was not at all how their plan was supposed to go. “Far from the Verge, but that would mean…”

“Yes!” her father said ecstatically. “They’re not elves. Now, I’ll admit, my dear, I was a little unsure of the idea myself. Humans are a very fickle bunch, you know. But after some important discussions, I'm willing to give them a try. You should have seen Elder Lorsan's face when I said that."

They must think he's crazy, Dhasca thought. Until now, they had been pretty wary of the humans. Elder Lorsan had even disowned his own daughter when he found out she had married one. This couldn't be going over too well. Then again, her father did have the crazy notion to marry her off, so maybe he was losing his mind.

Her father continued, "They are very similar to us. I don’t think you’d have a great deal of trouble conceiving with them, especially the humans. The thing is, some of these men, are some of the most illustrious among humankind. Imagine it! They want to forge an alliance with our people!”

He continued to babble on, but Dhasca ceased to hear him. Humans! And gods know what else! They were seeking her hand, but how? Why? Her mind was still reeling when she heard her father said. “Now, I want no argument about it. Take a few minutes to get ready, and I expect you in the great hall to greet them.”

He left, leaving Dhasca to try and process what was going on. Nilmini scrambled out from under the bed. “Oh, Nilmini, this is terrible,” Dhasca said, fretting nervously. “How could this have happened?”

She was grateful to have Nilmini to give her a reality check. “Look, this is fine. It changes nothing. I hear humans are more conceited than us. They start to see how large you’re getting, and they’ll take away those offers pretty quick.”

Dhasca looked at her frame. True, she was starting to round out more. “Nilmini, yes, I have grown, but I’m not really all that big. Healthy, and possibly plump, but not really something that would automatically be rejected.”

“True, you’re what…weighing eleven stone now?”

“A little under that.”

Nilmini looked her over, thinking about it. “Okay, so not exactly huge, but trust me, they’ll be a little less interested when they see the appetite you’ve developed. No lord or king or whatever’s going to want a wife that’ll eat him out of house and home.”

Dhasca sighed. “You’re making this sound so wonderful,” she said sarcastically. “And I don’t eat all that much, more than I used to, but-”

“It’ll be fine, we have nothing to worry about.” Nilmini started leading her to the door.

Entering into her father’s hall, she was actually surprised to find that there were more than just a few new guests she would be entertaining. Just how had all these people found them, and even stranger, desired her? She could easily recognize the humans. From what she had heard from the scouting parties, they differed very little from elves in appearance. There were one or two satyrs, former enemies of her people. She could tell by the size and intricacy of their horns that they were some of the more dominant males. And there were a few other species she didn’t recognize. There were some oddly colored creatures with smooth, sharp faces. From the looks of their attire, they were important scholars. Another group looked similar to the satyrs, yet they were much larger, and only had two horns.

Dhasca swallowed her pride and took a seat at the table.

121223222122.content:
Dhasca promised herself she'd at least be fair. Still, she wasn't in a comfortable position to be seated next to the satyrs. She'd always grown up with tales of their treachery and blood-thirsty nature. The blue-skinned beings she was still...unsure of. She didn't know what they were, let alone what they were like. For now, she would make her first diplomatic actions with the humans, and took a seat between what she thought were two lords. Her father nodded his approval, and commenced to keeping the other guests entertained.

She knew little of human culture, and tried to steer the conversation towards asking them about it. If it kept them talking, then maybe she could hide just how nervous she was. She felt like a huge rock had settled in her stomach. This was the worst thing that could possibly happen. Nilmini had promised that suitors would be dropping like flies. Instead, they were coming out of the wood works. The man to her left was fairly dense, and she could keep him at bay with tales of his war days. He was quite old to be seeking out a young wife, at least old by human standards.

The other man, seated to her right, was another matter entirely. He was a strong, well-built man, perhaps a tad portly who gazed at her with piercing green eyes. He rarely said much, and when she asked him questions, he would only give short answers, always going back to gazing at her. It was rather unsettling.

As the night wore on, she tried to find some excuse to leave, any excuse. A great opportunity came when the older man to her left had let his drink get the best of him. By now he was slurring his words and his motor skills were more than just lacking. When he had spilled some of his wine on her, it was a perfect opportunity to leave. Unfortunately, someone else insisted on coming with her. "Here, princess," the younger of the two men said, "let me at least escort you back to your room. Your guests have become quite rowdy."

He nodded over in the direction of the satyrs who clearly let the drink make them bolder and more aggressive. Her father was busy trying to calm them. The man took her arm and led her out.

Once out of the great hall, Dhasca again tried to take her leave of the man. "I think I shall be fine from here Thank you..." She paused, realizing in all this time she did not know his name.

"Roland, your majesty, King Roland."

This made Dhasca stop in her tracks. She had heard that there was a king in the central regions, outside of the Verge, but never would've guessed he would bother to come here for an elf. "You're..." she started to say, still surprised by it all.

He gave her a kind smile. "Yes, I am the king. Now that we have a moment alone, perhaps we can actually talk."

He sat her down on a bench and gave himself a little distance from her so as not to seem too forward. "Now, what do you know about me?"

She thought for a moment. Their scouting parties had only come back with scant information, provided they came back alive at all. "I only know you are a king and you rule in a city called Adinah."

The king nodded. "So it is true, that elves have had very little contact with our world. Very well, princess, I shall tell you my motives for coming here. I will keep no secrets from you, and I hope that by the end of tonight, I may just convince you to leave with me."

He was certainly bold, she would give him that. Still, Dhasca was fascinated by the bluntness of this man. She sat up straight, feigning disinterest. "Go on."

When he smiled with his teeth and looked at her with those eyes, she felt like she was being eyed by some wild beast. "I've come here really for two reasons, princess. The first is merely a matter of politics. You see, my men have discovered gold deposits in your land, but unfortunately, your tenacious people have prevented any mining in the area. I must say, your people are quite fascinating, and deadly too."

Indeed, elves could be quite fierce when defending their homes. Dhasca felt a swell of pride as he said this, but she was still confused. "Why does gold matter to you?"

He chuckled. "And that's why I think we can reach a peaceful agreement. We both need resources, just different materials. And your people don't value gold the same way we do. I like that. It means if I can strike up an alliance with your father, it will be one based on trust. I can be sure your father isn't going to lie to me to keep things for himself. When I found out he had a daughter he sought to marry off, well, that just sweetened the deal."

She eyed him suspiciously. So far, nothing he was saying would win any woman over. "And the second reason?"

"Right to the point, aren't you, princess? Yes, well the fact of the matter is I am looking for a queen. More importantly, I'm looking for heirs to my throne."

Typical, she thought. He and her father would get along quite well. He continued. "I do have children, it's true, but they've all been through the women of my harem. None of them can stand to rule when I am gone, according to the old ways. And my former queen, Damus rest her soul, died in childbirth some years ago. She was a rather thin and frail sort, unfortunately. You on the other hand..." He glided his fingers over the side of her belly, gently squeezing. "Seem quite healthy for the task."

Her face reddened and she swatted his hand away from her. He smiled wickedly. "Playing coy, are we? Oh, don't deny it, my dear. I saw the way you ate tonight. Got quite an appetite, don't you? You enjoy indulging."

His voice purred as if he had her caught in a trap. Dhasca really hadn't realized that she had eaten all that much. Gods curse Nilmini right now, she thought. If it wasn't for this stupid plan... "Course, you're nowhere near the biggest in my harem," he continued. Her eyes widened in surprise. "Oh, would you like to know a little secret about my women?"

He leaned forward and whispered in her ear, and her shock could not be concealed. "You wicked man!" she shouted.

"And devilishly handsome," he said, running a hand through his red-orange hair.

"Why are you telling me all this? What in your right mind makes you think I'm going to agree to marry you now?"

"I want there to be no secrets, just like I promised."

Her eyes narrowed. She couldn't believe what she was hearing. "So, just what is supposed to be so appealing that I'd want to marry you?" she asked.

He lowered his voice, resuming that calm, kind tone. "I'm a man who knows what he wants, and is willing to do whatever it takes to get it, princess. Sometimes that means I'm willing to pay any price. Let me start by saying that, as promised, you would be my queen, not my concubine."

Dhasca rolled her eyes. "And just what's so different about that?"

His smile widened. "Freedom, my dear. As my queen, you will have complete free will. You may go as you please in and out of the castle, with guards of course when you go out. I don't think I could stand the thought of losing another queen. You will have free reign over my servants, as they will be yours. And you wouldn't be subjected to the same...standards as my other women."

"Meaning?"

He nodded. "Meaning, if it is truly something you don't like, which I doubt..." He rested his hand again on her side, feeling its softness. "You will not gain an ounce unless you will it. You will not be some trophy like my other women. You will be my equal. You will not parade around for my many guests. No, instead you will have a place of honor beside me to converse with the lords and ladies of other lands. I think your people's wisdom is what some of them need to be hearing these days anyway."

Dhasca sat back, crossing her arms, thinking about it. "You seem pretty set on this," she said. "And you seem to want to offer quite a bit."

He bowed his head. "As I said, princess, I'm willing to pay any price. Any desire you may have shall be granted. I'm quite taken with you. To be honest, I never expected the elven princess to be quite as beautiful. Now, what do you say?"
