Yes, but maybe we can find a way out of it down the road.
No, this is just too weird. He's such a creep.
1212232221223.content:
As if on cue, a door slightly creaked and she saw Nilmini out of the corner of her eye. Had she been listening in this entire time? She looked back at the eager expression of the king, debating her next move. On the one hand, this arrangement did not seem appealing at all. This man was a disgusting creature with vulgar tastes despite his rather charming visage. Then again, she hadn't complained too much when she learned Nilmini had similar interests. And if this king did truly intend to give her anything she desired...

"I have some conditions of my own," she said, trying not to let her nerves betray her.

His eyes gleamed. "Now, you, my dear, know how to play this game right. I knew I found a suitable match in you. Very well, let's hear it then."

She motioned for Nilmini to come closer. "This is my personal healer and friend," she began. "If I am to stay at your castle, your human physicians will not know how to deal with elven diseases. She is also a proven midwife. If I am to bear you heirs..."

The king chuckled and tutted, "Now, princess, I've been completely honest and forthright with you. I had hoped you would do me the same honor. We both know she's not just your healer."

She raised an eyebrow, rather surprised by this. How could he possibly know? He seemed to read her expression. "You must think me quite daft. I'm no fool. I see the way you both look at each other. That seems to make sense now, and unfortunately it is a bit of a blow to my ego. I saw you as someone I could grow to love, and I had hoped I could be the same to you, but I see now you are taken."

Dhasca couldn't help but smirk just a little. Yet another suitor she had driven off. But, he continued, "Still, fair is fair, and I did promise you anything you desired. And I suppose if I still come out of this with the two goals I have come for, then it'll do. Consider it granted."

Both elves stuttered to find words. He was being serious. The king really was desperate to get what he wanted. He nodded. "Yes, feel free to bring her with you, along with any other servants...or lovers you may require. Gods, if you even wanted, I'd let you take your fill of my women if you wanted."

Nilmini coughed/gagged at this, rather shocked by his bluntness. She hadn't quite gotten as used to it as Dhasca had. He looked rather amused that he had caught them off guard like that. He then looked at Nilmini again. "Or perhaps I have it all wrong," he mused. He pointed at Nilmini. "I should've seen it before. I recognize a person with similar tastes to my own."

"Excuse me?"

He gave a gentle pat to Dhasca's stomach, which elicited a glare from the princess. Nilmini, on the other hand, looked like she was going to rip his arm off. "Just admiring your handiwork here," he chuckled. Her jaw nearly dropped. "Oh yes, I see it now. Quite frankly, that makes me feel better about letting you come along. I know you'll take good care of my future queen. And should you ever get bored, or should her majesty decide not to engage in our common interest, you may have your fun with some of my harem." He winked. "No rides, of course. Those are for me, but there are plenty of other activities you may enjoy."

Nilmini opened and closed her mouth several times, rather shocked with all that had been said. Dhasca was starting to feel rather warm, the conversation quickly becoming uncomfortable. The king stood. "Yes, I think we have an arrangement. I'll get my alliance with your father, and you'll at least tolerate me for the sake of continuing our bloodlines, and I'll let you have the freedom to be with your partner here. I'll let you two talk it over."

He strode away, looking rather confident, and thinking he had won. Dhasca took in a deep breath, trying to think. "This is insane, right?" Nilmini said. "He can't be serious."

"I think he is," Dhasca replied.

"What did he mean by his harem? What shared interests do I have with him?"

Dhasca leaned over and whispered in her ear, afraid other servants might be listening. Nilmini's eyes widened, and she suspected that was what she looked like when the king first told her. "That...that bastard!" Nilmini shouted, though with a hint of a smile.

"Well, don't act so excited about it," Dhasca scolded, catching her smile.

Nilmini still had a glazed look in her eye as she pictured it. "He has a whole castle with that going on?"

She tried to bring her lover back to reality. "Yes, and quit drooling over the idea."

"So, that's what he expects to do to you?" Nilmini asked worriedly. She remembered how much she had hurt Dhasca not too long ago, and was already angry at the possibility that someone else could do it to her.

Dhasca sat quietly, bunching her knees to her chest, at least as far as they would go, thinking deeply. "No, he said as queen, I have complete freedom. I can go and do as I please, and apparently love whomever I please."

She looked out in the direction where the king had walked away. "And, so long as you marry him and live in his castle, you'd have all this freedom?" Nilmini asked.

The princess nodded. "And I would have to have his children."

Nilmini nodded absent-mindedly. "Right, there's that. But...we could finally be together this way."

"Are you saying I should take this offer?" she asked.

Nilmini shrugged. "Well, what do you think of it all."

To be honest, Dhasca wasn't sure herself. Like Nilmini had said, it was pretty much an open opportunity for them to be together...mostly. She would have her freedom from her father. Then again, there was the nature of life at the palace, at least what the king described. Sure, she didn't have to subject herself to it, and Nilmini could still have an outlet for her interests even if Dhasca didn't, but it felt...strange. She felt like this was all too easy, like it was a trap of some sort. "I want to hear what you think first," Dhasca said, "and then I shall decide."
1212232221223.title: On One Condition

choices: Her father insists on an elven wedding in the Verge.
The king wants a traditional wedding at the palace.
Dhasca chooses to honor all requests, and have small weddings in both places.
12122322212231.content:
Nilmini sighed, wondering if this was the right decision. Gods knew Araris didn't bless her with the gift of wisdom. She just hoped she wouldn't regret it. "I think you should take him up on the offer," she blurted out.

Dhasca raised an eyebrow, but said nothing else, waiting to hear the rationale behind the decision. Nilmini tried gathering her thoughts and continued. "I mean, this way we'd get to be together, and your father would never have to know. We'd get to have a family...sort of. And the guy's pretty much offering total freedom."

The princess listened carefully, and Nilmini knew a few times that there were some objections she was ready to voice. Still, she pondered herself, knowing that even with her lover's advice, this wasn't going to be easy. "Is that what you want to do," Dhasca asked hesitantly, "just settle?"

Nilmini reached for her hands, clasping them in hers. "Think of it as settling down, with you. That's all we've ever wanted, isn't it?"

It was true. Ever since that first time she had kissed Nilmini, she knew that all she wanted was to be with her, happy and on their own. She wouldn't have cared if they were living together in a hut in the middle of the forest so long as she was with the woman she loved. And yes, somewhere in the back of her mind she knew that no matter what they would've done, there were still the old ways, and her father would've kept with tradition. They never would've had that dream here. Still... "But, it wouldn't be, at least not completely," Dhasca said. "I'd still have to share you with...him."

"It's not like you're going to fall in love with him, are ya?"

The princess shook her head at such a ridiculous notion. Nilmini continued. "See, then there's nothing to worry about. Besides, he's just using you as a means to an end, so I say why not do him the same courtesy? How else are we going to have a family?"

She was resting a hand on Dhasca's middle, as if she were already with child. Dhasca wasn't going to lie, she really had thought about something like this. Ever since they were young, Nilmini always told Dhasca she would make a great mother, and she had thought she would like the idea. Nilmini could already read her. "And, of course, who's going to take care of you and make sure you are absolutely comfortable through your pregnancy?"

Dhasca rolled her eyes. "I can already see where this is going. I suppose that won't be all bad. And I suppose I had better get used to that. I have a feeling the food at the castle is going to be quite filling."

She knew she was pushing all the right buttons with Nilmini right now, and was enjoying every minute of making her squirm, wanting to undress her right there in the halls. Nilmini tried to stay focused. "Um...yeah, yeah, I guess so. So, you'll do it?"

The princess nodded. "It could be our best chance. If he really means what he says and is willing to do anything to have me, I think we can make this work in our favor."

XXX

Dhasca had played her hand well, and kept from giving an official answer until her guests' stay neared its end. No point in angering some of the other suitors, especially the raucous satyrs. Still, that entire time, the king had a look on his face as if he knew he had won.

She still wasn't sure what to make of him. On one hand, there was something kind in him, a part of him that made him so charismatic and charming. He genuinely wanted to see people happy. On the other hand, there was something, not dark necessarily, but wild. It was like looking at a ferocious jungle cat; beautiful and elegant on the surface, but wild and hungry in its true nature. It was something she considered both exciting, and frightening at the same time.

Yet she could put it off no longer. The king's party were getting close to leaving, and she had to tell her father of her decision.

She found him in his chambers. "Ah, Dhasca, my beautiful little flower, come in," he greeted jovially.

She took a deep breath, knowing that there was no turning back now. "Father, I wanted to talk to you about our guests."

He nodded. "An odd bunch, I assure you, but it was nice to have some open communication with them. I hope we can form some stronger alliances with some of them in the future."

"That is sort of what I wanted to talk about."

Her father's eyebrows raised in surprise, but also in excitement. Was he about to hear what he had been waiting to hear for so long? Heart thundering in her chest, she just said it. "I think I have found a future husband."

The king let out a whoop of pure joy, and picked her up gleefully, soon realizing that his daughter was a tad heavier than he remembered. "This is fantastic! Who is he?"

"King Roland," she said softly, surprised she was voicing it aloud.

His eyes lit up even more. "Oh, that is just wonderful, Dhasca! You know, he is a shrewd man, but he certainly is determined. I rather liked him myself. You are sure?"

Dhasca nodded. "Yes, he has been nothing but kind, and truly wants me to be happy with him at his palace."

That was when her father's face fell a little. "Oh..." was all he said at first. "Yes, that would mean you would have to go there, now wouldn't it?"

Her heart broke a little hearing his disappointment at that realization. "Oh, daddy, it won't be all that bad. He tells me that the palace is quite wonderful, and he will see to it that I'm comfortable there. I doubt I will want for anything." She knew that was more than true.

"But, you are to be the future queen here. What will-"

She hugged him fiercely. "You're not going to die all that soon," she said. "You're still young, father. If anything else perhaps one of my brothers could, or maybe the king already has plans for one of our children to."

"Children?"

She laughed. "Well, not yet anyway, but he is eager to start a family. He has no heirs of his own."

Her father scratched his beard. While this was something he had wanted greatly for his daughter, he had never expected how hard it would be, especially now that he knew he was going to lose her. "Is this what you truly want, my beautiful little flower?"

"Of course, father."

"Very well then," he said. "I shall speak with him at once to start making arrangements."
12122322212231.title: An Engagement

choices: The king has his welcoming feast to celebrate his new queen.
Dhasca decides to try the hot springs below the castle.
Dhasca wants to take in the sights of the city first.
121223222122311.content:
Dhasca had, of course, been invited to sit in on her father's discussions with King Roland about her upcoming marriage. On the whole, she found it a rather dull affair. It was mostly the two of them hammering out the details of what their alliance would entail. As he had desired, the king was getting his chance to mine for some gold in the verge unmolested by the elves, provided he still maintained some effort to not disrupt the natural order in the area. The marriage also united their territory in the east with his kingdom, meaning future heirs could rule the Verge as lords and vassals to the future king, as Roland hoped she would soon produce.

In exchange, the elves would be receiving a steady supply of crops from Adinah as well as the aid of human healers to aid them in the disease epidemic. Dhasca was thankful for that. If anything, this marriage was actually helping her people. "And have you considered where to conduct the ceremony?" her father asked, finishing the discussion.

King Roland looked to Dhasca and smiled. She had to give him credit; he played the part pretty well. They had both agreed to faking some element of happiness and harboring feelings for each other. Through this entire meeting, he had been holding her hand. "What did you have in mind, your grace?" he asked politely.

"Well, I am to understand that you will be leaving with her for your palace soon. I was hoping that we might conduct a more 'traditional' ceremony, or at least traditional for us, here."

The king was still getting used to elven customs. "Could you elaborate. I'm most certain I do not know what an elven wedding is like."

Dhasca chose to answer. "It's really a small, intimate affair," she said. "A priest performs a small binding ceremony and then the couple are sent to the woods alone to plant a birch tree to ask Yva to bless the marriage, and..." She blushed, remembering the last and most important part of this ceremony. "And, well, the couple consummate their union there."

His eyes widened in delight and curiosity at the thought of it. Thinking for a moment, he finally said. "I rather like this idea myself, more symbolic than anything we have. I would be honored to participate in such a ceremony. We will perhaps have a small welcoming feast back at the palace, but nothing too grand."

He winked at the princess. It was just as well, she thought, and the king probably knew it too. Neither of them had told her father about the king's other interests or the women that inhabited the palace. It was probably best that they did not have the wedding in Adinah. "Wonderful," her father said. "Since that is the case, we can arrange things as soon as tomorrow evening at sunset."

The reality of all this was starting to set in for Dhasca. She was really about to do it. She was really going to marry this man. She took a deep breath, reminding herself why she was doing this: to be with Nilmini. "Terrific," King Roland said. "I don't know if I could spend another day apart from my beautiful bride, isn't that right, my dear."

"Of course," Dhasca said through clenched teeth. All for Nilmini, she had to keep reminding herself.

XXX

"This is actually rather peaceful," King Roland said, listening to the quiet sounds of the night's wildlife in the forest. They had just finished planting the tree sapling and he had chosen to rest on a nearby rock. Dhasca had remained incredibly silent, both through the ceremony, and this. The whole time, all she could think about was what was coming next. "Yes, it is always very nice out here in the evenings," she said absent-mindedly.

He cocked his head, studying her intently. "You know, we don't have to do this," he said, startling her.

"Don't have to do what?" she asked.

He smiled. "You know, consummate the marriage out here. Don't get me wrong, the idea of being in the outdoors for this sort of thing is rather exciting, I know this is something that makes you uncomfortable. You've never been with a man before, have you?"

"No, only with Nilmini."

"I respect that," he said. "You are very true to your lover. So, let us just enjoy a peaceful night here."

He leaned back against the rock, his hands resting behind his head. Dhasca had been undoing her braids, letting herbrown hair cascade over her shoulders. She was rather surprised by this. "You mean, you're just willing to sleep out here, and that's all?"

"Sure, why not?"

"Well, but how are we to..."

He sat up, looking her square in the eyes. "Yes, all in due time, those things will happen. But, I'd like you to come to it in your own way. I'm not going to force you. Take all the time you need, though try to come around to it before I get too old." He chuckled at the last bit, that gleam coming to his eyes again.

She thought, knowing that if not now, then she would never get comfortable with the idea. "It is still a tradition, and I'd hate to waste a good night like this. If this is to be my future, I would rather start now."

He scooted closer to her. "I am a man of my word, princess, or perhaps I should get used to calling you my queen. Anything you desire, I shall gladly oblige." He slowly began to reach for her dress to begin removing it.

XXX

Not a couple days later, the king had gathered his party, and had Dhasca's things packed to head back to the palace. Her father had agreed when she explained the need to have Nilmini around for a healer. Besides, he would rather trust a midwife he knew to care for his daughter than just any random human.

The king rode in the carriage with the two elves, passing the time by describing human customs and mannerisms, trying to get his new queen used to her new life at the palace. "You will find a great many things to suit any need you might have, my queen," he explained. "As I have mentioned, the food itself is quite exquisite."

Dhasca sighed, rather bored with the idea now. "Still, there are several other things that may interest you. There is a hot springs located just below the castle. There are several warm pools just in the cellar, and I have quite a collection of scented oils which may be added to the waters. You will also find that Bosch Keep has a rich history, and the temples in Adinah are quite an architectural delight. My castle is now yours, my queen. Feel free to take in any and all of these pleasures offered to you."

She could see the edges of the city in the distance. She couldn't believe it. This was to be her new home.
121223222122311.title: An Elven Wedding

choices: Nilmini is struck with temptation when the king visits Dhasca one night.
Dhasca learns it's harder to be queen than she thought.
The king starts getting a little more than intimate with Dhasca.
1212232221223112.content:
Dhasca traipsed down the stone stairs of the castle to take a dip in the hot springs below. After a long few days of travel all the way to Adinah, she needed to relax and rest.

The city was something else, and she had Nilmini had been impressed with the sheer size of it. There were buildings everywhere. They couldn't believe so many humans could live so close to each other. Back in the Verge, elves lived fairly spread out from each other, ensuring everyone had their necessary space. Here, everyone was jam-packed into the streets.

Some of the buildings were incredibly beautiful, such as the various temples the king pointed out. Some of the areas were a bit more unsavory. The streets there were grimy and filled with some frightening looking figures.

The princess, now queen, made it all the way down and let out a gasp when she saw the springs. They were simply gorgeous. The pools of water were large and inviting looking. The waters bubbled with warmth, and there seemed to be a certain luminescence of the water that gave the area a blue-green glow.

Dhasca disrobed and stepped into one of the warm pools. She sighed contently and leaned back to enjoy the bathing session.

The biggest surprise of all was the palace itself. It was bigger than she had imagined. Upon entering, the first thing she noticed was the immense great hall with its large tables, perfect for holding feasts with many guests. There were rooms upon rooms as they walked past the hall. Dhasca couldn't even begin to count them all.

It was Nilmini who spotted one first. She came to a halt in the middle of the hall and stared with her mouth agape into one of the rooms. When Dhasca caught up to her, she saw her too. It was a woman, covered in shimmering blue scales, laying in a water tank in the middle of the floor. But seeing a merfolk for the first time wasn't what surprised them. It was the sheer size of the woman. She was a huge blob of pillowy fat, laying in her tank, content and blissful, as a line of servants brought her endless helpings of food.

King Roland only winked at the two of them, and guided them on. That was when they finally got to see her own quarters. It was bigger than her father's wooden halls, and was built as if it were a separate home onto itself. There were cozy sleeping quarters, an ornate living quarters with a warm stove burning in the corner, and even a sort of dining area where the queen could take her meals if she did not wish to dine in the great hall.

"I hope everything is to you liking," the king had said.

"It's wonderful," Dhasca said.

"It's amazing!" Nilmini said ecstatically.

King Roland smiled. "I'm glad you are comfortable here. I'll let you two get settled in, and please, call for one of my servants if you need anything."

That had been earlier that evening. Dhasca was now glad to get a chance to just enjoy it all. The warm water felt so good against her skin, and helped to relax any sore muscles.

She heard someone approaching from behind her, and she tried to cover herself before they could see. Though she knew she would have to get used to the idea of having servants, she wasn't exactly ready for them to know her that intimately just yet.

Instead, a familiar body splashed into the water with her. "Great idea," Nilmini said. "This place is amazing. It's got everything."

"Gee, I'd almost think you were in love," Dhasca said.

"Well, it's going to take some getting used to, but I think I really could like all this."

"Uh huh, and you're sure it doesn't have to do with some of the women you've seen around here?"

Her lover shrugged her off. "Oh, come on. You know I love only you. It's just...different, you know? I mean, I never realized that there were other people who...you know, liked the same kind of thing I do."

Dhasca only gave her a bit of a half smile. Nilmini scooted closer to her. "I guess, since we don't have to worry about your dad trying to marry you off, we don't have to go through with that plan anymore, right?"

She blushed, and eventually met her lover's eyes. "Well, we don't have to put a stop to it," she said, smiling coyly.

Nilmini became excited. "Really? You want to? Look, don't get me wrong, I'd love that, but I don't want to make you feel like we have to."

"No, I...I want to. I'm still getting used to it, but I want to try. It's something special to you, and it's made things interesting for us. And, I don't know, I'm starting to kind of...like it."

"Really? You mean it?"

Dhasca nodded. "Yeah, it's kind of nice getting to eat what I want without having to worry. You really spoil me when we're doing it. And, some days..." She took Nilmini's hands in hers and put them to her rounded hips. "It feels nice."

Her lover got even closer to her, wrapping her in a passionate embrace and kissing her. "Well, alright then!"

She laughed before getting Nilmini under control. "But...I have a few rules."

"Anything."

"I want to still be able to walk. I'm not getting that big."

Nilmini nodded eagerly. "Of course. I'm not going to put you in that kind of situation."

"And second, let's take this nice and easy. I want to enjoy this with you."

"Absolutely."

The two elves bobbed in the water for several more minutes, just enjoying each other's company. Eventually, Nilmini had her own issues to voice. "So...what was it like?"

Dhasca looked at her confused. "What?"

Nilmini gave her a coy look. "You know...being with the king? Look, I know it's kinda something you have to do as part of this deal and all, but I know you two have already been trying for heirs. What's it like?"

She laughed. "It's different, that's for sure. I guess it's one of those things where my body knows that that's what it's supposed to do, but it's not as nice as when I'm with you. With you, it's like it was meant to be. You're not jealous are you?"

Nilmini tried to laugh it off. "Me? Jealous? No way! I mean, yeah, it's frustrating that we have to put up with that to have all this, but it's a necessary evil and all."

"You know, there are going to be some nights where he's going to be coming to my chambers. Are you going to be alright with that?"

She shrugged. "Sure, I'll find something else to do. It's a big castle."

Dhasca looked down, looking as uncomfortable as possible. "Are you...are you going to take up the king's offer to...you know...with some of his women?"

"What? Dhasca, I..."

She took a deep breath before saying her next sentence. "Because, it's okay if you do."

"What?"

"Look, I shouldn't expect you to not want to. I mean, I have to conceive heirs with the king. It isn't fair for me to expect you to have to endure that completely alone."

Nilmini held her close. "You're sure you're okay with that? Don't get me wrong, I've thought about it."

"Sure, it's not like you're doing anything too intimate with them. You deserve a little companionship while I attend to...queenly matters."

Nilmini kissed her. "You are the best thing ever. Dhasca, I love you and only you. You have nothing to worry about."

"Thanks."

She raised her eyebrows. "So...how about we make this bath a little more intimate," Nilmini said, reaching for Dhasca.
1212232221223112.title: Things are Heating Up

choices: Nilmini is lonely. She decides to stay and feed Margery.
Nilmini doesn't feel right about this, but it's better than nothing.
Nilmini can't go through with it. She's true only to Dhasca.
12122322212231121.content:
"You have the cutest little tummy," Nilmini murmured as the two elves lay cuddling in bed. "I'm thinking about asking for something sweet from the kitchens. I know you like your sweets."

Over the past several weeks, the two had settled into their new life in the palace. For most of the time, they had Dhasca's living quarters to themselves and could do as they pleased. Dhasca was the one who had settled in the most. Ever since deciding to share in her lover's interest, she had gotten considerably bigger. She had widened out a bit and was starting to look rather plump. Course, by this point, every part of her had a little extra padding to it. She loved it the most when Nilmini would cuddle with her, feeling all those extra inches.

"Well..." Dhasca started to say, rather pleased with the prospect of having something sweet to eat.

A knock at the door interrupted them. "Gods daminit!" Nilmini said in a frustrated sigh. "Not again."

The new queen gave her lover an apologetic look and sighed before getting up to answer it. As usual, there was the king waiting with his casual grin. "Really? Again? Tonight?"

He stepped into the room and kissed her cheek. "Yes, tonight. I intend to put an heir in you before the year's up. That is part of our arrangement, you know."

"I haven't forgotten." She huffed and went to Nilmini, kissing her forehead. "I'm sorry," she said. "I promise I'll make it up."

Her lover tried to pretend not to care and shrugged it off. "Yeah, I understand. I'll just go explore for a few. I haven't checked out the west wing yet."

She slipped out of the room, letting her eyes linger on Dhasca for as long as she could before the door shut behind her. She hated this! She hated having to share her with the king. She knew it wasn't Dhasca's fault, and that they had agreed to this to have their wonderful life here, but she hated it.

Oh, sure, Dhasca would find a way to make it up to her, but usually after one of those nights, she was too tired to do much of anything. Slowly, the king was taking her away one night at a time.

In the meantime, Nilmini had to find something to do. She hated that the most: finding something to occupy her time and keep her mind off of what was going on in their own bed. At least this way, Nilmini had gotten familiar with the castle.

Still the temptation was there. The king had offered, Dhasca had said she wouldn't mind it, and she was feeling pretty down. Maybe she would just see what was available.

Nilmini turned down the hall where she knew the concubines lived. She had heard several of the rumors among the servants. She knew which women were finicky and needy, and therefore best to avoid. She peeked into one room, and gasped when she saw the woman within who gave her a charming smile.

She was a human woman wearing a blue lady-in-waiting's dress, but most shocking of all was how immense she was. The woman's gargantuan gut bulged out and rested on her monstrous thighs, quivering and shaking with every one of her labored breaths. Labored breaths? All she was doing was just sitting there on a gigantic couch. Just how big was she, Nilmini wondered. Her pillowy arms rested on her belly, massaging it with pudgy sausage fingers. Her face was full and round with many chins, giving her a pouty, yet pleasant face.

The woman laughed, her round cheeks and many chins shaking with mirth. "Are you lost?" she asked.

"Um...I'm...I was just wondering if maybe you were hungry?"

Nilmini grimaced as she realized how stupid she must've sounded. All it took was one massive woman who only reached sizes in her fantasies, and she was reduced to a babbling idiot.

The woman only smiled. "Oh, yes, you must be the new queen's paramour. The king mentioned you. He said you might be by to visit."

She motioned for Nilmini to sit across from her, and she nodded to one of the servants to bring them refreshments. The elf wasn't sure what to say next. She found herself suddenly at a loss for words. The woman seemed to take control of the conversation. "I'm Margery by the way," she said.

"Um, Nilmini," she answered, finding her voice. "He...mentioned me?"

"Well, yes, the queen has been the talk of the castle recently. Not all of it's good though."

"Oh?"

"Well, think about it. She married the king, making her the official queen. She gets all the benefits of such a title. And any of her children will be legitimate heirs. Any children we have with him will get nothing."

That made sense, Nilmini thought. She hadn't realized how this would affect the rest of the people in the palace. Then another thought occurred to her. "Wait, you have children with him?"

She laughed again. "Me, no. I mean, I have two of my own, but they weren't through him. Ever since I became one of his women, though, he's seen to it that they are well taken care of."

"Um, how did you end up here, if I may ask?"

Margery's face turned to blissful nostalgia. "Well, believe it or not, I used to be a servant here in the castle. I actually used to serve the former queen. Anyway, the king always sees to it that all of his castle is well-fed, and well, certain results happen because of it, some of us more than others." She patted her massive gut for emphasis. "Anyway, after a while, I just got too big to get around like I used to. Thankfully, I was one of the pretty ones. So, the king let me stay here, and he's seen to everything I would need ever since."

The servants had brought several trays laden with food in that time. Nilmini was still unsure about what she should be doing right now. This was her first time trying to do this with anyone other than Dhasca.

"But, I've gone on about myself too much. Why are you here so late at night?"

She sighed, hating to admit it. "Dhasca is with the king. They're...they're..."

Margery nodded as much as her fat neck would allow. "I understand, and you're probably incredibly lonely right now. You don't want to have to spend the night alone."

She nodded with a guilty look on her face. Margery tried to put her at ease. "So, tell me a little about yourself. We've never had elves here before."

"Um...there's not much too tell. We're really a lot like you. I mean, we look the same and everything, kinda." Maybe that was why she was so drawn to Margery and not one of the other concubines like the merfolk. It was something familiar that she could get used to.

Margery could tell she was struggling for conversation, and tried to change the subject. "Well, tell me about this new queen we have. What's she like? I know some of the other women already hate her. Vuko's on a rampage about it. I want to give her a chance, though."

Nilmini smiled, thinking about her. Thinking about Dhasca always put her in a good mood. "She's the most wonderful woman I know. She's sweet and kind. She's funny. And she's incredibly cute, even when she's angry with me. She's shy sometimes, but once Dhasca opens up, she's the most amazing person."

She smiled knowingly. "She sounds wonderful," she said. "You must be really lucky to have her."

"Yeah..."

Margery then smiled seductively. "Well, let's not just sit here. You're here to feed me, aren't you?"

Nilmini had almost forgotten. Margery was just so easy to talk to. Still, she didn't feel that sure about what she was about to do. Was she really about to do this to someone other than Dhasca? Even though it wasn't cheating, it still felt like it. But, then again, the king was taking Dhasca away from her more and more. She needed companionship of some kind.

The elf took a forkful of food in her hand, taking a deep breath. Was she really about to commit to this?
12122322212231121.title: Only the Lonely

choices: I...I don't hear anything, Dhasca.
I think I hear a heartbeat!
Wait...two heartbeats?
121223222122311213.content:
Nilmini opened the door to her and Dhasca's chambers with as much stealth as could be mustered. Just as she had suspected, Dhasca was fast asleep on the bed, too tired after having entertained the king for an evening. She actually felt sorry for her lover. She was just the poor soul being used in all of this.

She slid into bed quietly, snuggling close to Dhasca, and wrapping one of her arms around her rounded waist. The queen stirred a bit. "You're back late," she said groggily.

She smiled weakly. Nilmini wasn't exactly proud of herself right now. "Yeah..." she said. "I, uh...went exploring and you know..."

Dhasca sighed. "I told you I wouldn't be mad. If that was something you wanted to do, I wasn't going to stop you. So, who did you find?"

"Her name was Margery. I guess she was a former servant here before she got too big. But look, I didn't go through with it, okay? I wanted to. I mean, it's not like I was in love with her or anything. But, I don't know...I just couldn't. It just doesn't feel the same with someone else."

She raised an eyebrow in surprise. "Feeding? How?"

Nilmini shrugged. "I don't know. It's something special, to me, to us, you know? It just didn't feel right with anyone else. I love you, Dhasca. And this is something I like doing with you. It would just be cheating if it was with anyone else."

Dhasca chuckled and kissed her. "You're silly. But, I love you for it. I actually kind of appreciate you not doing it. I don't know why, but I kind of think of this as something special between us too."

"I'm glad you're starting to like this. You're actually starting to get pretty big. I love how soft you are now."

She smiled. "Well, I did promise you I'd make it up. Maybe I'll have a nice breakfast prepared for us."

"You're the best!" Nilmini kissed her neck and went back to snuggling with her.

Dhasca however, still seemed to have a lot on her mind. "You know he'll leave us alone once I can get pregnant."

"I know, and I don't blame you for this. I mean, I'm kinda the one who said we should do this. I promise, I'll be more understanding."

* * *


Over the next several weeks, the two elves found ways to cope with their situation. Nilmini tried to be patient, and Dhasca had to keep hoping for the best.

All the while, the queen continued to grow rounder. She wanted to make her time with Nilmini count, and that often came in the form of their meals, where her lover would encourage her to eat more each time, and to try new dishes, which the kitchen staff told her was especially fattening.

The king had taken a liking to these changes as well, and even had his new queen weighed, much like he did with his other concubines. She was nearing close to thirteen stone now, and her rounded belly and bottom were clearly where most of these changes were going.

Still, Nilmini was starting to notice other changes in her lover. Today, she kept noticing Dhasca nodding off during the king's latest meeting with a lord from the north. As queen, she occasionally had to attend to these meetings between nobles to provide a good image for the king. However, Dhasca also proved helpful during these moments as well. She was insightful and wise, and often could make good suggestions when the king and his guest would sometimes come near to blows. That came with her training to be future leader of the elves, making her a suitable choice for queen.

Today was different. Dhasca seemed incredibly out of it, and several times, she had actually drifted into a deep sleep. Nilmini was worried about her. She knew she and the king had had some late nights, but this didn't look good.

When the king and the lord had finally departed, Nilmini had to shake Dhasca awake. "Huh, what?" she said sleepily.

"You fell asleep again," Nilmini said with a worried look. "Are you feeling alright?"

Dhasca yawned. "Yes, I've just been incredibly tired lately. But, I don't understand; I've been sleeping just fine."

Nilmini tried to call on as much of her healing abilities as she thought about the cause. But one set of alarm bells went off for her. "Anything else wrong? Have you been feeling sick at all?"

She thought for a second. "A little, but nothing too terrible. Some of the human dishes haven't been agreeing with my stomach."

She got a wide, ear to ear grin. "I don't think that's it at all," she said.

At first, Dhasca was confused, but eventually, she was able to read Nilmini's reaction. "You don't think...?"

She nodded. "Let's take a listen, shall we?"

Among one of the best attributes of the elves were their ears. They could hear wild game miles away, but it was also useful in another way. Elves knew of their pregnancies far sooner than other races because they could hear the child's heartbeat at the first suspicion that something might be up.

Dhasca smiled too, and opened her outer robe to the loose dress below. Nilmini knelt down, pressing her ear to her lover's stomach. For several anxious breaths, the two of them waited, Dhasca waiting for an answer, Nilmini listening for results. At last, Nilmini let out a small gasp.

"What is it?" Dhasca asked with a mix of worry and excitement.
121223222122311213.title: True Love

choices: Vuko begins her plot against the queen
Dhasca spends more time with Roland and Nilmini feels lonely
1212232221223112133.content:
"I hear two heartbeats!" commented Nilmini with a gasp.

"Two? Are you sure you heard well?" asked Dhasca.

"Trust me, I know what I heard. There were two heartbeats."

"So that means..."

"Yup, you're having twins," replied Nilmini, stroking gently the princess', now queen’s, belly.

Nilmini was sad and happy at the same time; happy because she was glad that her loving Dhasca was becoming a mother, but was sad because these were Dhasca and the king's children. As she stroked the belly with one hand, she closed the other one in a fist as a little fit of rage.

Nilmini took a deep breath and asked, "Aren't you happy?"

Dhasca nodded with a small smile but wasn't quite sure of that. Now what would she do? Was it better to inform the king immediately, as sooner or later he would find out anyway, or wait some more? She wasn't quite sure of how he would react. He still hadn't had a son, therefore an heir, right? At the same time, she couldn’t help but already feel love for the two little lives she carried within her.

------

It didn't take long. That evening, Dhasca and Roland had a walk in the large garden of the castle.
Dhasca liked that garden a lot. It reminded her of the Verge, with large trees and bushes that formed a large path. During that walk, the King noticed that something was strange about his wife, and when he asked, Dhasca immediately let it slip that she was pregnant.

Hearing these words, a large smile appeared on King Roland's face, and he hugged her.

"This is wonderful news," yelled Roland while pinching Dhasca's love handles, making the elf even more uncomfortable. "We have to inform all the kingdom and make a big feast to celebrate."

"Wait" said Dhasca. "Don't you think it's a bit too early to tell everyone?" True, elves could know that much sooner, but that always made it harder when things did go wrong in the early stages. The loss only hurt worse when an elven woman discovered there was no longer that steady heartbeat in her womb. Dhasca didn’t want to make it worse by telling many people, and wanted to be sure everything was fine.

Roland thought about it for a moment. "That's fine, but we shall still have a feast. You don't look very well, and I'm sure that a great lunch will help you," said the king while stroking Dhasca's chin.

"Besides, a pregnant woman must be well-fed for the welfare of the baby," added Roland patting Dhasca's belly before leaving.

------

So there was a large feast for the queen. A large banquet was held and Dhasca was encouraged to eat by the king, while Nilmini looked on at a distance, waiting for the feast to end so she could have some time with her lover. She didn't like how Roland was looking at Dhasca; she was too jealous, and feared that with the pregnancy she would receive even more attention from him, meaning less time for her to be with Dhasca.

At the moment, no one at court knew the exact reason of the feast. The cooks simply received the orders to immediately prepare a very large lunch worthy of the greatest ruler, while the servants speculated among themselves.

Some thought was a way to make the queen fatter faster (which was partially true), others that the king was sick and wanted to enjoy his last days, others that the queen was envious of the concubines and King Roland was trying to make her forgive him. Still, there was someone at court who guessed the truth...

In one of the fanciest room of the castle, Kimiko was enjoying her own little feast. She was a half-kitsune, with orange hair, and a very prominent gut that she got from her father. The teenaged hybrid was eating some of the pastries that laid on a large tray in front of her, while she was leaned on her bed.

"Hey, Hadrik," started the half-kitsune toward the nice-looking servant, "don't you think this dress suits me?" She put another pastry in her mouth.

The poor servant gave a quick glance at the orange dress, which was highlighting all her curves, and simply nodded in response.

Kimiko tried to toy with him. "What is it? Cat's got your tongue?" But this was suddenly interrupted by the slam of the door.

In the room, came a very fat Kitsune with fiery red hair, and tails that moved behind her large rump. She was Vuko, one of the first concubines of the King, who certainly thought she was practically the queen.

"Mom, I was having fun," protested the girl as the servant scurried out of the room.

"Well, now is not the time to be playing childish games. There a huge problem," replied Vuko, sitting next to the table, eyeing with greed the delicious pastries.

The kitsune began to eat with terrible table matters, leaving stains of creams all around her. Kimiko managed to save a couple of pastries and stand back in a corner to not be stained.

While devouring the goods, Vuko said, "Do you know that there's a feast for the queen?"

Kimiko, with her mouth full, nodded.

"And do you know why they're suddenly having one?"

Kimiko shook her head.

"Well, it's because that bitch it's pregnant," said Vuko while slamming her fist on the table. "It just has to be. I've never liked her; how could she steal the position of the king's favorite woman?"

"I know you don't like her, but why is her being pregnant a problem?" asked Kimiko before shoving her last pastry in her mouth

"Please, use your brain for once. What is the difference between a concubine and a queen?"

No answer came from Kimiko.

Vuko sighed. "The queen is officially married. Therefore, any child she'll have will be the future prince or princess."

This time Kimiko's eyes widened. "Does this mean that..."

"Yes" replied Vuko bluntly, "you're not the future princess anymore."

"But I'm the king's oldest daughter," protested the girl, beginning to cry.

"It doesn't matter; the queen's child comes first."

"So, does this mean I'm not a princess?"

"Yes, unless we make the king change his mind about his queen, and I've got an idea," replied Vuko with a grin full of cream.
1212232221223112133.title: Two heirs are better than one

12122322212231121332.content:
Needless to say, it was not an easy pregnancy for Dhasca. The sickness hit her hard. There wasn't a day that went by where she didn't end up in bed, too weakened by illness. Nilmini did her best to try and comfort her through all of it, but it proved hard. True, she was skilled in healing arts, but there were a lot of unknowns in this situation, since she had never dealt with a half-elf pregnancy before.

"You really need to eat something," Nilmini said, sitting beside Dhasca on the bed. She tried to find some humor in the situation. "And I'm not saying that to make you fatter." She rubbed her hand up and down her lover's hip.

She smiled weakly. "I know, but I'm still not feeling well right now. The two of you are really not making this easy." She put a hand on her lower belly. She tried to sit up. "I can try, though."

But before Nilmini could bring her the meager meal, the doors to their chambers burst open, and the king strode in. "And how is the mother of my future heirs today?" he asked with glee.

This was perhaps the most annoying part of it all. The two elves had been convinced that King Roland would leave them alone once Dhasca had gotten pregnant. Instead, it seemed to be his invitation to never leave the queen alone. He was constantly checking on her, having royal physicians measure her progress, and just being around almost all the time. It irritated the both of them to no end.

Dhasca sighed, not feeling up to trying to fight him off right now. "Fine," she said, "just a bit ill is all."

"Poor thing," he said, stroking her hair. Dhasca pulled away, but he seemed to take no notice. "I'm sure you will be well again soon enough."

Nilmini couldn't understand it. She knew the king was fully aware where her lover's heart lay. Yet, here he was, giving them no peace. She often wondered that even if he knew Dhasca couldn't love him, he had still developed feelings for her. Then again, as she had learned from the gossip among the servants and concubines, the king had lost his first wife and child in childbirth. Perhaps it did have him on edge, making him worry so. Still, it was annoying.

That didn't change the fact that it still felt incredibly isolating. Dhasca tried her best to get him to leave or to ignore him, but he was persistent, and always hovered close by. This left both of them feeling pretty lonely. Nilmini would often disappear, mostly to keep herself from getting angry. She was afraid of what would happen the day she couldn't hold her tongue with the king...or Dhasca. She knew it wasn't her fault, but sometimes, she did take the frustration out on her, and Nilmini knew that now especially was not the time for that. Dhasca was in a very fragile place right now. She was dealing with a pregnancy for the first time, trying to balance her relationship with the king and her, and her emotions were probably all over the place right now. If anything, she was probably scared, most of all, and Nilmini had to try her best to be supportive, but the king's advances toward her lover made that extremely difficult.

But, it was Dhasca who spoke up to defend herself. "I think all I need is plenty of rest," she said, "without you watching all the time. It doesn't put me at ease at all, and I don't think such stress is good for the little ones."

The king's face fell a little. "Oh...I see."

"I am in good hands," she said, nodding over to where Nilmini was standing. "Nilmini will see to it that I'm well cared for, I promise. But, you promised me something as well. You said that I will have the freedom to be with her as the woman I love. And right now, I require that love, but I can't with you always around. These are your heirs, I guarantee you that, but you have to let me handle it my way."

She was polite, but firm in her words. The king gave her a tight but earnest smile. "Of course, my queen," he said. "Indeed, I have promised you anything, and you shall have it. I worry is all." He kissed her forehead and left.

The two elves let out relieved sighs. "I don't think that's the last we'll see of him," Dhasca said, "but at least, he knows his boundaries."

"I guess," said Nilimini. "This...this whole thing isn't what I expected it to be."

She shook her head. "I know, it hasn't worked out the way I thought it would either. We just have to keep hoping it will all balance out. I want you to be as much a part of my children's lives as he is. This is our family too. But, we're just going to have to keep playing this back and forth until some kind of a resolution can be reached."

"I'd like that too. So...you still ready to try and eat something?"

Dhasca nodded eagerly. "Yes, when these two aren't making me sick to my stomach, they're making me feel as if I haven't eaten in weeks. Isn't that right?" She stroked the ever-so-slight curve of her stomach.
12122322212231121332.title: Love Isn't Easy

121223222122311213322.content:
Things didn't get any easier from there. It seemed that as the weeks passed, new challenges always presented themselves. As Dhasca got progressively rounder, she often had trouble judging her own size. Several times she had misjudged her bearings and bumped into a few things. Once, she had almost knocked over an expensive artifact balanced precariously on a podium. Of course, by the time she had figured out how to maneuver at her current size, she had grown another couple, repeating the process all over again.

And that was nothing compared to the pummeling her insides took. With twins came twice the activity, and often, the two fought each other for space. This left Dhasca feeling sore and exhausted after dealing with it all night. Though, that did result in one benefit. Constantly tired, Dhasca had resorted to little else other than trying to get some rest and eating to keep her strength up. Really, she was only halfway along, but she looked nearly due, between carrying two children and how much extra weight she had put on.

"If I had known this would have helped you gain weight, I would have been trying to find ways to get you pregnant sooner," Nilmini said jokingly as she took a loving pinch at her sides, which were significantly softer than from only a few weeks ago.

She didn't seem so amused. "Glad you're enjoying it."

"No, really, you look beautiful. I don't think I've ever seen you eat so much before, and it's really starting to show." She began letting her hands explore her lover's body.

"Mm, that does feel good," Dhasca purred, "but maybe try a little more here. They're starting to get especially restless." She placed Nilmini's hands on her belly, just as another sharp kick hit her. "Easy on your mother, okay?"

She laughed as she helped Dhasca quiet the little ones. "Well, you do have to realize, they are half the king's. They're probably going to be a bit...assertive."

"Oh, I hope they don't turn out too much like him. He can be nice, most of the time, but then he can be..."

"I know, but they're also half you. I think that's going to outweigh anything he brings to this. Plus, you know I'm going to help too, so hopefully, some of my good habits rub off on them."

She giggled. "Right now, I just might be able to outweigh the king."

"You're really driving me crazy right now."

* * *


Even though Nilmini did her best to keep Dhasca comfortable, there was no denying the fact that she was in a very uncomfortable place. She wondered what she could do to try and make things easier for her. She also knew that Dhasca was feeling pretty isolated in the castle. Very few of the other women wanted anything to do with her, and to their relief, the king had started to leave them alone. But, it still felt lonely.

An idea came to her a few weeks later. She was just finishing what was probably her second lunch for the day. Nilmini had to admit, the little ones did have their mother's appetite. "Everything okay?" she asked her.

The queen sighed. "It just feels so...I don't know, suffocating here. Don't get me wrong. This palace is incredible. I wouldn't trade any of this for anything, but it's just..."

"It's not the fresh air of home."

"Exactly!"

Nilmini beamed. "I've got it! Maybe we can visit the Verge. I'm sure your father would like to see you once before you become a mother, and I'm sure he'd be excited."

She thought it over. "Well, it would be nice. But, it is kind of a long trip, and I don't know how long I can last like this. And, what do you think he's going to say about me now?"

"Well, maybe not the most comfortable experience, but better to do it now than later. And, I don't think he'll mind either way. You look like you've been well taken care of."

"Maybe a little too well, but yes, I'd like that."

It was a perfect idea, Nilmini thought. Dhasca needed time away from the palace, needed to see her family. It would maybe take her mind off of all the unpleasant aspects of pregnancy, and it'd be just in time before she got so far along it would be impossible to travel. She quickly made the arrangements, though King Roland wasn't exactly thrilled with the idea. In fact, he hadn't really been in all that great of a mood since his queen told him off.

All the same, the two elves were able to arrange a small visit to the Verge, though they did have to take a few guards at the king's insistence. True, the ride wasn't exactly smooth, which succeeded in upsetting the twins into fits of kicking off and on, but they made it with no major issues.
121223222122311213322.title: Things stay difficult, but at least the king is...

choices: The king confronts Vuko. This is uncalled for!
The king orders for extra protection for Dhasca.
The king relents and tries to appease Vuko.

1212232221223112133224.content:
"Dhasca! My beautiful flower!" her father exclaimed when she first saw him.

She didn't realize that she would be so overcome with emotion when she entered the old halls for the first time since being married. Then again, that could've just been the hormones. She eagerly embraced her father, who clearly struggled to get his arms around her. He beamed when he first saw her.

"My goodness, just look at you. My little girl is now about to become a mother. Are you sure it was okay for you to come here? You look like you could be due any day now."

The queen shook her head. "No, not for a while. It's actually twins."

His smile got even wider. "Yva bless you! That's wonderful news. Your husband must be thrilled."

"Um, yeah, he's excited for his future heirs. I've missed you all so much."

"Well, you'll see your brothers soon enough. You know, your mother would be so proud of you right now." He gave her belly a pat. "Now, come, sit. You must be exhausted after that trip. I trust Nilmini has been seeing to your health during all of this. You are looking well, after all."

Dhasca snickered to herself. "Yes, she has been taking good care of me. And yes, Adinah is a city of plenty. I've never seen so many people in my life."

She proceeded to tell him of all the things she had seen in the capital city and the palace. She did neglect to mention the king's concubines, and how little she had really seen of the king. But he didn't seem to notice, and rather, he was fascinated by all that he heard.

"And, how have things been here?" Dhasca inquired.

Her father nodded. "Very well, in fact. Our alliance with the humans has proven to be beneficial. The disease epidemic has dropped dramatically. And, for the most part, they have been somewhat respectful. There may still be a few trust issues with the locals, but it's improving. But, we've got all of your visit to discuss these things. I had a welcome feast prepared when Nilmini sent word that you were coming."

This proved to be trickier than Dhasca had anticipated. True, she could get away with eating more than usual because of her pregnancy, but she didn't want to show the full extent of how much her appetite had increased, thanks to Nilmini. And, if she was being totally honest, compared to the feasts back at the palace, she was pretty sure she couldn't get away with even coming close to what she usually ate without drawing attention. What would have been a grand meal a couple of years ago, was now a rather quaint and simple dinner. She struggled to restrain herself.

To further add insult to injury, Dhasca had to once more, pretend she wasn't as close as she was with Nilmini. Her partner actually ended up having to go back to her own family in the village to sleep. Thus, as she lay in her bed that night, she felt empty inside.

But that was short lived. She heard a rustling outside her window, and before long, Nilmini was clambering through the window, a bag of extra food in hand. "Just like old times," she said with a grin.

Dhasca laughed. "I kind of miss those, you know." She pulled her closer for a kiss. "Now, where were we?"

Nilmini rummaged through the bag for a particularly sweet treat. "I think I know."

* * *


And so, that was how it went for her entire visit. Dhasca enjoyed spending time with her family once more. Her four brothers were eager to see her once more, and were overjoyed knowing they were soon to be uncles. And, it seemed that the visit did help take Dhasca's mind off of the minor inconveniences of her pregnancy. True, the little ones jostled and fought all the more as they needed more space, but at least she was able to take it in stride.

She was sad to go back, but she knew that the palace was where she belonged, and where she had the freedom to do as she pleased. "Thank you for this," she said to Nilmini as the carriage followed along the bumpy trails.

"I figured it would make you happy. Besides, you needed a little you-time before the little ones arrive."

Dhasca rubbed at the curve of her belly. "I hope I'm ready for this. Twins? I don't know if I can even handle one. Nilmini, what if I..."

She placed her hands over Dhasca's. "Look, I know it's just new-mother worries, and I'm not going to tell you it's going to be perfect. But, I do know one thing. You're going to be a good mother. These two are lucky to have you. Trust me, I've seen some of the king's other children. Their mothers hardly bother with them, and believe me when I say they didn't turn out the better for it. You're better than that because you're going to give those children all the love you could ever give."

Before Dhasca could answer, she heard a faint sound coming closer. An arrow shot through the carriage, piercing the seat behind Dhasca, only inches from her head. She ducked down as far as her body would allow her. Nilmini was beside her in an instant. "You okay?" she asked.

"Yeah," she gasped, her stomach heaving up and down with rapid breathing. "I...what was..."

"Just stay down. I'll go check on it." She helped Dhasca get laid down on the floor of the carriage to avoid further injury.

She and the rest of the guards, who had noticed the commotion fanned out, searching the forests nearby. They found no sign of the assailant. She returned back to Dhasca. "We're going to get back as soon as we can. Just stay down." She tried to stay calm, but her own heart was racing.

Upon their return, they told King Roland of the incident. He was busy examining the arrow. "I'm so sorry," Nilmini said. "I never meant for anything bad to happen like this. I don't even know where it came from."

"She's well?"

"Dhasca's fine, but a bit shaken up. The twins are still alright."

"Good." He then muttered to himself. "This steel was forged in the royal smith...Vuko." He wouldn't put it past his high-strung concubine to hire an assassin to take back what she believed to be hers.
1212232221223112133224.title: Something goes terribly wrong!

12122322212231121332242.content:
The solid wooden door shut behind them. Dhasca and Nilmini both grimaced with worry as they looked at the small, darkened room the king had ordered them to be moved to. It wasn't much: just a large, comfortable bed, a few sitting areas, and everything was dark. Even the windows had been covered.

"Why does it have to be so dark?" Dhasca asked.

Nilmini shrugged. "Don't know. It's kind of a tradition for this sort of thing."

Dhasca sighed and sat down on the bed. "We're prisoners now."

"No, no, nothing like that. Look, he's just worried about your safety and all. Trust me, I've learned a little about this 'confinement' thing. It's just a chance for you to get plenty of rest and to stay comfortable just before you give birth."

She crossed her arms. "But we can't leave. I'm pretty sure that's the definition of prisoners."

Nilmini sat beside her. "But we'll get to leave this room after you have the twins. It's not as bad as you think. Besides, where exactly did you have big plans on going right now?"

Dhasca rubbed her large, swollen middle. The twins were getting quite big...and heavy she thought. "Well, I don't want to go much of anywhere right now. Rolling over in bed is a chore anymore."

"See, it's perfectly fine."

"It's not fine! Nilmini, if he knew it was one of his concubines who tried to kill me, why hasn't he gotten rid of her? That would have been the sensible thing to do instead of locking me up in here."

"I don't know. You know him. He doesn't like giving up the things he likes. But look, we can make this work. Men aren't allowed in a woman's confinement chambers. It'll just be you and me for the next few weeks." She helped ease the elven queen onto the bed, stroking her middle all the while. "Just the two of us, no interruptions. How about something to eat? That usually makes you feel better."

After a few hours, Nilmini helped push the last bit of their meal past Dhasca's lips. She swallowed. "I don't think I could eat another bite," she said.

"Good, because that was all of it."

"You're kidding!"

Nilmini laughed. "Nope. You're really getting to where you can pack it away. I just can't get over how well you're growing." She took a handful of Dhasca's flabby lovehandles and squeezed. She couldn't get over how plush and soft the queen had become ever since moving into the palace. She still kept her delightfully plump pear shape, most of the weight settling into her round belly and hips, though her face was starting to look a little rounder these days. "Besides, you're what, nearly fifteen stone now. That's got to require quite an appetite to keep that figure up."

Dhasca laughed, letting her own hands run over her soft body. She was starting to enjoy the feel of it herself. It felt so wonderful to be loved and pampered in such a way. And she had to admit, she carried the weight well, she thought. It actually made her look more womanly, she thought.

Her lover was tracing circles on her side. "You know, we've never really talked about how far we want to go with this...how big you want to be that is."

"I did say I wanted to still be able to walk," Dhasca answered. "That gives us quite a bit of room to work with."

Nilmini smiled, an idea already coming to mind. "I think we could get away with maybe thirty-two, thirty-three stone, that is if you're up for it."

"Goodness, that's nearly twice my size now."

"Well, you'll lose some of that when you have the twins."

"Yes, do you think he's going to have me have more children?"

"Possibly, is that something you want?"

She smiled. "I wouldn't mind it. But, I am worried about their safety." An odd thought came to her mind, but she decided not to talk about it just yet.

* * *


"Anything?" Dhasca asked.

Nilmini had finished her morning routine of checking on her lover's progress. Dhasca was getting to that point where she was very uncomfortable in her pregnancy. Moving was such a chore, and it seemed there was no comfortable position for her to rest. She was looking pretty weary by now. She shook her head. "Same as always. At this point, it's just waiting." She patted Dhasca's belly, which had gotten tight and firm as a drum in the last few weeks.

Dhasca sighed. "I know you don't want to rush," she said to the little ones, "but you really need to get here soon."

"Be careful what you wish for," Nilmini said with a laugh. "You just might get it."

She sat beside her and Dhasca leaned her head on her shoulder. "I wouldn't mind that. I'm kind of ready to see them."

"We'll get there soon enough. Just be patient."
12122322212231121332242.title: The king orders for extra protection for Dhasca.

choices: It’s not satisfying. We have to trust the king.

121223222122311213322422.content:
It had happened in the middle of the night a few weeks later. Nilmini had seen to it that Dhasca had stayed as comfortable as possible in her little nest in the confinement room. She was actually surprised that she had lasted this long. Twins usually came early, and it seemed that she would make it to full term with the two. But as they had just settled in to sleep for the night, Dhasca had jostled her awake.

"I think it's happening!" she said breathlessly.

"How do you know?" Nilmini grumbled, still half-asleep.

"I really think I'm starting to feel the contractions."

"You've been having those for the past week. It's a sign you're getting close, but you don't know..."

"They're more intense than the last few times."

Nilmini had agreed to get up and check on her just to put her at ease. But, she had to admit, it was a possibility. A few hours later, and Dhasca was really starting to go into labor. While true, the queen wasn't in any danger of complications (Nilmini saw to that), it certainly wasn't easy either. But nonetheless, the two were brought into the world safely: a boy and a girl.

Dhasca, worn but overjoyed, held the two of them as they began to settle, nuzzling close to her. The boy was very quiet after the initial squalls after birth, and preferred snuggling as close as he could get to his mother. His ears were closed, and it was apparent they would turn into elven ones once he was older, but he had his father's face and eyes. A few strands of dark hair could be seen on the top of his head. The girl was a tad more restless, moving about and never settling for one position as she rested against her mother. Her face was more elven, but with human ears, and she already had a decent amount of red hair on top of her head.

"They're beautiful," Dhasca said, truly content in the moment.

"You did great," Nilmini said, sitting beside her. "Do you need me to hold one while you feed them?"

"I'd like that. After all, they really should know you. I want you to a part of their lives too." She handed her the boy, as the girl was the one whimpering and seemed more eager to feed.

Nilmini took the little future king in her arms, admiring his sweet, kind eyes. "Have you thought of names yet?" she asked.

The queen looked over at her, stroking the top of the girl's head. "Roland said that if I had a son, he wanted him to have a more traditional name, as future heir and all. I've been reading some of the old histories in the libraries of the palace. I like Godfrey." She looked back at her daughter. "And I think I'd like to name her Sylmae."

"Your mother's name?"

"I think it's fitting." While Dhasca's mother had died young, she had been very close to her for how short a time they had together.

"I like it."

For the first couple of hours, Dhasca took as much time as she could to enjoy the bond she had with her children, but even in all her excitement, she was still very exhausted from the ordeal. Nilmini helped her get the two laid down in the little cribs that had been brought into the room. She would get to leave the confinement room after she had rested a couple of days. In the meantime, she tried to get some sleep. Nilmini cuddled close to her.

"You already miss the belly?" Dhasca asked coyly.

"Nah, now you're all soft and cuddly again." She said this while gently letting her hands squeeze around Dhasca's middle, careful not to make her feel sore.

"I guess I'm going to have to work at it to gain their combined weight again," she said, nodding over to the two sleeping babes.

Nilmini hugged her even closer. "I love you so much right now," she said. "You know you're perfect, right? So, you're starting to like that?"

"A little. I've really gotten used to eating this well. And, I have to admit, I do feel happier like this. Besides, I now know how easy it is to get you in the mood." She placed her lover's hands over her widened hips, letting her explore their softness. She could practically feel Nilmini's blush. She laughed. "Just like that."

"Well, maybe after a little rest, we'll get started on that, and I'll send for something to eat. I'm sure the king will more than likely provide a nice feast to his queen who just gave him a couple of heirs."

"I'm worried about them, Nilmini. What happened with his concubine; that isn't going to just go away, and I'm sure she's not the only one who holds resentment. I'm actually scared, truly scared. How are we going to keep them protected?"

Nilmini drew a long breath and then said, "I have one idea, but...

12131.content:
The Pyknos Verge was just as beautiful as she had been told. Towering trees of various types, the soft echoing of birds deep in the woods, and there was even a small creek leading into the forest. It was true: this place was like a fairy tale.

But Varehl Diamond-Fist wasn't here to admire the beauty of the forest. No, the Orc had something else in mind.

Twirling her long, onyx-black braid in her hand, Varehl took out a large piece of parchment from her bag and looked at it. On it were the names of all the locations in Yndyre. Adinah, Roiling Bay, and the Overvektige Peaks had been crossed off. Pyknos Verge was next on the list.

"Alright, third's time the charm. I hope," Varehl said to herself. "Just show them you mean no harm, and you might get some info on Zela."

Zela. It had been 2 years and Varehl still hasn't found anything that could even hint as to where she disappeared too. But elves were supposed to be attuned to nature. Maybe somehow, that could give Varehl a hint as to what happened to her only friend. If not, well, she could always see if they would need her alchemy skills.

Replacing the parchment, Varehl sighed before entering the Verge. As she entered, she thought back to the last time she saw Zela.

------

2 years ago

"Look, the guy who sold me the map said it was true," Zela said as she and Varehl sat at their camp a few miles away from the Overvektige Peaks.

Zela had heard about cave near the Peaks that was supposed to contain some sort of naturally occuring spring with healing water. She had the idea to put some in several flasks and sell it at the nearest market. Convincing Varehl to come along, the two found the cave. Unfortunately, not only had the story been a complete lie, but a large nest of Harpies had taken the cave as their home, and they weren't quite welcoming to intruders. Varehl had to pay them in food as an apology.

"Well, because of that, we're short on food, and I'm pretty sure the harpies aren't going to welcome us back anytime soon," Varehl said.

Zela frowned. "Sorry," she said. She looked up at the moon. "Ah well. Maybe it's a good thing. Less food means less weight in my butt. And I never liked the Peaks anyway. Too cold."

Varehl stared at the naga, watching the moon bounce off her green scales. Zela's 6-foot tail was curled up under her, not even hiding her pear figure. Varehl looked back at her own rear. It was nowhere near as big, but Zela's eating habits were rubbing off on her a bit. Shaking her head, Varehl looked back at Zela.

"Tomorrow, I want to head back to Adinah. Maybe we can get some jobs and replace the food we-" Varehl started to say, before seeing her friend had fallen asleep. Chuckling, Varehl laid back. "Never mind, we'll talk in the morning." On that, she nodded off.

------

That had been the last time Varehl ever saw her friend. When she had woken up, Zela was gone. Varehl thought she had gone off to scout ahead, but she never returned. She thought maybe she went back up to apologize to the harpies again, but they said she never came back.

And thus, for 2 years, Varehl searched for her friend. Sometime during that, she had taken a liking, then an obsession, with a pear-shaped figure, and her own figure became one. If she wasn't looking for Zela, she was taking odd jobs, or just hanging around taverns.

------

Present Day

Having been walking for about a half-hour, Varehl stopped remembering and starting thinking on how to introduce herself to the elves. They had only just started to get used to humans, so she wasn't sure how they'd react to a 7 foot, green-skinned Orc with big muscles and a bigger butt.

Once she thought of her butt, her mind wandered a bit. Maybe there were some elven girls with pear-shapes. She had heard the elves were willowy, so she wondered how a pear shape would look on them. But she immediately shook those thoughts away. She had to stay focused. She needed any sort of clue on Zela.

Just then, she finally saw something. It was a person. And from the looks of it, it was indeed an elf. Smiling, Varehl began to approach the elf. As she got closer, she noticed it was a female elf, probably around her age, and was gathering... something, Varhel couldn't tell. And as she got closer still, Varehl noticed the elf did indeed have a slight but noticable pear shape to her.

Varehl cleared her throat, and the elf turned to look at her.

"Hello," Varehl began. "My name is Varehl. What is your name?"

The elf looked at Varehl in...
12131.title: Varehl Diamond-Fist, the Orc on a mission
