Unfortunately, their stock didn't last long, and they needed to ask to the other elves. They knew they would've never gave them anything, but were too desperate.

But the answer was always the same.

"As if I'd help a traitor like you," said the elf before slamming the door.

However, Nessar stopped it with his foot. Glesheri tried to calm him down but to no avail.

"Please, even some leftovers would be fine. We are really desperate. I understand you hate me, but at least have some pity my wife," begged the young man.

"I just told you. She's a traitor," replied the elf sternly. Then he gave a look at Glesheri's body. "And I think she can afford to go a few days without food."

Glesheri looked at her own chubby body. She had indeed developed new curves during the last couple of months, and her dress wasn't large anymore; she didn't even need to tie the ribbon.
But that comment about her size, made her ears fold and she started to cry.

"You bastard! Don't you dare insult my wife! For gods’ sake, she’s pregnant," yelled Nessar as he was about to punch him, but Glesheri stopped him.

"Nessar, please," said the elf with tears flowing from her eyes.

Nessar calmed down and hugged her.

"Sorry, my dear. Let's go home."

But back at home, a bad surprise was waiting for them. Someone had invaded and broke many things, some pots, the garden (again) and, more importantly, the crib.

Seeing the crib she and Nessar had worked on completely destroyed was too much for Glesheri, who was on the point of collapsing. Nessar grabbed her and embraced her in a big hug.

"How could have they done this? Why?" asked Glesheri between hiccups.

"I don't know, but this is the last straw," replied Nessar.

Glesheri temporarily ceased her crying and looked Nessar in his eyes. "We cannot stay here anymore" she said, with not the slightest hint of fear or hesitation. "We have to move somewhere else. I don't know where, you decide. Wherever you will go, I'll follow you."

Nessar kissed her and said, "Of course, I'm not going anywhere without you. I think I know what to do."
1213221231123.title: The last straw

choices: Glesheri is fascinated by the city, and has many questions.
The couple run into a friend of Nessar's while out.
Glesheri is struggling to adjust to the big city. So much noise!
12132212311231.content:
It had taken several days, but Nessar could finally see the rooftops of the homes of Adinah. He and Glesheri had packed everything they owned, which wasn't much given that they had lived a pretty simple life, into a cart and started making their way for the city in the dead of night.

Nessar knew it wasn't a good idea to be taking his wife through these rough roads and paths in her condition, but he knew they couldn't stay in the Verge until the baby was born. Between trying to make sure they had enough to eat, and worrying if someone may try to hurt them, there just wasn't time.

He guided their horse along the path, trying to keep from hitting too many bumps while Glesheri sat at the head of the cart. "We're almost there," he said. "You doing okay?"

Though she was glad to be away from such a hostile environment, that didn't change the fact that she was being forced to leave her own home: the place of her birth. Despite how she had been treated, the Verge was still home to her, and she would miss it dearly. She let out a deep, homesick sigh, but smiled back at him. "I'm fine," she said. "So, what are you to do when you return to your college?"

"Well, I still ended up with plenty of information to publish my tome on elven culture, though you'll be able to help me fill in the gaps. After that, I think they'll plan for me to do some translation work. That won't pay much, but it'll get food on the table."

"Pay?"

"Yes, I keep forgetting that it'll take a while for you to get used to some human customs. But, we're going to have to use money for food now. You'll be able to go to the markets for it. My home is just one street away from the best markets in the city. Anyway, I have a friend that'll stop by from time to time to help us. I'll have him check in with you and help you with understanding currency, at least until you get the hang of it."

In truth, he knew that there were some crafty merchants in Adinah, and they would likely find ways to cheat Glesheri once they knew she had no concept of currency. He would send Abelard to help with the shopping, more to keep the merchants honest, if anything else. Also, since he would be spending days working at the college, having someone to check in on her in case something were to happen with her or the child was a good precaution.

"I see..." she said, trying to process it all. Now she was the outsider having to learn about another culture. At least Nessar was seeing to it that she had plenty of help. "So, tell me about this home you have."

He continued guiding the horse. "It's not much," he said, "but it is a little bigger than our home in the Verge. It's really more of an apartment I rent. The woman who owns the building is nice, but she can be a bit prickly sometimes. But you'll be comfortable, I'll see to that. Course, the first thing we'll see to is getting a proper meal in you."

Throughout their trip, they had to live on whatever goods they still had. Their last crop of bumblebeans and a few odds and ends were all they had left. Glesheri hadn't complained, but Nessar knew it wasn't nearly enough. As the child grew, so too did his wife's appetite.

Glesheri seemed to be reading his thoughts. "I'm fine, really. Oh!"

"You alright?" he asked worriedly.

He was at her side in an instant. She nodded, smiled, and placed his hands on her belly. "You feel that?"

He grinned from ear to ear. He could feel a little fluttering motion under her skin. "Is that... Is she...?"

"She's moving," Glesheri said. "Hello, little one. Are you excited to see our new home too?"

More flutters. "We'd better get moving then," Nessar said, going back to lead the horse the rest of the way.

It was pretty clear when they had entered the city. The usual sounds and hustle and bustle of the city was in full-swing as it was nearly midday. Their cart slowed down to a crawl as Nessar tried to lead them through the crowds. People were everywhere, haggling, arguing, and talking. Buildings were clustered together in the cobbled streets, really giving the city a claustrophobic feel. Right now, they were in the residential and market districts. Maybe someday, he'd take Glesheri to see the nicer buildings of the colleges and temples.

But, eventually, they arrived at a tall stone building. It was really a shop, but there were a few apartments up above. He led Glesheri inside so that she could rest after their long journey while he unloaded the cart.

That didn't take long, and Nessar returned upstairs shortly after. Glesheri's ears had flattened and she looked a tad distressed. "It's a lot louder than I had expected," she said.

He chuckled. "Yeah, it's going to take some getting used to, living in a city."

"I thought I heard your voice," a voice said.

Nessar turned around to see a portly, middle-aged woman, who's face was wrinkled around the eyes, but she still wore a pleasant smile. He grinned. "Sornna, it's good to see you again," he greeted.

She crossed her arms, her tone teasing. "So, they already call you back here. Or was it that you couldn't rough it out in those woods. I always knew you were too much of a city boy to... Who is this?"

"Oh, this is Glesheri, one of the elves I met in the Verge. She's...well, she's my wife."

Glesheri stood to greet the older woman, who stared at her dumbstruck. "I'm sorry, of course, welcome dear. Oh, goodness, Nessar, well you do work fast, now don't you? Poor thing, you really are a saint for putting up with this one."

Glesheri giggled. "I'm happy to meet you. Thank you so much for letting us live here."

"Oh, I like her. She at least appreciates me, unlike others."

Nessar shrugged. "I appreciate you enough, Sornna. Anyway, I'm back for good, and I was just getting her settled in."

The woman shook her head and smiled. "Alright, well, I'll leave you to it. To think, an elf in the city. How fascinating."

She tottered off, leaving the couple alone once more. Glesheri's stomach started to growl. "Well, we'd better see to getting the both you fed," Nessar said, leading her to the door.
12132212311231.title: A Fresh Start

choices: Nessar looks some job at the college
Nessar asks Raschal's brother some assistance
121322123112312.content:
Glesheri found the human city very fascinating. For instance, they had apartments amassed together, and the buildings were really tall, or at least, much taller than an average elven one.

She was intrigued by the shops and the markets, places where you went to get stuff in exchange for money. Even the idea of using money was strange and complicated, as she still didn’t understand it, despite Nessar's multiple explanations.

She noticed how the shops were of different kinds based on the commodities they sold (“sell,” that was the right term, she remembered): weapons, decorations, and clothing. In the latter shop, Glesheri was thrilled to try some human clothes, but at the moment she was very hungry, and thankfully, humans had different stores for food of various kinds: the bakery, the butchery, the fruit shop and many others.

Glesheri couldn't resist and wanted to try and taste all the human food: the bread, the meats, the cow milk, and some of the fruits she had never seen. Nessar was more than happy to oblige and didn't hesitate to spend a large sum of money to satisfy her. Even when she didn't say anything, (she didn't want Nessar to spend too much money) he could gather from her gaze that she really wanted it, and bought it. Glesheri kissed him to thank him and ate while Nessar showed her the rest of the city.

During the walk, Glesheri noticed that many eyes were on her. An elf was something unusual in Adinah, ad even more so an elf in a relationship with a human, as after seeing her very close to Nessar and her obviously pregnant belly it wasn't hard to put two and two together. She felt a bit embarrassed and her cheeks couldn't stop blushing, but at least those gazes weren't discriminatory like the ones in the Verge.
She thought she could get used to living here, even if it was really noisy.

Nessar noticed that Glesheri was smiling, and it was that serene smile she had at the beginning of their marriage, when they weren't harassed by the elves. He would've done everything to keep that smile.

The couple sat on a bench in a square. Glesheri needed to rest to digest all the food and the baby was starting to make her feel tired.

In the middle of the square, there was a granite statue of a large man in armor, with a large crown on his head, holding a sword in the sky and watching the passersby with a penetrating gaze.

"Is that your god?" asked Glesheri pointing at the statue.

"No, he's Goran, the king's great-grandfather. According to some stories, he once killed a chimera that attacked the city, all alone with his sword."

Glesheri gasped. "Wow, and don't you have a statue of the current king?"

"Not here, and definitely not that big."

"You know," said Glesheri, leaning on Nessar's side, "I'd like to meet your king one day."

Nessar stroked her hair and replied, "I'd like to, but it's not that easy. You need to ask permission and stuff... He's an important and busy man."

"Really? Is the king so much more important than the others?" asked Glesheri, patting Nessar's chin.

"Yes, he's the king after all. But I think you elves have a much different idea of the king."

"And what about the queen?" asked Glesheri, getting more curious at every passing moment.

"Well..." Nessar scratched the back of his head. "…She died some time before I went to the Verge.”

Glesheri gasped. "I'm sorry..."

"Don't worry," replied Nessar giving a kiss on her cheek. “I didn’t know all that much about her. Very few people here do.”

Suddenly, someone interrupted the moment.

"Nessar? Is that really you?" asked a voice.

Nessar looked around and saw a chubby man around his age with an unkept blonde beard.

"Raschal!" said Nessar. "What are you doing here? Weren't you at the marshes studying the tiger-people?" And he stood up to greet the man.

"You mean the Rakshasa?" replied Raschal, giving him a brotherly hug. "Yes, but apparently they weren't the nicest guys." He showed him the scar on his arm.

Nessar rolled the eyes and snorted. "Tell me about it. I too had to leave the Verge."

"But it seems you brought a little souvenir with you," whispered Raschal with a chuckle.

Nessar blushed. "Oh, right, how stupid of me! Raschal, this is Glesheri…my wife. Glesheri, this is Raschal, a fellow scholar."

"Pleasure to meet you," said Glesheri with a wave of her hand.

"The pleasure’s all mine, meeting such a beautiful creature," said Raschal before turning to Nessar. "Wait, wife? You mean you married an elf? I know you had to study them, but you didn't need to work so closely with them." He noticed her belly. “And you certainly wasted no time starting a family."

"Haha," said Nessar, "and now what are you going to do?”

"I was about to meet the king and get a new assignment, but he's away on a 'diplomatic mission' so I don't have much to do for now."

"I'm in the same boat," said Nessar, "but I'll find a temporary job to keep me and my wife from starving; maybe I can check at the college. Plus, some of my research was fruitful."

"Good luck then," said Raschal with a pat on Nessar's back. "And if you need help, you can always ask at my brother's tavern. He'll definitely assist any friend of mine"

Then Raschal left and Nessar and Glesheri spent some more time together, while some peasants noticed them with curiosity and interest; some even got closer to Glesheri as if she was a rare animal to pet.

Then the couple finished the tour with another trip through the food shops. Glesheri was just too curious to taste all that human's cuisine had to offer
121322123112312.title: Exploring the capital

choices: As she gets used to the city, Glesheri notices how women look different.
As she gets used to the city, Glesheri wonders what sort of mother she'll be.
As she gets used to the city, Glesheri finds that humans look at her differently
1213221231123121.content:
Nessar had wasted no time, and the next day, he made it a point to go check in at his old college to inquire about future work. He made sure Glesheri was comfortable and had everything she needed before leaving. It was going to take some getting used to as he would be leaving her to work every day now.

His friend, and former assistant, Abelard came by as it would be his job to make sure Glesheri got used to life in the city. Abelard was a short, balding man, who was as sweet as honey. He would be perfect to give his wife tours of the city and to help her understand human life. Plus, this way she'd always have someone around in case anything happened with the baby.

Nessar took a deep breath and made his way up the stairs of the college, realizing for the first time it had been several months, nearly a year really, since he had been in these hallowed halls. He needed to see Master Bartholomew to find out what his next step should be. He would need to be providing for a family of three soon.

He found the master in his study on the top floor of the building. Master Bartholomew had been the master of the college for an incredibly long time, since Nessar was a boy, really, if not longer. He was a hunched, old man, whose vision was starting to go bad. His hearing was no better some days. Still, his sense of smell was as keen as ever, and he always knew who was in the room with him.

"Nessar, my boy!" he greeted. "I had heard you were back."

Nessar smiled and returned the greeting. "Yes, unfortunately, things took a bit of an ugly turn in the Verge."

Bartholomew seemed surprised by this. "Really? With you? My goodness, you are one of the nicest people out there. If you managed to get the elves to hate you, then they must be nasty little creatures."

He laughed nervously. "Well, it doesn't help that I may have gotten a little too involved with one of their own."

The old master raised an eyebrow in surprise. "Is that so?"

"I may have...fallen in love with an elf, and when she married me, that didn't go over so well with them."

He shook his head. "Nessar, you know the first rule of field work: Never get too close to the subject material."

"I know, I know, but...I don't know. It was worth it. I really do love her."

Bartholomew sighed. "I can sense that in you boy; all the signs of a fool in love. Well, what's done is done. You said in your last note that you should still be able to publish something with all the research you did manage to obtain?"

Nessar nodded. "I think so. By the time I left, I was really only filling in a lot of small odds and ends. My wife should be able to help me fill in those gaps for the final edit. But, more importantly, I wanted to inquire what I could be doing here after that. I can't exactly leave on another field work mission at this time. My wife is now with child, and I don't want to leave her on her own here so soon."

The master agreed. "No, that makes sense. We'll just have to make due. I have a lot of translation jobs for you to complete. We obtained some new texts from the Djinn scholars in the south, and I'm eager to have us start reading them. However, there is another matter we should discuss."

He gulped. This didn't sound good. Nessar tried to hide his nerves by playing it casual. "Oh?"

Bartholomew smiled. "Relax, boy, it's all good news, I hope. You've shown a lot of good progress over the years. Your research is thorough and detailed. And while, your recent actions show you lacked some good judgment, I assume it was a minor slip. The point I'm trying to get to, my boy, is that I think it's time we consider you for a position of master."

He could hardly contain himself. Nessar mouthed a few syllables, unsure where to begin. "I...uh...master?"

He nodded. "I think you've earned it. You have my and the college's full support. And your upcoming tome on the elves would prove a sufficient project to earn your spot. You're on the right track for this."

"I...I don't know what to say. Thank you!" Nessar said, shaking the master's hand. "But, what are you...where are you...?"

The master waved him off. "Relax, I'm not going anywhere. But, as you know, the king does keep a wise master on his council, and Master Theobald is considering retirement."

He couldn't believe it. Him, working for the king? Could this be real? It had to be a dream. "Sir, I..."

Bartholomew chuckled. "All in good time, my boy. Let's not get ahead of ourselves. You first need to finish your work and have it edited and presentable. In the meantime, we'll pay you for your translations, and we shall work everything out from there."

Nessar thanked the master again and again, before Bartholomew sent him on his way. He was eager to go home and tell his wife.

Upon returning home, he found Glesheri sitting comfortably, humming to herself, and...knitting? Or rather, she was attempting to. She smiled and greeted him. "What's all this?" Nessar asked?

"Sornna tried to teach me knitting," she answered. "I thought it would be nice, since our child will be born in winter. This way, she'll have a nice, warm blanket. I'm still getting the hang of it." She held up the knotted mess tangled around her fingers.

He laughed. "You will. I know you will," he said. "Abelard didn't already leave you, did he?"

She nodded over toward the kitchen. "He's in there. He's been very helpful. We went shopping in the market for things to make dinner with, and he insisted on cooking himself."

Good ol' Abelard, he thought: helpful to a fault. "That's terrific. We'll eat, and I'll tell you some wonderful news."

Nessar couldn't believe it, but things were starting to look up for them.
1213221231123121.title: New Opportunities

choices: Glesheri decides to gain on purpose, phernaps Nessar will like it
Great news, the King is back
12132212311231211.content:
Once Nessar told Glesheri the news that he would've become a Master in the college, and after explaining what it meant, the elf felt really happy and leaned closer to Nessar, promising him a good night of cuddles (naturally, once the couple was left alone).

Abelard was happy too, upon hearing this, and Nessar told him to make a rich dinner to celebrate, something. And his friend was glad to oblige, and Glesheri even more so. She didn't know if it was the baby or simply she that loved human food too much, but she felt she could eat every day a bit more than the one before.

That night, Nessar and Glesheri were in the bed, embraced in a tight hug. The man could feel the curves of his wife getting softer and softer, and she was starting to have a bit of a double chin when she turned down her head.

He patted her belly. "Finally, you will have all what you need. Are you happy?" he said to the child in the womb.

Glesheri chuckled. "She kicked. I think it's a yes"

"How much time until she's born?" asked Nessar, as he didn't exactly know how long an elf's pregnancy lasted.

"I already told you, in winter, so a couple of months, give or take."

Nessar gave a look around in the room. It wasn't the best so far, but he was sure to gain enough money to make it comfortable for the baby. Thankfully they had a couple of empty rooms. That combined with the money a Master earned, it meant they could afford many other children.

"Dear? What are you thinking?" asked Glesheri, stroking his chin.

Nessar realized he was too lost in his thoughts. "Uhm... nothing important," he replied.

Maybe it was a bit too early to think about having other children. Besides, he had to ask to his wife. Speaking of which, he glanced at his wife's chubby body another time. These days Glesheri was eating a lot, but thankfully he could afford to feed her whatever she wanted. He felt lucky to be able to pamper his wife without having to worry.

Then he curled on his side and fell asleep.

----

Over the next few days, Nessar went to the college where he worked on the translation of the texts, while Glesheri explored the city with Abelard, until one day, she decided to go and explore it all by herself.
She had done enough tours to remember the streets and the more important places. Besides, she would've soon reached the day when, with her pregnancy, it would be better to stay at home.
So she put on her new dress, a gift from Sornna, and she was thankful of that, as with her pregnancy, her old ones were becoming too tight, tough the pregnancy wasn't the only cause, as the gown was a bit fierce on her hips.

The elf walked down the street, greeting all the people she met. In just a couple of weeks, she could already feel at home with the humans, even if most of their customs were still strange and unknown to her.

She took her daily pouch of money; after having (finally) learned somewhat how these work. Nessar gave her a small bag every day of these golden discs the humans use to take what they want. Her husband told her she could take whatever she wanted, but to be aware of the possible crooks.

For this reason, Glesheri visited only a couple of shops, close to her home, where Abelard could confirm their honesty. Coincidentally, they were all food shops, something that the human food-lover didn't mind at all.

She went to the bakery, where she had already a good bond with the owners. It was a family business, led by a nice couple with the help of their children.

Glesheri entered and greeted the woman behind the booth.

"Glesheri, you're again today?" asked the woman with a big smile.

"Of course, Giana, your bread is really good," replied the elf who, after going there nearly every day, had become a favorite customer.

Giana was a really large woman, probably twice as large as the average female-elves of the Verge, with short dark brown hair. Her hips were almost brushing against the doorframe, but being a mother of four children, that could have been expected.

"So, what do you want?" asked Giana. "Today we've got this special bread with olives." She waved the bread in front the elf.

Trying new food was an offer Glesheri couldn't refuse. "Olives, aren't these the ones used to make oil?"

Giana nodded, making her double chin quiver. "Yes, they're also good to eat."

"Then, I suppose I really can't refuse," replied the elf. "However, I'd want some regular bread too."

"Sure, no problem. I'll go to the oven, so you can have some fresh bread," replied the baker, patting Glesheri's head as if she were a pet. She had gotten used to that. Humans still knew so very little about elves, and they thought of her as no more than an ignorant primitive. She didn’t mind it, as that was better than some of the abuse she had suffered at the hands of her own people, but she hoped her husband’s research would help disprove some of those ideas.

The woman waddled to the back door, and Glesheri could hear her talking to her husband. Meanwhile she waved her hand to one of their children, and the only daughter among them; she was something like ten years younger than Nessar, and every time Glesheri came in the shop, the blonde girl looked at her with curiosity, especially the pointy ears.

Then, a blow of wind signaled that the back door opened momentarily, and Glesheri could see the baker squishing his wife's hips in a close embrace.

Glesheri leaned her head and started to think. Was the baker liking his wife because she was fat?
Suddenly, she remembered Nessar's words: that where he came from a fat wife was a good sign that the man is rich and takes good care of her. Could it be that Nessar...

But her thoughts were interrupted as Giana came back with a tray of freshly-made bread, hot from the oven.

"Here it is, how much do you want?" asked Giana.

"Uh, the usual," replied Glesheri, still in her thoughts.

"Ok, and the bread with olives?"

"Uh…" Glesheri looked at the bread; the small green fruits seemed inviting. "Three pieces," she said, but she changed her mind. Maybe it costed too much. "No two." But she changed her mind again, as it seemed really inviting. "No, three."

Giana laughed. "Ok, here it is. It's 5 golden coins."

Glesheri thanked her and said hello to the fat baker and his daughter as she left the bakery before quickly sinking her teeth in the new kind of bread. It was soft, but the olives didn't add much to the flavor. It wasn't much different from bread with oil. But, still, a new experience was always good, especially regarding human food. Still, that didn’t change the kicking sensation she felt. “You like that, don’t you?” she said, knowing her little one kicked frequently when her mother ate food she liked.

Walking in the streets, Glesheri looked at the women of the city and noticed how they were much fuller figured than the ones of the Verge. In fact, if the elves commented on how chubby she had become, in Adinah she didn't have a hard time finding a woman more padded than her, and she had gotten even plumper since the day she moved in Adinah.

But that was inevitable, since she came to this city. Eating had become probably her main activity of the day, and she knew it wasn't the pregnancy’s fault. She simply liked human food too much. In a way, she was really glad to have moved to Adinah.

Still, despite her plumper form, Nessar loved her regardless. Actually, considering Adinah's women's constitution, could it be that he liked her even more with more meat on her bones? She noticed how he hugged and tickled her jiggling form, but had never considered that maybe, Nessar would like her even more with some more flab, and that could mean that she had to eat even more delicious food.

She thought about that while going in another shop, gently stroking her womb
12132212311231211.title: Getting used to Adinah's lifestyle

choices: Nessar likes Glesheri this way and encourages these changes.
Nessar likes Glesheri this way and lets things progress on their own.
Nessar doesn't mind either way. So long as his wife's happy.
Nessar is a little worried. Glesheri might be eating too much.
121322123112312111.content:
As the weather turned colder in Adinah, Glesheri had taken to staying inside. For one, elves were not very well suited to the cold. The Verge saw its fair share of cold temperatures and the occasional snow. However, the trees of the Verge served as a protective barrier against the most frigid winds and the harshest blizzards. Second, Glesheri was so far along in her pregnancy that she just couldn't get around as well as she would have liked. Plus, Nessar insisted that she spend this time getting plenty of rest.

"The little one must be especially hungry today," Abelard remarked, bringing her something to eat.

Abelard had stuck around to help assist her at home, and to be around should she go into labor anytime soon. If anything else, Glesheri was just glad to have company around.

The elf chuckled. "Well, that's not exactly it," she said. "At least not all of it. I've just been thinking lately."

He sat down on the corner of the bed. She liked having Abelard around. He was a very good conversationalist, and he didn't consider her as simple-minded like some of the other people did. He knew her well enough to know that she was intelligent in her own right.

"Thinking about what?" he asked.

Glesheri now felt a little embarrassed. It was one thing to have this idea, but saying it aloud seemed odd, now that she thought about it. "Well, I've just been thinking. It might be nice to...I don't know, get a little fatter."

He let out a hearty laugh. "Now, that's a new one for me. Whatever for?"

"It's just that I've noticed some of the other people here, what they look like and all. And, Nessar said something about having a fat wife as a sign of success."

Abelard continued to chuckle. "Ah, yes, humans here in the city are rather well-fed, and the women here are a tad on the large side. But, I wouldn't worry too much about that. Nessar loves you just the way you are."

"I know that," she said. "I don't have to worry about him not liking me. But, I just thought it might be nice, and he might be very pleased."

He smiled. "Well, I suppose a little extra winter weight wouldn't hurt you. And yes, Nessar does have his penchant for larger women. I just so happen to know a little recipe that my mother used to make that you might like. It's simple, and a bit fattening, just what you're looking for."

She smiled back, eager to try whatever it was that he had promised. It turned out that they were a simple sweet tart. They were simply delicious. Despite all her explorations of human foods, she hadn't really explored too many of their sweets, and now she regretted not having done so early. She ate several dozen of them.

And the little one seemed to like them too. She kicked cheerfully. Glesheri made sure not to eat so many that she made herself too full. She didn't want the little one to feel too crowded in there with her full stomach. Abelard seemed to be aware of that and made sure she ate rich, quality meals rather than just massive amounts of food.

For the next couple of weeks, the results were starting to show. She was indeed getting plumper every day. Eating plenty and spending almost all of her time laying around was bound to do that. Her cute round face had gotten even rounder, and her double-chin was more pronounced. Her belly had gotten even rounder, and while true, that was mostly the child growing, parts of it were soft and squishy. She had gotten significantly wider as well. She gently pinched some of her sides. Yes, she was getting fatter. Hopefully, Nessar would be pleased.

Indeed, Nessar did notice these changes. He noticed that his wife was softer to cuddle at nights when they slept together. He noticed that every night, she seemed to take up more space on their bed. He noticed that there wasn't a single part of her that he could feel that was bony in the slightest. He rather liked these changes, and found that she was even more attractive, if that was even possible.

Wait...where had that idea come from? Why did he think she was more attractive this way? Nessar always prided himself on believing that looks didn't matter. But, he couldn't deny it: he liked her this way. He had always grown up with the larger women of Adinah and was attracted to them for sure, but with Glesheri, none of that had mattered. He loved her because she was sweet, kind, and funny. He still did like all those things about her, he knew.

However, he didn't know that his wife was doing this on purpose. He just knew his wife was eating more every day, and was starting to look nice and round.

Hm...perhaps he did like the idea of having a fat and happy wife.

1213221231123121111.content:
It was a cold day of winter in Adinah, and Glesheri was lying in her bed. Recently sleeping was becoming harder, as with her pregnant belly she was having some difficulties in finding a comfortable position. Thankfully, she thought as she woke up, she developed a soft natural cushion in her own body, and it kept growing every passing day.

Glesheri was probably double her original size, if not even more, and she was liking it. She didn't know for sure why, though. Maybe because it was simply the consequence of eating delicious human food, or maybe because it was arousing touching her own new curves, or possibly because there was someone else that was enjoying it even more.

Speaking of which, Nessar came in the bedroom with a tray.

"Good morning, my dear," said the man sitting beside her on the bed.

"Morning," replied the elf, raising her back so she would be sitting on the bed too while also moving some of her long hair from her face. She winced a little as a sharp pain struck her.

“You okay?” he asked worriedly.

“Yes,” she said. “I think I just woke up the little one trying to sit up is all.”

"You woke up just in time, I was about to leave for work," said Nessar, putting the tray next to his wife and kissing her round cheek.

"Aren't you gonna stay at home these days? It could be any day now," said Glesheri, patting her overly round belly, still much softer than a standard pregnant one.

"Just a couple more days, just enough time to finish the translations, and then I'll have the permission to stay at home for a few weeks," replied Nessar, getting close to Glesheri's side. Now he could feel his body brushing against something very squishy, very different from the willowy body of months ago.

Naturally Nessar was really happy for this change, and not only because he thought Glesheri's new form suited her, but because she seemed happy with this too. So, he couldn't help but not-so-subtly encourage Glesheri's eating habits by making her richer and even more fattening meals, unaware that Abelard was doing the same thing. Glesheri caught onto this and was more than happy to satisfy her caring husband's desire and, at the same time, her gluttony for human food.

----

"Here's dinner," said Nessar bringing a tray with two bowls of stew and a large piece of bread to his wife later that evening, who was forced to stay at bed.

Glesheri cooed. "Thanks my dear, I really wanted it."

"There's still more back in the kitchen, if you want," replied Nessar, getting next to his wife's hip, which was softer than ever.

Glesheri giggled. "Stop tickling me, or I can't eat," she said patting Nessar's hand.

"Sorry, sorry. I hope you like it. This time I've used different kinds of meat, let's hope it tastes good."

She felt that sharp pain again. It didn’t worry her because she had been feeling them every so often the past couple of weeks. It was just her body telling her things were getting close, she figured. She brushed off all of Nessar’s worries and decided to eat.

Glesheri's voraciousness in devouring all the stew was a good answer to Nessar’s hope, and she quickly emptied the first bowl and proceeded to empty the second one.

"I think I'll fill this one," said Nessar with a wink, while Glesheri nodded in approval.

As Glesheri's appetite rose, so did her standard portions, and recently she reached the average of three servings per meal, plus some side dish, but she contained herself and didn't stuff until she was full. The baby was now big and she couldn't risk crowding her with her bloated stomach.

After the dinner, the couple spent some time embracing each other, almost apparent in silence.

"If you keep treating me so well, I'll really become fat," commented Glesheri suddenly. She didn't want to discuss the idea of gaining on purpose with Nessar, at least not yet. She didn't know for how long he would have enjoyed it, and tried to inquire in an indirect way.

"You deserve to be treated so well," replied Nessar; it seemed he would've liked it, no matter her size.

"Then, maybe I can give you a little reward," replied Glesheri before giving him a long passionate kiss. "I don't know if it's Adinah's atmosphere, but I love you more than ever," said the elf.

"Me too, you've never looked so beautiful"

Glesheri smiled. He was probably referring to her extra weight, but something more important was about to happen...

"Nessar..." said Glesheri with a gasp.

"Yes?"

"The baby is coming," replied Glesheri, putting an hand on her belly with a grimace, while water poured across the bed.

12132212311231211111.content:
"She's beautiful," Glesheri murmured as she gazed lovingly at the small sleeping bundle in her arms.

For as much worrying as Nessar did during her pregnancy, he had kept his head through the whole ordeal. He sent Sornna at once to fetch a midwife. At first, that concerned the elf. In her culture, while midwives did exist, they were only called upon in emergencies, when complications arose. Mostly, a trusted female relative or friend would help with the birth. Though, if they had stayed in the Verge, she would have had no one who would have wanted to help her, lest they become an outcast as well.

Thankfully for Glesheri, she faced very little struggle. True, humans were a tad larger than elves, and the child being half-human did make it a tad more painful, but it was worth it. In the early hours of that morning, their daughter had come squalling into the world.

But now, she was just content to be lying there in a clean bed, holding her daughter while she slept peacefully after her first feeding. She wouldn't trade this moment for anything in the world. She already felt a strong bond with her child the moment they first touched.

"She's perfect," Nessar said, stroking the few dark hairs on the top of the baby's head gently, and kissing his wife. "I can't believe she's finally here."

The elf smiled as the child nestled closer to her mother's soft body, yawning slightly. "Look," she said, nodding at her child's head, "her ears are closed. They'll open in a few weeks, and will be pointed like mine, just like you hoped. And look, she has your hair."

"She's everything we could've hoped for," he said. "What are we going to name her?"

"What's a good human name?" she asked. "We live in a human city now, so I think that would be best."

Nessar thought for a moment. "How about Nilinda?" he said. "That was my mother's name."

She beamed. "I love it already. Hello, little Nilinda."

The child gurgled a little in her sleep and smiled back. "It's wonderful," Glesheri said. "We're going to be a family."

He laughed. "Well, you'll get to name the next one. There will be a next one, right?"

She gave him a look, but nodded. "Yes, if the gods will it, I'd like several children. But, for now, I'm happy to have my body back to myself for a little while." Nessar laughed, grabbing some of her side and gently squeezing it. "Well, mostly to myself anyway."

She stifled a yawn herself. "Here," said Nessar. "She's sleeping right now, and you probably should get some rest too. You've been up since last night. I'll hold her, and wake you if she needs to be fed again."

It was hard to want to let go of her child after having just held her for the first time, but she had to admit that Nessar was right: she needed sleep when she could. Glesheri carefully handed Nilinda to her husband, instructing him on how to properly hold her before laying back down on the bed for a little rest.

Nessar still couldn't believe this was really happening. He had a daughter now! He never wanted this moment to end, being a family for the first time. He looked at her proudly, glad he could be here to witness all of this. In a short time, the child awoke, and Nessar feared she would cry being in the arms of someone unfamiliar to her, but those beautiful baby blue eyes seemed to know that he wasn't all that much of a stranger. "Hey," he said gently, "I guess this is the first time we get to talk outside of your mother's belly. My pretty little Nilinda...you're really here. Don't worry, I love your mother so much, I would do anything for her, and I'll do anything for you. Just, maybe go a little easy on us. We're new to this."

She made a few small noises, and he would have liked to believe she understood. More likely, she probably recognized the voice that spoke to her just outside the womb. "I already know you'll be beautiful, like your mother," he said, "but maybe getting a few brains from your dad isn't so bad either, right? I'm sure you'll be pretty smart."

Nessar reached out a finger towards her, and she took it instinctively in her firm grasp. She shook at it for a few seconds, comfortable with her father being this close to her. "I love you more than anything."

He looked over to where Glesheri lay sleeping, clearly exhausted from her ordeal. Even without her great bump, she was still a bit on the heavy side, and Nessar still liked that. A mother should be soft and warm anyway, he reasoned. Plus, he told himself, there was no way he was going to deny the mother of his child anything, especially food. Truly, this was a perfect life.

choices: As Nilinda grows, Glesheri brings her daughter for a walk in Adinah
Glesheri finds out she's pregnant again
121322123112312111113.content:
After Nilinda's birth, the couple was happier and closer than ever. Thankfully, there were only a few nights where she cried, forcing Nessar to wake up and cuddle her. He didn't mind it much though because, looking at the bright side, he could see his beautiful daughter. She really resembled her mother, barring the dark hair, or to be more precise, her mother when she was very slim.
Nilinda stopped crying the moment she felt her father's warm arms, and quickly fell asleep, but Nessar kept her in his arms for a couple more of minutes before going to bed.

"Goodnight, my princess," said the man, gently kissing his daughter's forehead.

Nilinda was a very quiet child, and generally cried only for a thing: when she was hungry.

"She really resembles you a lot," joked Nessar watching his wife breastfeeding Nilinda. "She's even got your appetite."

"Ha-ha, very funny," replied Glesheri, who couldn't deny that she was becoming really gluttonous, as she was eating as much as ever, and now she didn't even have the pregnancy as an excuse. "You could make less food if you wanted," added the elf before giving a pat on the baby's back.

"Do you think you can resist the temptation?" asked Nessar, putting a pastry on the table, next to Glesheri.

The elf looked at it. It was very inviting, and even had a cherry on it. She loved those small red fruits. She put Nilinda comfortably on one arm and grabbed the treat, only to shove it in her mouth.

"Ok, I can't, but you can't resist this either," said Glesheri, pinching one of her sides and winking.

Nessar leaned close to her, almost face to face, with a big smile. Glesheri blushed, and prepared her lips for a kiss, only to find that Nessar had picked up Nilinda and was now raising her up.

"Who's daddy's princess? Yes, you are," said Nessar in a goofy voice.
The more than a month-old baby smiled.

"Hey, she smiled! Did you see honey? She smiled at me."

"That was probably just gas," replied Glesheri with a laugh, taking back Nilinda.

Unfortunately, their bliss didn't last long. After a couple of months, Nessar had to go back to work, and came back with a sad expression.

"My dear, what is it?" asked Glesheri upon glancing his husband's face.

"The king gave me a new job, and I have to study the naga in the marshes," replied the man, taking a seat on the chair.

"Oh my, is it so far away?"

"Yes," replied Nessar with his head nodding like there was a spring in the neck. "I Will probably stay some months away from home. I tried to refuse it, but it would cost me my future job as a master."

Glesheri put Nilinda back in the crib and sat next to Nessar. "If it's just for the job, please refuse it. I don't care if we don't have many money."

"But we need it," replied the man. Then he took Glesheri's hands. "I want for you and Nilinda to not face any difficulties, but I promise I'll complete my research as fast as possible and then I'll come back."

Glesheri hugged him, with some tears dropping from the eyes. "If you have to."

Nessar went to the crib. Nilinda was asleep and curled on a side. He gently stroked her black hair and her small pointy ears.

"When are you departing?" asked Glesheri, hugging him from behind. Her belly, which had become round and soft, was pressed against his back.

"Tomorrow, I have to prepare my luggage," replied her husband.

But he suddenly turned around and grabbed her hips. "But first, I want to spend one last night with you," he said with a smile.

Glesheri smiled back. "Ok, come here, you!" And she pulled him with her, before landing on the bed.

That night was one of the best the two had, probably because the idea of being separated for so long goaded them in enjoying it the most they could. Once the loving moment had finished, Glesheri could hardly sleep; she had just spent a whole year married to Nessar, and now she didn't know how she could endure entire months without him. At least there was Nilinda, and this motivated her to stay strong.

The next day Nessar left, with the luggage in his hand, he looked at his wife and daughter for a last time before departing. Glesheri was a chubby elf, bordering on fat, with a round face with puffy cheeks, a large gut bulging from her dress and thick thighs to sustain her wide hips. Even her breasts had become large, though part of it it's because she was now a mother. He was going to miss all of that.

In her arms there was Nilinda, small and with her eyes wide open. Once Nessar started to leave, the baby started crying.

"Shhh, don't cry, my dear little Nilinda. Dad is going to return soon," said Glesheri lulling her daughter, even if inside she was having the same feeling.

The next few days were hard, as she woke up without finding her husband making her breakfast (there was Abelard or Sornna, but it wasn't the same) and the bed seemed much larger and emptier than usual.

At least there was Nilinda. Glesheri spent nearly all her time next to her daughter and playing with her, as the little half-elf was growing, and Glesheri expected her to say her first words as soon as possible. She was her father’s child after all: incredibly smart and quick to learn. Though that didn't fill the void left by Nessar's departure and she tried to compensate with more food. She had barely left her home in weeks, having to take care of her child, and asked Sornna to buy the groceries in her place, and to take as much as they could.

The elf loved human cuisine, but at the same time it reminded her of Nessar, so she would swing from happy moments to melancholic ones, with the main results were becoming plumper than ever. However, maybe this would be a pleasant surprise for Nessar once he came back, to find that both his daughter and wife had grown, albeit in different ways.

1213221231123121111131.content:
As the warmer weather approached, and the sun began to stay out longer, it was hard to resist the temptation to go outside. Back in the Verge, like most elves, Glesheri had spent most hours outdoors, and she missed going out in the sunshine and fresh air, though a crowded city like Adinah lacked some of the natural comforts. Still, it was a good day for being out, and she thought it might help her take her mind off of missing Nessar.

She fashioned a simple little sling to carry Nilinda in from a blanket. She draped it over her shoulder and placed the baby in, so that the three-month old could lay snug across her chest. Such things were common to the elves, as the women often foraged for food, tended family gardens, and other such matters, having to take their small children with them. Nilinda looked comfortable and went into her afternoon snooze.

Going out in the city for the first time since going on bed rest felt old and new at the same time. It was old because very little had changed. The city was the same, the people were the same, very little changed in Adinah. But it was different because it felt like the first time in nearly forever to the elf. She had forgotten how crowded the streets could be and had to maneuver carefully, so as not to run into anyone, or disturb the child hanging in front of her. True, part of the problem may have been that she was much wider than the last time she had been out and about in the city.

She had decided too make this a functional trip out as well, and stopped at the usual shops for food for the week. Many of the shop owners, who hadn't seen her in a while, were glad to see that she was back. They would chat and fuss over her new child, telling her how adorable she looked and how much she looked like her mother. Glesheri beamed and was glad to converse with people she considered to be somewhat friends. She had forgotten how much she missed this part of going out.

"So, you gettin' much sleep these days?" the baker's wife teased, as she played with Nilinda.

Glesheri nodded. "She's a quiet baby, for the most part. Though, she's been crying a little more often lately. I think she misses her father."

"Can't believe they sent him off to that gods-forsaken land," she said. "I wouldn't want to be anywhere near those serpents."

There wasn't a day that went by that Glesheri didn't worry about him over there. She had heard tales about how dangerous the southern jungles could be. She had heard how the naga were a fierce and sometimes formidable race. She hoped Nessar was alright.

The woman sensed her discomfort and decided to change the subject. "You've been looking good though, nice and healthy."

Not for the first time today, Glesheri realized she was actually starting to look normal in Adinah. Her extra girth made her seem like any other well-fed woman in the bustling city. Were it not for the ears, people would have mistook her for human. She absent-mindedly rubbed her hand into her soft, round belly, liking the feel of the plush skin as she squeezed.

"Yes," she said. "Nessar makes sure I never starve."

She laughed. "I can see that. You were such a scrawny little thing when you first came here. Well, city-livin' does certainly have a way of putting meat on your bones." She handed Nilinda back to her mother. "Now, then, I think I've got everything you asked for."

She gave the elf a sack, filled with all the various goods she had purchased. At least Nessar must have been doing fairly well on his excursion, as the money that was coming in to their home was a little more than it used to be. She happily paid, and wandered out onto her next stop.

People didn't seem to be so fascinated with an elf in their midst anymore. Fads had a tendency of wearing off quickly in the city. Plus, Glesheri, like so many others in the city had heard the news: the king had married the princess of the elves. Glesheri had a hard time believing Princess Dhasca would have wanted to marry a human king on her own. But then, if the king was handsome enough, or if they had really fallen in love it was possible. She couldn't help but feel a pang of anger and frustration at that. She had married a human and became a social pariah. The princess does it, and suddenly it's okay? Then again, Glesheri didn't know how the other elves might have reacted to such a thing. Maybe they had been just as angry with Dhasca as they were with her?

By late afternoon, she decided to take a small rest on a bench. Nilinda was getting fussy for her afternoon feeding anyway. It was nice just sitting and watching the people go by. A few times, some people would stop to ask her how old her baby was or to make funny faces at the child. But, mostly, people let her be.

And when she reached lulled periods like this, she turned to her frequent activity: eating. She snacked on a few of the goods she had gotten, and she had bought extra, knowing this would probably happen. Glesheri still liked the idea of being rather round and fat. She liked the feel of her soft body, and she knew Nessar enjoyed it too. Plus, Nilinda liked snuggling close to her mother's soft curves. If it made everyone happy, why stop?

Eventually, she knew she had to get up and continue her shopping if she wanted to get home before supper. As the months passed, Nessar eventually returned in the summer to a...

12132212311231211111313.content:
Nessar was on a chart, with a bag in his hands. Inside it was his long research on the nagas. Thankfully, they were all much nicer than what their appearance suggested and didn't trouble him at all. This way, his research was done in only six months, and the young man was home. He was especially fascinated by the idea of the rainy season rituals.

He instantly recognized the roofs of Adinah's towers and buildings from far away, and while he saw them becoming taller and closer, his heartbeat kept racing.

"You from Adinah, huh?" asked a man sitting next to him. He had a half messy blonde head, and was missing a tooth.

Nessar nodded. "Um, yeah. I haven't been here in months."

"I can see that from your eyes," commented the man. "Do you have someone important waiting for you?"

Nessar nodded. "A beautiful wife and a just as beautiful daughter."


Answering that question, made Nessar even more anxious to see Glesheri and Nilinda again. He wondered if they've been well without him.

The man chuckled. "And what are they gonna do once you are back?"

Nessar shrugged his shoulders. "Don't know, I guess they'll be happy? Especially my wife once I show her what I have here." And he patted his large bag, that was almost ready to burst.

He rushed home. The king could've waited for the research's results, but Nessar couldn't wait to meet his family again.

In his hurry, he had troubles in fitting the key, but once he could open the door he slammed it and screamed, "I'm baaack!"

At first there was no answer, and Nessar put the heavy bag on the floor during the wait, then, he could hear some steps, and soon after that, Glesheri was walking toward him. Actually, she wasn't walking but waddling, and the elf had a beaming smile on her round face.

Nessar couldn't help but notice Glesheri's changes. In the span of 5-6 months, the elf had gotten much wider. She was officially, undeniably fat, probably even more than Adinah's average woman, with large breasts resting on her round and soft belly, which was jiggling in front of her large thighs. All these features plus the wide hips made Glesheri looks like a motherly goddess. And for her husband, she was just as beautiful as an actual goddess.

Once the two met, tears poured from the eyes of both, and they embraced in a big hug. Nessar felt Glesheri's body had gotten much softer, and that he could barely touch his hands behind her back.

"I missed you," said the elf.

"I missed you too," replied the man. "There hasn't been a day where I didn't think about you and Nilinda. Speaking of, how is she?"

Glesheri grabbed his hand and dragged him to Nilinda's room. There Nessar saw his daughter, who had grown a lot during these months, sitting on the carpet and playing with a doll and some wooden toys.

"Nilinda" said Glesheri. "your father is here."

The little half-elf raised her eyes to see Nessar. She now had big eyes, the elven ears had fully stretched, and her black hair were growing to halfway down her neck. Once she saw her father, as if she somehow recognized him, she leaned on her hands to reach him, but she couldn't crawl yet so she simply fell on her belly.

Nessar chuckled and approached Nilinda. "Don't worry, my daughter." Then he raised her and looked at her. "You've grown into a beautiful baby." He turned toward Glesheri. "It's too obvious she's taken from you."

Glesheri sat on a chair and replied, "Please, stop with these flatteries."

"I'm just saying the truth," said Nessar getting close to her. "Now we're all together, and we will be forever.”

Nilinda smiled and muttered some baby words. The couple interpreted it as an agreement.

-----

Nessar narrated some episodes that happened with the naga, like the meeting with the queen, who was incredibly fat, like the king's fattest concubines, then, after he finished narrating, it was Glesheri's turn.
The elf, however, didn't have much to say, except some episodes regarding Nilinda, like her first words or her failures when she tried to stand up. This was because she mainly spent the time at home or going for a walk in Adinah, and on both occasions she spent most of the time eating, and she was aware of her changes, and how Nessar and Nilinda (The latter by sleeping comfortable next to her mother) appreciated them, and Glesheri didn't mind them at all too.

In the meanwhile, Nessar prepared a special feast for his wife using a large chunk of triceratops meat he brought back from the Motee Marshes. Glesheri couldn't resist from the smell and began digging in, while Nessar fed Nilinda her food.

"I knew you would've liked it," said Nessar, looking at Glesheri, eating with delight. "There are these fruits too."

"Thanks *munch* I've already seen them *chomp* but, honestly, I think human food is better."

"Then later we can go and eat in a tavern, if you have some space."

Once she finished the triceratops meat and proceeded on eating the rest of the food, Glesheri replied, "Sure! I'll surprise you with how much I can eat.” She winked.

In fact, Glesheri could see herself eating more and more as her stomach became larger. Abelard took note of that since he had to make his portions bigger and bigger.

"Ok, I'll ask Sornna to take care of Nilinda for a while," replied Nessar while lulling his daughter to make her fall asleep, "and then we'll spend a nice day together."
