1531.content:
In the middle of a magnificent, large and well decorated room, above a heap of cushions, rested a large Kitsune, likely as soft as the same cushions she was resting upon. Her hair was fiery red, just like her tails. She was wearing an elegant pink robe with a design of golden flowers and a little bronze crown on her head.

The kitsune in question was also very fat, with a big round gut that was pressing against the robe's belt, two legs as large as a slim woman's waist and a noticeable pair of pillowy breasts, whose cleavage was uncovered.

She was Vuko, one of the king's first concubines.

A few servants entered the rooms with trays of food, which they laid next to Vuko, and then quickly retracted, as if she could eat them along with the food.

Then, in stark contrast with her appearance, she ate with the same elegance of a boar, spoiling her dress and the cushions around her, all the while tenaciously shaking the fox-tails behind her.

A maid rolled her eyes and sighed, thinking about all the mess she'd have to clean once the Kitsune ended her lunch.

Once she finished, Vuko leaned on her back and untied the belt of her robe, freeing her large stuffed gut.
The servants proceeded with their job; some cleaned what food stains and crumbs they could, and others massaged Vuko's belly.

The kitsune belched, not caring about the poor servants who were about to lose their senses standing near here. They were insignificant compared to her: The King's favorite concubine. Though, recently he hasn't been visiting her for a while. Thinking of this made Vuko angrily but delicately place an hand on her belly and a frown appeared on her fat face, much to the terror of the servants, who feared she wasn't satisfied with their job.

Like all the women of King Roland's harem, Vuko used to be slim...ish.
She was one of the many Kitsune monks that lived in the temples but, unlike them, she wasn't very devoted and was actually pretty bored with her life.

Thankfully for her, she had heard of the king in the central regions who collected only the most beautiful women, and the elegant living conditions they received under his care. Thus, a young Vuko didn't waste any time traveling to Adinah to seduce him and conquered Roland with her already curvaceous body.
Since then, these had been wonderful years. She's been pampered and treated like a queen, more so, she considered herself the queen. She was the King's favorite and the mother of his eldest child, therefore the future heir, or so she would like to believe.

Once she was satisfied, she put on a new fancy dress and left the room to explore her castle, only to remember that walking was really tiring, so she opted to visit the concubines main room. She might as well concede them the honor of her presence once in a while.

Upon opening the two double doors, in front of her there were masses of fat, though in different sizes. The king was known for his peculiar taste in women, and it was no wonder he had a harem of women of different kinds of that, but hardly anyone could have expected he would've started collecting women of all races.
And he got a wide assortment: merfolk, gorgon, djinn, orc and, of course, a Kitsune.

Looking around the room, she noticed there had been no trace of Mitera for a while, not that she minded. The castle had been quieter without her.

Vuko considered herself superior to all the other concubines. In fact, she thought that she was the original and the others some mere copies to entertain the king while she couldn't. She looked with superiority at the orc and the djinn, who were both smaller than her, a sign that they'd been there for less time, while she looked with disdain at that whale of a mermaid and that incredibly fat gorgon. In their case, the logic was that they were too lost in food and couldn't contain themselves, in particular the mermaid, whose only time she wasn't eating was when she simply had no food to reach. Vuko wondered if she'd make the floor collapse under her if she kept growing like that.

"Oh, what makes you come all the way here?" Jamila asked sarcastically. "Boredom or hunger?"

"I'd say both," replied Vuko, grabbing a plate with sweet treats, and then picking a handful of them and devouring them like they were the last ones left.

The djinn stepped back, avoiding the crumbs and said, "Hey! Watch your manners. You make the whale right there look like a proper lady."

Hearing the word "whale", the quarter- ton mermaid briefly interrupted her never-ending lunch and asked, "Were you talking about me?"

"No, about the king's dog," replied Vuko sarcastically, spitting drops of cream everywhere.

"Ooh, I didn't know the king has a dog. I wonder what it tastes like," muttered the mermaid. Wondering about the taste of a dog made her hungry again and went back to her main activity: eating.

Vuko was too busy to deal with how strange that was, and, despite eating less, she was much messier, and once she was finished, she left colorful drops and crumbs on all the carpets.

"You know what? I think I’m going to have a bath," muttered Vuko, leaving the room.

She ordered a warm bath, and a massage on her back. Once immerged in the water up to her chest, a servant gently stroked her fat shoulders like two rolls of bread, and the Kitsune was munching a few sweet fruits kept in a golden bowl. She loved her concubine life and all the comfort she got. The only price was to eat as much as possible to gain weight, and Vuko considered it a fair trade, though she disliked those who ate to the point of hindering their mobility.

However, a servant entered in the bathhouse and interrupted that moment

"Madam, you're wanted outside."

1532.content:
Isallia felt the cart hit a bump in the road, disrupting her restless sleep. They were no longer under the canopy of the forest, but now out in the sun, bound for the capital city. Coming back to consciousness, she remembered the chains that bound her wrists. The humans had captured her nearly two days ago. All she knew now was that they were taking her to Bosch Keep, the massive castle that lay at the center of Yndyre.

Her body was stiff and sore after having been jostled around in the cart for that long, and her wrists were starting to chafe. Still, her fear at the fate that awaited her at the castle made her forget about all of her discomfort.

As she awoke, her other senses returned to her. Her tall ears flicked as she heard the sounds of her captors chatting among themselves, though she barely paid attention to what they were saying. She had learned quickly that it was better for her to not appear to be listening or to even be moving. They taunted her less when they thought she was sleeping. How had she gotten into this mess anyway?

* * *


Isallia was stirred awake by the same noise that had woken her for the past two months. "Shh, it's okay. Mama's here," she cooed to her newborn son, who was whimpering.

He was beautiful, she thought, as she gazed down at his big brown eyes: his father's eyes, she reminded herself. She stroked the side of his head, near his little elven ears, which hadn't quite opened up yet. And he had the sweetest smile. How she wished his father could see him.

For just over three months, her mate, Inaril, had been sick with an unknown disease. The healers knew it had come from exposure to humans, but had yet to find a cure. He had gone into a fever-induced coma just before their son, Rhalas, was born. Since then, she had been on her own while he was slowly dying in the healers tents.

As Rhalas finished feeding, she sighed. "Maybe he will at least be awake today," she said to him, trying to convince herself more than anything. Poor Inaril had not even been conscious to know he had a son.

She settled Rhalas onto a sling strung around her back and began her walk to the healers' tents. Several neighbors stopped to ask how she had been since Rhalas' birth or offer condolences about Inaril. She hadn't been out too much in the past few weeks, trying to avoid this exact situation. She hoped she could hold it together today. Between all the changes to her hormones and all the strain she was under, she had been an emotional wreck.

Isallia was halted as she neared the healers. "I'm sorry," Lemill, the healer elder, told her sorrowfully, "he's still not well and likely contagious."

She had been hearing the same thing day in and day out. She was just lucky they were able to still keep him alive at this point, she knew. "And you have found no cures?" she asked in an accusatory tone. She didn't mean to sound like that, but she was getting exhausted by all of this.

He placed a hand on her shoulder. "We are trying everything we can, Isallia. Believe me. But with no one returning alive from the scouting parties, there's very little we can learn about this disease."

Isallia fought back tears and only nodded in agreement. "We will let you as soon as anything changes. You and the little one take care for now, okay?"

She gave him a weak smile and decided to head back. There was always tomorrow, she had to keep telling herself.

She almost bumped into Silra, one of the village elders. Hm, she seemed a little larger since the last time Isallia saw her. Course, she was one to talk. Isallia was still a quite plump after having her child. Plus, they had been at peace with the satyrs now for a couple of years. Seemed natural that people were able to rest and eat more.

"Isallia, I see you're out and about," Silra said, not really seeming all that concerned with her. "Seems that you're doing well then. Listen, our last scouts have gone missing, and your family is next on the rotation. Since Inaril is still sick, and you seem well enough, you'll have to go."

She could feel Rhala's tiny little hands tapping at her back as these horrendous words tumbled out of Silra's mouth. "You can't be serious," Isallia sputtered. "Rhala's still too young for me to-"

Silra only rolled her eyes, not really listening. "Look, it isn't our first choice either. But, these humans keep getting closer and closer to us. We have to watch them. Plus, you were one of the best. You'll be fine to scout for the day."

"But, but-"

"I'm sorry, but that's final. Make arrangements, and meet the scouting party in an hour."

Isallia had recruited the help of her friend, Niyi to watch Rhala while she was gone. "Silra is just being ridiculous," Niyi said. "How can she think to do this to you?"

She reluctantly handed Rhala to her. "Yeah well, I'm not getting much of a choice in this. I promise, I'll be back by nightfall." She gently kissed Rhala's forehead as she said this. She hoped she was right.

* * *


That was not at all what had happened. Some human hunters had found their party just before the sun had set. They had slaughtered all the others, but for some reason kept her. She hadn't figured out why, and she dreaded to find out the answer. They were getting close to the keep, she could tell.

"You can tell your king, he'll learn nothing from me," she spat. "I'd rather die than tell him the secrets of the elves."

A spear prodded her in the side. "Shut up, elf whore!" one of the hunters shouted. "You'll do what we say, and right now, that's shut up!"

He prodded her again to punctuate this sentence. Yva help her, she prayed to herself. She could only imagine what horrors awaited her at the palace.

She was dragged in to the great hall by three of the hunters. Two had proven too few when she put up a good fight to get away. The king, a tall and imposing man sat at the head of the table, clearly uninterested in this party disturbing his feast. Upon first glance, he seemed like a round, jovial sort of fellow with dark-red hair. But when she gazed into those eyes that looked at her like a predator eyes a meal, she knew that was not the case.

Isallia could not help but notice the large proportions of the women in attendance at the feast. They were all varying sizes of "large," some were downright immense. Many of them were too busy greedily devouring their dinners, brought on by a small platoon of servants. Only one or two bothered to look up at the strange, exotic creature before them.

"Your majesty," the lead hunter said, "while traveling the Pyknos Verge, we encountered the rare and beautiful creatures known as the elves. We were able to capture one. Perhaps she would make an excellent addition to your harem? For a price of course."

Her tall, pointed ears perked. What had they just said? Harem? They were sorely mistaken if they thought she would willingly...

"Hmm," the king said examining her with keen interest, "you know, she would do well here. I could use..."
1532.title: Isallia

choices: Isallia befriends Tevi in hopes of learning some way to escape.
The king visits Isallia to see how she is settling in to her new home.
Something else (author's choice).
15321.content:
"I could use another woman for my 'collection,'" he said with a laugh. Isallia did not find it so amusing. "Yes, I've never had an elf among my women. Quite frankly, I've never seen one this up close before."

He stepped down from his spot at the head of the table and came close to examine her. She refused to meet his gaze. She was not some wild animal to be gawked at so. The king circled around her, like a wild cat watching his prey. This greatly unsettled Isallia. At first she assumed him to be a child-like fool who was only amused by the newest "toy" to his collection. The look he was giving her now told her there was something darker behind that gaze.

"Yes, very charming features," he said, completing his examination. "You know, I imagined them a little shorter, but this one's actually quite beautiful. A little bony, sure." He pinched her side, which caused her to bolt around, and give him a fierce look. "But she'll be presentable in a couple months," he finished, chuckling. "I like the fire this one's got in her eyes. She'll be a real treat."

"You so much as touch me again, and you will find limbs ripped off," Isallia spat.

The king seemed hardly fazed and laughed again. "Oh, yes, quite a bit of fun indeed. However, I think it's time you started getting used to the rules around here, little elf. From here on out, you will address me as 'your majesty' or King Roland. Are we clear?"

"Damus has a special place for people like you when you die."

The king's friendly demeanor shattered as he grabbed her by the throat. She never realized how quickly his personality could turn around. She suppressed the urge to quiver with fright. Only now had she come to realize what a dangerous situation she was in.

"I have guards here, a great many actually, who would love nothing more than smashing your pretty body bone by bone. I'd watch how you speak to me. Now then, I imagine these fellows here have not properly taken care of you on your journey here. You must be tired. My servants will show you to your chambers." He tossed a small bag of gold to the hunters, who greedily snatched it up.

Isallia was meanwhile halfway down the halls, following the servants. While it would have been easy to overpower them, she knew the king was right, and that with his masses of guards, she had no hope of escaping...yet. She would take the time to figure out the layout of the castle and plan her escape from there. It was not like that would be hard. With her only being a member of his slew of women, she'd probably get free range of exploring the castle. Plenty of opportunities to watch guard shifts and figure out the best time to make her leave.

The bed chambers she was given were quite elegant, she had to admit. She was a little surprised with how big they were. It made her wonder if the king treated all his women this well, or if this was only small lodgings and there were grander rooms for his favorites, or even the queen, if there was one.
Still, she had to admit, she was tired. She climbed in to the massive, but incredibly soft bed. She was a little disturbed by the animal fur blankets. Not that she was unused to having animal hides for coverings, but just not this much of it. She wondered how many animals had been slaughtered to make something like this to cover a bed this big. Still, the castle was much more drafty and cold than her snug hut in the forest, and decided that beggars could not be choosers. Isallia did not realize just how tired she was as she almost instantly drifted off to sleep.

She awoke to a cheerful voice greeting her. "Ah, did I disturb you, miss?" the serving girl said as she set down the last of several trays.

Isallia sat up to find that a more than hearty breakfast had been set out. More like a small feast, she thought. Something like this could've easily fed all the elders in the village back home. The girl must've noticed her wide-eyed look. "Oh, no one expects you to eat all this," she said, "at least not yet. No, his majesty just didn't know what sort of things you would like. We've never had an elf before."

She slowly got up to survey all that they had brought. One thing she immediately noticed was the overpowering, and sometimes conflicting smells of all the flavors. "There seems to be an awful lot of meat just for breakfast," she said.

The girl wilted a little, feeling as though she had done something wrong. "Oh, a thousand apologies, miss. Do elves not eat meat?"

"No, it's fine. We sometimes do," Isallia said, trying to make her feel better, "just not so much at one time. It seems like an awful waste to kill so many animals for that."

The girl nodded. "Noted. I'll let the cooks know by this afternoon."

Isallia sniffed at what appeared to be a familiar smelling berry smell coming from what looked like some sort of gelatinous spread. She began to put some of it on a piece of bread. She had to admit, she had never eaten this well back home, and for the odd assortment of human cuisine, it wasn't all that bad. Plus, her captors had practically starved her for the past few days. Anything would’ve tasted good at this point. "Will there be anything else, ma'am?" the girl asked.

"Oh, uh, no I guess, uh..."

"My name is Tevi, miss."

"Uh, Tevi. No, I plan on looking around the castle some."

The girl's eyes went wide, thinking that was the silliest thing she had said. "Oh, no, miss, you're not allowed to leave your chambers."

Isallia's eyes narrowed. "Excuse me?"

Tevi shifted nervously, trying to find the best way to explain. "Well, you see, miss, the king entertains a great many lords and such from neighboring lands, and he is very particular about showing off to these visitors. Since you're one of the new girls, you're well...not suitable to be seen yet."

Suddenly, it seemed to register. The other women she had seen, the food, it all made sense now. "He wants to fatten me up, doesn't he?"

"Well, his majesty does clearly have a type, miss. Oh don't worry. It isn't all bad. Some of the girls really do like being here, and the cooks are excellent. If it's boredom you're worried about, I can make some arrangements. Do you like sewing? Reading? Wait, can elves read?"

As the girl babbled on, it was all Isallia could do not to vent her frustrations in the slew of curse words she wanted to say. That bastard was smart, smarter than she gave him credit for anyway. It was a perfect way to keep her from escaping. Keep her locked away in here until she was too big to really get out. Hm, she'd have to get more creative if she was going to get out of here.
15321.title: The King's Newest

choices: Isallia lives up to her promise, and so does the king.
Isallia still resists. Maybe the king needs to take drastic measures.
Isallia lives up to her promise, but the king lies to her.
153212.content:
Isallia was inconsolable for several days after that. She was truly and utterly trapped. There was no reason for her to live anymore, she thought. She would never see her son or Inaril again. She could never go home. She would be forever locked in this prison of twisted torture.

Tevi had tried desperately to make the poor elf comfortable in her new home, but knew that nothing she was doing was helping. She could not possibly know why Isallia was so sad, but she could only imagine. She was probably scared and alone and the poor thing probably had someone back from wherever it was she was from that she was hopelessly missing. Unfortunately, Isallia had let this sorrow manifest in another way. "Please, miss," Tevi begged quietly.

"I'm not hungry," Isallia snapped for the dozenth time. "I'm not giving in to your king's despicable 'tastes.'"

"But, miss, his majesty has very explicit instructions to..."

"Then he can kill me if he wants to," Isallia snapped. "I don't care."

Tevi shook her head. "Oh, he's not going to be pleased about this."

She left, leaving Isallia with her own thoughts. Well, screw him if he wasn't pleased! That odious and disgusting man, and his harem. She wondered how many of them were there by choice, and how many were prisoners like her. Finally, she could hold back tears no longer. These were the tears only a mother could weep. Isallia wanted nothing more in that moment than to see her son, her baby, just one more time, hold him, and tell him that everything was alright, that she was not dead and gone. How alone he must feel. Her heart was breaking just thinking about it.

The door to her chambers opened once more. "Tevi, I swear, if you try again, I will throw something at you," Isallia growled.

"Oh, now that's a horrible way to greet someone," a masculine voice said.

Isallia jumped, when she realized it was the king. She quickly scrambled to the corner of her enormous bed that was farthest away from him, and held the quilt close to her, as if it were some sort of protective shield. "I want nothing to do with you," she said, even angrier knowing who it was.

King Roland set down a silver platter on a nearby table and that sat on the opposite end of her bed. "I understand you're not adjusting well to your new home," he said as sweetly as possible. "Tell me about it."

"No."

The king snapped his fingers. "See, you're going to have to get used to the idea that saying no to me is a bad idea."

One of the king's hulking knights loomed behind her. He could have easily snapped her in half if she wasn't paying attention. Isallia remained resilient and only crossed her arms. "What do you want to know?"

"Well, first thing's first," he said.

He took one of the pastries off the platter and handed it to Isallia. "You are out of your mind if you think..."

"Ah, ah, ah," the king taunted. "Elves must have terrible memories, because I could've sworn we had an arrangement about saying no."

Isallia looked at the knight behind her, who was cracking his knuckles menacingly. She tentatively took a bite. It was indeed a delicious and sweet-tasting thing, and considering she had not eaten for a couple of days, that made it all the better. But she felt like it was poison, knowing its purpose. "Now, I'll level with you, my dear," King Roland said, "you've rather captivated me when you first came here. I've never seen your kind, and you are incredibly beautiful. I don't think you realize the advantageous position you're in. You see, I'd give you just about anything to see you comfortable here."

Isallia swallowed a second bite. "What are you saying?" Her eyes narrowed, her mind working a mile a minute.

The king traced circles with his finger on the quilt. "Give me your demands, and perhaps we can come to an arrangement. I had thought you would find yourself happy here on your own, but I see there are some things I just can't give you to make you feel this way."

She thought for a moment. "I can ask for anything?"

He nodded graciously. "Within reason, my dear, within reason, but let's hear them."

She sat up straighter. "First, I will not be your concubine."

He made a disgruntled sound. "Sorry, that part stays on the table. You're here for a reason."

Isallia tried again. "Fine, you have concubines to settle your certain 'needs.' I will have no part of that. You may converse with me, you may hold me, and I may even let you kiss me on occasion, but you will not..."

He held up a hand to silence her. "I think I get your point. Physical to a certain degree. I might be able to work with that, though it will be tempting." He eyed her with a hungry glint.

It was all she could do to suppress an eye roll. "We will have all of this in writing, yes?"

The king was surprised. "I didn't think elves could read."

"Your people invade my land. We wanted to learn about you."

King Roland laughed heartily. "Clever little elf, aren't you? Very well, yes, I will have my scribes draft something up. What else?"

Isallia sighed as she tried to utter the next bit out. "I have a family: a mate, a son. I wish to see them."

He scratched his beard, thinking deeply about the idea. No wonder she didn't want a more physical relationship with someone as rich and as handsome as he, he thought. Hm, he could use this to his advantage. "We can arrange something," he said at last. "Provided, you meet certain demands of mine."

She had finished eating the pastry, and he handed her another from the plate. She saw how many more were there, and became quite worried. "How much?" she asked.

A devilish half-grin spread to his face. He had her. "Let's say, for every stone-worth you gain, I'll let you have a day to see them. Reasonable?"

Isallia's face fell. She knew she might have some freedoms while she followed his demands, but for how long? Would he forget his promises after a few weeks or months? Would he live up to them at all? She sighed, "Yes, I understand."
153212.title: A Deal is Struck

choices: Isallia has gained enough to go back home for one day.
Isallia still has a little growing to do before she can go home.
1532121.content:
While Isallia didn’t entirely trust the king to live up to this agreement, she did at least comfort herself knowing she could have some leverage in the situation. She would see what would happen at first, and if she discovered he had been lying, well, then he could kiss his “willing” participant goodbye. Then again, he could just find a way to force her to eat if she still refused, and she hated to think of that possibility. For now, she still had to have hope.

The king, in his eagerness, had plied his new acquisition with lots of food, but Isallia only ate what felt comfortable. Yes, she was eager to see her family again, but she also wasn’t going to give the king the satisfaction of watching her stuff herself like one of his other prized “hogs.” She still hadn’t had a chance to meet any of the others, still confined to her room. She was genuinely curious to know what some of his other concubines were like. She wanted to know if they saw the monster she saw in the king.

They had figured out that, at the moment, Isallia weighed almost exactly eight stone, and the king quickly whipped up a document with their arrangement. As part of it, she had agreed to let him feed her on occasion. He had practically strong-armed her into that piece of the agreement, but if it got her back to her family for just one day…

She just hadn’t accounted for how zealous or sometimes forceful he would be during these times. At the moment, she was nursing her swollen, and painfully stuffed stomach from her latest encounter. It seemed, as she understood it, that he made time to see each and every one of his concubines, and that her being a new and fascinating catch for him, she got just a little more attention, or at least more frequently. He at least saw to feeding her once a week. She rubbed the tight curve of her belly, suddenly being reminded of the last time she looked like this, when her family was whole, or at least as whole as it was ever going to be.

* * *



The warm sunlight hitting her face finally caused Isallia to stir. She stretched her arms a little, and tried sitting up. That was getting harder these days. Inaril was at her side in an instant. “Decided to sleep in, did we?” he asked playfully, stroking her hair.

She yawned. “Well, had to when your child decided to spend most of the night kicking my organs. Course, now that I’m up, they want to make sure I haven’t forgotten.”

She placed Inaril’s hands on the lower part of her rounded belly. He could feel a few punches knocking at his fingers. She was truly content in this moment. Everything was perfect. She was with a man she cared about very much, and they were going to have the family they always wanted.

He laughed. “Okay, okay, I get it. You and mom are both probably hungry.”

Isallia’s stomach growled in response. “Food does sound good,” she said.

He helped her quiet down the aggressive movements in her insides, and kissed her cheek before rising. Isallia made an attempt to get up as well, before Inaril gently coaxed her back into the bed. “Inaril, I’ve still got a few weeks. I’m pregnant, not invalid,” she complained.

“I know,” he said, “but you ought to at least take rest where you can. Really? Only a few weeks? Is it that soon?”

Isallia had loved his child-like wonder from the moment they found out they were to have their first child. He had been incredibly attentive and wanted to know just about everything that was going on as their little one continued to grow. He had proudly bragged to all their friends about how they were going to raise a large family, and she loved how joyful he had been about the news. “Yes, only a few weeks,” she answered, rather excited just saying that herself. She rubbed her belly and whispered to it, “Although, I think you’d better get here sooner before your father drives me crazy trying to keep me on bedrest.”

* * *



Not more than a few days after that, Inaril had gotten sick. The worst part was how alone she felt without him. She had to go through her last few weeks of her pregnancy on her own, and when the time did come, she really only had her friend Niyi to help her. Inaril wasn’t even conscious when Rhala was born. He had been so hopeful, and now he didn’t even know he had a son.

Isallia tried her best to roll over in her current state and go to sleep. She groaned as her stomach protested to the slightest bit of pressure. This was going to be harder than she thought. Sure, she was going to be fine for a little while, but what would happen as she continued to get bigger? Would she reach a point where she couldn’t even get up? What then? Would the king let her see her family at all at that point?

She had to try and not think about that. Right now, she had to focus on the now. Surely, by now she’d be getting close to having her first day to spend with her little boy. Surely, she had met the first of the king’s demands to earn some time back among her people.
1532121.title: Desperate Times, Desperate Measures

choices: King Roland decides to help Isallia to make her more comfortable.
King Roland decides to try and make Isallia fall in love with him.
King Roland ignores these signs and becomes more insistent.
15321211.content:
"Ha! Just what I thought. A hair above nine stone," the king crowed, as Isallia went through the demeaning process of being weighed once a week.

In truth, if she was being honest with herself, that wasn't all that bad. Considering everything, being starved and later coming here, she had pretty much ended up no bigger than when she had first left. But, she wasn't going to show any sign of relief at that. There was no way she was going to give the king even an inch of satisfaction.

"As promised, little elf, I will give you one day back in the Verge."

She was actually surprised to hear this. She had been waiting for the moment for the king to double-cross her on this little bargain. Then again, it wouldn't have been to his advantage to go back on their deal so soon. He might still hold off on that idea, when she wouldn't be in a place to protest. "Really?" she asked, having trouble concealing her excitement.

He nodded. "But of course, I am a man of my word. I will arrange for a carriage to take us tonight. We should arrive there by the first light of morning."

She arched her eyebrows. "We?"

King Roland chuckled. "You didn't think I'd just send you there on your own did you? No, no, then you'd have a chance to get away. I will be attending with you, along with a few of my guards."

"The elders aren't going to be pleased with that. You'll be lucky if they even let you anywhere close to the Verge."

He put an arm around her shoulder, giving it a light squeeze. "That's where you come in, my dear. You'll meet with your beloved elders and tell them that I will be coming with you one way or the other. Or, perhaps you'd rather not take the chance, and you could just stay here."

She swallowed, weighing her options. In the end, anything was worth it to see Rhalas again. "I'll do it."

"Good," he said, gently poking her side. "Now, best you go to your room to prepare. I had something extra special brought up for you to celebrate. Might as well get a jump on that ten stone, eh?"

She tried to resist the urge to throttle him. But, she had to keep reminding herself that she was doing it all for her son.

Isallia was surprised to discover that by the next morning, they were indeed in the Verge. He must've ran his horses ragged to make such good time, she thought. Still, it was good to breath in that fresh, natural air again.

That sense of relief was short lived. Fairly soon, she and the king found themselves at the ends of spear points from her own people. No surprise there, she thought. Humans were still not to be trusted. However, one of the warriors recognized her, and though he considered it against his better judgment, led her and the king to the elven king, Orym.

And King Orym was not pleased...

"So, you thought that you would just bring a human to the Verge and everything would be fine?" he asked incredulously after she had relayed most of her story. "Do you realize what a danger you've brought here? Did you even think of the consequences to our people?"

Elven politics were slightly different than that of humans. Hierarchy and status was mere formality. Conversations were held with everyone being considered equals. Votes were taken among the elders, true, but only based on what they believed the people wanted. King Roland had to admit he was impressed that Isallia held her ground. "I did it for my family, for my child. If it was your child, wouldn't you have done the same?"

The king's only daughter, and heir apparent, Princess Dhasca was sitting beside her father when Isallia said this. She placed a hand on her father's. "We can't blame her for her reasons," she said.

"That's not what I meant. It's that... Oh, fine, you may go back to your family as of now, but we will be keeping a sharp eye on your guests."

Isallia nodded. "Believe me, I don't trust them either. These unfortunate circumstances have made it so that I have no choice."

There were no words to express the joy Isallia felt when she was at last reunited with her son. He gurgled and gave a happy squeal when he was able to be held in familiar arms once more. "I missed you so much, my sweet, baby boy," she cooed, holding him close.

King Roland had insisted on following her to ensure she didn't run away, but in that moment, he felt a bit out of place. "I'll just, leave you to catch up," he said in an embarrassed whisper. "I expect you back at the carriage by morning."

She hardly heard him, so focused on making the most of her time with her family. She began retelling her tale to Niyi, leaving nothing out. "You can't be serious!" she said. "He...he does that to those women?"

She nodded. "Yes, though some of them may be more willing than others. But, if I want to keep seeing Rhalas and maybe Inaril one day, I have to go along with this. It's not so bad right now. I mean, I haven't changed all that much."

"Well, no," Niyi said, "but pretty soon, you will. And then what? You're just playing into his hands right now."

"That maybe, but right now, I just want to focus on being back here. Is there any word about Inaril?"

She sighed. "Same as always: no change. The healers can't deal with all these new human diseases. I don't know what we're going to do."

King Roland had been listening just outside the door to this conversation. So, that's why she hadn't seen her mate yet. Though he wasn't about to give up his newest acquisition, perhaps there was a way to make her more complacent.
15321211.title: Just Enough

choices: The great hall.
The concubines' living room.
The dungeons.
153212111.content:
Isallia didn't sleep at all that night. She spent her entire time watching Rhalas sleep peacefully. She wanted to memorize every bit of him before she had to leave. It had been far too long since she had seen him last. He was now starting to crawl, and she was missing his entire life being trapped in the castle.

Rhalas had fallen asleep holding her finger, and she didn't dare move, wanting to enjoy his touch for as long as she could. She had no idea the sun had risen when she felt King Roland's hand on her shoulder. "It...It's time to go," he said quietly, trying not to sound mean.

Isallia fought back tears. How could anyone be so cruel as to take a mother away from her child?

"Just a minute more," she pleaded.

"You know, you can see him again in a very short time. You've already overcome the first hurdle. It'll be much easier after that."

She bit back her lip, refraining from uttering the curse on her lips. Was that all he cared about? "Very well," she muttered.

Isallia refused to speak to him the entire carriage ride back. Instead, it was he who tried to make conversation. "So, I was thinking that I might be able to forge an alliance with your people," he began. "I've been having a lot of trouble reaching the gold deposits near the Verge due to your scouts getting in their way."

She crossed her arms, and decided to watch the landscape outside instead.

"Still, I think there are some things that we can arrange to make sure all parties are satisfied. I think if I offer the possibility for some of my human physicians to help your people through the disease epidemic, we might be able to strike a deal."

Her ears perked at the mention of that. That could...that could help Inaril. "Why are you telling me all this?" Isallia asked, finally breaking her silence.

"Ah, so now you'll talk to me," the king chuckled. "Well, it's not like I have my advisors here to talk about this with right now. Just my own ridiculous musings. Anyway, my plan is to offer this arrangement to your king the next time you meet my...demands."

He said this word as if it were dirty. He really didn't like thinking of Isallia as his prisoner. He hated her thinking she was forced into this.

Isallia was thinking quickly. "So, the quicker I...put on weight, the sooner we can go back so that you can make this offer."

"Indeed."

She thought about it. Though she knew this was just another way for the king to get what he wanted out of her, there were a lot of benefits to meeting those demands for now. It would mean she could get back to Rhalas that much sooner. It also meant she could help Inaril, maybe even save his life. In the meantime, she needed to still find a way to escape.

"I'd like to make one change to this plan," she said carefully. "I'm growing tired of being confined to my quarters. I'd like free range of the castle."

Roland scratched his beard, thinking it over. "I suppose there is no harm in that. I don't have any plans of entertaining any guests any time soon. And so long as we're not using this as an opportunity to get in a lot of physical activity..." He gave a gentle prod to her middle. "I see no reason not to grant your request. Perhaps it is time that you start familiarizing yourself with my castle, and my harem. You may want to start getting acquainted with them."

That was perhaps the furthest thing from what she wanted to be doing. Still, there was a chance that some of them may know a few secrets about the castle. Plus, she was curious to know how many of these women were there of their own accord and how many of them were prisoners like her.

Upon returning to the castle, the king released her back to her room to do as she pleased while he started making plans for their next trip to the Verge.

Isallia wasn't surprised in the least to find a large meal prepared for her in her room. Well, she did have to actually try this time if she intended to help her family, she reasoned. She couldn't avoid it.

She really tried to push her limits this time. The sooner she could put on enough weight to please the king, the sooner she could get back. Despite the signals in her brain to tell her she was full, she pushed on to eat a few more bites.

After eating, she was tempted to go straight to sleep. She hadn't slept much in the past few days, and all the food made her lethargic. But, she really wanted to take advantage of her new freedom about the castle. There was so much to learn and so much to do. She needed to learn as much as she could if she had any hope of escaping.

It was almost like being freed from a prison cell when she first stepped out of her door towards the halls. She wasn't sure where to go first, or where to even go to find anything. She had never seen anything of the castle since they first led her to her room.

She decided to go to the right, and hoped that if she followed it as far as she could, she would find something. As she continued walking, she eventually found...
153212111.title: Not a Complete Monster

choices: Isallia goes back to searching the castle for an escape route.
Isallia works on getting big enough to go back to the Verge.
Isallia's starting to lose hope. There's no getting out of here.
1532121112.content:
At first, she wasn't entirely sure where she was. Human customs and homes were still so new to her that she didn't know what every room was used for in the palace. Though, truth be told, having not seen any of the castle, she wasn't sure what she was supposed to expect.

But, here she was, in a dimly-lit, but cozy room. Beautiful, exotic rugs lined the floors, and over-stuffed cushions and pillows lined nearly every corner. Women of all species and various sizes were lounging on these cushions, conversing with each other, some gossiping, others giggling among themselves. In the center of the room was an enormous glass structure filled with water, where an enormously obese merfolk woman was floating about, resting on her plushy sides. She waved playfully at Isallia.

It didn't take a genius to realize who these women were. Given that they were all various sizes of round, it was pretty clear that she had found some of the other members of the king's harem. There wasn't a single one as thin as Isallia was.

A few of these women stared at her, curious about their intruder, but most went about their conversations as though nothing had happened.

Isallia was about to turn around and try to go back to looking around when a soft hand grabbed her shoulder. "Oh, you must be that new one the king's been talking about," a voice said. "I'm surprised that he let you wander over here. You're such a bony thing. Ha, have a lot of catching up to do, don't you?"

The woman holding her was a beautiful and enticing creature. She was a woman with magenta skin, smooth features, and was a tad wide in the hips and busty. She didn't seem too afraid to show off her figure either. She gave a seductive smile and her dark eyes seemed to smile with her. Her dark, raven-black hair fell naturally, as she made herself relaxed in this place.

"Um...I..." Isallia didn't really know what to say.

The woman laughed. "Poor thing, shy too? Well, come on over here, I won't bite, I promise. Come on, sit with us. I'm Jamila."

Jamila lead her over to a pile of cushions near the glass structure in the center of the room. The bloated merfolk was waiting over nearby, heaving herself up enough to be partially out of the tank to talk. She waved again.

"And this is Morfil. Look who the king finally decided to let us meet!"

Isallia sat down on the cushions nervously, not sure what to do, but the two women were extremely pleasant and conversational, putting her at ease.

"Ooh, she's cute!" Morfil squealed. "You can tell she's new around here."

She blushed, knowing how odd it was to actually be embarrassed about being thin. Almost immediately after sitting down, a servant brought them a plate of delicacies. Morfil quickly began stuffing her chubby cheeks with food, crumbs spilling down into the water. Jamila was more subdued, but she wasn't afraid to indulge either. Isallia didn't want to be rude, and took some as well. Plus, it couldn't hurt to keep working towards her goal of getting back to the Verge.

"It's amazing to think we now have an elf among us," Jamila said. "You know Roland; won't be satisfied until he has a woman of every species practically." She ate a sweet doughy treat with slow and seductive bites, moaning with ecstasy at the flavor.

"I'm sorry," Isallia said, "but I'm afraid I don't know what either of you two are. We don't see a lot of foreigners in the Verge."

Jamila was happy to answer. "Well, I'm called a djinn. Unfortunately, my fate has me bound to a magic bottle. I must serve whatever master possesses the bottle. The king just happened to find me. Lucky him."

So, she was a prisoner like her. But, the djinn woman didn't seem to distressed about it.

"Not that I can complain," she continued. "I get free food, I get to pretty much laze around all day, and I can kind of do as I please. Probably the best situation I can think of for my kind. Sure, the king has his tastes, but that's not all that bad."

Morfil finally stopped gulping down food, probably because there wasn't any left. While they waited for another servant to come back with more, she decided to speak. "I'm a merfolk. We're from all the way south. I sort of came her by accident. Slavers. I was given to Roland as a gift. But, he's actually been very kind. I've never been treated so wonderfully, and the food's far too good."

"No, you've never skimped on a meal before," Jamila chuckled. "What about you? Oh, I don't think we ever got your name."

"Isallia," she said in a hoarse whisper. "I'm Isallia. I, suppose my story is similar to yours. Hunters caught me while I was on a scouting mission and sold me to the king. But, I guess I'm having trouble getting used to it. You see, I have a family back in the Verge. I want to get back to them."

She relayed her story to the djinn and the merfolk who looked at her sorrowfully. "Oh, dear," Jamila said, wrapping Isallia up in a hug. The elf nearly suffocated as the djinn's ample busom was pressed to her face. "That's awful. But, Roland's at least helping."

"Yeah, only if I get fatter," Isallia said, turning bitter. "How can you live under such an odious man?"

"He's really not as bad as you say," Morfil said. "He's at least very sweet to me."

"Yes, he is very kind," Jamila added. "I know it's hard for you to see because of your situation, but I'm sure if you just told him how you felt, he would understand and would help you more."

A servant had returned with more food. Morfil seemed to go through it pretty quick, whereas Jamila and Isallia had really only eaten a third of it between the both of them. No wonder the merfolk was nearly a quarter ton in size.

"I don't know," Isallia said. "I'm trying. Really, I am. He's promised to help my husband the next time we go back. I...I really should go now. I'm feeling very tired."

"Okay..." Jamila said. "But, feel free to come see us anytime. You know, half the fun is having each other around to talk to."

"Yeah," Morfil added. "The food's the other half. Jamila, would you be a dear and help me rub my stomach? I think I ate too much."

The djinn smiled wickedly. "Oh, but of course. Morfil, you really need to stop overdoing it so much."

Isallia quietly got up and left as quietly as she had come. While she was happy to have someone sympathize with her, these women clearly couldn't understand her.
1532121112.title: The King's Women

The king keeps her in there for 9 months.
The king is very angry. He keeps her there for a whole year.
1532121113.content:
One turn led to another, and another, and still another. Honestly, Isallia wasn't sure she could find her way back at this point. It never occurred to her how big the palace was, or how many different rooms a single home could have. But, she hadn't seen any doors to any other rooms for quite some time, so she wasn't sure where this corridor was leading.

She debated stopping and turning around, but once she had gone down several flights of stairs, she felt like she had to find out where this was going. It was starting to get darker and cooler the further down she went, and she was certain she was hearing dripping coming from somewhere. Eventually, she found a large, wooden door at the bottom of the last set of stairs.

Isallia looked around to make sure no one was watching, and she tugged on the iron handle. It was heavy, but she managed to open it. Slipping inside, she left the door open a crack. She didn't want to take the risk of being locked in. It took a moment for her eyes to adjust to the darkness, but as she did, she realized what she must've found.

She had somehow reached the castle's dungeons. Dark dank cells were on either sides of the walls. A few loose chains hung from notches in each cell. Over in a corner, she spotted a room with various devices she assumed were for torturing prisoners for information. Isallia didn't want to think about that. Stranger still was that the palace dungeons seemed to be completely empty. True, she knew that Adinah was in a state of peace, but wouldn't there still be a few dissenters who needed to be put in their place?

However, for Isallia, this was a golden opportunity. Her heart filled with hope at the prospect of finding an escape route here. She began to comb through the dungeon, looking for loose bricks or secret entrances. For a moment, she was afraid she wouldn't find anything. It occurred to her that they would likely not want anyone being able to escape from a dungeon. But, she had to believe there was a way out, a secret tunnel or something for emergencies.

At long last, at the very end of the hall, she found a door in the floor. Upon opening it, a horrid smell hit her nostrils. It smelled like something had died down there. She assumed it must be some sort of catacomb under the castle. This gave her hope. She had heard about human cities having catacombs that wound under the very feet of its citizens. This might be her way out!

But, before she could start to climb down, she felt a pair of strong hands clamp down on her shoulders. "I had a feeling you might abuse your new freedom," she heard the king say as he came around to face her. It was one of the big hulking guards that had ahold of her. The king shut the door and stood within inches of her. "And this is the thanks I get for trying to be nice."

* * *


Isallia awoke with a headache, but that was the least of her worries when she discovered that she could hardly move. She had been chained to some uncomfortable, metal bed down in the dungeons. She struggled against her bonds for several minutes before giving up in frustration, for the time being. It was only then that she noticed the king sitting just across the room.

He seemed rather bored with the whole situation. "I tried to be reasonable," he said calmly. "I even tried to help you because I genuinely felt bad for your family. And yet, you still go and do something like this."

"Because you're a sick monster who takes pleasure in watching women submit to you," she spat back.

He nodded. "Now, that is an interesting way of putting it, but I don't think you understand me at all. Over the next few months, I think you will start to understand."

The doors to the cell opened as several servants came baring trays of steaming foods. Isallia glared at him. "You wouldn't dare."

He laughed. "Oh, I would. You see, I tried it your way. I tried giving you the freedom to eat of your own free will, but you've just proven that that's clearly not going to work. I'm not a cruel man, really I'm not. But, I can be when people go back on their promises."

"I'd like to see you try."

"Oh, I'm not going to be feeding you. Do you honestly think I'm stupid enough to put my hands anywhere near where you can bite? No, no, I'm content just to watch this time. Trust me, there are other ways I can enjoy this little punishment of yours."

One of the servants roughly pushed a thick pastry past her lips. She shouted a string of curses between bites, trying to keep from choking. The king seemed to ignore her.

"We'll see what you have to say after a few hours. Gentlemen, you stop when I tell you to, and may the gods so help you if you do so any sooner. Trust me when I say I'm not going to let her die, but when we're done today, she's going to feel like she could."
1532121113.title: The Dungeons

Inaril is unsure what he thinks of Isallia now.
Inaril actually likes her more this way.
15321211133.content:
The days started to blur together now. Isallia had stopped bothering to count long ago. Each one was just more of the same living nightmare anyway.

It was always the same every day. The king's servants would proceed to stuff her full of food, often to the very verge of bursting open her stomach. She could feel it, and it seemed the king knew exactly where her breaking point was every day. Still lying there, writhing in pain as her filled stomach pressed hard against her organs, the king would finally get involved, poking, prodding, and taking his time to feel every inch of her. She couldn't struggle, even if she wanted to, her body pinning her down. And he wasn't gentle either. He made sure it was the most painful experience she could ever feel as his fingers jabbed into her flesh or squeezed at her sides. A few times he would compliment the progress she had made, but most days he spat insults at her, trying to get her to react.

Isallia considered fighting back, but she was truly and genuinely afraid of what would happen if she did. After all, the only step left they could take to punish her would leave her dead. She didn't want to take that risk. At the same time, she wasn't about to show him that. If she could keep up the visage of being stoic and unfeeling through this, maybe it would take away his enjoyment of it.

But as the days passed, he didn't seem inclined to leave her alone. And every day, Isallia noticed that her view was slowly being obscured by her ever-increasing belly. Despite the fact that she was indeed getting fatter, he still fed her more and more, ensuring that every day, she was painfully stuffed. She wondered how long this could go on.

It was nearly nine months later that the king finally released her. She finally heard the click of her latest, and widest set of shackles yet, were opened, not being replaced by another set. The king ordered his men to help her roll up to a sitting position.

"I think we've reached an understanding," he said with a grin. "I don't think you'll dare to try to escape again." He chuckled. "Rather, I don't think you even have the ability to escape anymore. Come, let's take a look, shall we?"

She glared at him, but also daring a glance at her own body. She honestly hadn't seen much of it, being forced to lay there for all that time. She gasped a little as she saw her now round and enormous gut spill onto her lap. Hands exploring its plush softness, she now realized this was real. It hadn't been just a horrible nightmare.

Isallia tried to stand, but found that near impossible. Not only was she dealing with the extra weight, but having laid there for nine months, her muscles were all but completely useless. The king's grin broadened. "I figured that might be a problem, but never fear, I always have a plan for such things."

With a snap of his fingers, four strong guards came into the room with a large litter to carry her. With a heave, two of them got her up to her feet and placed her in. This was so humiliating, she thought, but she knew she couldn't give him the satisfaction of knowing that.

First, he took her to be weighed. "Twenty-one and a half stone," the king said. "That's certainly an improvement."

Isallia couldn't hid her own shock hearing that for the first time. She had more than doubled in weight during this long and enduring torture. "How about a look?" the king said, leading her before a mirror.

She wanted to sob right then and there. She didn't even recognize herself there anymore. All she saw was a fat, round ball of flab. Her body had merely distributed the weight evenly, leaving her in a near-spherical shape with pudgy, pillowy arms and legs. She couldn't stand to look at herself anymore.

"You like it?" the king said maliciously. "Some of my best work in so short a time. And I must admit, you carry it well. This delightfully round gut alone."

"Don't touch me," she said, venom dripping from every word.

"You no longer get to call the shots, my dear. You are mine now, and I will do as I please. But, I'm not a complete monster. A deal was a deal. Let's see, that's twelve stone more than the last time we weighed you, so that's twelve days you will get to spend back at the Verge. I'm sure your husband will be eager to see what's happened to you."

"He's...he's alive?" she gasped.

"Of course. I still went through on my deal with the elves, and I think I came away with a pretty good bargain. But as I understand it, you're people are doing well for themselves, thanks to me. I believe he may have lived. Exciting isn't it. We'll get you ready to go. In the meantime, I'm sure you'd like a little time to get settled back in. Gentlemen, to the living quarters."

The litter whisked Isallia away to the concubine's quarters. But, Isallia could hardly think about that now. Inaril was alive? She was both angry and excited, and also a bit terrified. What would he say when he saw her? Would he even know who she was? Would he still love her? Her anger with the king could wait. She had to see him.
15321211133.title: The king keeps her in there for 9 months.

We need to kill him.

153212111332.content:
The hardest part was getting used to how heavy she was. Without having any opportunity to walk as her weight slowly increased, Isallia was constantly frustrated by how her body resisted her every time she tried to walk. Not that the king encouraged her to do so anyway. He didn't stop her, but that was mostly because he knew she was incapable of it. Every time she tried to stand, she was left out of breath, her wobbling knees screaming for her to sit back down. And what few steps she could manage, she required something within reach for her to use as support, or she ran the risk of falling.

She wanted nothing more than to just give up, to sob and beg the gods for a merciful end. Every day she woke up, feeling her rolls of flab, realizing it wasn't a horrible nightmare. How could she possibly see her family like this? Yet, the thought of being reunited with her son again and seeing her husband alive and well for the first time over two years pushed her to continue.

When she arrived at the Verge and her fat bulk was squeezed out of the carriage she only took a few shaky steps before she had to sit down on a nearby stump and catch her breath. She felt pathetic. Honestly, she had seen a few of the king's women who were bigger than her and could still get around. Of course, they hadn't been chained to a bed for months unable to use a single muscle.

Isallia's face turned a light shade of red as she noticed the looks the other elves were giving her. Chances were an over three-hundred pound elf before.

"Gods, Isallia!" a voice said breathlessly.

It felt like a dream to see him standing in front of her. Inaril actually looked like his old self, full of life and energy. His stare was what was foreign to him. It was a mix of shock and something she couldn't identify...disgust maybe. She felt ashamed.

But that look quickly faded as he realized it was really her. He ran up to her and threw his arms as far around her as he could. She felt embarrassed as his hands squeezed tightly into her fat. But before she could stop herself, tears began streaming down her cheeks. "You're alive!" she said.

He laughed. "Yes, I am. But, it was horrible. They told me what had happened to you, that the king kept you prisoner. What has he done to you?" His hands were still exploring her rounded form, as if expecting it to be some sort of trick of the mind.

Isallia began to cry again. He held her, not asking any more questions, and let her get it out of her system. "It's okay," he said. "We can talk when we get back to the house."

"Is Rhalas there?" she asked between sobs, eager to see her son.

"Of course. To be honest, I was shocked when they first handed him to me. The healers said I would have some memory loss, and I had forgotten you had been pregnant when I first became ill. But, Isallia, he's beautiful. I couldn't have asked for a more beautiful child."

With much struggle, he was able to help his wife to her feet and they slowly made their way back to their home. By that point, she was out of breath and heaving as though she might die right on the spot. "Are you sure you're well?" Inaril asked.

She shook her head. "I'm sorry, it's just...I haven't had a lot of time to get used to all of this," she said, gesturing to her body.

She gave a frustrated sigh when she saw their home. The door clearly wasn't wide enough for someone her size to get in. With much shoving, squeezing, and sucking breath in, they were able to get her in eventually. And that was when she saw him. Her little boy had grown up so much. He now had a full head of hair, his eyes shone brightly with curiosity, and she almost broke down again when she saw him start to stand up and walk. But, despite how overcome with motherly love she was, her son only looked at her with confusion, and her heart broke. He didn't recognize her.

Inaril picked him up and placed him in her arms. "See, it's your mother," he said.

The boy didn't know what to do. He looked up at the round, puffed-up face of the unknown woman with curiosity, but nothing more. Still, he wasn't going to deny that the woman who held him was like a giant pillow, and he warmed up somewhat to her, snuggling. Isallia was doing her best not to show how upset she was.

"Give him time," her husband said. "He'll remember eventually. You were gone for so long. Now, come and sit. I'm afraid you're going to pass out. If you can, I'd like you to tell me what happened."

As their son napped in her arms, she began to relay the entire story of what had happened since the day she left the village. He listened intently, his brow furrowing as she explained each detail. When she had finished, she hung her head in shame. She knew it was a lot to ask. How could Inaril love her like this? How could she expect to have any kind of a normal life if she had to be taken away from it until she could get fatter?

At first, he didn't say anything. He got up and put Rhalas to bed and then came back to her. After a few seconds of standing there, he hugged her once more. "I've missed you so much," he said. "I just...I just..."

"I know, it's a lot. I'm sorry."

"Sorry? Why would you be sorry?"

"Inaril, look at me! I'm this fat, round ball who can't even get up anymore. You don't need that kind of a burden to deal with."

"Listen to me, I love you no matter what. You're everything to me, Isallia. You're the woman I fell in love with and the mother to my child. I couldn't ask for more. And bigger or smaller, you're still that woman who means everything to me. I'm just angry with the king. How could a person be so cruel? And then he has the gall to go and help our people out, marry our princess, and still treat you so terribly."

"Marry our princess?"

His brow raised. "You didn't hear? He arranged a deal where he married Princess Dhasca and gave our people aid in exchange for him having free range of the Verge to mine for gold. But, knowing this, knowing what a monster he is, I can't live with that Isallia."

"And what are you saying?"
153212111332.title: Inaril still loves her, but is enraged at the k...

choices: “You will be my personal maid.”
“You will by MY concubine.”
"I need an extra nurse for my child and myself. As you can see, it's busy here."
15322.content:
“A pet for my favourite concubine…Vuko has been terribly needy as of late and I do not have the time to satisfy her incredible appetite.”

A pet!? The words rang through Isallia’s head. Was this king so terribly cruel that he treated sentients as mere beasts? What were these concubines like if he spoke this way? They must be emaciated and downtrodden. As the elf contemplated her fate, the humans “talked business”; once a deal was struck the king spoke again. Not to Isallia but at her.

“Guards, escort this newest purchase to my most treasured concubine…she should be most pleased by this…”

As soon as the king returned to entertaining Isallia felt once again a rough set of hands around her upper-arms and she was soon frog-marched towards a side-door. From there the elf was led through a serious of winding corridors before finally was escorted into another large room.

It was not as vast as the throne room, but still far greater than the previous corridors or even than the houses she had spied from her kart window. The room was tall and constructed from alabaster-white marble, with spiral stairs at the back and a massive fountain in the center surrounded by a huge pool. Settled around this structure were many women, all scantily clad and in conversation with each other. It seemed Isallia’s assumption was wrong…the concubines were anything but emaciated and weak.

A pair that seemed the most familiar with each other was an Orc and a Djinn. The former green-skinned woman was well-muscled like almost all of her kind, but seemed to have a little bit of softness to her form. Meanwhile the azure-colored Djinn was a much more classical idea of a concubine. She was stunningly beautiful, with long dark-blue hair running down her back like a waterfall; her huge heaving breasts were kept in check by her glittery brassiere, and meanwhile her lower-garments were hidden in her firm but plump behind.

The other women were better fed though, much better.

Resting on the edge of the pool of water was a human woman, Isallia would describe her features as cute but modest, which contrasted heavily with her extremely revealing attire. She was also immensely fat, far fatter than even anyone at the king’s table earlier. Her huge gut sat on top of, between and overwhelmed her thighs, while her hands gently rested on its massive surface. She seemed to be a little overwhelmed with the situation, keeping to herself.

Meanwhile, settled in the middle of the pool was what Isallia could just about recognize as a Merfolk woman. Just about as this woman was clearly more lard than anything else.

Her great body was coiled slightly as she rested on her side, one pillow-shaped arm propping up her head as she beamed a dopey smile whilst her tail tried to splash in the water, but seemed pinned down by its own weight. Her face was swaddled by her cheeks and chins so much that her eyes were forced into a squint, but she seemed perfectly happy with her situation.

Isallia stared in awe, there was just no way a woman of such extreme girth and obesity could even move under her own power! Was this what the king did to his women then? Fatten them up like hogs for the for his own sick pleasure?

Speaking of which, as Isallia was led across the hall she saw another monumental woman. To her horror the elf realized she was staring at a gorgon! But the massive reptile was also in no position to actually get up and harm anyone. The obese glutton was nearly as fat as the immobile merfolk, her obesity pinning her in place as she barked at various maids to fetch her more food. Was this “Vuko” that the king had spoken of? Gods, Isallia wished to the heavens that she did not have to serve such a creature.

But it seemed fate had something else in store for her that day. The guards led Isallia past the monstrous serpentine women and up the marble staircase. They pushed open the door and made a nod to indicate she go inside. Her bindings were cut and she felt the base of a spear push against her back as Isallia entered a third room.

It was not as grand or as well-lit as any other the others, but it was still just as occupied. Most of the women inside were not more concubines however, most seemed to be nurses running back and forth helping the other two women, and these two were clearly part of the king’s harem.

The first was a Satyr, this already made Isallia a bit more nervous. While aggressions had ended between the elves and the satyrs in the Verge, it was a very tense peace. She did not trust a satyr as far as she could throw one, and in this one's case, that was not at all. The satyr was laid on her side with her gigantic backside jutting up like a mountain. Her predicament though was quite different to the women outside, for this goat-legged woman was not settled down due to her swaddling adipose, but because her stomach was stretched and swollen with child. Her pale belly jutted outwards massively; with a little bit of fur on the underside, she must have been near-to-term.

The other woman though was a more imposing figure. She was laid back in a regal position, her long orange hair flowing over her back and touching the floor, her hands here held out as nurses filed her long claw-like nails as she gave them a haughty look. Like the Satyr, this woman was also heavily pregnant, her massive belly sat neatly on her extremely thick thighs, with her huge breasts in-turn resting on that gravid sphere.

She was clearly not human though; sticking out of the top of her orange hair were a pair of triangular orange-furred ears, her eyes were a vibrant yellow and trailing out between her legs were no less than nine orange-colored tails.

Isallia had never encountered a race like this before, and was initially curious. This was banished in place of fear when the woman spoke.

“You there!” The woman barked, baring a set of sharp canine fangs. “Come here!”

Isallia did as instructed.

“Are you the new slave the king has bought?” The stern woman asked. Isallia simply nodded, even if she wasn’t this did not seem like the kind of person she would like to see angry.

“Good, the king has promised me that I would have someone of my own who shall do as I say…I am Vuko, but you may address me as mistress.” At this point the maids seeing to the woman stopped their pampering and began to help the satyr instead. Clearly they were not under direct control of Vuko, just instructed to help all the concubines.

“Speak up! Or are you dumb?”

“No, mistress.” Isallia quickly responded.

“Good. And you are obedient to a fault, I like that.” Vuko then picked up a small fruit from a nearby bowl, dropped it into her mouth, swallowed it and then continued. “I am the most powerful person in this castle after the king…and since I have control over his majesties…appetites shall we say that makes me the most powerful person in all of Yndyre. I simply have to ask and the King does whatever I please, that is why you are here before me. So take one step out of line, disobey me for one single second and you will wind up under the headsman’s axe…or worse.”

The elf gulped and nodded.

“Now, as to what I want to DO with you…”
15322.title: Fit to Serve

choices: She really must see to Vuko's needs first. You wouldn't like her when she's mad.
One meal can't hurt. She can just say she got lost. It's the truth, right?
One of the king's guards spots them. He has something important to say.
153223.content:
Vuko huffed as several more maids and nurses left her side to attend to other matters. "As you can see, it's a bit short staffed here in the confinement room. I will be in need of another nurse."

"Confinement room?" So many things outside of the verge were so strange and new to Isallia.

The kitsune rolled her eyes. "Leave it to Roland to send me the most daft of creatures to serve me. Confinement is the period just before a woman has a child. She is shut off from the rest of the world, kept in a dark room, and attended by only her closest nurses, maids, and midwives. Here, is where the king keeps us during confinement. Now, as I said before, you will be serving me, and only me."

"And do what exactly?"

"Ugh, must I teach you everything? You do what I tell you, when I tell you. And when the time does come, you will serve my children."

Isallia took another glance at the voluptuous kitsune. It was hard to tell if she was having twins or if she was just large. "Children?"

"Yes, my future child, and my daughter, Kimiko. She is probably around causing a ruckus in the palace, no doubt, such a willful child."

It now occurred to Isallia that the king probably had had several children through these concubines. In fact, it wouldn't surprise her at all to find several of them wandering about the castle, and she wouldn't have known in the slightest.

"Do you understand?"

Isallia nodded. "Yes, mistress. How may I serve you?"

At least this way, she might get some freedoms about the castle: a perfect opportunity to find a way to escape.

"Are elves always this stupid? Go to the kitchens and bring me my midday meal, of course. And tell those wenches in the kitchens that they had better not have burnt the lamb again."

Isallia let out a small squeak and left the room quickly, not even the slightest bit sure where the kitchens might be.

"Don't be so hard on her," Mitera, the satyr woman on the next bed over said, doing her best to roll over, given her girth, to face Vuko.

The kitsune waved her off. "You can't go easy on the help. Makes them soft."

Mitera only sighed, rubbing her bump as several strong kicks disturbed her. Satyr children were incredibly active, and often restless. It made it even less enjoyable considering that they had hooves and sometimes the start of their horns. "Poor thing," she said.

"And the bleeding heart starts again," Vuko grumbled.

"Oh, don't act like you didn't see it. You made her your nurse for your child after all. You can see it too. She's more than capable for the job."

The kitsune rolled her eyes as some of the attendants went back to rubbing her feet. She purred. "Well, why not use her where she's most useful?"

The satyr continued to muse. "You know what that means though, don't you? Breasts all swollen like that? She's had a child before, fairly recently actually."

"So what? Lots of our nurses have had children before. How else did they get the job?"

Mitera shook her head. "You don't understand at all. Elves don't just bring their families to the city. That poor woman was taken from her home, her child, and ended up here. She's not just a servant; she's a prisoner! Roland...Roland wouldn't..."

Vuko fell back onto her pillows, crossing her arms over her belly, which made her look very squished when she pouted. "Look, it's not our job to question him and his decisions. He knows what he wants, and he takes it."

"I suppose... Still, I feel bad for her."

She gave a shrill laugh. "What do you care? Last I knew, you're people hated elves."

Mitera sighed and tried to roll back over. "I don't know why I bother talking to you."

Meanwhile, Isallia was still in search of the kitchens. The castle was incredibly big, and there were rooms everywhere. There were also many twists and turns in the halls, and several times, the elf became unable to backtrack her way to where she was before. If she had any hope of ever escaping, this wasn't helping.

She gave a frustrated sigh as she turned down the wrong hall for the fourth time. "Lost?" a voice said.

Isallia turned around to see one of the other serving girls. In some ways she was surprised to see just how round and plump this girl was, but then again, it made sense. The king saw to it that everyone stayed pretty well-fed in this place. Odd, and slightly disconcerting.

"Um, yes. I'm looking for the kitchens. Lady Vuko..."

The girl shook her head and rolled her eyes. "Of course it's Lady Vuko. She always wants something. Demanding thing, isn't she, even more so now that she's expecting. Acts like she's carrying the future prince or princess or something. Hmpf, she knows Roland isn't going to let Kimiko rule."

The plump girl said this all rather fast, and Isallia had a hard time following everything. "The kitchens?" she reminded her.

"Yes, yes, I'll take you there. Come with me. My, my, you're an elf aren't you? Oh, how fascinating. Do you really hear from a mile away? Do your people really live in huts made of animal skins? My, but you are a bony little thing. Aren't you hungry?"

As if in response, Isallia's stomach began to growl. The hunters had practically starved her while she was in their captivity, only giving her enough to get by. For several days now, she had learned to ignore the hunger pangs. "It's fine, really," Isallia lied. "I...really must get to the kitchens to get Lady Vuko her..."

"Don't you worry about that. We'll get you set up for her in a moment. Enormous thing could stand to wait for a meal. Come now, let's get you something to eat."

Isallia wanted to resist. She didn't want to know what Vuko's wrath might be like. Yet, she was quite hungry.
